translated: living beings until only a skeleton remains, and being abandoned.

original: punarapyāpyāyitakāyā rudhirābhyaktena kāyena yāvacchvamukhena bahuvidhāṃ prāṇino bhakṣayitvā punarhīnasyairaṇḍavṛkṣasya mūle niṣaṇṇā vividhaiśca
analyzed: punar api āpyāyita kāyāḥ rudhira abhyaktena kāyena yāvat śva mukhena bahuvidhām prāṇinaḥ bhakṣayitvā punar hīnasya eraṇḍa vṛkṣasya mūle niṣaṇṇāḥ vividhaiḥ ca
translated: Again, with a body nourished by blood, with a body smeared with blood, up to with a face like a dog's, having eaten many kinds of living beings, again sitting at the foot of a low castor-oil plant, and being eaten by various

analyzed: prāṇibhiḥ khādyante
translated: living beings.

original: te tvayā mohapuruṣāstrividhe puṇyakriyāvastuni samādāpitā prātiṣṭhāpitā dāne yame saṃyame ca /
analyzed: te tvayā moha puruṣāḥ trividhe puṇya kriyā vastuni samādāpitā prātiṣṭhāpitā dāne yame saṃyame ca
translated: Those deluded people were encouraged and established by you in the three kinds of bases of meritorious action, in generosity, in restraint, and in observances.

analyzed: te deveṣu cyavana duḥkham abhilaṣanti
translated: They long for the suffering of falling from the gods.

analyzed: manuṣyeṣu jarā vyādhi maraṇa apriya saṃprayoga priya vinābhāva duḥkhām preteṣu kṣudh pipāsa duḥkham
translated: Among humans, they long for the suffering of old age, sickness, death, association with the unpleasant, separation from the pleasant,🔽and hunger and thirst among the hungry ghosts.

analyzed: tiryakṣu anyonya bhakṣaṇa duḥkham nārakeṣu dāha cheda vadha bandhana nānāvidha kāraṇa ādi duḥkham abhilaṣanti
translated: Among animals, they long for the suffering of eating each other, and among hell beings, they long for the suffering of burning, cutting, killing, binding, and various other causes.

original: trividhe ca puṇyakriyāvastuni pratiṣṭhāpitā deveṣu devarājyamabhilaṣanti manuṣyeṣu caikadvīpaiśvaryamākāṅkṣante /
analyzed: trividhe ca puṇya kriyā vastuni pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ deveṣu deva rājyam abhilaṣanti manuṣyeṣu ca eka dvīpa aiśvaryam ākāṅkṣante
translated: And those established in the three kinds of bases of meritorious action long for godhood among the gods and for the sovereignty of one or two continents among humans.

analyzed: teṣām tatra sarva sattvāḥ paribhogam gacchanti
translated: There, all beings go to enjoy them.

analyzed: te pi ca sarva sattvānām āhāra paribhogam gacchanti
translated: And all those beings will enjoy food.

original: evaṃ te mohapuruṣāḥ sarve tvayā trividhe puṇyakriyāvastuni
analyzed: evam te moha puruṣāḥ sarve tvayā trividhe puṇya kriyā vastuni
translated: In this way, foolish man, all of them will be established by you in the three types of meritorious deeds,

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ tava upāsakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: and will become your lay followers.

analyzed: idam brāhmaṇa tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: Brahmin, this is the previous sign of that dream.

original: yattvaṃ brāhmaṇa svapnamadrākṣīt apare manuṣyā mahiṣarathābhirūdhāḥ sumanāmālālāṅkṛtaśirasaḥ apathena dakṣiṇābhimukhaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: yat tvam brāhmaṇa svapnam adrākṣīt apare manuṣyāḥ mahiṣa ratha abhirūdhāḥ sumanā mālā lāṅkṛta śirasaḥ apathena dakṣiṇa abhimukham gacchanti
translated: Brahmin, you saw in the dream other men mounted on buffalo chariots, their heads adorned with garlands and wreaths, going by an untrodden path facing south.

original: te 'pi tvayā brāhmaṇa kulaputrāḥ triṣu puṇyakriyāvastuṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ kevalamātmadamanārthaṃ ātmaśamanārthaṃ śrāvakayānasaṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: te pi tvayā brāhmaṇa kula putrāḥ triṣu puṇya kriyā vastuṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ kevalam ātma damana artham ātma śamana artham śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Brahmin, those sons of good family were also established by you in the three types of meritorious deeds, but only for the sake of self-control and self-pacification, they set out in the vehicle of the disciples.

analyzed: teṣām śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitānām brāhmaṇa pudgalānām idam
translated: Brahmin, this is the previous sign for those individuals who set out in the vehicle of the disciples.

original: atha khalu kulaputra brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇū rājānamāraṇeminametadavocat durlabhaṃ mahārāja manuṣyatvaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ rājānam āraṇeminam etat avocat durlabham mahā rāja manuṣya tvam
translated: Then, son of good family, the brahmin Samudrarenu said this to King Aranemin: Great king, human birth is difficult to obtain.

analyzed: durlabhā kṣaṇa saṃpad
translated: The perfection of the moment is difficult to obtain.

analyzed: durlabham udumbara puṣpa sadṛśānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām prādurbhāvaḥ loke
translated: The appearance in the world of Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, who are as rare as the udumbara flower, is difficult.

analyzed: durlabhaḥ kuśala dharme chandaḥ
translated: The desire for wholesome dharmas is rare.

analyzed: durlabham samyak praṇidhānam
translated: Right aspiration is rare.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam mahā rāja deva rāja tvam
translated: Great king, the state of being a king of the gods is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam mahā rāja manuṣyeṣu ca eka dvīpa aiśvarya rāja tvam
translated: Great king, the sovereignty of a king over one continent among humans is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam dvis tris cāturdvīpika rāja tvam
translated: The sovereignty of a king over two, three, or four continents is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: ciram mahā rāja saṃsāra duḥkham anubhavitavyam
translated: Great king, you will experience the suffering of cyclic existence for a long time.

analyzed: anavasthitāḥ mahā rāja vāyu vega capalāḥ deva manuṣya saṃpattayaḥ
translated: Great king, the prosperity of gods and humans is unstable, as fickle as the speed of the wind.

original: dakacandropamā bālāḥ pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇairatṛptā viṣayeṣu mattā devamāṇuṣāṃ śriyamabhilaṣanti /
analyzed: daka candra upamāḥ bālāḥ pañcabhiḥ kāma guṇaiḥ atṛptāḥ viṣayeṣu mattāḥ deva māṇuṣām śriyam abhilaṣanti
translated: Foolish people, who are like the moon reflected in water, are not satisfied with the five sense pleasures, intoxicated by objects, and desire the prosperity of gods and humans.

original: te bālāḥ punaḥ punarnarakeṣu kāraṇāduḥkhamanubhavanti tiryakṣu saṃmohaduḥkhaṃ preteṣu
analyzed: te bālāḥ punar punar narakeṣu kāraṇā duḥkham anubhavanti tiryakṣu saṃmoha duḥkham preteṣu
translated: Those foolish people again and again experience the suffering of burning in the hells, the suffering of confusion among animals,

original: kṣutpipāsāduḥkhaṃ manuṣyeṣu priyaviprayogaduḥkhaṃ deveṣu cyavanaduḥkhaṃ punargarbhavāsaduḥkhaṃ
analyzed: kṣudh pipāsā duḥkham manuṣyeṣu priya viprayoga duḥkham deveṣu cyavana duḥkham punar garbha vāsa duḥkham
translated: the suffering of hunger and thirst among hungry ghosts, the suffering of separation from the loved ones among humans, the suffering of falling among gods, and the suffering of being in the womb again.

analyzed: paraspara śīrṣa prapātana duḥkham anyonya bhakṣaṇa duḥkham
translated: The suffering of falling on each other's heads, the suffering of devouring each other.

analyzed: evam bhramamāṇāḥ bālāḥ duḥkham anubhavanti
translated: Thus, wandering, the foolish ones experience suffering.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: kalyāṇamitravirahitāḥ samyakpraṇidhānaṃ na kurvanti na vyāyamanti aprāptasya prāptaye 'nadhigatasyādhigamāyāsākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra virahitāḥ samyak praṇidhānam na kurvanti na vyāyamanti aprāptasya prāptaye na adhigatasya adhigamāya a sākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai
translated: Separated from spiritual friends, they do not make the right aspiration, do not strive, for the attainment of what has not been attained, for the realization of what has not been realized, for the manifestation of what has not been manifested.

original: evaṃ mūrkhā bālāḥ khidyante bodhicittena yatra sarvaduḥkhakṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: evam mūrkhāḥ bālāḥ khidyante bodhi cittena yatra sarva duḥkha kṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, the foolish ones tire themselves with the thought of enlightenment, where all suffering is destroyed.

original: saṃsāreṇa ca na khidyante nodvijanti yatra punaḥ punarduḥkhotpattirbhavati /
analyzed: saṃsāreṇa ca na khidyante na udvijanti yatra punar punar duḥkha utpattiḥ bhavati
translated: And they do not tire of, are not disgusted with, the world, where the arising of suffering occurs again and again.

original: parīkṣasva mahārāja yathā saṃsāraḥ sarvaduḥkhānāṃ bhājanabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: parīkṣasva mahā rāja yathā saṃsāraḥ sarva duḥkhānām bhājana bhūtaḥ
translated: Examine, great king, how the world is the vessel for all sufferings.

original: tasmāttarhi tvaṃ mahārāja kṛtādhikāro bhagavataḥ śāsane 'varopitakuśalamūlastriṣu ratneṣu labdhaprasādaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi tvam mahā rāja kṛta adhikāraḥ bhagavataḥ śāsane varopita kuśala mūlaḥ triṣu ratneṣu labdha prasādaḥ
translated: Therefore, great king, you who have done what is to be done in the Blessed One's teaching, who have planted the roots of goodness, who have gained faith in the Three Jewels,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ datta dānau k psū
translated: you who have given gifts to the Blessed One,

original: mahābhogatāyai rakṣitaśīlaḥ svargopapattipratilābhāya śruto bhagavato 'ntikāddharmaṃ prajñāmahādharmapratilābhāya te saṃpatsyante /
analyzed: mahā bhoga tāyai rakṣita śīlaḥ svarga upapatti pratilābhāya śrutaḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt dharmam prajñā mahā dharma pratilābhāya te saṃpatsyante
translated: For the attainment of great enjoyment, you have protected morality. For the attainment of rebirth in heaven, you have listened to the Dharma from the Blessed One. For the attainment of great Dharma, you have studied. Those will be accomplished.

analyzed: yaṣṭa yajñaḥ tvam mahā rāja utpādāya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: You have performed a sacrifice, great king, for the sake of generating the mind for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: āha alam brāhmaṇa
translated: He said, Enough, Brahmin.

analyzed: na aham brāhmaṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhilaṣāmi saṃsāra abhirataḥ
translated: I do not desire unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, Brahmin, I delight in cyclic existence.

original: yanmahābrāhmaṇa mayā dānaṃ dattaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ dharmaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: yat mahā brāhmaṇa mayā dānam dattam śīlam rakṣitam dharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: Whatever giving I have given, whatever morality I have protected, whatever Dharma I have listened to,

analyzed: durlabhā hi brāhmaṇa anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain, Brahmin.

original: dvirapi samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo rājānamāha śuddho mahārāja bodhimārgaḥ /
analyzed: dvis api samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājānam āha  śuddhaḥ mahā rāja bodhi mārgaḥ
translated: The Brahmin Samudrarenu said to the king for a second time, The path to enlightenment is pure, great king.

analyzed: āśayena praṇidhānam kartavyam
translated: With intention, the vow should be made.

analyzed: paripūrya abhiprasannaḥ sa mārgaḥ dhyā āśayena viśuddhaḥ
translated: When the path is fulfilled, being delighted, it is purified with superior intention.

analyzed: ṛjuḥ sa mārgaḥ aśaṭhaḥ
translated: That path is straight, not deceitful.

analyzed: śuddhaḥ sa mārgaḥ kleśa pravāhaka tvāt
translated: That path is pure, being free from the flow of afflictions.

analyzed: vipulaḥ sau mārgaḥ anāvarṇa tvāt
translated: That path is vast, being free from dispraise.

analyzed: samavasaraṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ cintanāya
translated: That path is inclusive, being fit for reflection.

original: nirbhayaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvapāpākaraṇatayā /🔽sumṛduḥ sa mārgaḥ dānapāramitayā /
analyzed: nirbhayaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva pāpa ākaraṇa tayā  su mṛduḥ sa mārgaḥ dānapāramitayā
translated: That path is fearless because of the non-performance of all evil.🔽That path is very soft because of the perfection of giving.

original: śītalaḥ sa mārgaḥ śīlapāramitayā /🔽nirāśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ kṣāntipāramitayā /
analyzed: śītalaḥ sa mārgaḥ śīla pāramitayā  nirāśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ kṣānti pāramitayā
translated: That path is cool because of the perfection of morality.🔽That path is without support because of the perfection of patience.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna āśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ vīrya pāramitayā
translated: That path is based on support because of the perfection of effort.

analyzed: anāvilaḥ sa mārgaḥ dhyānapāramitayā
translated: That path is unpolluted because of the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: su viditaḥ sa mārgaḥ kpsū
translated: That path is well-known

analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā
translated: because of the perfection of wisdom.

original: suprasannaḥ sa mārgo mahāmaitryā /🔽svabhāvajñānānugataḥ sa mārgaḥ mahākaruṇayā /
analyzed: su prasannaḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā maitryā  svabhāva jñāna anugataḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā karuṇayā
translated: That path is very clear because of great loving-kindness.🔽That path is endowed with the knowledge of the intrinsic nature because of great compassion.

analyzed: sadā ānanditaḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā muditayā
translated: That path is always joyful because of great sympathetic joy.

analyzed: akliṣṭaḥ sa mārgaḥ upekṣayā
translated: That path is unafflicted because of equanimity.

analyzed: apagata kaṇṭakaḥ sa mārgaḥ kāma vyāpāda vihiṃsā vitarkaiḥ
translated: That path is free from thorns because of thoughts of desire, malice, and harm.

original: kṣemaṃgamanaḥ sa mārgo 'pratihatacittatayā /🔽dhūrtavirahitaḥ sa mārgaḥ rūpaśabdagandharasasparśaviditatvāt /
analyzed: kṣemaṃgamanaḥ sa mārgo pratihata citta tayā  dhūrta virahitaḥ sa mārgaḥ rūpa śabda gandha rasa sparśa vidita tvāt
translated: That path leads to safety because of the unobstructed mind.🔽That path is free from deceit because of knowing form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

analyzed: nihata māra pratyarthikaḥ sa mārgaḥ dhātu āyatana su vimṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: That path has defeated the enemy Mara because of the thorough examination of the elements and sense bases.

analyzed: su prabodhaḥ sa mārgaḥ avidyā andhakāra nirāvaraṇa tvāt
translated: That path is well-awakened because of the absence of the darkness of ignorance.

analyzed: dṛḍha vīrya sattva citta gamanaḥ sa mārgaḥ apagata śrāvaka pratyekabuddha manasikāra tvāt
translated: That path is one that leads to firm vigor, courage, and mind, because it is free from the thoughts of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: utsoḍhaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva tathāgata dhiṣṭhita tvāt
translated: That path is one that is endured, because it is empowered by all the tathāgatas.

analyzed: mahā ratna niṣpādakaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvajña tā ratna anukūla tvāt
translated: That path is one that produces the great jewel, because it is favorable to the jewel of omniscience.

analyzed: sadā prakāśitaḥ sa mārgaḥ asaṅga jñānasya bhagavataḥ
translated: That path is one that is always illuminated, because of the Blessed One's unobstructed knowledge.

original: kuśalamūladeśakānucīrṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvatathāgatānugṛhītatvāt /🔽duṣṭakleśānukūlavigataḥ sa mārgaḥ anunayapratighaprahīṇatvāt /
analyzed: kuśala mūla deśaka anucīrṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva tathāgata anugṛhīta tvāt  duṣṭa kleśa anukūla vigataḥ sa mārgaḥ anunaya pratigha prahīṇa tvāt
translated: That path is one that is practiced by those who teach the roots of virtue, because it is favored by all the tathāgatas.🔽That path is one that is free from the defilements that are favorable to the afflictions, because it is free from attachment and aversion.

analyzed: nihata rajaḥ sa mārgaḥ vyāpāda khila krodha apagata tvāt
translated: That path is one that has destroyed dust, because it is free from malice, resentment, and anger.

analyzed: sugati gamanīyaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva akuśala virahita tvāt
translated: That path is one that leads to a good rebirth, because it is free from all non-virtue.

analyzed: kṣemaṃgamaḥ mahā rāja saṃbodhi mārgaḥ nirvāṇa paryavasānaḥ
translated: Great King, the path to complete enlightenment is one that leads to safety, with nirvāṇa as its culmination.

analyzed: utpādaya mahā rāja bodhi cittam
translated: Great King, generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: rājā prāha ayaṃ brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ aśītivarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ loka utpanno /
analyzed: rājā prāha ayam brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām loke utpannaḥ
translated: The king said, Brahmin, the Tathāgata has appeared in the world when the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years.

analyzed: na śakyam tathāgatena sarve pāyaḥ śamayitum
translated: It is not possible for the Tathāgata to pacify all the lower realms.

original: ye sattvā avaruptakuśalamūlaste sattvāḥ phale sthitāḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlaḥ te sattvāḥ phale sthitāḥ
translated: Those beings who have planted the roots of virtue are the beings who are established in the fruit.

analyzed: kecid samādhi dhāraṇī kṣāntiṣu niṣpannāḥ
translated: Some are perfected in concentration, mnemonic powers, and patience.

original: utkṛṣṭakuśalamūlāstu ye sattvāste bodhau avaivartyāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: utkṛṣṭa kuśala mūlāḥ tu ye sattvāḥ te bodhau a vaivartyāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: But those beings with superior roots of virtue have become irreversible from enlightenment.

analyzed: kecid avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ deva manuṣya śriyam anubhavanti
translated: Some, having planted the roots of virtue, experience the glory of gods and humans.

analyzed: svaka svakaiḥ sattvāḥ kuśala akuśalaiḥ karmabhiḥ bhramanti
translated: Beings wander due to their own wholesome and unwholesome actions.

original: katame sattvā bhagavatā vinītāḥ sadekasattvasyāpi duḥkhaṃ na praśāntaṃ /
analyzed: katame sattvāḥ bhagavatā vinītāḥ sat eka sattvasya api duḥkham na praśāntam
translated: Which beings have been guided by the Blessed One, for whom even the suffering of a single being has not ceased?

analyzed: kṣetra bhūtaḥ kevalam bhagavataḥ āśrayaḥ
translated: The Blessed One's body is merely a field.

analyzed: na an avarupta kuśala mūlānām sattvānām duḥkha mocanam karoti
translated: He does not liberate beings from suffering unless they have planted the roots of virtue.

analyzed: utpādayāmi aham bodhi cittam
translated: I generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: bodhisattvacaryāṃ caraṃstenāhaṃ mahājñānasamucchrayeṇa acintyenodāreṇa dharmamukhapraveśena sattvān vinayeyaṃ buddhakāryaṃ ca kuryāṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva caryām caran tena aham mahā jñāna samucchrayeṇa acintyena udāreṇa dharma mukha praveśena sattvān vinayeyam buddha kāryam ca kuryām
translated: Practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, by that great accumulation of wisdom, with inconceivable vast entrance into the Dharma, I will guide beings and accomplish the Buddha's work.

original: na kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhāya cittaṃ KpSū
analyzed: na kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhāya cittam
translated: I will not only generate the mind for enlightenment in this defiled Buddha-field.

analyzed: pariṇāmayeyam
translated: I will dedicate [merit]

analyzed: yadi aham tādṛśam buddhakṣetram labheyam utpādayeyam aham bodhi cittam
translated: If I were to obtain such a buddha-field, I would generate the mind of awakening.

original: tadāhaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yadāhamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ ca spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: tadā aham bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi yadā aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ca spṛśeyam
translated: Then I would practice the conduct of a bodhisattva until I touched the highest complete enlightenment.

original: sarvaṃ ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ duḥkhaṃ praśamayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sarvam ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām duḥkham praśamayeyam
translated: And I would completely pacify all suffering for beings in that buddha-field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastādṛśamṛddhyabhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskṛtavān tadādarśavyūhaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tādṛśam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān tat ādarśavyūham nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then, son of noble family, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratna-garbha performed such a miraculous transformation and entered the samādhi called Array of Mirrors.

original: tathā samāhitena bhagavatā ādarśavyūhe samādhau tathārūpāvabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāhitena bhagavatā ādarśa vyūhe samādhau tathārūpa avabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: When the Blessed One was thus concentrated in the Array of Mirrors samādhi, such a radiance appeared.

original: yenāvabhāsena daśasu dikṣvekaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaḥ sarvaguṇavyūhā dṛṣyante /🔽keṣucid buddhā bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: yena avabhāsena daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ sarva guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣyante  keṣucid buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: By that radiance, in the ten directions, in each direction, world systems as numerous as the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields were seen, all beautifully arrayed.🔽In some, the Blessed Buddhas had passed into parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: keṣucid parinirvāṇāya saṃsthitāḥ
translated: In some, they were present, about to pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: yatra ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bodhivṛkṣamūle niṣaṇṇā māraṃ parājayanti /
analyzed: yatra ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bodhivṛkṣa mūle niṣaṇṇāḥ māram parājayanti
translated: Where bodhisattva mahāsattvas, seated at the foot of the Bodhi tree, defeat Māra.

analyzed: yatra ca acira abhisaṃbuddhāḥ dharmacakram pravartayanti
translated: Where they soon attain perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma.

analyzed: yatra ca acira pravṛtta dharmacakram dharmam deśayanti
translated: Where they teach the Dharma soon after setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

original: yatra ca buddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sphuṭāṃ buddhakṣetrāṃ /
analyzed: yatra ca buddhānām bodhisattvānām sphuṭām buddhakṣetrām
translated: Where the Buddha-fields are filled with Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yatra śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām utpādaḥ na asti
translated: Where there is no arising of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: yatra ca śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ utpadyante
translated: Where śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do arise.

original: yatra ca śūnyaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ buddhebhyo bodhisattvebhyaḥ KpSū
analyzed: yatra ca śūnyam buddhakṣetram buddhebhyaḥ bodhisattvebhyaḥ
translated: Where a Buddha-field is empty of Buddhas, bodhisattvas,

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ  kvacid kliṣṭam buddhakṣetram pañca kaṣāyam
translated: śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽Where a Buddha-field is defiled, with the five degenerations.

analyzed: kvacid pariśuddham apagata pañca kaṣāyam  kvacid utkṛṣṭāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Where it is pure, free from the five degenerations.🔽Where the beings are exalted.

analyzed: kvacid hīnāḥ  kvacid dīrgha āyuṣkāḥ
translated: Where they are inferior.🔽Where they have long lives.

analyzed: kvacid alpa āyuṣkāḥ
translated: Where they have short lives.

analyzed: kānicid buddhakṣetrāni agninā saṃvartante  kānicid udakena
translated: Some Buddha-fields are destroyed by fire.🔽Some by water.

analyzed: kānicid vāyunā  kvacid vivartante
translated: Some by wind.🔽Some are rolled up.

analyzed: kvacid vivṛttāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: Some, having been rolled up, remain.

analyzed: te sarve udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: They were all seen illuminated by that vast radiance.

original: sarvāvatī sā parṣattāṃ dṛṣṭvā buddhakṣetre guṇavyūhān /
analyzed: sarvāvatī sā parṣad tām dṛṣṭvā buddhakṣetre guṇa vyūhān
translated: The entire assembly, having seen the array of qualities in the Buddha-field,

original: samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ punā rājānametadavocat paśya mahārājaitān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān /
analyzed: samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ punar rājānam etat avocat paśya mahā rāja etān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān
translated: the brahmin Samudrareņu again said to the king, Your Majesty, behold these arrays of qualities in the Buddha-field.

analyzed: utpādaya mahā rājan uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Arouse the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment, Your Majesty.

analyzed: gṛhāṇa mahā rāja buddhakṣetram yādṛśam ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Take up, Your Majesty, the Buddha-field as you wish.

original: athāraṇemī rājā yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat kena bhagavan karmaṇā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ
analyzed: atha araṇemī rājā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat kena bhagavan karmaṇā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddham buddhakṣetram
translated: Then King Arṇemī, bowing with folded hands in the direction of the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One: By what karma, Blessed One, does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva take up a pure Buddha-field,

analyzed: kena karmaṇā a pariśuddham
translated: by what karma an impure one?

analyzed: utkṛṣṭāḥ sattvāḥ kena karmaṇā
translated: By what karma are beings excellent,

analyzed: yāvat dīrgha āyuṣkāḥ sattvāḥ vistaraḥ
translated: up to long-lived, in detail?

original: bhagavān āha praṇidhānavaśena mahārāja bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti apagatapañcakaṣāyaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha praṇidhāna vaśena mahā rāja bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddham buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇāti apagata pañca kaṣāyam
translated: The Blessed One said, Your Majesty, by the power of aspiration a bodhisattva-mahāsattva takes up a pure Buddha-field, free from the five degenerations.

analyzed: praṇidhānena a pariśuddham
translated: By aspiration an impure one.

analyzed: rājā prāha aham bhadanta kpsū
translated: The king said, Venerable One,

original: bhagavan nagaraṃ praviśyaikāgre niṣadya praṇidhānaṃ cintayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhagavat nagaram praviśya ekāgre niṣadya praṇidhānam cintayiṣyāmi
translated: I, Blessed One, having entered the city and sat in seclusion, will contemplate my vow.

original: tathārūpaṃ me buddhakṣetramapagatapañcakaṣāyaṃ rocate tatremā subhavacaryā pariṇāmayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tathārūpam me buddhakṣetram apagata pañca kaṣāyam rocate tatra imā su bhava caryā pariṇāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I delight in a Buddha-field of that kind, free from the five degenerations, and there I will dedicate these good practices.

original: bhagavān āha yasyedānīṃ mahārāja kālaṃ manyase /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yasya idānīm mahā rāja kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, If it is the right time for you, great king.

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavato 'ntikāt prakāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhikṣu saṅgham ca triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ ntikāt prakāntaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, King Arṇemi, having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and the assembly of monks, circumambulated them three times and departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: nagaraṃ praviśya svake gṛha ekāgraḥ pratisaṃlīno niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: nagaram praviśya svake gṛhe ekāgraḥ pratisaṃlīnaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having entered the city and his own house, he sat in seclusion, one-pointed.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam vyūham cintayati
translated: He contemplated the arrangement of the vow for a Buddha-field.

analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jyeṣṭham rāja putram animiṣam āmantrayati
translated: Then, noble sir, the brāhmaṇa Sāgara-megha addressed his eldest prince, Animiṣa:

analyzed: utpādaya tvam animiṣa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: You, Animiṣa, should arouse the mind for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yacca tvayā tribhiḥ puṇyakriyāvastubhiḥ śubhaṃ caratā puṇyamārjitaṃ tatsarvamanuttarayāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayā /
analyzed: yat ca tvayā tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ śubham caratā puṇyam ārjitam tat sarvam anuttarayām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayā
translated: And whatever merit you have accumulated by performing the three bases of meritorious action, you should dedicate all that towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa prāha ahamapyupādhyāya svagṛhaṃ gatvaikākī rahogato niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃścintayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: sa prāha aham api upādhyāya sva gṛham gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān cintayiṣyāmi
translated: He said, I too, preceptor, will go to my own home, sit alone in seclusion, and contemplate the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field.

analyzed: yadi bodhāya cittam utpatsyate
translated: If I generate the mind towards enlightenment,

analyzed: punar āgamya bhagavataḥ sakāśam bodhi cittam pariṇāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I will return to the Blessed One and dedicate the enlightened mind.

original: ataḥ so 'pi rājaputro bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavato 'ntikāt prakāntaḥ / KpSū
analyzed: atas saḥ pi rāja putraḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavataḥ ntikāt prakāntaḥ
translated: Then that prince also bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and the assembly of monks, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: svakaṃ niveśanaṃ gatvā ekākī rahogato niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ cintayati /
analyzed: svakam niveśanam gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayati
translated: Having gone to his own house, he sat alone in seclusion and contemplated the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo 'grapurohito dvitīyaṃ rājaputraṃ nimantrayitvovāca /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gra purohitaḥ dvitīyam rāja putram nimantrayitvā uvāca
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, invited the second prince and said:

analyzed: utpādaya tvam kumāra bodhi cittam
translated: You, prince, should generate the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: vistareṇa peyālam yāvat
translated: In detail, as before, up to...

analyzed: sarva rāja putra sahasram bodhau samādāpayati
translated: He inspired a thousand princes to attain enlightenment.

analyzed: caturaśītiḥ koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi
translated: Eighty-four thousand minor kings,

original: anyāni ca navatiḥ koṭyaḥ sattvānāṃ bodhau samādāpayati /
analyzed: anyāni ca navatiḥ koṭyaḥ sattvānām bodhau samādāpayati
translated: and another ninety koṭis of beings, he inspired to attain enlightenment.

analyzed: te pi sarve evam āhuḥ
translated: They all said,

original: vayamapi svasvagṛhaṃ gatvaikākino niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ cintayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api sva sva gṛham gatvā ekākinaḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too, having gone to our own homes, sitting alone, will contemplate the adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: evamuktvā sarva eva svagṛhāṇi gatvaikākino niṣaṇṇāḥ saptavarṣāṇi buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānāni cintayanti //
analyzed: evam uktvā sarve eva sva gṛhāṇi gatvā ekākinaḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ sapta varṣāṇi buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānāni cintayanti
translated: Having said this, they all went to their own homes and sat alone, for seven years contemplating the vows for the adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyaivaṃ apareṇa samayena cetasaḥ parivitarka udāpādi /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya evam apareṇa samayena cetasaḥ parivitarkaḥ udāpādi
translated: Then, noble sir, at another time, this thought arose in the mind of the brahmin Samudrareṇu:

analyzed: mayā khalu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bahu prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi samādāpitāni
translated: Indeed, I have inspired many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of niyutas of beings to the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: ayaṃ ca mayā buddho bhagavān saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakarṇairupanimantritaḥ sārdhamaparimitena bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: ayam ca mayā buddhaḥ bhagavān sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakarṇaiḥ upanimantritaḥ sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: And I have invited this Buddha, the Blessed One, for seven years with all the necessities, together with an immeasurable saṅgha of monks.

original: yadi ca mamānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryate tathā cāyaṃ praṇidhānaṃ saṃpadyate yad ahaṃ devāsuragandharvayakṣarākṣasakumbhāṇḍān 🔽asmin mahāyajñe samādāpayāmi /
analyzed: yadi ca mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryate tathā ca ayam praṇidhānam saṃpadyate yat aham deva asura gandharva yakṣa rākṣasa kumbhāṇḍān  asmin mahāyajñe samādāpayāmi
translated: If my aspiration for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is fulfilled, and if this vow is accomplished, then I will inspire the gods, asuras, gandharvas, yakshas, rakshasas, kumbhandas,

analyzed: kpsū
translated: and mahoragas to participate in this great sacrifice.

original: atha kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ purohito vaiśravaṇamākāṅkṣate darśanāya /
analyzed: atha kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ purohitaḥ vaiśravaṇam ākāṅkṣate darśanāya
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin priest Samudrarenu desired to see Vaisravana.

original: atha khalu vaiśravaṇo mahārājānekairyakṣaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto yena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastenopajagāmopetya
analyzed: atha khalu vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rāja anekaiḥ yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ yena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upajagāma upetya
translated: Then the great king Vaisravana, surrounded and attended by many hundreds of thousands of yakshas, approached the brahmin Samudrarenu. Having approached,

original: samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyāgrataḥ sthitvaitadavocat kiṃ brāhmaṇa matto hyākāṅkṣase /
analyzed: samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya agratas sthitvā etat avocat kim brāhmaṇa mattaḥ hi ākāṅkṣase
translated: he stood in front of the brahmin Samudrarenu and said this: Brahmin, what do you desire from me?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha kaḥ bhavān
translated: The brahmin said, Who are you?

original: vaiśrāvaṇaḥ prāha śrutaṃ tvayā brāhmaṇāsti vaiśravaṇo nāma yakṣādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: vaiśrāvaṇaḥ prāha śrutam tvayā brāhmaṇa asti vaiśravaṇaḥ nāma yakṣa adhipatiḥ
translated: Vaisravana said, Brahmin, have you heard that there is a lord of the yakshas named Vaisravana?

original: so ahaṃ / brāhmaṇa kim ājñāpayasi kiṃ karavāṇi / /
analyzed: saḥ u aham brāhmaṇa kim ājñāpayasi kim karavāṇi
translated: I am he. Brahmin, what do you command? What can I do for you?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha
translated: The brahmin said,

analyzed: śṛṇu yakṣa adhipate ham bhagavat pūjām kariṣye
translated: Listen, lord of the yakshas! I will make offerings to the Blessed One.

analyzed: tvam atra autsukyam āpadyasva
translated: You should take an interest in this.

original: sa prāha tathāstu yathā tvaṃ brāhmaṇākāṅkṣase /
analyzed: sa prāha tathā astu yathā tvam brāhmaṇa ākāṅkṣase
translated: He said, So be it, as you brahmins desire.

original: tena hi tvaṃ mahārāja yākṣān asmākaṃ vacanenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpaya /
analyzed: tena hi tvam mahā rāja yākṣān asmākam vacanena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpaya
translated: Therefore, great king, in our words, encourage the yakshas to generate the resolve for supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ca punar samādāpaya
translated: And encourage them in this way:

analyzed: saced yūyam yakṣāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau arthikāḥ gacchata
translated: If you yakshas are intent on supreme perfect enlightenment, go.

analyzed: yūyam pārāt samudrasya gośīrṣam uraga sāra candanam ānayantu
translated: From the other side of the ocean, bring sandalwood from the Gośīrṣa mountain and from the Uragasāra mountain.

analyzed: apare bhagavataḥ rthe gandham apare vividhām puṣpān
translated: Others for the Blessed One's sake, bring various fragrances and flowers.

analyzed: yena aham divase divase bhagavataḥ pūjām kariṣyāmi
translated: So that I can make offerings to the Blessed One day after day.

analyzed: evam astu brāhmaṇa
translated: So be it, brahmin.

original: vaiśravaṇo mahārājā tasya brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya tatraivāntarhitaḥ bherīmāhatya yakṣarākṣasāṃ sannipātyaitadavocat KpSū
analyzed: vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājā tasya brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya tatra eva antarhitaḥ bherīm āhatya yakṣa rākṣasām sannipātya etat avocat
translated: Having promised the brahmin, the great king Vaiśravaṇa, having struck the drum there, having assembled the yakshas and rākṣasas, said this:

analyzed: yat khalu mārṣāḥ jānīyuḥ
translated: Whatever you know, sirs,

analyzed: ayam jambudvīpe samudrareṇuḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ rājñaḥ raṇeminaḥ gra purohitaḥ
translated: in this Jambudvīpa, the brahmin named Samudrarenu is the chief priest of King Araṇemi.

original: taṃ ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṅghena saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakaraṇairupasthāsyati /
analyzed: tam ratnagarbham tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham sārdham bhikṣu saṅghena sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upasthāsyati
translated: He will serve the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratnagarbha, together with the assembly of monks, for seven years with all requisites.

analyzed: tat yuṣmābhiḥ tat kuśalam anumoditavyam
translated: You should rejoice in that merit.

original: tena ca yūyaṃ kuśalamūlenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayatā /
analyzed: tena ca yūyam kuśala mūlena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayatā
translated: And you should generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through that root of merit.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahuyakṣarākṣasakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi añjaliṃ kṛtvocuḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bahu yakṣa rākṣasa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi añjalim kṛtvā ūcuḥ
translated: Then at that time many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of yakṣas and rākṣasas, with palms joined, said:

original: yaḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya puṇyābhisyandaḥ kuśalābhiṣyando ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya puṇya abhisyandaḥ kuśala abhiṣyandaḥ ratnagarbham tathāgatam arhantam
translated: The merit and wholesome flow of the brāhmaṇa Samudrareṇu, who serves the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratnagarbha,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upatiṣṭhati sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: together with the immeasurable assembly of monks, for seven years with all requisites,

original: tatsarvaṃ vayaṃ puṇyaskandhamanumodāmastena ca kuśalamūlenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyemahi /
analyzed: tat sarvam vayam puṇya skandham anumodāmaḥ tena ca kuśala mūlena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyemahi
translated: we rejoice in all that accumulation of merit, and through that root of merit may we attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ prāha śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ
translated: The great king Vaiśravaṇa said, Listen, sirs.

original: yaḥ kaścid yuṣmākaṃ kuśalamūlenārthikaḥ puṇyārthī sa saptavarṣān pārāt samudrasya gośīrṣoragasāracandanamānayatu /

original: tena hi mārṣā gacchāmo jambudvīpamavatarāmaḥ bhagavato darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /

translated: Then those five kings of gods, each one of the kings of gods, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of living beings, women, men, boys, and girls,

translated: ‘If my hope for

translated: supreme perfect enlightenment is fulfilled,

translated: up to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of beings generating the mind of awakening to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

translated: Together with women, men, boys, and girls, they came to this four-continent world together with Shakra to see the Blessed One,

translated: with women, men, boys, and girls who had generated the mind of enlightenment for the highest perfect enlightenment, had come to the four continents

analyzed: yadi mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūriḥ bhavati tat yathā evam koṭī śatam vaiśravaṇānām yāvat koṭī śatam mahābrahmaṇām mām anuvartanti tathā evam  kpsū
translated: If my wish for highest complete enlightenment is fulfilled, then just as a hundred koṭis of Vaiśravaṇas up to a hundred koṭis of great Brahmās follow me, may the Blessed One follow me in the same way.

analyzed: me bhagavān anuvartate
translated: The Blessed One followed him.

original: yadevaṃrūpaṃ mahāprātihāryaṃ kuryāt yāvattrisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ tiryāñco yāmalokikā nairayikāsteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ duḥkhāvedanā
analyzed: yat evaṃrūpam mahā prātihāryam kuryāt yāvat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ tiryāñcaḥ yāmalokikāḥ nairayikāḥ teṣām sarveṣām duḥkha āvedanā  /
translated: If one were to perform such a great miracle, up to the humans, animals, and those in the Yama world in the great trichiliocosm, and the suffering sensations of all those in the hells

analyzed: praśāmyeta sukhā vedanā utpadyeta
translated: were to be pacified, and a feeling of pleasure were to arise,

original: teṣāṃ caikaikakasyāgrato buddhanirmitaṃ tiṣṭhet yastāṃ sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayet /

translated: and a Buddha emanation were to stand before each of them, exhorting those beings to highest genuine full Awakening,

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya cetasā cittamājñāya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ pratāpaṃ nāma
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya cetasā cittam ājñāya tasyām velāyām pratāpam nāma
translated: Then, noble sir, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, knowing the thought of the brahmin Samudrarena, at that time entered the concentration called

analyzed: samādhim samāpannaḥ

analyzed: yathā samāhitena cittena bhagavān pratāpe samādhau bhagavataḥ kāyāt ā ekaikasmāt romakūpāt
translated: As the Blessed One's mind was thus concentrated, from each pore of the Blessed One's body

original: gaṇanāsamatikrāntā raśmaya udgatāstaiśca raśmibhirayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ sphuṭo 'bhut /
analyzed: gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ raśmayaḥ udgatāḥ taiḥ ca raśmibhiḥ ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ sphuṭaḥ bhuj
translated: more than a full count of light rays emerged, and this trichiliocosm was filled with those light rays.

translated: For those beings born in the hot hells, cool winds blow, by which all the suffering of hunger, thirst, and fatigue of those hell beings is pacified, and a feeling of bliss arises.

analyzed: ekaikasya ca nairayikasya nirmitaḥ buddha vigrahaḥ grataḥ tiṣṭhati dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛta gātraḥ aśītibhiḥ anuvyañjanaiḥ samalaṅkṛta śarīraḥ
translated: And in front of each hell being, an illusory Buddha image stands, with a body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, and a body adorned with the eighty minor marks.

analyzed: atha teṣām nairayikānām sukha samarpitānām etat abhūt
translated: Then, to those hell beings filled with bliss, this thought occurred:

original: KpSū kiṃ pratyayamasmākaṃ duḥkhapraśāntaṃ sukhaṃ ca prādurbhūtaṃ / /
analyzed: kim pratyayam asmākam duḥkha praśāntam sukham ca prādurbhūtam
translated: What is the cause for the pacification of our suffering and the arising of bliss?

analyzed: te tam bhagavantam paśyanti dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛtam aśīti anuvyañjana virājita gātram
translated: They see that Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, with a body radiant with the eighty minor marks.

analyzed: te tam dṛṣṭvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Having seen him, they say this:

original: asya mahākāruṇikasya mahātmano 'nubhāvena vayamevaṃ sukhinaḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: asya mahā kāruṇikasya mahātmanaḥ nubhāvena vayam evam sukhinaḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: By the power of this great compassionate one, we have become so happy.

analyzed: te prīti saumanasya jātaḥ prasanna manasaḥ bhagavantam prekṣante
translated: They, with joy and gladness, with serene minds, look at the Blessed One.

original: teṣāṃ bhagavānāha sādhu yūyaṃ sattvā namo buddhāyeti vācaṃ bhāṣatāṃ /
analyzed: teṣām bhagavān āha sādhu yūyam sattvāḥ namaḥ buddhāya iti vācam bhāṣatām
translated: The Blessed One says to them, Good, good! You beings, speak the words 'Homage to the Buddha.'

analyzed: anuttarāyām ca samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayata
translated: And arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ yuṣmākaṃ duḥkhāvedanā na bhūya utpadyate /
analyzed: evam yuṣmākam duḥkha avedanā na bhūyas utpadyate
translated: In this way, your experience of suffering will not arise again.

original: nityaṃ ca sukhāyā vedanāyā lābhino bhaviṣyatha /
analyzed: nityam ca sukhāyāḥ vedanāyāḥ lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: And you will always obtain the experience of happiness.

analyzed: te evam āhuḥ
translated: They say this:

analyzed: namaḥ buddhāya utpādayāmaḥ vayam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Homage to the Buddha! We arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat ca asmākam kuśala mūlam karma āvaraṇa a kṣayāya saṃvartatu
translated: And may that wholesome root of ours lead to the exhaustion of karmic obscurations.

analyzed: tatas ca kecid cyutvā manuṣyāṇām sabhā gatāyām upapadyante
translated: Then some of them, having passed away, are reborn in the human realm.

original: ye nairayikāḥ sattvā agninā dahyante teṣāṃ te raśmayaḥ śītalān vāyūn pramuñcanti /
analyzed: ye nairayikāḥ sattvāḥ agninā dahyante teṣām te raśmayaḥ śītalān vāyūn pramuñcanti
translated: Those beings in the hells who are burned by fire, for them those rays emit cool breezes.

analyzed: te taiḥ spṛṣṭāḥ praśānta kṣudh tarṣāḥ ca aduḥkhāḥ bhavanti
translated: They, being touched by them, with hunger and thirst pacified, become free from suffering.

original: yāvat kecit tataścyāvitvā manuṣyāṇāṃ sabhāgatāyāṃ upapadyante /
analyzed: yāvat kecid tatas cyāvitvā manuṣyāṇām sabhā gatāyām upapadyante
translated: As long as some of them, having fallen from there, are reborn in the same world as humans.

original: evaṃ tiryagyonirvaktavyā evaṃ yāvan manuṣyā vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam tiryagyoniḥ vaktavyā evam yāvat manuṣyāḥ vaktavyāḥ
translated: The animal realm should be described in the same way, and so on up to humans.

original: sā ca prabhā pratinivṛtyā bhagavantaṃ triṣkṛtvaḥ KpSū
analyzed: sā ca prabhā pratinivṛtyā bhagavantam triṣkṛtvaḥ
translated: And that light, having returned, circumambulated the Blessed One three times

analyzed: pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavataḥ uṣṇīṣe ntarhitā
translated: and disappeared into the top of the Blessed One's head.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca gaṇanātikrāntā devamanuṣyā yakṣarākṣasanāgāsurā avaivartikāḥ sthāpitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ deva manuṣyāḥ yakṣa rākṣasa nāga asurāḥ a vaivartikāḥ sthāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And having seen that, countless gods, humans, yakshas, rakshasas, nagas, and asuras were established in irreversibility in supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntaḥ ca sattvāḥ samādhi kṣānti dhāraṇī pratilabdhavantaḥ
translated: And countless beings attained concentration, patience, and retention.

original: yairjambūdvīpakairmanuṣyaiḥ śrutamañjure nagare rājadhānyāṃ jambūvanodyānaṃ bhagavato 'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca devairdivyairalaṅkāravibhūṣaṇairalaṅkṛtaṃ
analyzed: yaiḥ jambūdvīpakaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ śrutamañjure nagare rājadhānyām jambu vana udyānam bhagavataḥ rthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca devaiḥ divyaiḥ alaṅkāra vibhūṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛtam
translated: Those humans in Jambudvipa who heard that in the capital city of Amrapali, the grove of Amrapali was adorned for the Blessed One and the assembly of monks with divine ornaments and adornments by the gods,

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam gatvā paśyemaḥ
translated: We should go and see.

original: tatra ca ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ paśyema bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: tatra ca ratnagarbham tathāgatam paśyema bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: And there we should see the Tathagata Ratnagarbha and the assembly of monks.

original: tatra gatvā bhagavataḥ sakāśād dharmaṃ śṛṇuyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra gatvā bhagavataḥ sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyāmaḥ
translated: Having gone there, we should listen to the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena divasedivase 'nekāni devamanuṣyebhyaḥ strīpuruṣadārakadārikākoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena divase divase nekāni deva manuṣyebhyaḥ strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: At that time, every day, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods, men, women, boys, and girls

original: mañjurakaṃ nagaramāgacchanti bhagavato darśanāyopasaṃkramaṇāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: mañjurakam nagaram āgacchanti bhagavataḥ darśanāya upasaṃkramaṇāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: came to the city of Mañjūṣa to see the Blessed One, to approach him, to attend on him, and on the community of monks,

analyzed: tam codyānām didṛkṣavaḥ
translated: and to see that park.

analyzed: tasya ca udyānasya viṃśat dvāra sahasrāṇi sapta ratna mayāni abhūvan
translated: That park had twenty thousand gates made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: ekaikasmin udyāna dvāre pañca pañca śatāni ratna pīṭhānām prajñaptāni
translated: At each park gate, five hundred jeweled seats were arranged.

analyzed: teṣu ca pañca pañca māṇavaka śatāni upaviṣṭāni
translated: And five hundred young brahmins were seated on each of them.

original: ye te sattvā gatāstamudyānaṃ praviśanti tāṃste māṇavakā buddhasāraṇaṃ gamayanti dharmaśaraṇaṃ gamayanti saṅghaśaraṇaṃ gamayanti /
analyzed: ye te sattvāḥ gatāḥ tam udyānam praviśanti tān te māṇavakāḥ buddha sāraṇam gamayanti dharma śaraṇam gamayanti saṅgha śaraṇam gamayanti
translated: Those beings who went to that park and entered it, those young brahmins led them to take refuge in the Buddha, led them to take refuge in the Dharma, led them to take refuge in the Saṅgha,

analyzed: an uttarāyām kpsū
translated: and inspired them to generate the mind of unsurpassed

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti cittam ca utpādayanti
translated: perfect complete enlightenment, and they generated the mind of enlightenment.

original: āsanasthā ye dūrasthāyinaḥ paścāttamudyānaṃ praviśanti bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca darśanāya /
analyzed: āsana sthāḥ ye dūra sthāyinaḥ paścāt tam udyānam praviśanti bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca darśanāya
translated: Those who were seated far away entered that garden later to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to attend upon him, and to see the community of monks.

original: evaṃ samudrareṇumā brāhmaṇenāgrapurohitena tāni saptavarṣāṇi gaṇanātikrāntā devā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā vinītā niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /🔽gaṇanātikrāntā nāgāḥ asurā yakṣarākṣasāḥ kumbhāṇḍā gandharvāḥ pretāḥ piśācā nairayikā gaṇanātikrāntāḥ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā
analyzed: evam samudrareṇumān brāhmaṇena agra purohitena tāni sapta varṣāṇi gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ devāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ vinītāḥ niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā  gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ nāgāḥ asurāḥ yakṣa rākṣasāḥ kumbhāṇḍāḥ gandharvāḥ pretāḥ piśācāḥ nairayikāḥ gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā  /
translated: Thus, for those seven years, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, the chief priest, inspired, trained, settled, and established more than counted gods in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: vinītāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: More than counted nāgas, asuras, yakṣas, rākṣasas, kumbhāṇḍas, gandharvas, pretas, piśācas, and hell beings were inspired, trained, settled, and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat tiryagyoni gatāḥ iti
translated: Up to those born as animals.

original: sa teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāmatyayena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturaśītiścakrasahasrāṇi sthāpayitvā divyaṃ cakraratnaṃ /
analyzed: sa teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām atyayena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturaśītiḥ cakra sahasrāṇi sthāpayitvā divyam cakra ratnam
translated: When those seven years had passed, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, having set aside eighty-four thousand wheels, except for the divine wheel-treasure,

analyzed: caturaśīti hasti sahasrāṇi sapta ratna alaṅkāra vibhūṣitāni sthāpayitvā hasti ratnam
translated: eighty-four thousand elephants adorned with the ornaments of the seven jewels, except for the elephant-treasure,

analyzed: yāvat caturaśīti ratha sahasrāṇi niryātayati
translated: And for eighty-four thousand years he made offerings.

original: teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ atyayena rājño 'raṇeminaḥ na rāgacchanda utpadyate /🔽na dveṣacchandaḥ na mohacchandaḥ na rājacchandaḥ na dhanacchandaḥ na KpSū
analyzed: teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām atyayena rājñaḥ raṇeminaḥ na rāga chandaḥ utpadyate  na dveṣa chandaḥ na moha chandaḥ na rāja chandaḥ na dhana chandaḥ na kpsū
translated: After the passing of those seven years, King Arṇe-mi did not give rise to desire for passion,

original: putracchandaḥ na devīcchandaḥ nāhāracchandaḥ na pānacchandaḥ na vastracchandaḥ na gandhacchandaḥ na yānacchandaḥ na nidracchandaḥ nātmacchandaḥ /
analyzed: putra chandaḥ na devī chandaḥ na āhāra chandaḥ na pāna chandaḥ na vastra chandaḥ na gandha chandaḥ na yāna chandaḥ na nidra chandaḥ na ātma chandaḥ
translated: did not give rise to desire for hatred, did not give rise to desire for delusion, did not give rise to desire for kingship, did not give rise to desire for wealth, did not give rise to desire for sons, did not give rise to desire for queens, did not give rise to desire for food, did not give rise to desire for drink, did not give rise to desire for clothing, did not give rise to desire for perfume, did not give rise to desire for vehicles, did not give rise to desire for sleep, did not give rise to desire for self,

analyzed: na para chandam kṛtavān
translated: and did not give rise to desire for others.

analyzed: sapta varṣāṇi na pārśvam nikṣiptavān
translated: For seven years he did not lay his side down.

analyzed: na ca asya rātri saṃjñā utpannā
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of night.

analyzed: na divasa saṃjñā utpannā
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of day.

original: na rūpasaṃjñāṃ na śabdasaṃjñāṃ na rasasaṃjñāṃ na gandhasaṃjñāṃ na sparśāsaṃjñāṃ utpāditavān /
analyzed: na rūpa saṃjñām na śabda saṃjñām na rasa saṃjñām na gandha saṃjñām na sparśa asaṃjñām utpāditavān
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of form, the notion of sound, the notion of smell, the notion of taste, or the notion of touch.

analyzed: taiḥ ca saptabhiḥ varṣaiḥ kāya śramaḥ na utpannaḥ
translated: For those seven years, he did not give rise to physical fatigue.

original: nityaṃ satatasamitaṃ daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyāṃ diśi sahasraṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paramāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: nityam satata samitam daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasram buddhakṣetram paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām paśyati
translated: Always, continuously, in the ten directions, in each direction, he sees the array of qualities of the Buddha-fields in the world-realms equal to the atoms in a thousand Buddha-fields.

analyzed: na ca sumeruḥ cakṣuṣaḥ vabhāsam āgacchati
translated: And Mount Sumeru does not come within the range of his vision.

original: nānye parvatāḥ na cakravāḍamahācakravāḍāḥ na lokāntarikā na candrādityau na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣo 'vabhāsaṃ āgacchanti /🔽yathā tāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: na anye parvatāḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na loka āntarikāḥ na candra ādityau na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣaḥ vabhāsam āgacchanti  yathā tām buddhakṣetram pariśuddhām paśyati
translated: Other mountains, the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, the intervening spaces, the moon and sun, and the celestial palaces do not come within the range of his vision.🔽As he sees the perfectly pure Buddha-field,

analyzed: tathā eva pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyan praṇidhānam cintayati
translated: in the same way, seeing the array of qualities of the perfectly pure Buddha-field, he forms a resolution.

original: yathāraṇemī rājā īdṛśena sukhaguṇavihāreṇa saptavarṣāṇi viharati /
analyzed: yathā araṇemī rājā īdṛśena sukha guṇa vihāreṇa sapta varṣāṇi viharati
translated: Just as King Araṇemi dwells for seven years in such a pleasurable and virtuous dwelling,

analyzed: īdṛśān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhān paśyati
translated: seeing such an array of qualities of the Buddha-field,

analyzed: pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham praṇidhānam
translated: forming a resolution for a perfectly pure Buddha-field,

analyzed: cintayan niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: sitting and contemplating.

analyzed: evam animiṣaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ rāja putraḥ
translated: In the same way, the eldest prince Animisa,

analyzed: nimuḥ
translated: Nimisa,

analyzed: indra gaṇaḥ
translated: the Indra group,

original: evaṃ tadrājñaḥ sarvaṃ putrasahastaṃ ca caturaśītikoṭṭarājasahasrāṇi aparāṇi ca dvānavatiprāṇakoṭyaḥ sarvāṇyevameva saptavarṣāṇi ekākino rahogatāḥ
analyzed: evam tat rājñaḥ sarvam putra sahastam ca caturaśīti koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi aparāṇi ca dvānavati prāṇa koṭyaḥ sarvāṇi evam eva sapta varṣāṇi ekākinaḥ rahaḥ gatāḥ
translated: Thus, the king, all his thousand sons, the eighty-four thousand minor kings, and the other nine hundred and twenty million beings, all in the same way, for seven years, alone and in seclusion,

original: daśasu dikṣvaikaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān lokadhātūn paśyanti /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn paśyanti
translated: they see in the ten directions, in each direction, world systems equal to the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields.

original: na ca teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ antareṇa rāgacchanda utpanno na dveṣacchando na mohacchandaḥ /
analyzed: na ca teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām antareṇa rāga chandaḥ utpannaḥ na dveṣa chandaḥ na moha chandaḥ
translated: And during those seven years, not even a desire for passion, hatred, or delusion arose in them.

analyzed: yāvat na teṣām śrama sthānam utpannam abhūt
translated: Until not even a thought of weariness arose in them.

original: satatasamitaṃ ca daśasu dikṣvaikaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyanti /
analyzed: satata samitam ca daśasu dikṣu aikaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti
translated: And constantly, in the ten directions, in each direction, they see the arrays of qualities of buddha-fields equal to the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields.

analyzed: na ca teṣām sumeruḥ cakṣusaḥ vabhāsam āgacchati
translated: And Mount Sumeru does not appear to their eyes.

original: na cānye parvatā yāvanna divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣo 'vabhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: na ca anye parvatāḥ yāvat na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣaḥ vabhāsam āgacchanti
translated: And no other mountains, up to the divine palaces, appear to their eyes.

original: yathaiva te buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ tathaiva pariśuddhabuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānaṃ cintayanti /
analyzed: yathā eva te buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ tathā eva pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam cintayanti
translated: Just as they have seen the arrays of qualities in the Buddha-field, they conceive the vow for the arrays of qualities in the perfectly pure Buddha-field.

original: sarva evamīdṛśena guṇavihāreṇa saptavarṣān viharanti /🔽kecit pariśuddhabuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ cintayanti /
analyzed: sarve evam īdṛśena guṇa vihāreṇa sapta varṣān viharanti  kecid pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām cintayanti
translated: All of them dwell in such a practice of qualities for seven years.🔽Some conceive the arrays of qualities in the perfectly pure Buddha-field,

analyzed: kecid a pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayanti
translated: while some conceive the arrays of qualities in the impure Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastāni saptavarṣāṇi nirgatāni niṣṭhitāni viditvā saptaratnaṃ niryātayati /
analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tāni sapta varṣāṇi nirgatāni niṣṭhitāni viditvā sapta ratnam niryātayati
translated: Then the brahmin Samudrareņu, knowing that those seven years had passed and were completed, offered the seven jewels.

original: KpSū yena ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat mayā bhadanta bhagavan rājāraṇemī
analyzed: yena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat mayā bhadanta bhagavan rājāraṇemī  /
translated: He bowed with folded hands in the direction of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and said to the Blessed One: Venerable Blessed One, I have inspired King Aranemi

analyzed: anutarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitaḥ
translated: to the highest complete enlightenment.

original: sa gṛhaṃ gatvaikākī rahogataḥ pratisaṃlīno niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa gṛham gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ pratisaṃlīnaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: He went home, alone, secluded, and sat down in private.

original: na cātra kasyacin manuṣyasya praveśo dīyate /
analyzed: na ca atra kasyacid manuṣyasya praveśaḥ dīyate
translated: And no human being was allowed to enter there.

original: evaṃ tatsahasraṃ rājaputrāṇāṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitaṃ /
analyzed: evam tat sahasram rāja putrāṇām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitam
translated: In the same way, he inspired a thousand princes to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

translated: In that Buddha-field, Blessed One, where I will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, there will be no hells, no animal realms, no realms of Yama.

translated: And may all sentient beings be endowed with such skill in miraculous powers that they travel to many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhafields in a single instant of mind.

original: mā ca tatra sattvā bhaveyuḥ parigrahavanto 'ntataḥ svaśarīre 'pyanāgṛhītamānasāḥ /

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all beings would be irreversible from highest genuine full Awakening.
