translated: All beings there would be bound to one more birth,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā praṇidhānam
translated: except through a vow.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ tatra eka pūrvāhṇena buddha anubhāvena gaṇanā atikrāntān buddhān paryupāsīran
translated: In one morning, through the power of the Buddha, all beings there would attend to more than can be counted Buddhas.

original: yāvad vividhena bodhisattvavikurvitenākāṅkṣeyuḥ buddhānāṃ pūjāṃ kartuṃ tathaiva teṣāṃ siddhyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vividhena bodhisattva vikurvitena ākāṅkṣeyuḥ buddhānām pūjām kartum tathā eva teṣām siddhyeyuḥ
translated: And as much as they would wish to make offerings to the Buddhas through various kinds of bodhisattva transformations, it would be accomplished just like that.

analyzed: tena eva pūrva bhaktena vivarteyuḥ
translated: They would be able to live on that very same food from the past.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca buddha piṭakam kathayeyuḥ
translated: All beings would be able to recite the Buddha's canon.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca nārāyaṇa bala samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: All beings would be endowed with the strength of Narayana.

original: na kaścit sattvo buddhakṣetraguṇālaṅkārasya varṇaparyantaṃ śaktaḥ syādgṛhītumantaśo divyenāpi cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: na kaścid sattvaḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṅkārasya varṇa paryantam śaktaḥ syāt gṛhītum antaśas divyena api cakṣuṣā
translated: No being would be able to fully describe the adornments of the Buddha-field, even with a divine eye.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ tatra pratisaṃvid prāptāḥ syuḥ
translated: All beings there would attain the analytical knowledges.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya pratibhānāḥ
translated: They would have innumerable insights.

analyzed: ekaikasya ca bodhisattvasya yojana sahasra pramāṇam syāt
translated: Each bodhisattva would be a thousand leagues tall.

analyzed: prabhāsvaram ca tat buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: That Buddha-field would be radiant.

analyzed: samantena ca gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhāḥ tatra dṛśyeyuḥ
translated: On all sides, beyond count, the adornments of the Buddha-fields would be seen there.

original: ye cātra sattvā upapadyeyuryāvadbodhiparyantena brahmacāriṇaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca atra sattvāḥ upapadyeyuḥ yāvat bodhi paryantena brahmacāriṇaḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings born there would be celibate until enlightenment.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ sa devakasya lokasya namasyanīyāḥ syuḥ
translated: They would be worthy of homage from the world with its gods.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na indriya vikalāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Until enlightenment, their faculties would be unimpaired.

analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ divya atikrāntam ārya prīti sukham pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And the beings born there would attain divine, supermundane noble joy and happiness.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca tatra kuśala mūla samavadhānāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings there would be united in the roots of virtue.

original: sarvasattvāśca tatra navāni vastrāṇi kāśāyāṇi dhārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca tatra navāni vastrāṇi kāśāyāṇi dhārayeyuḥ
translated: And all beings there would wear new saffron-colored robes.

original: sahopapannāśca tatra sattvāḥ suvibhaktivatīṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ suvibhaktivatīm samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And the beings born there would attain the samadhi called 'well-ordered',

original: yasya samādheḥ pratilābhādgaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā buddhān paryupasīran yāvad bodhiparyantenānupaśyeyuḥ🔽ye ca tatra bodhisattvā upapadyeyuḥ te yādṛgjātīyāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛgjātīyān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ KpSū
analyzed: yasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā buddhān paryupasīran yāvat bodhi paryantena anupaśyeyuḥ  ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ upapadyeyuḥ te yādṛś jātīyām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛś jātīyān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ
translated: by attaining which samadhi they would go to buddha-fields beyond number and serve the buddhas until the end of their lives.🔽And the bodhisattvas born there would see the arrays of qualities of buddha-fields of whatever kind they wished,

original: teṣu ratnavṛkṣeṣu paśyeyuḥ /🔽sahopapannāśca sattvāḥ samādhiṃ pratilabheyuryasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt daśasu dikṣu
analyzed: teṣu ratna vṛkṣeṣu paśyeyuḥ  saha upapannāḥ ca sattvāḥ samādhim pratilabheyuḥ yasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt daśasu dikṣu
translated: they would see those arrays of qualities of buddha-fields among those jeweled trees.

original: gaṇanātikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāstiṣṭhato yāpayato nityaṃ paśyeyurye
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ nityam paśyeyuḥ ye
translated: And the beings born there would attain the samadhi, by attaining which samadhi they would always see the buddhas dwelling and remaining in buddha-fields beyond number in the ten directions,🔽the buddhas who are present.

original: tatra sattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ te sarva evaṃrūpeṇa cīvaravimānālaṅkārābharaṇavarṇarūpeṇa
analyzed: tatra sattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ te sarve evaṃrūpeṇa cīvara vimāna alaṅkāra ābharaṇa varṇa rūpeṇa
translated: There, beings would be reborn. They would all have such forms, robes, palaces, ornaments, and complexions,

analyzed: syuḥ yathā paranirmita vaśavartinaḥ devāḥ
translated: like the devas who control others' emanations.

original: na tatra buddhakṣetre pāṃśuśilā kālaparvatā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre pāṃśuśilā kālaparvatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: In that Buddha-field, there would be no dust, stones, black mountains,

analyzed: na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na sumeruḥ na mahā samudrāḥ
translated: no Cakravāḍa or Mahācakravāḍa mountains, no Sumeru, no great oceans.

analyzed: na tatra avareṇa nivaraṇa kleśa śabdāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvatas ca
translated: There, the words 'lower realm', 'obstruction', 'affliction' would not exist at all, in any way.

original: tatra narakatiryagyoniyamalokaśabdo na syānnākṣaṇaśabdo na duḥkhaśabdaḥ /
analyzed: tatra naraka tiryagyoni yama loka śabdaḥ na syāt na akṣaṇa śabdaḥ na duḥkha śabdaḥ
translated: There would be no words for 'hell', 'animal birth', 'ghosts', 'lower realms', 'bad rebirth', or 'suffering'.

analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa aham bhagavan buddhakṣetreṇa arthī
translated: In such a Buddha-field, Blessed One, I aspire.

original: tāvadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvaduṣkaracaryāṃ cariṣye yāvannaivaṃrūpairguṇairbuddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣye /
analyzed: tāvat aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva duṣkara caryām cariṣye yāvat na evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣye
translated: For so long, Venerable Blessed One, I will practice the difficult practices of a bodhisattva until I purify a Buddha-field with such qualities.

analyzed: evam aham bhadanta bhagavan puruṣakāram kariṣye
translated: In this way, Venerable Blessed One, I will make human effort.

analyzed: tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye
translated: Only then will I fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: daśa yojana sāhasrikaḥ ca me bodhivṛkṣaḥ bhavet
translated: And my Bodhi tree would be ten thousand yojanas high.

analyzed: tatra niṣaṇṇaḥ ca aham eka kṣaṇena citta utpādena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeya
translated: And while sitting there, I would attain supreme perfect enlightenment in a single thought.

original: apramāṇā ca me prabhā syāt buddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇām KpSū 🔽avabhāsayanti /
analyzed: apramāṇā ca me prabhā syāt buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām  avabhāsayanti
translated: And may my radiance be immeasurable, illuminating many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddha-fields.

original: aparimāṇā ca mamāyurbhavedaprameyakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ na śakyaṃ kenacid gaṇayitumanyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: aparimāṇā ca mama āyuḥ bhavet aprameya kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām na śakyam kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: And may my lifespan be immeasurable, not able to be calculated by anyone except through omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: aprameyaḥ ca me bodhisattva saṅghaḥ syāt śrāvaka pratyekabuddha varjitaḥ
translated: And may my assembly of bodhisattvas be immeasurable, free from śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: yanna śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ anyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: yat na śakyam gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: not able to be calculated except through omniscient knowledge.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mamāprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhā bhagavanto varṇabhāṣaṇaṃ kuryurghoṣaṃ cānuśrāvayeyuryaśa udīrayeyuḥ
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ varṇa bhāṣaṇam kuryuḥ ghoṣam ca anuśrāvayeyuḥ yaśaḥ udīrayeyuḥ
translated: And may the buddhas, the blessed ones, in immeasurable, incalculable other buddha-fields praise me when I attain enlightenment, proclaim my fame, and make my glory resound.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mamāprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye sattvā nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuste sarve buddhakṣetre kuśalamūlapariṇāmanaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye sattvāḥ nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ te sarve buddhakṣetre kuśala mūla pariṇāmanam kṛtvā
translated: And may all those beings in immeasurable, incalculable other buddha-fields who hear my name, having dedicated their roots of virtue to my buddha-field,

analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: may be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā ānantarya kārakān sattvān saddharma pratikṣepakān
translated: Except for those beings who have committed the crimes with immediate retribution and who have rejected the true Dharma.

original: bodhiprāptasya me 'nyāsu gaṇanātikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu sattvā bodhicittotpādaṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya me nyāsu gaṇanā atikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ bodhi citta utpādam kuryuḥ
translated: When I have attained awakening, may beings in other world systems, beyond enumeration, arouse the mind set on awakening.

analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapattim ākāṅkṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Desiring to be reborn in my buddha-field,

analyzed: tatra ca kuśala mūla pariṇāmanam kuryuḥ
translated: and there direct the roots of virtue,

analyzed: teṣām ca aham maraṇa kāla samayeṣu agratas tiṣṭheya bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ
translated: and may I stand before them at the time of their death, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: te ca māṃ dṛṣṭvā prītiṃ prasādaṃ ca mamāntika utpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca mām dṛṣṭvā prītim prasādam ca mama antike utpādayeyuḥ
translated: May they, on seeing me, arouse joy and serene confidence towards me,

analyzed: sarva āvaraṇa tām kpsū
translated: and may all their obscurations

analyzed: ca nivartayeyuḥ
translated: be removed.

analyzed: kālam ca kṛtvā asmākam buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And after death, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāste 'smākaṃ sakāśādaśrutapūrvāṃ dharmadeśanāmākāṅkṣeyuḥ śrotuṃ te yādṛśīmākāṅkṣeyustādṛśīṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ te smākam sakāśāt aśruta pūrvām dharma deśanām ākāṅkṣeyuḥ śrotum te yādṛśīm ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: And may the bodhisattvas there, who have not heard such Dharma teachings from me before, desire to hear them. May they hear whatever they desire.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mama gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvā nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ te 'vaivartikāḥ syuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvāḥ nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ te vaivartikāḥ syuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And when I have attained awakening, may bodhisattvas in buddha-fields beyond count hear my name, and may they become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect awakening.

analyzed: prathamām kṣāntim pratilabheyuḥ tathā dvitīyām
translated: May they attain the first forbearance, and likewise the second.

original: yādṛśīṃ samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ cākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīṃ samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ ca pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśīm samādhim dhāraṇīm ca ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm samādhim dhāraṇīm ca pratilabheyuḥ
translated: May they attain whatever meditative absorption and dhāraṇī they desire.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca mama gaṇanātikrānteṣu kalpeṣu paścād gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca mama gaṇanā atikrānteṣu kalpeṣu paścāt gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: And after countless eons have passed since my parinirvāṇa, in countless buddha-fields,

original: bodhisattvā mama nāmadheyaṃ śrutvā paramāṃ prītiṃ prasādaṃ prāmodyaṃ ca prāpnuyurmāmeva
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mama nāmadheyam śrutvā paramām prītim prasādam prāmodyam ca prāpnuyuḥ mām eva
translated: may bodhisattvas, having heard my name, attain supreme joy, faith, and delight, and may they pay homage to me alone,

analyzed: namasyamānāḥ āścarya prāptāḥ yaśa kīrtim ca varṇayeyuḥ
translated: and, filled with wonder, proclaim my fame and glory.

original: bodhisattvabhūtena ca yadā mayā buddhakāryaṃ abhiniṣpāditaṃ tataḥ paścādanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtena ca yadā mayā buddha kāryam abhiniṣpāditam tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya iyam
translated: And when I, as a bodhisattva, have accomplished the deeds of a buddha, then afterwards I shall fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: abhisaṃbuddhasya ca mama paramaprasādapratilabdhā bodhisattvāḥ prathamāyāḥ kṣāntyā lābhinaḥ syurdvitīyāyāḥ tṛtīyāyāḥ /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhasya ca mama parama prasāda pratilabdhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ prathamāyāḥ kṣāntyāḥ lābhinaḥ syuḥ dvitīyāyāḥ tṛtīyāyāḥ
translated: And may the bodhisattvas who have attained supreme faith in me, who has attained perfect enlightenment, obtain the first acceptance, the second, and the third.

original: yādṛśīṃ ca samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ ākāṅkṣeyustādṛśīṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśīm ca samādhim dhāraṇīm ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And may they obtain whatever meditative absorption and dhāraṇī they desire.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena anupaśyeyuḥ
translated: And may they see up to the end of enlightenment.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāḥ striyo mama nāmadheyaṃ KpSū
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāḥ striyaḥ mama nāmadheyam
translated: And may those women in buddha-fields beyond counting who hear my name,

analyzed: śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ parama prīti prāmodyam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: may they attain supreme joy and delight.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may they give rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyaḥ strī tvam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And may they not again obtain a female body up to the end of enlightenment.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca me gaṇanātikrānteṣu kalpeṣu gaṇanātikrāntā yāḥ striyo mama nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ paramaprītiprāmodyaṃ prasādaṃ ca prāpnuyuḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu kalpeṣu gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ yāḥ striyaḥ mama nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ parama prīti prāmodyam prasādam ca prāpnuyuḥ
translated: And may those women in buddha-fields beyond counting, beyond calculation, who hear my name after my parinirvāṇa, may they attain supreme joy, delight, and faith.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may they give rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyaḥ strī tvam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And may they not again obtain a female body up to the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: īdṛśam aham bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetram ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: I aspire to such a buddha field, Venerable Blessed One.

analyzed: īdṛśāḥ ca pariśuddha āśayāḥ sattvā
translated: I aspire to such pure beings.

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ ham bhagavan buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Blessed One, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment in such a buddha field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho rājño 'raṇeminaḥ sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājñaḥ raṇeminaḥ sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, gave his approval to King Aranemi:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā rāja
translated: Excellent, excellent, great king!

original: gambhīraste mahārāja praṇidhānaṃ pariśuddhaṃ te buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: gambhīraḥ te mahā rāja praṇidhānam pariśuddham te buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: Your aspiration is profound, great king, and you have accepted a pure buddha field.

original: paśya mahārāja paścimāyāṃ diśi koṭīśatasahasrabuddhakṣetrāṇāṃ atikramya indrasuvirājitā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: paśya mahā rāja paścimāyām diśi koṭī śata sahasra buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramyaḥ indrasuvirājitā nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: Look, great king, in the west, beyond a hundred thousand koṭis of buddha-fields, there is a world-system called Indrasuvirajitā.

original: tatrendraghoṣeśvararājo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati pariśuddhānāṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tatra indraghoṣeśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati pariśuddhānām sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: There dwells the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Indrarājo, who abides, endures, and teaches the Dharma.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ KpSū
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām
translated: And in that buddha-field, there is no mention of śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: prajñaptiḥ api asti
translated: not even the word 'prajñapti' exists.

analyzed: utpādāya na tatra śrāvaka pratyekabuddha kathā kriyate
translated: There, the teachings of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are not given for the sake of production.

analyzed: śuddhā ca tatra mahāyāna kathā
translated: There, the teachings of the Mahāyāna are pure.

analyzed: sarve eva upapādukāḥ sattvā
translated: All beings are born spontaneously.

original: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāmāpi jñāyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāma api jñāyate
translated: There, even the name of women is not known.

original: sarva ete guṇāstatra buddhakṣetre yathā mahārājenāparimitaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānam🔽kṛtamamitāśayāḥ sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāstena tvaṃ mahārāja indraghoṣeśvararājatathāgatasya
analyzed: sarve ete guṇāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre yathā mahā rājena aparimitam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam  kṛtam amita āśayāḥ sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ tena tvam mahā rāja indraghoṣa īśvara rāja tathāgatasya
translated: All these qualities are in that Buddha-field, just as the Great King has made the vow for the infinite array of qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: parinirvṛtasya tasmin saddharme 'ntarhite ṣaṣṭīnāmantarakalpānāmatyayena sā lokadhāturmeruprabhā nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya tasmin saddharme ntarhite ṣaṣṭīnām antara kalpānām atyayena sā lokadhātuḥ meruprabhā nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: Since immeasurable beings with aspirations have been accepted as disciples, you, Great King, after the Tathāgata Indraghoṣeśvara-rāja has passed into parinirvāṇa, and when his true Dharma has disappeared, after the passing of sixty intermediate kalpas, that world realm will be called Meruprabhā.

analyzed: tatra acintyamatiguṇarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There, the Tathāgata named Acintyamati-guṇarāja will appear, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: yathā eva indraghoṣa īśvara rājasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya indrasuvirājitāyām
translated: Just as it is for the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Indraghoṣeśvara-rāja, in the world realm Indrasurāvijitā,

analyzed: lokadhātau buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ tathā eva acintyamatiguṇarājasya tathāgatasya meruprabhāyām
translated: In the world system Meru-prabha, the array of qualities of the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja will be just the same as the array of qualities of the Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja.

analyzed: lokadhātau guṇa vyūhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the world system Meru-prabha, the array of qualities of the Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja will be just the same as the array of qualities of the Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja.

analyzed: tasya ca acintyamatiguṇarājasya tathāgatasya ṣaṣṭi antara kalpāṇi āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: And the lifespan of that Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja will be sixty intermediate eons.

original: yadācintyamatiguṇarājastathāgataḥ parinirvāsyati tasya ṣoḍaśāntarakalpāḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: yadā acintyamatiguṇarājaḥ tathāgataḥ parinirvāsyati tasya ṣoḍaśa antara kalpāḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: When the Tathāgata Acintya-mati-guṇa-rāja has attained parinirvāṇa, his true Dharma will remain for sixteen intermediate eons.

original: tasya saddharme 'ntarhite sahasrāntarakalpātyayena viratirnāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya saddharme ntarhite sahasra antara kalpa atyayena viratiḥ nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When his true Dharma has disappeared, after the passing of a thousand intermediate eons, that world system will be called Viraṭi.

analyzed: tatra raśmiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There, the Tathāgata named Raśmi, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: and so on as before.

analyzed: samāḥ ca eṣām āyuḥ samāḥ lokadhātuḥ
translated: Their lifespans will be the same, and the world system will be the same.

original: evaṃ parinirvṛtānāṃ saddharme 'ntarhite aparā nāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam parinirvṛtānām saddharme ntarhite aparā nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, when they have attained parinirvāṇa and the true Dharma has disappeared, that world system will be called Aparā.

original: tara ratneśvaraghoṣo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha utpatsyate /
analyzed: tara ratneśvaraghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ utpatsyate
translated: There, the Tathāgata named Ratneśvara-ghोṣa, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, will appear.

original: samo buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaḥ samaṃ cāntarakalpā sthāsyati yāpayiṣyati dharmaṃ ca deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: samaḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ samam ca antara kalpā sthāsyati yāpayiṣyati dharmam ca deśayiṣyati
translated: The adornments of the Buddha-field will be the same, and it will endure for the same number of intermediate eons, maintaining the Dharma.

analyzed: tasya parinirvṛtasya sapta antara kalpām saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: After his parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma will remain for seven intermediate eons.

analyzed: tasmin ca saddharme ntarhite
translated: And when the true Dharma has disappeared,

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: the same as before.

original: evaṃ cāprameyāparimāṇān tathāgatāṃstatra buddhakṣetra upapannān paśyāmi parinirvṛtāṃśca /
analyzed: evam ca aprameya aparimāṇān tathāgatān tatra buddhakṣetre upapannān paśyāmi parinirvṛtān ca
translated: In this way, I see immeasurable and innumerable Tathāgatas born in that Buddha-field and attaining parinirvāṇa.

original: naivāsau lokadhātussaṃvartate na nivartate /🔽tatrānāgate 'dhvani atikrānta ekasmin gaṅgāvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye nadīgaṅgāvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī nāma
analyzed: na eva asau lokadhātuḥ saṃvartate na nivartate  tatra anāgate dhvani atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye nadī gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī nāma
translated: That world system neither evolves nor devolves.

analyzed: bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, after one incalculably long eon has passed in the second incalculably long eon, that world system will be called Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: tatra tvam mahā rājan uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, you, great king, will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: amitāyuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will become the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Amitāyus.

original: rājāraṇemyāha kutra te bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye 'smākaṃ prathamataraṃ tatra buddhakṣetre KpSū
analyzed: rājā araṇemī āha kutra te bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye smākam prathamataram tatra buddhakṣetre
translated: King Arṇema asked, Bhagavān, where are those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will first go to that buddha realm?🔽🔽

original: 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante / /🔽bhagavān āha ime te mahārāja bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye 'prameyairasaṃkhyeyairatulyairaparimāṇairdaśabhyo
analyzed: nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante  bhagavān āha ime te mahā rāja bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye prameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atulyaiḥ aparimāṇaiḥ daśabhyaḥ
translated: King Arṇema asked, Bhagavān, where are those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will first attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood in that buddha realm?

original: digbhyaḥ tābhyastābhyo lokadhātubhya āgatā maṃ vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: digbhyaḥ tābhyaḥ tābhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ āgatāḥ mam vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: The Bhagavān said, Great King, these are those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have come from those innumerable, countless, immeasurable, and limitless worlds in the ten directions to pay homage to me, to attend on me, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: ye mama purato niṣaṇṇā ete 'tītairbuddhairvyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye mama puratas niṣaṇṇāḥ ete tītaiḥ buddhaiḥ vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those who are seated in front of me have been prophesied by the buddhas of the past to attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: pratyutpannairapi buddhairbhagavadbhirete kulaputrā vyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: pratyutpannaiḥ api buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ ete kula putrāḥ vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those noble sons have been prophesied by the buddhas, the bhagavats of the present to attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: ye tatra buddhakṣetre prathamataram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: They will first attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood in that buddha realm.

original: ekaikaścaiṣa mahārāja bodhisattvo 'nekeṣāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ antike kṛtādhikāro 'varuptakuśalamūlo bhāvitaprajñaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca eṣa mahā rāja bodhisattvaḥ nekeṣām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām antike kṛta adhikāraḥ varupta kuśala mūlaḥ bhāvita prajñaḥ
translated: Each of these bodhisattvas, great king, has served many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas, has planted the roots of virtue, and has cultivated wisdom.

original: ta ete mahārāja kulaputrā ye tatra prathamataraṃ buddhakṣetre buddhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te ete mahā rāja kula putrāḥ ye tatra prathamataram buddhakṣetre buddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those sons of good family, great king, will be the first buddhas in that buddha-field.

original: rājāraṇemyāha ayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo yenāhaṃ sapariṣatko
analyzed: rājā araṇemī āha ayam bhadanta bhagavan samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena aham sa pariṣatkaḥ
translated: King Arṇemī said, Reverend Lord, this brahmin Sāgara­rendu, who has inspired me and my assembly

original: 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ sa kiyatā kālenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate / /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ sa kiyatā kālena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: to aspire to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, in how long will he attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: bhagavān āha mahākāruṇika eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha mahā kāruṇikaḥ eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, This brahmin Sāgara­rendu is a great compassionate one.

analyzed: śroṣyasi tvam yathā eṣa siṃhanādam nadiṣyati
translated: You will hear him roar a lion's roar.

original: rājā āha yadyeṣa me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati yathāhaṃ KpSū
analyzed: rājā āha yadi eṣa me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati yathā aham
translated: The king said, If this aspiration of mine is fulfilled,

analyzed: bhagavatā vyākṛtāḥ
translated: as I have been prophesied by the Blessed One,

original: tadyathāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pādavandanaṃ kuryāṃ pañcamaṇḍalena tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavaḥ prakampantu pracalantu /
analyzed: tat yathā aham bhagavataḥ pāda vandanam kuryām pañca maṇḍalena tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ prakampantu pracalantu
translated: then let the world-systems, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, shake and tremble when I pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One with the five-part prostration.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti te ca māṃ vyākuryuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti te ca mām vyākuryuḥ
translated: And may the Buddhas who are present, supporting themselves, in those Buddha-fields, prophesy my enlightenment.'

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalakena pādayornipatitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalakena pādayoḥ nipatitaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, King Arṇemī prostrated at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha with his whole body.

original: yadaiva rājñaḥ śirasā pṛthivī spṛṣṭā tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhakṣetrāḥ kampitāḥ calitāḥ pracalitāḥ kṣubhitāḥ saṃprakṣubhitāḥ /
analyzed: yadā eva rājñaḥ śirasā pṛthivī spṛṣṭā tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ kampitāḥ calitāḥ pracalitāḥ kṣubhitāḥ saṃprakṣubhitāḥ
translated: As soon as the king touched the earth with his head, Buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River shook, trembled, and quaked.

analyzed: gāṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhāḥ vyākurvanti
translated: Buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River prophesied:

original: santīraṇe buddhakṣetre dhāraṇe kalpe 'śītivarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho rājānamaraṇeminaṃ vyākaroti
analyzed: santi īraṇe buddhakṣetre dhāraṇe kalpe śīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājānam araṇeminam vyākaroti
translated: 'In the Buddha-field called Sāntīraṇa, in the kalpa called Dhāraṇa, when the lifespan of beings was eighty thousand years, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, prophesied to King Arṇemī:

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgate dhvani atikrānte gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye praviṣṭe
translated: 'In the future, after an asaṃkhyeya kalpa equal to the sands of the Ganges River has passed,

original: dvitīye 'saṃkhyeye sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvamitaśuddhāyāṃ amitāyurnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīye saṃkhyeye sukhāvatyām lokadhātau amita śuddhāyām amitāyuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: in the second asaṃkhyeya, in the world system called Sukhāvatī, in the Amitāyur-nāma world system, you will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One called Amitāyus.'

original: samantato daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamān lokadhātūn avabhāsayiṣyasi /🔽bhagavān āha
analyzed: samantataḥ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān lokadhātūn avabhāsayiṣyasi  bhagavān āha
translated: You will illuminate the worlds in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara sattvā vidhi jña vyākṛtaḥ tvam daśa balaiḥ
translated: Rise, O supreme being, you who know the rules, you have been prophesied by the Ten Powers.

analyzed: gaṅgā prakhyā velita vasumatī sa śailā bhaviṣyasi nara vara damya sārathiḥ
translated: You will be a leader of the best of men, taming the unruly, with the earth and mountains shaking like the Ganges, and the earth with its mountains will be shaken.

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī tuṣṭa udagraḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ
translated: Then, noble son, King Arṇemi, being satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, and happy,

analyzed: atikramya na atidūre ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: sat down to one side, not too far away, in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo rājño 'raṇemino jyeṣṭhaputramanimiṣaṃ nāma rājakumāramāmantrayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājñaḥ raṇeminaḥ jyeṣṭha putram animiṣam nāma rāja kumāram āmantrayati sma
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the eldest prince of King Arṇemi, the prince named Animīṣa:

analyzed: animiṣaḥ vocat
translated: Animīṣa said:

original: peyālaṃ pūrvavat /🔽avalokitā mayāpāyā ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāḥ pracaṇḍaghoraṃ duḥkhaṃ anubhavanti /
analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat  avalokitāḥ mayā apāyāḥ ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ pracaṇḍa ghoram duḥkham anubhavanti
translated: The same as before.🔽I have looked at the lower realms and the beings who have been born there, experiencing extremely fierce and terrible suffering.

original: avalokitā mayā svargā ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāḥ saṃkliṣṭacittāḥ punarapyapāyeṣu prapatanti /
analyzed: avalokitāḥ mayā svargāḥ ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ saṃkliṣṭa cittāḥ punar api apāyeṣu prapatanti
translated: I have looked at the heavens and the beings who have been born there, with defiled minds, falling back into the lower realms again.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca mayā avalokitāḥ akalyāṇa mitra saṃsṛṣṭāḥ viharanti
translated: I have looked upon all beings who are dwelling in association with bad friends.

analyzed: dharma durbhikṣa andhakāre kuśala mūla parikṣīṇā
translated: In the famine of the Dharma, in the darkness, their roots of virtue exhausted,

analyzed: dṛṣṭi grāha grastāḥ ku mārgaiḥ vihanyate
translated: seized by the crocodiles of views, they are being destroyed by bad paths.

analyzed: svareṇa aham bhagavan tān sattvān vijñapayāmi
translated: With my voice, Blessed One, I make those beings understand.

original: sarvaṃ ca kuśalaṃ pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarvam ca kuśalam pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And I dedicate all that is wholesome to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yad ahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ careyaṃ ye kecanasattvā duḥkhotpīḍā bhayatarjitā dharmadurbhikṣāndhakāre praviṣṭā līnā dīnā atrāṇā aśaraṇā aparāyaṇā
analyzed: yat aham bodhisattva caryām careyam ye kecana sattvāḥ duḥkha utpīḍāḥ bhaya tarjitāḥ dharma durbhikṣa andhakāre praviṣṭāḥ līnā dīnā atrāṇā aśaraṇā aparāyaṇā
translated: If I were to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, whatever beings are oppressed by suffering, terrified by fear, entered into the famine of the Dharma, darkness, sunken, miserable, without protection, without refuge, without recourse,

analyzed: nāma ca parikīrtayeyuḥ
translated: and were to proclaim my name,

original: yadyahaṃ divyena śrotreṇa śṛṇuyāṃ divyena cakṣuṣā paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi aham divyena śrotreṇa śṛṇuyām divyena cakṣuṣā paśyeyam
translated: if I were to hear them with my divine ear and see them with my divine eye,

original: na ca tāṃ sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tām sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyam
translated: and if I were not to liberate those beings from their misfortunes,

analyzed: na aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then I would not attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sattvahetościrapraṇidhānaviśeṣeṇa ciraṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi tadā me āśāparipūrirbhavatu /
analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavan sattva hetoḥ cira praṇidhāna viśeṣeṇa ciram bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi tadā me āśā paripūriḥ bhavatu
translated: Blessed One, if I, for the sake of beings, with a long-standing special aspiration, were to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva for a long time, then may my hopes be fulfilled.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan mahārājāraṇemī atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgānadīvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvanuttarāṃ🔽amitāyurnāma bhaviṣyati tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /🔽pariśuddhe buddhakṣetre pariśuddhānāṃ sattvānāṃ buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavat mahā rāja araṇemī atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye sukhāvatyām lokadhātau anuttarām  amitāyuḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  pariśuddhe buddhakṣetre pariśuddhānām sattvānām buddha kāryam kariṣyati

translated: The same as before.

original: pratigṛhyāñjaliṃ ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatametadavocat yanmayā bhagavān sarvopakaraṇairupasthitaḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: pratigṛhya añjalim ratnagarbham tathāgatam etat avocat yat mayā bhagavān sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upasthitaḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: Having accepted the palms together, he said this to the Tathagata Ratnagarbha: Whatever I have attended to the Blessed One with all the requisites, together with the assembly of monks,

analyzed: yat ca me kāya vāc manaḥ su caritam
translated: and whatever good conduct I have had in body, speech, and mind,

analyzed: idam ca anumodanā sahagatam puṇya skandham
translated: And this heap of merit endowed with rejoicing,

analyzed: etat sarvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmi
translated: I dedicate it all to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na tu kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: But I will not attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in a defiled buddha-field.

analyzed: na ca atikṣipram prāpnuyām
translated: And I will not attain it too quickly.

analyzed: na yāvat ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam tāvat bodhi caryām caran
translated: As long as I have not attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, for that long, while practicing the conduct leading to enlightenment,

original: daśasu dikṣvanantāparyanteṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu anantā paryanteṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyam
translated: I will see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the endless and boundless other world systems in the ten directions.

original: ye mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitā yeṣāṃ mayā tatprathamaṃ bodhicittamutpāditaṃ bodhicitte pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitāḥ yeṣām mayā tat prathamam bodhi cittam utpāditam bodhi citte pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Those whom I first inspired towards enlightenment, for whom I first generated the mind of enlightenment, who were established in the mind of enlightenment by me,

original: pāramitāsu ca ye mayā samādāpitā niveśitā pratiṣṭhāpitā bodhicaryāṃ caratā /🔽tān ahaṃ divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgānadīvālikāsame buddhakṣetre paramāṇurajaḥsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhān bhagavato dharman deśayataḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: pāramitāsu ca ye mayā samādāpitāḥ niveśitā pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bodhi caryām caratā  tān aham divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgā nadī vālikā same buddhakṣetre paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ dharman deśayataḥ paśyeyam
translated: and those whom I inspired, introduced, and established in the conduct leading to enlightenment while practicing the conduct leading to enlightenment.

analyzed: ye mayā bodhāya samādāpitāḥ
translated: With my divine eye I will see those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teaching the Dharma in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, in buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms of a world system, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, whom I inspired towards enlightenment.

analyzed: evam aham bodhisattva caryām caran buddha kāryam kuryām
translated: In this way, while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, I will perform the activities of a buddha.

original: tāvadahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ careyaṃ sattvānāmāśayapariśodhayamānaḥ yāvantaḥ kecit sattvā KpSū
analyzed: tāvat aham bodhisattva caryām careyam sattvānām āśaya pariśodhayamānaḥ yāvantaḥ kecid
translated: For so long I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, purifying the intentions of beings, as many as there are

original: mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeran ta evaṃvidhāḥ syuḥ tadyathā brahmakāyikā devāḥ /
analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeran te evaṃvidhāḥ syuḥ tat yathā brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ
translated: in my buddha-field, so that they will be like this, just as the gods of the Brahma world are.

original: tathā ca buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ pariśodhayeyaṃ yathā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ ekaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham pariśodhayeyam yathā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram ekam buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: And I will purify the array of qualities of the buddha-field in such a way that the three-thousand great-thousand worlds equal to the sands of the Ganges river will be one buddha-field.

original: tasya ca buddhakṣetrasya bhavāgraparyantāni prākārāṇi anekaratnasaṃsthitāni nānāratnapratyuptāni ca syuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca buddhakṣetrasya bhavāgra paryantāni prākārāṇi aneka ratna saṃsthitāni nānā ratna pratyuptāni ca syuḥ
translated: And the walls of that buddha-field, up to the peak of existence, will be made of various jewels and inlaid with various jewels.

original: sarvā ca tatra buddhakṣetre śuddhavaiḍūryamayī pṛthivī syāt /
analyzed: sarvā ca tatra buddhakṣetre śuddha vaiḍūrya mayī pṛthivī syāt
translated: And the entire buddha-field there will be made of pure beryl.

analyzed: apagata rajaḥ pāṣāṇa śarkarā apagata kaluṣa saṃsparśā dharaṇī syāt
translated: The earth will be free from dust, stones, and gravel, and will be free from defiled contact.

analyzed: na tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāma prajñaptiḥ syāt
translated: There will be no designation of the name 'woman' there.

original: sarvasattvāścopapādukāḥ syurna tatra sattvāḥ kavadīkārāhārāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca upapādukāḥ syuḥ na tatra sattvāḥ kavadīkāra āhārāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings will be spontaneously born. There the beings will not have food that is swallowed.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā prītyāhārā dharmāhārāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra prīti āhārāḥ dharma āhārāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all the beings there would be nourished by joy and by the Dharma.

original: na tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ prajñaptiḥ syāt /
analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām prajñaptiḥ syāt
translated: In that Buddha-field there would be no designation of Śrāvakas or Pratyekabuddhas.

original: śuddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāmapagatakhilamaladveṣamrakṣāṇāṃ śuddhānāṃ brahmacāriṇāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ syāt /
analyzed: śuddhānām bodhisattvānām apagata khila mala dveṣa mrakṣāṇām śuddhānām brahmacāriṇām buddhakṣetram pariśuddham syāt
translated: It would be a pure Buddha-field of pure Bodhisattvas, free from anger, hatred, and jealousy, pure in conduct and celibacy.

original: sarve tatra bodhisattvā muṇḍāḥ kāṣāyavastradhāriṇaḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve tatra bodhisattvāḥ muṇḍāḥ kāṣāya vastra dhāriṇaḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: All the Bodhisattvas there would appear with shaven heads and wearing saffron robes.

analyzed: samanantara prādurbhūtānām mahā avabhāsam bhavet
translated: As soon as they are born, there would be a great light.

original: teṣāṃ dakṣiṇe haste ratnapātrī nānārasapūrṇā prādurbhavet /🔽samanantaraprādurbhūtānāṃ evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyurnāsmākaṃ pratirūpaṃ ye vayaṃ kavaḍīkārāhāramāharema / KpSū
analyzed: teṣām dakṣiṇe haste ratna pātrī nānā rasa pūrṇā prādurbhavet  samanantara prādurbhūtānām evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ na asmākam pratirūpam ye vayam kavaḍīkāra āhāram āharema
translated: In their right hands would appear jeweled bowls filled with various delicacies.🔽As soon as they are born, they would attain such mindfulness, thinking, It is not fitting for us to eat solid food.

original: yannūnaṃ vayamanyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā buddhān bhagavatastiṣṭhato yāpayato 'nenāhāreṇa pratimānayāmo buddhaśrāvakāṃśca duḥkhitaṃ ca janaṃ pratimānayāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat nūnam vayam anyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ nena āhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ buddha śrāvakān ca duḥkhitam ca janam pratimānayāmaḥ
translated: We should rather go to other world systems and offer this food to the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are present and living there, and to their Śrāvakas, and to the suffering people.

original: pretabhavaneṣu ca gatvā kṣuttarṣaprajvalitagātrān sattvān anenāhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ /
analyzed: preta bhavaneṣu ca gatvā kṣudh tarṣa prajvalita gātrān sattvān anena āhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ
translated: And having gone to the abodes of the pretas, we will satisfy the beings there with food and drink, whose bodies are burning with hunger and thirst.

original: sahacittotpādena te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā acintyacāritravatīṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: saha citta utpādena te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ acintyacāritravatīm nāma samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: As soon as they arouse the thought of enlightenment, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will attain the samādhi called 'Possessing Inconceivable Conduct'.

original: tasya ca samādheḥ pratilābhādasajjanā daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca samādheḥ pratilābhāt asat janāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaccheyuḥ
translated: And by attaining that samādhi, they will go to immeasurable other buddha-fields in the ten directions, to those buddha-fields where the buddhas, the blessed ones, are dwelling and living.

original: tiṣṭhato yāpayato buddhān bhagavata āhāreṇa pratimānayeyuḥ śrāvakāṃścānyāṃśca sattvāṃ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ āhāreṇa pratimānayeyuḥ śrāvakān ca anyān ca sattvān
translated: They will satisfy the buddhas, the blessed ones, and their disciples and other beings with food.

original: prītyā pratimānya dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtvā tenaiva pūrvabhaktena svabuddhakṣetraṃ āgaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: prītyā pratimānya dharma deśanām kṛtvā tena eva pūrva bhaktena sva buddhakṣetram āgaccheyuḥ
translated: Having satisfied them with joy and given a Dharma teaching, they will return to their own buddha-field with that same morning meal.

analyzed: evam cīvara ratnāni
translated: And so with the jewel robes.

original: yāvat tenaiva pūrvabhaktena svakaṃ buddhakṣetramāgatyānyonyaṃ cīvareṇa prāvarayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat tena eva pūrva bhaktena svakam buddhakṣetram āgatya anyonyam cīvareṇa prāvarayeyuḥ
translated: They will return to their own buddha-field with that same morning meal and dress each other in those robes.

original: yāvanti ca tatra buddhakṣetre teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāmupabhogaḥ paribhogā
analyzed: yāvanti ca tatra buddhakṣetre teṣām bodhisattvānām upabhogaḥ paribhogāḥ
translated: And whatever enjoyments and possessions those bodhisattvas have in that buddha-field,

original: bhaveyustaiḥ sarvairbuddhaiḥ śrāvakaiścānyaiśca sattvaiḥ sahasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā paścādātmanā paribhuñjeyuḥ /
analyzed: bhaveyuḥ taiḥ sarvaiḥ buddhaiḥ śrāvakaiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ sahasā dhāraṇam kṛtvā paścāt ātmanā paribhuñjeyuḥ
translated: Having made it common to all those Buddhas, their disciples, and other beings, they would then consume it themselves.

analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaṇa varjitam ca buddhakṣetram bhavet
translated: And that Buddha-field would be free from the eight unfavorable conditions.

original: na ca tatra duḥkhaśabdo bhavet / KpSū
analyzed: na ca tatra duḥkha śabdaḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no word for suffering.

analyzed: na śikṣā grahaṇa śabdaḥ
translated: There would be no word for taking up the precepts.

analyzed: āpatti vyutthāna śabdaḥ pi na bhavet
translated: There would be no word for arising from offenses.

analyzed: aneka ratna śata sahasra upacitam tat buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: That Buddha-field would be filled with many hundreds of thousands of jewels.

analyzed: aneka ratna pratyuptam maṇi sandarśana sadṛśam bhavet
translated: It would be adorned with many jewels, like the Jewel-Array.

original: yāni maṇiratnāni daśasu dikṣvadṛṣṭapūrvāṇi tāni aśrutapūrvāṇi tāni maṇiratnāni pracareyuḥ /
analyzed: yāni maṇi ratnāni daśasu dikṣu a dṛṣṭa pūrvāṇi tāni a śruta pūrvāṇi tāni maṇi ratnāni pracareyuḥ
translated: Those jewel-gems that have never been seen before in the ten directions, those jewel-gems that have never been heard of before, those jewel-gems would be distributed.

original: yeṣāṃ maṇiratnānāṃ nāmadheye nirdiśyamāne varṣakoṭyo 'pi kṣayaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām maṇi ratnānām nāmadheye nirdiśyamāne varṣa koṭyāḥ u pi kṣayam gaccheyuḥ
translated: For those jewel-gems, when their names are being indicated, even millions of years would pass.

original: yaśca bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣeta svarṇamayaṃ eva buddhakṣetraṃ paśyeyaṃ tasya svarṇamayaṃ eva tiṣṭheta /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣeta svarṇa mayam eva buddhakṣetram paśyeyam tasya svarṇa mayam eva tiṣṭheta
translated: And any bodhisattva who would wish to see the Buddha-field made of gold, for him it would stand made of gold.

analyzed: yaḥ rūpya mayam ākāṅkṣeta sa rūpya mayam paśyet
translated: If he would wish for one made of silver, he would see one made of silver.

analyzed: na ca asya suvarṇa mayam parihāyeyam
translated: But it would not be lost for him as made of gold.

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: The rest is as before.

original: ya ākāṅkṣeta sphatikamayaṃ vaiḍūryamayaṃ aśmagarbhamayaṃ lohitamuktāmayaṃ musālagalvamayaṃ evaṃvidhaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ paśyema /
analyzed: yaḥ ākāṅkṣeta sphatika mayam vaiḍūrya mayam aśmagarbha mayam lohita muktā mayam musālagalva mayam evaṃvidham tat buddhakṣetram paśyema
translated: Those who wish to see that buddha-field made of crystal, beryl, cornelian, red pearl, coral,

original: ityākāṅkṣeyuḥ /🔽agarumayaṃ tagaramayaṃ tamālapatramayaṃ yo bodhisattva ākāṅkṣeduragasāracandanamayaṃ goṣīrṣacandanamayaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ draṣṭuṃ tasya tathaiva
analyzed: iti ākāṅkṣeyuḥ  agaru mayam tagara mayam tamāla patra mayam yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣet uragasāra candana mayam goṣīrṣa candana mayam tat buddhakṣetram draṣṭum tasya tathā eva
translated: they should wish thus.

analyzed: syāt
translated: If a bodhisattva wishes to see that buddha-field made of agaru wood, tagara flower, tamala leaf, or uragasāra sandalwood, or gośīrṣa sandalwood, it would be just so for him.

original: yathā yathā yādṛśamākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathā tathā tādṛśaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā yathā yādṛśam ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathā tathā tādṛśam syāt
translated: As they wish, in whatever way, it would be just so for them.

analyzed: na ca ekaḥ dvitīyasya praṇidhiḥ syāt
translated: But the vow of one would not be the vow of another.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva praṇidhiḥ paripūryate
translated: The vow of all would be fulfilled.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sūryācandramasau KpSū
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sūryācandramasau kpsū
translated: And in that buddha-field, the sun and moon

analyzed: prajñāyeyātām
translated: would not be known.

analyzed: svayam prabhāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: The bodhisattvas there would be reborn with their own light.

analyzed: anyām yādṛśīm prabhām ākāṅkṣeran tādṛśīm utsṛjeyuḥ
translated: They would emit whatever kind of light they wish,

analyzed: antatas buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu api
translated: even up to hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddha-fields.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre rātridivasānāṃ nāmadheyamapi prajñāyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre rātri divasānām nāmadheyam api prajñāyate
translated: And in that buddha-field, the names of night and day are not even known,

analyzed: anyatra kusuma vikasana tayā
translated: except for the opening of flowers.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śītoṣṇaṃ prajñāyate na vyādhirna glānyaṃ na jarāmaraṇamanyatra
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śīta uṣṇam prajñāyate na vyādhiḥ na glānyam na jarā maraṇam anyatra
translated: And in that buddha-field, cold and heat are not known, nor sickness, nor sorrow, nor old age and death, except

original: yo bodhisattva ākāṅkṣedbodhimabhisaṃboddhuṃ so 'nyatra lokadhātāvuṣitvā āyuḥ kṣapayitvā
analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣet bodhim abhisaṃboddhum saḥ nyatra lokadhātau uṣitvā āyuḥ kṣapayitvā
translated: if a bodhisattva wishes to attain enlightenment and become fully enlightened, he would do so after living in another world-system and exhausting his lifespan,

analyzed: bodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: and become fully enlightened.

analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre maraṇam bhaveyuḥ
translated: In that buddha-field, there would be no death.

analyzed: anuttara parinirvāṇena upari antarīkṣe tathāgata parinirvāṇam syāt
translated: There would be a tathāgata's parinirvāṇa in the sky above, with unsurpassed parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: yādṛś jātrīyān ca bodhisattve upabhoga paribhogām ākāṅkṣeran tādṛś jātīyāḥ abhinirvarteyuḥ
translated: And whatever kinds of enjoyments and possessions the bodhisattvas would desire, they would be produced in those very kinds.

original: sarvatra ca buddhakṣetre gaganatale tūryakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrā vādyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca buddhakṣetre gagana tale tūrya koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāḥ vādyeyuḥ
translated: And in all the buddha-fields, hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of musical instruments would play in the sky.

original: na ca tebhyastūryebhyaḥ kāmopasaṃhitāḥ śabdā niścareyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tebhyaḥ tūryebhyaḥ kāma upasaṃhitāḥ śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ
translated: And from those musical instruments, sounds connected with desire would not issue forth.

analyzed: anyatra pāramitā śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ
translated: Other than that, the sounds of the perfections would issue forth.

analyzed: buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ bodhisattva piṭaka dharmaparyāya śabdaḥ niścaret
translated: The words 'Buddha,' 'Dharma,' 'Saṅgha,' 'Bodhisattva Piṭaka,' and 'Dharma discourse' would resound.

analyzed: yathā adhimuktāḥ bodhisattvāḥ tādṛś jātīyām śabdām śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: The Bodhisattvas, according to their inclinations, would hear sounds of that kind.

analyzed: bodhisattva cārikām aham bhagavan caramāṇaḥ yāvat mayā aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu
translated: Blessed One, while I am practicing the Bodhisattva conduct, may I see the arrays of qualities in countless, immeasurable

analyzed: buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ te vyūhāḥ te laṅkārāḥ tāni
translated: hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of Buddhas, and may all those arrays, those adornments,

original: liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tāni sthānāni tāni praṇidhānāni sarva eva mama buddhakṣetre praviśeyuḥ /
analyzed: liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tāni sthānāni tāni praṇidhānāni sarve eva mama buddhakṣetre praviśeyuḥ
translated: those signs, those indications, those places, and those aspirations enter my Buddha-field,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vyūhām pañca kaṣāyikān ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām
translated: except for the arrays of Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas, and the arrays of qualities in the five-defiled Buddha-fields.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre narakatiryakpretāḥ prajñāyeyurna sumerurna cakravāḍamahācakravāḍā na śīlāpāṃśuparvatāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre naraka tiryak pretāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na śīla apāṃśu parvatāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ
translated: And in that Buddha-field, the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama should not be known, nor should Mount Sumeru, the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, nor the Śīla, Apāṃśu, and Paryaṅka mountains be known.

analyzed: na mahā samudrā
translated: Nor should the great oceans be known.

analyzed: na ca anye kāṣṭha vṛkṣāḥ bhaveyuḥ divya atikrāntaiḥ nānā vṛkṣaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam
translated: And there should not be other wooden trees in that Buddha-field, but it should be filled with divine, extraordinary trees.

original: syāt / anyatra divyaiḥ kusumairmāndāravamahāmāndāravairna ca tatra durgandhaṃ syānnānāgandhairudārodāraistadbuddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: syāt anyatra divyaiḥ kusumaiḥ māndārava mahāmāndāravaiḥ na ca tatra durgandham syāt nānā gandhaiḥ udāra udāraiḥ tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam syāt
translated: It would be so. Elsewhere, with divine flowers such as māndārava and mahāmāndārava, and there would be no bad smell, with various strong and strong fragrances, that Buddha-field would be filled.

analyzed: sarve tatra eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ utpadyeran
translated: All the Bodhisattvas there, bound to one birth, would be born.

analyzed: na tatra eka sattvaḥ syāt yaḥ tatas cyavitvā anyatra pratyājāyeta
translated: There would not be a single being there who, having passed away from there, would be reborn elsewhere.

analyzed: anyatra tuṣitebhyaḥ tatas cyutaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: Except from the Tuṣita heaven, having passed away from there, he would attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tāvadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yāvannaivaṃvidhaṃ mahāpuruṣakāramabhiniṣpādayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tāvat aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi yāvat na evaṃvidham mahā puruṣakāram abhiniṣpādayiṣyāmi
translated: Reverend Lord! I shall practice the conduct of a bodhisattva for so long as I have not accomplished such a great deed.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam buddhakṣetram sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I shall establish a Buddha-field like this.

analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ śuddha āśayaiḥ sattvaiḥ eka jāti pratibaddhaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: Together with beings of such a pure intention, Bodhisattvas bound to one birth,

analyzed: sārdham tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I shall establish that Buddha-field as crowded.

original: na tatra bodhisattvaḥ syād yo na mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na tatra bodhisattvaḥ syāt yaḥ na mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitaḥ syāt
translated: There would not be a Bodhisattva there who had not been first inspired towards enlightenment by me.

original: sarve te tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ ye mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitāḥ pāramitāsu niveśitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ ye mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitāḥ pāramitāsu niveśitāḥ
translated: May all those bodhisattvas whom I first inspired to seek enlightenment and established in the perfections be reborn there.

original: tatraivedaṃ buddhakṣetramantargataṃ kuryāṃ sarve cāmī duḥkhā praśamayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra eva idam buddhakṣetram antargatam kuryām sarve ca amī praśamayeyam
translated: May this very buddha-field be included there, and may all their sufferings be pacified.

original: bodhisattvabhūto 'haṃ bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpaṃ puruṣakāraṃ niṣpādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtaḥ ham bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpam puruṣakāram niṣpādayeyam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, as a bodhisattva, may I accomplish such deeds.

analyzed: tatas paścāt tatra buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Only then may I fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in that buddha-field.

original: daśacāturdvīpikasahasrapramāṇo me bodhivṛkṣaḥ pariṇāhena syāt /🔽saptaratnavicitrasandarśano nāma bhavet /
analyzed: daśa cāturdvīpika sahasra pramāṇaḥ me bodhivṛkṣaḥ pariṇāhena syāt  saptaratnavicitrasandarśanaḥ nāma bhavet
translated: May my Bodhi tree be ten thousand leagues in height and circumference.🔽May it be called 'Adorned with the Seven Jewels'.

analyzed: daśa tri sāhasraḥ samanta pariṇāhena
translated: May it be seven thousand leagues in circumference.

original: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya gandhenābhayā ca kṛtsanaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya gandhena ābhayā ca kṛtsanam buddhakṣetram sphuṭam syāt
translated: May the entire buddha-field be filled with the fragrance and radiance of that Bodhi tree.

original: tasya mūle pañcacāturdvīpikapramāṇaṃ me nānāratnavicitraṃ vajrāsanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tasya mūle pañca cāturdvīpika pramāṇam me nānā ratna vicitram vajrāsanam syāt
translated: At its foot, may there be a diamond seat for me, five leagues in height and adorned with various jewels.

analyzed: praśama kṣama su vicitra jñāna gandha samavasaraṇam nāma bhavet caturaśīti yojanāni ucca tvena
translated: And it would be called ‘The Fragrance of Knowledge of Various Ways to Pacify,’ and would be eighty-four yojanas high.

analyzed: tasya aham bodhi vṛkṣasya mūle vajrāsane niṣīdeyam
translated: I would sit on a vajra seat at the foot of that tree of enlightenment.

original: paryaṅkamābhujya tenaiva muhūrtenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ yāvat parinirvāṇakālaṃ tatparyaṅkaṃ na KpSū
analyzed: paryaṅkam ābhujya tena eva muhūrtena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam yāvat parinirvāṇa kālam tad paryaṅkam na
translated: I would cross my legs and in that very moment I would awaken to highest genuine full Awakening, and until the time of my passing into final nirvāṇa I would not uncross my legs, not even for a moment.

original: bhindyāṃ na muceyaṃ na tasmād bodhivṛkṣamūlāduttiṣṭheyaṃ /
analyzed: bhindyām na muceyam na tasmāt bodhivṛkṣa mūlāt uttiṣṭheyam
translated: I would not break or loosen them, and I would not rise from the foot of the tree of enlightenment.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūlastha evāhaṃ vajrāsane niṣaṇṇo 'haṃ nirmitān buddhān bodhisattvāṃśca gaṇanātikrānteṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣa mūla sthaḥ eva aham vajrāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ ham nirmitān buddhān bodhisattvān ca gaṇanā atikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyam
translated: While I was sitting at the foot of the tree of enlightenment, on a vajra seat, I would send forth emanations of Buddhas and Bodhisattvas to other buddha-fields, beyond number.

original: ekaiko buddha ekapūrvabhaktena sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ buddhaḥ eka pūrva bhaktena sattvānām dharmam deśayet
translated: Each Buddha would teach the Dharma for one morning meal.

original: tenaiva pūrvabhaktena gaṇanātikrāntān sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ avaivartikāṃ sthāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tena eva pūrva bhaktena gaṇanā atikrāntān sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ a vaivartikām sthāpayeyuḥ
translated: In that very morning meal, they would inspire and establish beyond number beings in highest genuine full Awakening, and would establish them in irreversibility.

analyzed: evam nirmitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bodhisattva kāryam kuryuḥ
translated: In the same way, emanated Bodhisattvas would do the work of Bodhisattvas.

original: bodhiprāptasya me gaṇanātikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣvanyāsu lokadhātuṣu mama kāyo dṛṣyet /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣu anyāsu lokadhātuṣu mama kāyaḥ dṛṣyet
translated: When I have attained Awakening, may my body be seen in other world systems in the ten directions, beyond the calculable.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ mama kāyo lakṣaṇālaṅkṛtaścakṣurindriyasyābhāsamāgacchet sarve te sattvā niyatā bhaveyuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām mama kāyaḥ lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtaḥ cakṣuḥ indriyasya ābhāsam āgacchet sarve te sattvāḥ niyatāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may all those beings whose eyes behold my body adorned with the major and minor marks be destined for unsurpassed, complete Awakening.

original: yāvad bodhiparinirvāṇena te sattvā avirahitā bhaveyurbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi parinirvāṇena te sattvāḥ avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: May those beings never be separated from the sight of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, until they attain Awakening and Nirvāṇa.

original: na tatrendriyavikalā bhaveyurye ca tatra bodhisattvā māṃ draṣṭuṃ iccheyuste yena yenaiva gaccheyuḥ parivarteyuḥ caṃkrameyurniṣīdeyuḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ /
analyzed: na tatra indriya vikalāḥ bhaveyuḥ ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ mām draṣṭum iccheyuḥ te yena yena eva gaccheyuḥ parivarteyuḥ caṃkrameyuḥ niṣīdeyuḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: May there be no beings there with impaired faculties. And those Bodhisattvas who wish to see me there, wherever they go, wherever they turn, wherever they walk, wherever they sit, wherever they lie down,

original: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samanantarotpāditena buddhanamaskāracittena māṃ bodhivṛkṣaniṣaṇṇaṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samanantara utpāditena buddha namaskāra cittena mām bodhivṛkṣa niṣaṇṇam paśyeyuḥ
translated: may all those Bodhisattvas see me seated at the Bodhi tree as soon as they arouse the thought of paying homage to the Buddha.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca yasya dharmasaṃśayaḥ syāt so 'sya sahadarśanena vigacchettīrṇavacikitsāḥ syādanupadiṣṭasya dharmapadasyārthamājāneyuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca yasya dharma saṃśayaḥ syāt saḥ saha darśanena vigacchet syāt anupadiṣṭasya dharma padasya artham ājāneyuḥ
translated: And may their doubts about the Dharma be dispelled as soon as they see me, and may they be free from doubts. May they understand the meaning of the Dharma teaching that has not been taught.

analyzed: a pramāṇam me k psū
translated: May my lifespan be immeasurable,

original: āyurbhavet na śakyate kenacid gaṇayituṃ anyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: āyuḥ bhavet na śakyate kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: Life would be immeasurable, not able to be counted by anyone except through omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: apramānāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And there the bodhisattvas would be immeasurable.

original: yasmiṃśca kṣaṇe 'haṃ tatra buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ tasmin kṣaṇe tatra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvā muṇḍāḥ kāṣāyavastrāḥ
analyzed: yasmin ca kṣaṇe ham tatra buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam tasmin kṣaṇe tatra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvāḥ muṇḍāḥ kāṣāya vastrāḥ
translated: And in whatever moment I would attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that buddha-field, in that moment the bodhisattvas there would have shaven heads and wear red robes,

original: yāvan mama parinirvāṇānna cātra buddhakṣetra ekasattvo 'pi dīrghakeśaḥ syāt śuklaprāvaraṇo vā /
analyzed: yāvat mama parinirvāṇāt na ca atra buddhakṣetre eka sattvaḥ dīrgha keśaḥ syāt śukla prāvaraṇaḥ vā
translated: until my parinirvana, not a single being in this buddha-field would have long hair or wear white clothes.

analyzed: sarve eva śramaṇa varṇāḥ syuḥ śramaṇa pratirūpāḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: All would be of the appearance of ascetics, and would remain as proper ascetics.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, good man!

original: tvamapi paṇḍito vyakto medhāvī atīvaśobhanaṃ te praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tvam api paṇḍitaḥ vyaktaḥ medhāvī atīva śobhanam te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You are wise, clear, and intelligent. You have made a very beautiful vow.

analyzed: atīva guṇavāstvam atīva jñānavān
translated: You are very virtuous, very knowledgeable.

original: yatastvaṃ kulaputra sarvasattvānāmarthāyaivaṃrūpāṃ pravarāṃ praśastāṃ matiṃ kṛtavān pravaro buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: yatas tvam kula putra sarva sattvānām arthāya evaṃrūpām pravarām praśastām matim kṛtavān pravaraḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: Since, noble son, you have made such an excellent and praiseworthy resolution for the sake of all beings, you have chosen an excellent array of qualities for your buddha-field.

analyzed: tatas te kula putra mañjuśrīḥ nāma bhavatu
translated: Then, noble son, your name will be Mañjuśrī.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam mañjuśrīḥ anāgate dhvani atikrāntayoḥ dvayoḥ nadī vālikā samayoḥ asaṃkhyeyayoḥ
translated: You will be, Mañjuśrī, in the future, after two Ganges river sands of eons have passed,

original: praviṣṭe ca tṛtīye 'saṃkhyeye dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi śuddhavirajaḥsannicayo nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: praviṣṭe ca tṛtīye saṃkhyeye dakṣiṇasyām diśi śuddhavirajaḥsannicayaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: and when the third incalculably long eon has begun, in the southern direction, there will be a world system called Pure and Stainless Accumulation.

analyzed: tatra ca sahā lokadhātuḥ antargatā bhaviṣyati
translated: And the Sahā world system will be included within that.

analyzed: anupraviṣṭaḥ ca evaṃrūpayā guṇa vyūhayā tat buddhakṣetram prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: And having entered, that buddha field will appear with such an array of qualities.

analyzed: tatra tvam mañjuśrīḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, Mañjuśrī, you will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: samantadarśī nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: samantadarśī nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: You will be the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Samantadarśin.

original: evaṃrūpā ca te bodhisattvaparṣadbhaviṣyati sarve caite praṇidhānāstvayi saṃpatsyante yathā tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpā ca te bodhisattva parṣad bhaviṣyati sarve ca ete praṇidhānāḥ tvayi saṃpatsyante yathā tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And such will be your assembly of bodhisattvas, and all these aspirations will be fulfilled in you, just as you have made the aspiration.

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtena tatas tvam bahu buddha koṭīṣu avarupta kuśala mūlaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: As a bodhisattva, you will then plant roots of virtue under many millions of buddhas.

analyzed: āśaya pariśodhakaḥ ca kleśa pramardakaḥ
translated: It purifies intentions and crushes afflictions.

original: ye ca te mañjuśrīssattvā nāmaṃ śroṣyanti teṣāṃ sarvakarmāvaraṇakṣayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ye ca te mañjuśrīḥ sattvāḥ nāmam śroṣyanti teṣām sarva karma āvaraṇa kṣayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And, Mañjuśrī, those beings who hear this name will have all their karmic obscurations destroyed.

analyzed: kuśala vivardhakaḥ ca bhaviṣyasi
translated: And you will increase their virtue.

original: mañjuśrīrāha yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśāparipūrirbhavediti yathā me praṇidhānaṃ🔽kṛtaṃ tathā caiva māṃ buddhā bhagavanto vyākurvantu ye daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu
analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūriḥ bhavet iti yathā me praṇidhānam  kṛtam tathā ca eva mām buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākurvantu ye daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu
translated: Mañjuśrī said, Blessed One, if my wishes are to be fulfilled in this way, as I have made a vow,🔽may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide, are present, and live in the immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions, and who teach the Dharma to beings,

original: lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānām ca dharmam deśayanti
translated: prophesy me in the same way.

analyzed: tathā aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpantu
translated: May immeasurable and incalculable Buddha-fields quake in that way.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ bhavantu
translated: And may all beings be filled with such happiness.

analyzed: tat yathā dvitīya dhyāna krīḍā vyūha samāpannasya bodhisattvasya
translated: Just as a bodhisattva who has attained the second dhyāna and the play array samādhi.

analyzed: tathā aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ divya māndārava puṣpāṇi abhipravarṣantu
translated: In the same way, may divine coral tree flowers rain down from immeasurable and incalculable Buddha-fields.

original: tebhyaśca māndāravebhya evaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścaratu yaduta buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ KpSū
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca māndāravebhyaḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścaratu yat uta buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ
translated: And from those coral trees, may sounds such as these issue forth, namely, the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha,

analyzed: pāramitā śabdaḥ bala vaiśāradya śabdaḥ ca niścaratu
translated: the sound of the perfections, and the sound of the powers and fearlessnesses issue forth.

original: yadā cāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandeya tadā caivaṃrūpaṃ nimittaṃ prādurbhavet /
analyzed: yadā ca aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandeya tadā ca evaṃrūpam nimittam prādurbhavet
translated: And when I pay homage to the Blessed One with my five points touching the ground, may such signs appear then.

original: yadā ca mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtaṃ tadā tatkṣaṇādevamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpitā /
analyzed: yadā ca mañjuśriyā kumāra bhūtena bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtam tadā tad kṣaṇāt evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpitāḥ
translated: And when homage was paid to the Blessed One's feet by Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, at that very moment, innumerable and immeasurable buddha-fields shook.

analyzed: divyāni ca māndāravāṇi abhipravarṣitāni
translated: And a rain of divine coral tree flowers fell.

original: sarvasattvāścaivaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitā abhavanyathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ abhavan yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And all beings were filled with such happiness as had been made by the vow.

original: ye ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāsteṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti te tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti /
analyzed: ye ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām dharmam śṛṇvanti te tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who heard the Dharma of those Blessed Buddhas asked those Buddhas,

original: ko 'tra hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ evaṃrūpāṇāṃ nimittānāṃ prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ tra hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ evaṃrūpāṇām nimittānām prādurbhāvāya
translated: What is the cause here, what is the condition, for the appearance of such signs?

original: te ca buddhā bhagavanto mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ vyākurvanti anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam vyākurvanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will prophesy Mañjuśrī, the Youth, to the state of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: uttiṣṭha pravaramati viśālabuddhe vyākṛtastvaṃ daśadiśi lokanāthaiḥ /🔽calitā kṣitiḥ tarpitāḥ sattvāḥ saukhyaiḥ puṣpāḥ pravṛṣṭā bheṣyase buddha loka // iti //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara mati viśāla buddhe vyākṛtaḥ tvam daśa diśi lokanāthaiḥ  calitā kṣitiḥ tarpitāḥ sattvāḥ saukhyaiḥ puṣpāḥ pravṛṣṭā bheṣyase buddha loka iti
translated: Rise, O you of supreme intelligence, of vast wisdom, you are prophesied by the Lords of the world in the ten directions.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: The earth has trembled, beings have been satisfied with happiness, flowers have rained down, you will become a Buddha in the world.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturthaṃ rājaputramānaṅgaṇaṃ nāmāmantrayati /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturtham rājaputram ānaṅgaṇam nāma āmantrayati
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the fourth prince, named Anangana:

analyzed: peyālam yathā mañjuśriyā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The same as Mañjuśrī made a vow.

analyzed: tasya bhagavān sādhukāram anuprādāsīt
translated: The Blessed One expressed his approval to him:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Good, good, son of noble family!

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtaḥ tvam kula putra aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām kleśa parvatām bhetsyasi
translated: As a bodhisattva, son of noble family, you will shatter the mountain of afflictions of immeasurable and countless beings.

analyzed: buddha kāryam ca kariṣyasi
translated: And you will do the work of a Buddha.

analyzed: tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: Then afterwards you will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tena tvaṃ kulaputra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaśrīrnāma bodhisattvo bhavasva /🔽bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsānāgate 'dhvanyatikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikānāmasaṃkhyeye
analyzed: tena tvam kula putra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaśrīḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ bhavasva  bhaviṣyasi tvam vajra cheda prajñā avabhāsa anāgate dhvani atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikānām asaṃkhyeye
translated: Therefore, noble one, you should be called the bodhisattva Vajraccheda-prajñā-prabhāsa-śrī.🔽In the future, after one incalculably long eon has passed,

analyzed: anupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā saṃkhyeye purimāyām diśi daśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān
translated: and the second incalculably long eon has been entered, in the east, beyond buddha-fields equal to the number of grains of sand in ten Ganges rivers,

analyzed: buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn atikramya tatra animiṣā nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: there will be a world system called Animiṣā.

analyzed: tatra tvam kula putra bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyasi
translated: There, noble one, you will attain enlightenment.

original: samantabhadro nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasampanno bhaviṣyasi yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: samantabhadraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will become the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened one, perfect in wisdom and conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassable guide, the trainer of men, the teacher of gods and humans, the buddha, the bhagavat named Samantabhadra.

original: evaṃrūpaṃ ca te buddhakṣetramanekaguṇavyūhitaṃ bhaviṣyati yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam ca te buddhakṣetram aneka guṇa vyūhitam bhaviṣyati yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And your buddha-field will be adorned with many qualities, just as you have made the vow.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: (Kps 11)

original: samanantaravyākṛtaśca kulaputra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vajracchedaprajñāvabhāso bodhisattvo 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samanantara vyākṛtaḥ ca kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaḥ bodhisattvaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Immediately after the prediction, the Bodhisattva Vajraccheda Prajñāprabhāsa was predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: gagana tala gatāni anekāni deva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi sādhukāram aduḥ gośīrṣa uraga sāra candana agaru tamāla cūrṇam ca pravārṣuḥ
translated: In the sky, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods rained down sandalwood powder of the best quality, such as gośīrṣa, uragasāra, and tamāla leaves, saying Excellent!.

original: sa āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tadyadāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat yadā aham bhagavantam
translated: He said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of aspiration of mine is fulfilled, then when I pay homage to the Blessed One with the five-part prostration,

original: pañcamaṇḍalena vandeyaṃ tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāllokadhātavo divyātikrāntenodāreṇa🔽gandhena sphuṭā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: pañca maṇḍalena vandeyam tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān lokadhātavaḥ divya atikrāntena udāreṇa  gandhena sphuṭāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: may worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River be pervaded with a divine, extraordinary, vast fragrance.

original: ye ca tatra lokadhātuṣu sattvā upapannā bhaveyuḥ nairayikā vā tairyagyonikā vā yāmalaukikā vā devā vā manuṣyā vā te sarve taṃ gandhaṃ ghrāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ upapannāḥ bhaveyuḥ nairayikāḥ vā tairyagyonikāḥ vā yāmalaukikāḥ vā devāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā te sarve tam gandham ghrāyeyuḥ
