translated: And may all beings born in those worlds, whether in the hells, as animals, in the realm of the Lord of Death, as gods, or as humans, smell that fragrance.

original: teṣāṃ kāyavyādhiḥ kāyaduḥkhaṃ cittavyādhiḥ cittaduḥkhaṃ ca tāvacciraṃ praśāntaṃ bhavedyāvadahaṃ śīrṣeṇa pṛthivīṃ spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām kāya vyādhiḥ kāya duḥkham citta vyādhiḥ citta duḥkham ca tāvat ciram praśāntam bhavet yāvat aham śīrṣeṇa pṛthivīm spṛśeyam
translated: Their bodily illness and bodily suffering, and their mental illness and mental suffering, would be pacified for a long time, as long as I touch the earth with my head.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāso bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandate /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandate
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Diamond Flame of the Wisdom Radiance bowed at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnasaṃbhava with his five limbs.

original: atha tavadeva gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavo divyātikrāntenodāreṇa gandhena sphuṭā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: atha tavat eva gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ divya atikrāntena udāreṇa gandhena sphuṭāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Then at that very moment, world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges were filled with a fragrance surpassing that of the gods.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ kāyavyādhiścittavyādhiḥ kāyaduḥkhaṃ cittaduḥkhaṃ ca praśāntaṃ pratiprasrabdhaṃ /🔽KpSū
analyzed: sarveṣām ca sattvānām kāya vyādhiḥ citta vyādhiḥ kāya duḥkham citta duḥkham ca praśāntam pratiprasrabdham  kpsū
translated: And the bodily illness and mental illness, the bodily suffering and mental suffering of all beings were pacified and calmed.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha vajrabheda kara gandhena
translated: Rise, O Diamond Splitter, the realms are filled with fragrance.

analyzed: sattva sukham prīti karaḥ vara loka pitā
translated: You will bring joy and happiness to beings, O father of the excellent world.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ pañcamaṃ rājaputramabhayaṃ nāmāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pañcamam rājaputram abhayam nāma āmantrayate sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrareṇu addressed the fifth prince, named Abhaya:

original: peyālaṃ / na ca kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre /
analyzed: peyālam na ca kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre
translated: The same as before, not only in this defiled buddha-field.

original: tatrāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ yatra na narakā bhaveyurna tiryagyonirna yamalokāḥ /
analyzed: tatra aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam yatra na narakāḥ bhaveyuḥ na tiryagyoniḥ na yama lokāḥ
translated: There, Blessed One, I would awaken to perfect and complete awakening, where there would be no hells, no animal realms, no realms of hungry ghosts.

original: yatra nīlavaiḍūryamayī bhūmirvistareṇa yathā padmāyāṃ lokadhātau buddhakṣetre guṇavyūhā tathā vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: yatra nīla vaiḍūrya mayī bhūmiḥ vistareṇa yathā padmāyām lokadhātau buddhakṣetre guṇa vyūhā tathā vaktavyāḥ
translated: Where the ground would be of blue beryl, and the adornments of virtues in the Buddha-field would be described in detail as in the world-system Padma, the Buddha-field.

original: abhayaśca rājaputro ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyāgrataḥ padmaṃ sthāpayitvāha /
analyzed: abhayaḥ ca rāja putraḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya agratas padmam sthāpayitvā āha
translated: And Prince Abhaya, in the presence of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, having placed a lotus in front, said:

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadahaṃ bhagavato 'nubhāvena darśanavyūhaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat aham bhagavataḥ nubhāvena darśana vyūham samādhim pratilabheyam
translated: If, Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then by the Blessed One's power I would obtain the samadhi called Darshanavyūha.

original: yenāhaṃ bhagavato 'grato daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsaṃkhyai rathacakrapramāṇamātraiḥ KpSū
analyzed: yena aham bhagavataḥ gratas daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ saṃkhyaiḥ ratha cakra pramāṇa mātraiḥ
translated: By which, in front of the Blessed One, in world-systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, in Buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms, with lotuses the size of chariot wheels,

original: padmaiḥ puṣpavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣet vayaṃ ca paśyema /
analyzed: padmaiḥ puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣet vayam ca paśyema
translated: a rain of flowers would fall, and we would see it.

original: sahodīrate vākye buddhānubhāvena darśanavyūhaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabdhavān /
analyzed: saha udīrate vākye buddha anubhāvena darśana vyūham samādhim pratilabdhavān
translated: As soon as these words were spoken, by the Buddha's power he obtained the samadhi called Darshanavyūha.

original: daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamai rathacakrapramāṇāmātraiḥ padmaiḥ padmavarṣaṃ pravarṣitaṃ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ ratha cakra pramāṇā mātraiḥ padmaiḥ padma varṣam pravarṣitam
translated: In the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, a rain of lotuses was caused to fall, with lotuses as numerous as the atoms in a buddha-field, the size of chariot wheels.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā abhayaḥ rāja kumāraḥ parama prīti saumanasya jātaḥ babhūva
translated: Seeing this, Prince Abhaya became filled with supreme joy and happiness.

original: bhagavān āha atīva kulaputra śobhanaṃ tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha atīva kula putra śobhanam tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, your aspiration is extremely beautiful.

analyzed: śobhanam ca buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: And you have chosen a beautiful buddha-field.

analyzed: ati śīghram ca te samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: You have attained the samādhi very quickly.

analyzed: satya vacanena padma vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitāḥ
translated: By your truthful words, a rain of lotuses has been caused to fall.

original: sa āha yadi mamānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvāśāparipūrirbhaveta tadete padmā gagane tiṣṭhantu tathaiva gagane sthitā varṣantu /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūriḥ bhaveta tat ete padmāḥ gagane tiṣṭhantu tathā eva gagane sthitāḥ varṣantu
translated: He said, If my wish for the highest perfect enlightenment is to be fulfilled, then may these lotuses remain in the sky and rain down from the sky just as they are.

original: bhagavān āha atikṣipraṃ kulaputra gaganatalaṃ padmairmudritaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ati kṣipram kula putra gagana talam padmaiḥ mudritam
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, the sky is quickly sealed with lotuses.

original: tena hi tvaṃ kulaputra gaganamudro nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: tena hi tvam kula putra gaganamudraḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, noble son, you should be named Gaganamudra.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam gagana mudraḥ na āgate dhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye
translated: You will become Gagana-mudra in the future, after an incalculably long time, when one Ganges river's worth of sand has passed,🔽and you have entered the second incalculably long time.

analyzed: anupraviṣṭe dvitīye pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi koṭī śata sahasram gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni
translated: In the southeast direction, after passing a hundred thousand koṭis of Ganges river's worth of sand

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāṇi atikrāmayitvā tatra padmā nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Buddha-fields, there will be a world system named Padma.

analyzed: tatra tvam bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There you will attain enlightenment.

original: padmottaraśca nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasyarhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno yāvadbuddho bhagavān aprameyena śuddhena bodhisattvasaṅghena /
analyzed: padmottaraḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān aprameyena śuddhena bodhisattva saṅghena
translated: And you will become the Tathāgata named Padmottara, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the world, the Leader of men to be tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, together with an immeasurable assembly of pure bodhisattvas.

analyzed: aparimāṇā ca te āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And your lifespan will be immeasurable.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ ca etaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam lapsyasi tat etat praṇidhāṇam kṛtam
translated: You will obtain all these qualities, as you have made this aspiration.

original: gaganamudro bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā nipapāta /
analyzed: gaganamudraḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā nipapāta
translated: The bodhisattva Gagana-mudra bowed his head at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha.

analyzed: tat bhagavān āha
translated: Then the Blessed One said:🔽You will become one who benefits the world, who pacifies the defilements of afflictions,

analyzed: bhaviṣyase jagati hita karaḥ kleśa kaluṣa śama karaḥ
translated: in the world.

analyzed: kṣetra rajaḥ sama guṇa dharaḥ bodhim prāpsyasi yathā pūrva jinaiḥ
translated: You will attain enlightenment, possessing the qualities of the dust of the fields, as did the previous victors.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ ṣaṣṭhaṃ rājaputramambaraṃ nāmāntrayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṣaṣṭham rājaputram ambaram nāma āntrayati sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the sixth prince, named Ambara:

original: peyālaṃ / na ca kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre /
analyzed: peyālam na ca kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre
translated: The same as before. Not only in this defiled buddha-field,

original: yāvad yathā gaganamudreṇa bodhisattvena praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat yathā gaganamudreṇa bodhisattvena praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: but as far as the bodhisattva Gagana-mudra has made a vow:

original: yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tad daśadiśī gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu KpSū
analyzed: yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat daśa diśī gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu
translated: If, Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, then in the ten directions, in as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River,

original: lokadhātuṣu sarvagaganeṣu saptaratnamayāḥ chatrāḥ prādurbhavantu hemajālapraticchannāḥ saptaratnamayābhirghaṇṭābhiralaṅkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu sarva gaganeṣu sapta ratna mayāḥ chatrāḥ prādurbhavantu hema jāla praticchannāḥ sapta ratna mayābhiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ
translated: may parasols made of the seven precious substances appear in all the sky, covered with golden nets, adorned with bells made of the seven precious substances.

original: tatra chatraghaṇṭājālairevaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścaret yaduta buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ pāramitāśabdo balaśabdo 'bhijñāśabdo vaiśāradyaśabdaḥ /
analyzed: tatra chatra ghaṇṭā jālaiḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścaret yat uta buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ pāramitā śabdaḥ bala śabdaḥ bhijñā śabdaḥ vaiśāradya śabdaḥ
translated: And from those parasols, bells, and nets, may a sound like this come forth, namely the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the perfections, the sound of the powers, the sound of the superknowledges, the sound of the fearlessnesses.

original: sarve ca te sattvā evaṃrūpaṃ śabdaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ te śrutvā sarve 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ evaṃrūpam śabdam śṛṇuyuḥ te śrutvā sarve nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may all those beings hear such a sound, and having heard it, may all of them generate the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: ye cātra sattvāḥ pūrvamutpāditabodhicittāste 'vaivartikā bhaveyuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye ca atra sattvāḥ pūrvam utpādita bodhi cittāḥ te vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may those beings here who have previously generated the mind of enlightenment become irreversible from unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: samanantaravyāhṛte 'smiṃ vyāhāre atha daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvagaganatalāt peyālaṃ evaṃrūpāḥ śabdā niścaranti /
analyzed: samanantara vyāhṛte smin vyāhāre atha daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva gagana talāt peyālam evaṃrūpāḥ śabdāḥ niścaranti
translated: Immediately after this utterance, then from the entire sky in the worlds in the ten directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, such sounds emerged:

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca anubhāvāt svayam eva adrākṣīt
translated: And through the Blessed One's power, he saw it himself.

original: punarevaṃ āha sacenme bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tadahaṃ bhagavataḥ purato jñānavairocanaṃ samādhiṃ
analyzed: punar evam āha saced me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānam kṛtam tat aham bhagavataḥ puratas jñāna vairocanam samādhim
translated: Again he said, If, Blessed One, this kind of wish of mine is fulfilled, as I have made a vow, then I, Blessed One, in front of the Blessed One, will enter the concentration of the radiance of wisdom.

analyzed: yena mama kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ nivarteyuḥ
translated: By which my wholesome dharmas will be turned back.

original: pratilabdhe ca samādhau māṃ bhagavāṃ vyākuryāt /
analyzed: pratilabdhe ca samādhau mām bhagavām vyākuryāt
translated: And when I have attained the concentration, may the Blessed One prophesy me.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca anubhāvena jñāna vairocana samādhiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: And through the Blessed One's power, the concentration of the radiance of wisdom was attained.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, good man!

analyzed: udāram te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have made a lofty vow.

analyzed: tena tvam puṇya abhisyandena daśasu kpsū
translated: By that outpouring of merit, in the ten directions

analyzed: dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ bahavaḥ ca eka pramāṇāḥ
translated: in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, and in many buddha-fields of the same measure,

analyzed: śata sahasra manojña śabda saṃcoditaḥ buddhakṣetraḥ
translated: the buddha-field will be stirred by a hundred thousand delightful sounds.

analyzed: tatas tvam kula putra vegavairocanaḥ nāma bhagasva
translated: Therefore, good man, you will be called Vairocana of Speed.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vega vairocana atikrānte na āgate dhvani eka nadī gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye
translated: In the future, after the passing of Vairocana of Speed, in an asaṃkhyeya kalpa as numerous as the sands of one Ganges River,

analyzed: anupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tikramitvā
translated: having entered the second, in the eastern direction, having passed over world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: ādityasomā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra tvaṃ bodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: ādityasomāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra tvam bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: there is a world system called Ādityasoma. There you will attain enlightenment.

original: dharmavaśavartīśvararājo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasyarhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: dharmavaśavartī īśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed lord named Dharmeśvara.

original: sa ca vegavairocano bodhisattvastaṃ bhagavantaṃ pañcamaṇḍalena vandati ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ /
analyzed: sa ca vegavairocanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tam bhagavantam pañca maṇḍalena vandati ratnagarbham tathāgatam
translated: And that bodhisattva Vegadhārin bowed to that Blessed One with his five points, to the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: uttiṣṭha suvrata surata dāntacitta sattvebhyaḥ tīvrakaruṇā mahatī pravṛttā /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha suvrata surata dānta citta sattvebhyaḥ tīvra karuṇā mahatī pravṛttā
translated: Rise, O one of good vows, O one of controlled mind, for the sake of beings, let the great and intense compassion arise.

original: tāre hi sattvān duḥkhārṇavatīraṃ saṃsthā yāvanna budhyasi anuttarabuddhabodhiṃ //🔽KpSū
analyzed: tāre hi sattvān duḥkha arṇava tīram saṃsthā yāvat na budhyasi anuttara buddha bodhim  kpsū
translated: O Tārā, liberate beings from the ocean of suffering, until you attain the unsurpassed Buddha enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ saptamaṃ rājaputramaṅgajamāmantrayāṃ āsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ saptamam rāja putram aṅgajam āmantrayāṃ āsa
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Sāgara­rendu addressed the seventh prince, Aṅgaja:🔽Just as the bodhisattva Vegadhārin has made a vow, in the same way, son of noble family, you too make a vow.

original: peyālaṃ / na cāsmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre tatrāhaṃ bodhimabhisaṃbuddheyaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam na ca asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre tatra aham bodhim abhisaṃbuddhā iyam
translated: I will not attain enlightenment in this defiled buddha-field.

original: yatra ca na narakā na tiryagyoniḥ na yamalokaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yatra ca na narakāḥ na tiryagyoniḥ na yama lokaḥ prajñāyate
translated: Where there are no hells, no animal realm, and no realm of Yama is known.

original: na mātṛgrāmo na ca sattvānāṃ garbhavāsaḥ /
analyzed: na mātṛgrāmaḥ na ca sattvānām garbha vāsaḥ
translated: No women, and no beings are conceived in the womb.

original: na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍamahācakravāḍā na pāṃśuśailaparvatā notsadaśarkarakaṭhallakaṇṭakagahanā na kāṣṭhavṛkṣā na mahāsamudrā /
analyzed: na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na pāṃśu śaila parvatāḥ na utsada śarkara kaṭhalla kaṇṭaka gahanāḥ na kāṣṭhavṛkṣāḥ na mahā samudrāḥ
translated: No Sumeru, no Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa, no mountain of dust, no deep valleys, no thickets of thorns and brambles, no wooden trees, no great oceans.

original: na ca tatrādityacandrā na tārakarūpā na rātridivasā na tamaskandhā /
analyzed: na ca tatra āditya candrāḥ na tāraka rūpāḥ na rātri divasāḥ na tamaḥ skandhāḥ
translated: There would be no sun, moon, or stars, no day or night, and no darkness.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāmuccāraprasrāvakheṭasiṅghāṇakaṃ na kāyakhedadurgandhaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām uccāra prasrāva kheṭa siṅghāṇakam na kāya kheda durgandham
translated: There would be no urine, feces, phlegm, or other bodily impurities or bad smells.

original: na ca sattvānāṃ kāyaklamatā bhavet na cittaklamatā /
analyzed: na ca sattvānām kāya klama tā bhavet na citta klama tā
translated: The beings there would have no physical or mental fatigue.

analyzed: na ca tatra pāṃśu bhūmiḥ bhavet
translated: There would be no dusty ground.

original: sarvā ca tatra bhūmiraśmagarbhamayī bhavet anekaratnaśatasahasrālaṅkṛtā bhavet /
analyzed: sarvā ca tatra bhūmiḥ aśma garbha mayī bhavet aneka ratna śata sahasra alaṅkṛtā bhavet
translated: The entire ground would be made of precious stones, adorned with many hundreds of thousands of jewels.

original: māndāravamahāmāndāravapuṣpāvakīrṇaṃ ca tad buddhakṣetraṃ nānāratnavṛkṣālaṅkṛtaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa avakīrṇam ca tat buddhakṣetram nānā ratna vṛkṣa alaṅkṛtam bhavet
translated: That buddha-field would be strewn with coral tree and great coral tree flowers, and adorned with jeweled trees.

analyzed: te ca ratna vṛkṣāḥ nānā ratna jāla alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Those jeweled trees would be adorned with nets of various jewels.

original: nānāratnaduṣyā nānāratnavastrā nānāratnamālā nānāratnābharaṇālaṅkārālaṅkṛtā nānāmālyebhyo nānāvādyairnānāratnabhājanairnānāpuṣpaiśca te ratnavṛkṣālaṅkṛtā 🔽KpSū
analyzed: nānā ratna duṣyāḥ nānā ratna vastrāḥ nānā ratna mālāḥ nānā ratna ābharaṇa alaṅkāra alaṅkṛtāḥ nānā mālyebhyaḥ nānā vādyaiḥ nānā ratna bhājanaiḥ nānā puṣpaiḥ ca te ratna vṛkṣa alaṅkṛtāḥ  kpsū
translated: They would be adorned with various jeweled canopies, various jeweled garments, various jeweled garlands, various jeweled ornaments, various flower garlands, various musical instruments, various jeweled vessels, and various flowers.

analyzed: bhaveyuḥ na tatra rātriḥ prajñāyeta
translated: There would be no night there,

analyzed: anyatra yadā puṣpāḥ saṃkuceyuḥ vādyāḥ ca vādyeyuḥ
translated: except when the flowers close and the musical instruments play.

analyzed: saṃkucitebhyaḥ ca puṣpebhyaḥ bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: And the bodhisattvas would be reborn from folded flowers.

original: samāpannāśca tatra bodhisattvā darśanavyūhaṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: samāpannāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ darśana vyūham nāma samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And the bodhisattvas who have entered there would attain the samādhi called Array of Visions.

original: yena samādhinā pratilabdhena daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhato yāpayato buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yena samādhinā pratilabdhena daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyuḥ
translated: By attaining that samādhi, they would see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, dwelling and living in other world systems equal to the atoms in ten buddha-fields in the ten directions.

analyzed: tad kṣaṇe ca evaṃrūpam viśuddham divya śrotram pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And at that very moment, they would attain such pure divine hearing,

original: yena daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: yena daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhānām bhagavatām dharma deśanām śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: by which they would hear the Dharma teachings of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in other world systems equal to the atoms in ten buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: sahopapannāśca sattvāḥ sarve jātismarā bhaveyuste ca buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān kalpān anusmareyuḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca sattvāḥ sarve jāti smarāḥ bhaveyuḥ te ca buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān anusmareyuḥ
translated: And all the beings who are reborn there would have the memory of their past lives, and they would remember the kalpas equal to the atoms in a buddha-field.

original: sahopapannāśca te sattvāḥ sarve evaṃrūpaṃ divyaṃ cakṣuḥ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca te sattvāḥ sarve evaṃrūpam divyam cakṣuḥ pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And all those beings who are reborn there would attain such divine vision,

original: yat samantāddaśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yat samantāt daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām paśyeyuḥ
translated: They would see the arrays of qualities of buddha-fields equal to the atoms in all the buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: sahopapannāśca te sattvāḥ sarva evaṃrūpeṇa paracittajñānakauśalyena samanvāgatā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca te sattvāḥ sarve evaṃrūpeṇa para citta jñāna kauśalyena samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those beings who are reborn together would all possess such a form of skill in the knowledge of others' minds.

original: yadekakṣaṇena buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sarvasattvānāṃ cittacaritāṃ vijāneyuryāvadbodhiparinirvāṇāṃ KpSū
analyzed: yat eka kṣaṇena buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sarva sattvānām citta caritām vijāneyuḥ yāvat bodhi parinirvāṇām
translated: In a single moment, they would know the mental activities of all beings in buddha-fields equal to the atoms in a buddha-field, up to the complete nirvana of enlightenment.

analyzed: te sattvāḥ tām samādhim
translated: Those beings would bow to that samadhi.

original: rātryāḥ pratyuṣakālasamaye caturdiśaṃ sugandhāḥ prītikarāśca mṛdusukhasaṃsparśā vāyavo vāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: rātryāḥ pratyuṣa kāla samaye caturdiśam sugandhāḥ prīti karāḥ ca mṛdu sukha saṃsparśāḥ vāyavaḥ vāyeyuḥ
translated: At dawn, fragrant and delightful breezes that are pleasant to the touch would blow in the four directions.

analyzed: ye tān puṣpān vikāsayeyuḥ
translated: They would cause those flowers to bloom.

original: te ca bodhisattvāstābhyaḥ samādhibhyo vyutthihitvā tebhyaḥ puṣpakeśarebhya uttiṣṭheyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ tābhyaḥ samādhibhyaḥ vyutthihitvā tebhyaḥ puṣpa keśarebhyaḥ uttiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas, having arisen from those samadhis, would rise up from those flower stamens.

original: tathārūpaṃ ca ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratilabheran yad ekacittakṣaṇene buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamānyekaikāṃ diśaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: tathārūpam ca ṛddhi viṣayam pratilabheran yat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni ekaikām diśam gaccheyuḥ
translated: They would attain such a state of spiritual power that in a single instant they would go to each of the directions equal to the atoms in a buddha-field.

original: tiṣṭhato yāpayato buddhān bhagavato vanditvā paryupāsitvā tadā nivarteyuḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ vanditvā paryupāsitvā tadā nivarteyuḥ
translated: while standing, walking, sitting, or lying down, they would pay homage to the Buddha Bhagavats, serve them, and then return.

analyzed: tatra ca māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpakeśareṣu paryaṅkam ābadhvā niṣīdeyuḥ
translated: And there, on the filaments of coral tree and great coral tree flowers, they would sit cross-legged.

original: dharmasukhamanasikāreṇa tathāgataṃ prekṣeyuryena yena ca niṣīdeyuḥ parivarteyurvā sarvadiśāsu ca māmeva paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: dharma sukha manasikāreṇa tathāgatam prekṣeyuḥ yena yena ca niṣīdeyuḥ parivarteyuḥ vā sarva diśāsu ca mām eva paśyeyuḥ
translated: With the mental focus on the happiness of the Dharma, they would behold the Tathagata, and wherever they would sit or turn, they would see me in all directions.

original: yathārūpaṃ ca tatra bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ kāṅkṣāvimatidharmeṣu saṃśayotpadyeta tatsarvaṃ mama darśanavyavalokanamātreṇa vigaccheyuḥ
analyzed: yathārūpam ca tatra bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām kāṅkṣā vimati dharmeṣu saṃśayaḥ utpadyeta tat sarvam mama darśana vyavalokana mātreṇa vigaccheyuḥ
translated: And whatever kind of doubt or uncertainty about the Dharma might arise for those bodhisattva mahasattvas, all that would be dispelled merely by seeing and beholding me.

original: yathārūpaṃ ca dharmadeśanān te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathārūpaṃ dharmadeśanāṃ mama vyavalokanamātreṇājāneyuḥ /
analyzed: yathārūpam ca dharma deśanān te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathārūpam dharma deśanām mama vyavalokana mātreṇa ājāneyuḥ
translated: And whatever kind of Dharma teaching those bodhisattva mahasattvas might desire, they would know that very kind of Dharma teaching merely by my beholding them.

analyzed: amamāḥ aparigrahāḥ ca  tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They would be without possessions and without clinging.

analyzed: antaśas sva kāya jīvitena api anarthikāḥ
translated: The beings there would have no regard even for their own bodies and lives.

original: sarve ca tatra bodhisattvā avaivartikā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all the bodhisattvas there would be irreversible.

analyzed: na tatra akuśalasya nāma kpsū
translated: There would be no name for unwholesome actions.

original: bhavenna ca tatra buddhakṣetre śikṣāgrahaṇasya nāma bhavet /
analyzed: bhavet na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śikṣā grahaṇasya nāma bhavet
translated: And in that Buddha-field, there would be no mention of taking up the precepts,

analyzed: na ca āpatti vyūtthāpana kathā
translated: nor any talk of transgressing the precepts.

analyzed: yathā yāvat sarva sattvāḥ dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And so on up to: all beings would be endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: sarve ca nārāyana balikāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: and all would have the strength of Narayana.

analyzed: na ca tatra eka sattvaḥ pīndriya vikalaḥ bhavet yāvat bodhi nirvāṇena
translated: And not a single being there would have impaired faculties, until enlightenment and nirvana.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā muṇḍā navakāṣāyacīvaraprāvṛtāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ muṇḍāḥ nava kāṣāya cīvara prāvṛtāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: And all the beings there would be reborn with shaven heads, wearing the saffron-colored robe,

analyzed: su vibhaktam ca samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: and would attain well-developed concentration.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena praṇāmeyuḥ
translated: And they would maintain it until the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: sarve ca tatra samavadhāna kuśala mūlāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all there would have wholesome roots in common,

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ jarāvyādhiduḥkhaṃ prajñāyeta /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām jarā vyādhi duḥkham prajñāyeta
translated: and in that Buddha-field, the suffering of old age and disease of beings would not be known.

original: yeṣāṃ sattvānāmāyuḥparikṣayo bhavet te sarve paryaṅkena parinirvāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām sattvānām āyuḥ parikṣayaḥ bhavet te sarve paryaṅkena parinirvāyeyuḥ
translated: For those beings whose lifespan would end, all of them would attain nirvana while sitting cross-legged.

analyzed: svakāt ca śarīrāt tejaḥ dhātum pramuñceyuḥ yena ātmanaḥ śarīram sādhyeyuḥ
translated: And they would emit the fire element from their own bodies, by which they would cremate their own bodies.

original: caturdiśaśca vāyava āgaccheyuḥ ye tāni bodhisattvaśarīrāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu kṣipeyuḥ /
analyzed: caturdiśas ca vāyavaḥ āgaccheyuḥ ye tāni bodhisattva śarīrāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu kṣipeyuḥ
translated: And let winds come from the four directions that would scatter those Bodhisattva bodies in empty Buddha-fields.

original: evaṃrūpāśca mahāmaṇiratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ tadyathā rājñaścakravartinaḥ prabhāsvaraṃ maṇiratnaṃ /🔽ye ca tatra sattvāstāṃ maṇiratnaprabhāṃ paśyeyuḥ taṃ vā maṇiratnaṃ paśyeyuḥ spārśeyurvā te sarve narakatiryagyamalokaduḥkhāni yāvadbodhinirvāṇena
analyzed: evaṃrūpāḥ ca mahā maṇi ratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ tat yathā rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ prabhāsvaram maṇi ratnam  ye ca tatra sattvāḥ tām maṇi ratna prabhām paśyeyuḥ tam vā maṇi ratnam paśyeyuḥ spārśeyuḥ vā te sarve naraka tiryagyama loka duḥkhāni yāvat bodhi nirvāṇena
translated: And let such great jewel-gems appear, just like the radiant jewel-gem of a wheel-turning king.

analyzed: mā pratisaṃvedayeyuḥ
translated: And let all those beings who would see the radiance of that jewel-gem or see or touch that jewel-gem not experience the sufferings of the hells, animal realms, or the world of Yama, until awakening and Nirvāṇa.

original: te ca tataścyavitvā tatropapadyeyuḥ yatra tiṣṭhanto KpSū
analyzed: te ca tatas cyavitvā tatra upapadyeyuḥ yatra tiṣṭhantaḥ
translated: Let them, having passed away from there, be reborn where the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, abide,

original: yāpayanto buddhā bhagavantaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: yāpayantaḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayanti
translated: live, and teach the Dharma to beings.

original: tatropapannāśca te sattvāsteṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśāddharmaṃ śṛṇuyuste ca bodhicittamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra upapannāḥ ca te sattvāḥ teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyuḥ te ca bodhi cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And let those beings who are reborn there hear the Dharma from those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and let them generate the mind of awakening.

analyzed: saha utpādite ca bodhi citte vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And as soon as they generate the mind of awakening, let them become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: na kaścitsattvo mama buddhakṣetre 'samāhitaḥ kālaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: na kaścid sattvaḥ mama buddhakṣetre samāhitaḥ kālam kuryāt
translated: No sentient being in my buddhafield would die in a state of distraction.

original: na duḥkhavedanāyā na parasparavyāvadhacittāviprayogamaraṇāya tataśca mārākṣaṇeṣupapadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na duḥkha vedanāyāḥ na paraspara vyāvadha citta aviprayoga maraṇāya tatas ca māra akṣaṇeṣu upapadyeyuḥ
translated: They would not die a painful death, nor would they die as a result of mutual conflict and disharmony. Instead, they would be reborn in the realms of the Maras.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantaṃ buddhadarśanenāvirahitā bhaveyuḥ dharmaśravaṇena saṅghopasthānenāvirahitā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantam buddha darśanena avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ dharma śravaṇena saṅgha upasthānena avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Until the end of cyclic existence, they would never be separated from the sight of the Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, and from serving the Sangha.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā apagatakhiladveṣamrakṣerṣyāmātsaryā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ apagata khila dveṣa mrakṣa īrṣyā mātsaryāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: All the sentient beings there would be free from anger, hatred, malice, envy, and stinginess.

analyzed: vivarjitam ca tam buddhakṣetram śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ bhavet
translated: That buddhafield would be devoid of Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: śuddhaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ tam buddhakṣetram sphuṭam bhavet
translated: That buddhafield would be filled with pure Bodhisattvas.

original: snigdhacittā mṛducittā avairacittā akilviṣacittāḥ śāntacittāḥ samāhitacittāśca bhaveyuḥ tatra ye sattvā upapadyeyuḥ /🔽prabhāsvaraṃ ca me tadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhavet /
analyzed: snigdha cittāḥ mṛdu cittāḥ avaira cittāḥ akilviṣa cittāḥ śānta cittāḥ samāhita cittāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ tatra ye sattvāḥ upapadyeyuḥ  prabhāsvaram ca me tat buddhakṣetram bhavet
translated: The sentient beings who are reborn there would have loving minds, gentle minds, minds free from enmity and resentment, peaceful minds, and concentrated minds.🔽My buddhafield would be radiant.

analyzed: mahat guṇa vyūham ca me tat buddhakṣetram bhavet
translated: My buddhafield would have a great array of qualities.

original: daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamaiḥ lokadhātubhirdṛśyeta gandhena ca sphuret /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ lokadhātubhiḥ dṛśyeta gandhena ca sphuret
translated: It would be seen from buddha-fields as numerous as the dust particles in the ten directions, and its fragrance would pervade them.

analyzed: nitya sukha samarpitāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: The beings there would always be endowed with happiness.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre duḥkhaśabdaḥ śrūyeta /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre duḥkha śabdaḥ śrūyeta
translated: And in that buddha-field, the word 'suffering' would not be heard.

original: tāvaccāhaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yāvadahaṃ bodhisattvabhūtaścaivaṃrūpābhirbuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhasaṃpadābhiḥ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ
analyzed: tāvat ca aham bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi yāvat aham bodhisattva bhūtaḥ ca evaṃrūpābhiḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha saṃpadābhiḥ buddhakṣetram pariśuddham
translated: For so long shall I practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, as long as, being a bodhisattva, I establish a buddha-field purified with such an abundance of qualities of a buddha-field,

analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ pariśuddha āśayaiḥ sattvaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: and that buddha-field is filled with beings of such a pure intention.

original: tataḥ paścād ahaṃ tatra buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ /
analyzed: tatas paścāt aham tatra buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Only then shall I fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect awakening in that buddha-field.

analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me pramāṇā prabhā bhavet
translated: And when I have attained awakening, may my radiance be immeasurable.

original: sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu ca daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu lakṣanālaṅkṛto me kāyaḥ saṃdṛśyediti
analyzed: sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu ca daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu lakṣanā alaṅkṛtaḥ me kāyaḥ saṃdṛśyet iti
translated: And may my body adorned with the marks be seen in other buddha-fields in the ten directions, as numerous as the dust particles in a thousand buddha-fields.'

original: ye ca tatra sattvā māṃ paśyeyuḥ teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ rāgaḥ praśamayet /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ mām paśyeyuḥ teṣām sattvānām rāgaḥ praśamayet
translated: And may those beings who see me there have their passion pacified.

analyzed: dveṣaḥ moha īrṣyā māna mrakṣa sarva kleśa upakleśāḥ praśameyuḥ
translated: May their hatred, ignorance, envy, pride, hypocrisy, and all the major and minor defilements be pacified.

analyzed: sarve bodhi cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: May all of them generate the mind set on awakening.

original: yathāvidhāśca samādhidhāraṇīrākāṅkṣeta tathārūpā māṃ dṛṣṭvā pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: yathāvidhāḥ ca samādhi dhāraṇīḥ ākāṅkṣeta tathārūpāḥ mām dṛṣṭvā pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And may they obtain, by seeing me, whatever kinds of meditative absorptions and mnemonic powers they desire.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ śītanarake pratyājātā bhaveyusteṣāṃ māṃ dṛṣṭvā sukhāvedanā prādurbhavet /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ śīta narake pratyājātāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām mām dṛṣṭvā sukhā vedanā prādurbhavet
translated: And may those beings who have been reborn in the cold hells, when they see me, experience the sensation of pleasure.

original: tathārūpāṃ ca sukhāṃ vedanāṃ pratilabheran yathāpi nāma dvitīyadhyānasamāpannasya
analyzed: tathārūpām ca sukhām vedanām pratilabheran yathā api nāma dvitīya dhyāna samāpannasya
translated: And may they obtain such a pleasant sensation as that of a monk who has attained the second meditative absorption.

original: bhikṣoste ca māṃ dṛṣṭvā parameṇa kāyacaitasikena sukhena samarpitā bhaveyuste ca
analyzed: bhikṣoḥ te ca mām dṛṣṭvā parameṇa kāya caitasikena sukhena samarpitāḥ bhaveyuḥ te ca
translated: And may they, having seen me, be filled with the highest physical and mental pleasure.

analyzed: sarve n uttarāyām kpsū
translated: And may they all generate the mind set on unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayeyuste ca tataścyavitvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeran /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ te ca tatas cyavitvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeran
translated: complete enlightenment. And may they, having passed away from there, be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: tatra ca anaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And there may they be irreversible from unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: ye ca sattvāḥ pretabhavaneṣūpapannāḥ mama paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ preta bhavaneṣu upapannāḥ mama paśyeyuḥ
translated: May those beings who have been reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts see me.

analyzed: peyālam a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May they become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam tiryagyoni gatāḥ vaktavyāḥ
translated: The same should be said for those born as animals.

original: evaṃ devāḥ dviguṇā ca me prabhāsayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam devāḥ dviguṇā ca me prabhāsayeyam
translated: May my light shine twice as far as that of the gods.

analyzed: apramāṇā ca me āyuḥ bhavet
translated: May my lifespan be immeasurable.

analyzed: yat na śakyam kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra sarvajña jñānena
translated: It should not be possible for anyone to count it, except through the knowledge of omniscience.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvaparimāṇeṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavanto mama varṇaṃ bhāṣeranyeṣāṃ anuśrāvayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu aparimāṇeṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama varṇam bhāṣeran yeṣām anuśrāvayeyam
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the immeasurable, incalculable other world systems in the ten directions proclaim my praise, and may they cause others to listen to it.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā mama varṇaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ te tatra mama buddhakṣetre kuśalamūlaṃ pariṇāmayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ mama varṇam śṛṇuyuḥ te tatra mama buddhakṣetre kuśala mūlam pariṇāmayeyuḥ
translated: And may those beings who hear my praise there direct their roots of virtue towards my Buddha-field.

original: te kālaṃ kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyuḥ sthāpayitvānantaryakārakāṃ saddharmapratikṣepakāṃ āryāpavādakāṃ /
analyzed: te kālam kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ sthāpayitvā ānantarya kārakām saddharma pratikṣepakām ārya apavādakām
translated: May they, after death, be reborn in my Buddha-field, except for those who have committed the actions with immediate result and those who have slandered the noble ones.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me ye sattvā aprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mama nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ mama ca buddhakṣetra upapattiṃ ākāṅkṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me ye sattvāḥ aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mama nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ mama ca buddhakṣetre upapattim ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may the beings who hear my name in the immeasurable and incalculable world systems, and who aspire to be reborn in my Buddha-field,

original: teṣāmahaṃ maraṇakālasamayeṣvanekagaṇaparivṛto vitimirasamādhiṃ samāpannāḥ tathārūpeṇa subhāṣitena tān sattvān saṃtoṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām aham maraṇa kāla samayeṣu aneka gaṇa parivṛtaḥ vitimira samādhim samāpannāḥ tathārūpeṇa su bhāṣitena tān sattvān saṃtoṣayeyam
translated: at the time of their death, surrounded by many groups, having attained the Vitimīra-samādhi, may I satisfy those beings with such eloquent speech.

analyzed: teṣām sattvānām sarva duḥkham praśamet
translated: May all the suffering of those beings be pacified.

original: tenaiva prasādena niścitāṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ / KpSū
analyzed: tena eva prasādena niścitām samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: By that very faith, may they attain the definite samādhi.

analyzed: citta spṛhaṇām dharma kṣāntim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: May they attain the mental delight and the acceptance of the Dharma.

original: kālaṃ ca kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: kālam ca kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And having died, may they be reborn in my Buddha-field.

original: ye ca punaranyatra buddhakṣetreṣu saptadhanavirahitāḥ sattvā anarthikāḥ tribhiryānairanarthikā
analyzed: ye ca punar anyatra buddhakṣetreṣu sapta dhana virahitāḥ sattvāḥ anarthikāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ anarthikā
translated: And again, may the beings who are devoid of the seven riches in other Buddha-fields, who are not interested in the three vehicles,

analyzed: deva mānuṣikābhiḥ saṃpattibhiḥ anarthikāḥ kuśala paryeṣṭyā tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ
translated: who are not interested in the prosperity of gods and humans, who are not interested in seeking virtue, who are not interested in the three bases of meritorious action,

original: adharmarāgaraktā viṣamalobhābhibhūtā mithyādharmaparītāsteṣāṃ prabhāsamādhinā maraṇakālasamaye purataḥ tiṣṭheyaṃ /
analyzed: adharma rāga raktāḥ viṣama lobha abhibhūtāḥ mithyādharma parītāḥ teṣām prabhā samādhinā maraṇa kāla samaye puratas tiṣṭheyam
translated: They are stained by unrighteous passion, overcome by uneven greed, and surrounded by false Dharma. At the time of their death, may I appear before them.

analyzed: aneka gaṇa parivṛtaḥ dharmam deśayeyam
translated: Surrounded by a multitude, may I teach the Dharma to them.

analyzed: teṣām svakam buddhakṣetram darśayeyam
translated: May I show them my own buddha-field.

analyzed: bodhau ca samādāpayeyam
translated: And may I inspire them to aspire to enlightenment.

original: te sattvā mamāntike paramaprītiprasādaṃ prāmodyaṃ pratilabheyuḥ bodhau ca cittānyutpādyeyuḥ /
analyzed: te sattvāḥ mama antike parama prīti prasādam prāmodyam pratilabheyuḥ bodhau ca cittāni utpādyeyuḥ
translated: May those beings attain supreme joy, faith, and delight in me, and may they generate the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: teṣām sarva duḥkhāḥ vedanāḥ praśameyuḥ
translated: May all their feelings of suffering be pacified.

analyzed: te sūryapradīpam ca samādhim pratilabheran
translated: May they attain the solar-lamp concentration.

analyzed: moha praṇāham ca eṣām bhavet
translated: May their delusion be eliminated.

original: kālaṃ ca kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: kālam ca kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And after death, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, good man!

analyzed: śodhanam te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Your vow is purifying.

original: sa prāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā ca daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣūragasāracandanacūrṇaṃ
analyzed: sa prāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā ca daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu uraga sāra candana cūrṇam
translated: He said, If, Blessed One, my hopes are to be fulfilled in this way, then in the ten directions, in other buddha-fields equal to the number of atoms in the buddha-fields, may sandalwood powder from the aloe wood tree be scattered,

analyzed: pravarṣatu
translated: Let it rain.

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ gandhaṃ ghrāyeyuḥ te sarve bodhau cittamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam gandham ghrāyeyuḥ te sarve bodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may all beings who smell that fragrance generate the mind of awakening.

analyzed: aham ca etarhi
translated: And may I now

analyzed: praṇītadyutim nāma samādhim pratilabheyam
translated: attain the samādhi called 'Excellent Radiance.'

analyzed: yat svayam eva paśyeyam
translated: May I see it myself.

original: utpāditaśca kulaputra praṇītadyutiḥ samādhiḥ svayamevādrākṣīt tadbuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu uragasāracandanacūrṇaṃ
analyzed: utpāditaḥ ca kula putra praṇīta dyutiḥ samādhiḥ svayam eva adrākṣīt tat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu uragasāracandana cūrṇam
translated: And the Excellent Radiance samādhi, O son of noble family, having been generated, he saw himself the sandalwood powder raining down in the ten directions, in as many world systems as there are atoms in a buddha-field.

original: daśasu dikṣvekaikasyāṃ diśi gaṇanātikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ prāñjalibhūtā adrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ prāñjali bhūtāḥ adrākṣuḥ
translated: And in the ten directions, in each direction, he saw more than could be counted beings with their hands folded in reverence.

analyzed: ye bodhāya cittāni utpādayanti
translated: Those who were generating the mind of awakening.

original: bhagavān āha atiśīghraṃ kulaputra gandhavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ati śīghram kula putra gandha vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā
translated: The Blessed One said: O son of noble family, the rain of fragrance has been very quickly caused to rain down.

original: gaṇanātikrāntāśca sattvā bodhau samādāpitāstena tvaṃ kulaputra siṃhagandho bhavasva /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ ca sattvāḥ bodhau samādāpitāḥ tena tvam kula putra siṃhagandhaḥ bhavasva
translated: And more than could be counted beings have been inspired towards awakening by you. Therefore, O son of noble family, you shall be called Siṃhagandha.

original: atikrānte siṃhagandha ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsaṃkhyeye 'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye uparimāya diśāyeto
analyzed: atikrānte siṃhagandhe eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā saṃkhyeye nupraviṣṭe dvitīye uparimāya
translated: O Siṃhagandha, when one asaṃkhyeya of Ganges river-sand measure has passed and a second has been entered, in the upper direction from here,

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt dvicatvāriṃśat gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni
translated: from a buddha-field, as many buddha-fields as there are atoms in forty-two Ganges river-bed sands, equal to the number of atoms in a buddha-field,

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramya tatra nīlagandhaprabhāsavirajaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Beyond forty-two times the number of sand grains in the Ganges, in as many buddha-fields as there are atoms in buddha-fields, there is a world system called Blue Fragrant Light Without Dust.

analyzed: tatra tvam siṃhagandhā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: prabhāsavirajaḥsamucchrayagandheśvararājo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddho yāvad buddho bhagavān /🔽KpSū
analyzed: prabhāsa virajaḥsamucchrayagandheśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān  kpsū
translated: You will be the Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, called 'Fragrance King of the Mountain of Light Without Dust,' up to 'Buddha, Blessed One.'

original: atha khalu kulaputra siṃhagandho bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vanditavān /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra siṃhagandhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vanditavān
translated: Then, noble son, the bodhisattva Fragrance of the Lion bowed his head to the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

original: taṃ ratnagarbhastathāgata āha 🔽uttiṣṭhāsuranaradevapūjita tāraya tvaṃ bhagatisattvaduḥkhitāṃ /
analyzed: tam ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha  uttiṣṭha asura naradeva pūjita tāraya tvam bhagati sattva duḥkhi tām
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said to him:🔽Rise up, you who are worshipped by gods, asuras, and humans, liberate the suffering beings with your love!

original: chittvā tvaṃ bhavaduḥkhakleśabandhanāṃ bheṣyasi narajina āryapudgalaḥ //
analyzed: chittvā tvam bhava duḥkha kleśa bandhanām nara jinaḥ ārya pudgalaḥ
translated: Having cut the bonds of suffering, afflictions, and existence, you will become a noble person, a human victor.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo 'ṣṭamaṃ rājaputramamighaṃ nāmāmantrayāṃ āsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṣṭamam rāja putram amigham nāma āmantrayāṃ āsa
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the eighth prince, named Amiघ,

original: peyālaṃ / tāvadahaṃ bhagavan kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhisattvabhūto bodhisattvacārikāṃ cariṣyāmi yāvadahaṃ daśasahasrān kliṣṭān buddhakṣetrānevaṃrūpāṃ
analyzed: peyālam tāvat aham bhagavan kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhisattva bhūtaḥ bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi yāvat aham daśa sahasrān kliṣṭān buddhakṣetrān evaṃrūpām
translated: As much as I, Blessed One, will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva in a troubled buddha-field as a bodhisattva, until I establish ten thousand troubled buddha-fields in such a

analyzed: pariśuddhām sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: pure way,

analyzed: yathā nīlagandhaprabhāsavirajam buddhakṣetram tathā bhaviṣyati
translated: as the buddha-field of Nīlagandha-prabhāsa-viraja will be.

analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ avarupta kuśala mūlaiḥ pariśuddha āśayaiḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram
translated: That buddha-field will be filled with such bodhisattvas who have planted wholesome roots, who have pure intentions, who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: sphuṭam sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I will establish it.

analyzed: paścāt aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyāmi
translated: Afterwards I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tathārūpāmahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvacārikāṃ cariṣyāmi yathā nānye bodhisattvāścaranti /
analyzed: tathārūpām aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi yathā na anye bodhisattvāḥ caranti
translated: I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva in such a way, Venerable Blessed One, that other bodhisattvas do not practice.

original: yadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannimāni saptavarṣāṇi buddhaguṇabodhisattvaguṇapariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇapariśuddhaṃ rahogata ekākī saṃcintayamāno
analyzed: yat aham bhadanta bhagavan imāni sapta varṣāṇi buddha guṇa bodhisattva guṇa pariśuddham buddhakṣetra guṇa pariśuddham rahogataḥ ekākī saṃcintayamānaḥ
translated: Bhagavān, for these seven years, I have been reflecting alone in solitude, contemplating the pure qualities of the Buddha, the pure qualities of the bodhisattvas, and the pure qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: darśanavyūhasamādhipūrvaṃgamena ekadaśabodhisattvasamādhisahasrāṇi yāni mayātrotpāditāni pratilabdhāni bhāvitāni /
analyzed: darśana vyūha samādhi pūrvaṃgamena eka daśa bodhisattva samādhi sahasrāṇi yāni mayā atrā utpāditāni pratilabdhāni bhāvitāni
translated: I have generated and attained mastery over eleven thousand bodhisattva samādhis, with the Array of Vision Samādhi at the forefront.

original: eṣā mama bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvabhūtasya bodhisattvacārikā /
analyzed: eṣā mama bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva bhūtasya bodhisattva cārikā
translated: This, Bhadanta Bhagavān, is my bodhisattva conduct as a bodhisattva.

original: ye 'pi te daśasu dikṣvanantāparyantāsvanyāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ hitāya sukhāya dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te daśasu dikṣu ananta aparyantāsu anyāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānām hitāya sukhāya dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: Those Blessed Buddhas who are present, remaining for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many beings, teaching the Dharma in other world systems in the endless and limitless other world systems in the ten directions,

original: ye trādhvasamatikrāntā dhvajāgrākeyūrā buddhakṣetrāstāṃ paripūrṇāṃ jinaiḥ paśyeyaṃ āvarteyaṃ /
analyzed: ye trādhva samatikrāntāḥ dhvaja agrā keyūrāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ tām paripūrṇām jinaiḥ paśyeyam āvarteyam
translated: I wish to see those Buddha-fields that are beyond the three times, with their banners and armlets, filled with Jinas.

original: tena ca samādhināhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan paramāṇurajaḥsamān buddhān bhagavato bodhisattvaśrāvakagaṇaparivṛtān paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: tena ca samādhinā aham bhadanta bhagavan paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhān bhagavataḥ bodhisattva śrāvaka gaṇa parivṛtān paśyeyam
translated: And by that samādhi, Bhadanta Bhagavān, I wish to see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, surrounded by assemblies of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, as numerous as the atoms in a pore of skin.

analyzed: ekaikasya aham aniśrita asamādhi balena buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ kāyaiḥ vandeyam
translated: By the power of the samādhi of being without a basis, I would pay homage with bodies as numerous as the atoms in all buddha-fields.

original: KpSū ekaikena cāhaṃ kāyenānuttarairvicitrai ratnaiḥ puṣpairanuttarairvicitrairgandhairmālyaiśca curṇavilepanairvādyaiḥ sarvābhiścānuttarābhirvyūhābhirekaikaṃ 🔽pūjayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ekaikena ca aham kāyena anuttaraiḥ vicitraiḥ ratnaiḥ puṣpaiḥ anuttaraiḥ vicitraiḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ ca curṇa vilepanaiḥ vādyaiḥ sarvābhiḥ ca anuttarābhiḥ vyūhābhiḥ ekaikam  pūjayeyam
translated: And with each body, I would make offerings to each of them with unsurpassed and various jewels, flowers, perfumes, garlands, powders, ointments, and musical instruments, and with all the unsurpassed arrays.

analyzed: eka kṣetre ca aham samudra vālikā pramāṇān kalpām careyam
translated: And I would practice in each field for eons as numerous as the sands of the ocean.

original: yadā cāhaṃ sarvakāyavibhāvanena samādhinaikakṣaṇenaikaikasya buddhasya buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhagocarān ājāneyaṃ /
analyzed: yadā ca aham sarva kāya vibhāvanena samādhinā eka kṣaṇena ekaikasya buddhasya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddha gocarān ājāneyam
translated: And when, in a single moment, I would understand the spheres of activity of each buddha, as numerous as the atoms in all buddha-fields, through the samādhi of the manifestation of all bodies,

analyzed: guṇākara samādhinā ca aham bhadanta bhagavat na ekaikasya buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ anuttaraiḥ tavaiḥ tava iyam
translated: By the samādhi of the source of qualities, Venerable Blessed One, I would praise each of them with unsurpassed praises as numerous as the atoms in all buddha-fields.

original: animiṣasamādhinā cāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan nekarajāgracittapramāṇena sarvabuddhakṣetrān pūrṇāṃ jinaiḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: animiṣa samādhinā ca aham bhadanta bhagavat na ikara jāgra citta pramāṇena sarva buddhakṣetrān pūrṇām jinaiḥ paśyeyam
translated: And by the samādhi of unblinking, Venerable Blessed One, I would see all buddha-fields filled with victorious ones, with a mind as vast as the sky.

original: araṇāsamādhinā cāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan nekacittakṣaṇena sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvānatītānāgatapratyutpannān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyeyaṃ
analyzed: araṇā samādhinā ca aham bhadanta bhagavat na eka citta kṣaṇena sarva buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvān atīta anāgata pratyutpannān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyeyam
translated: With the concentration of non-conflict, Venerable Blessed One, in a single moment of thought, I would see the qualities and arrays of the Buddha-fields of the past, future, and present Bodhisattvas in all the Buddha-fields.

analyzed: śūraṅgama samādhinā ca aham bhadanta bhagavat naraka īśu avataritvā
translated: With the concentration of heroic progress, Venerable Blessed One, having descended into the hells,

analyzed: nairayikam ātma bhāvam abhinirmiṇitvā nairayikānām sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: having emanated a body like that of the denizens of hell, I would teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells.

analyzed: bodhāya ca samādāpayeyam
translated: I would encourage them towards enlightenment.

analyzed: tatas tān sattvān bodhāya cittam utpādayeyam
translated: I would cause those beings to generate the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: tatas cyavitvā manuṣyāṇām sahabhāvya tāyām upapadyeyuḥ
translated: Then, having passed away from there, they would be reborn in the company of humans,

original: yatra buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśāddharmaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: yatra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: where the Blessed Buddhas abide, and they would hear the Dharma from those Blessed Buddhas.

analyzed: a vaivartika bhūmau ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam  evam tiryakṣu
translated: I would establish them in the stage of non-retrogression.🔽In the same way, among the animals.

analyzed: evam preteṣu
translated: In the same way, among the hungry ghosts.

analyzed: evam yakṣeṣu
translated: In the same way, among the Yakshas.

analyzed: evam rākṣaseṣu  evam asureṣu
translated: In the same way, among the Rakshasas.🔽In the same way, among the Asuras.

analyzed: evam nāgeṣu
translated: In the same way, among the Nagas.

analyzed: evam kinnara mahā urageṣu
translated: In the same way, among the Kinnaras and Mahoragas.

analyzed: evam piśācapūtana kaṭapūtaneṣu
translated: In the same way, among the Pishachas, Putanas, and Kumbhandas.

analyzed: evam manuṣya caṇḍāleṣu
translated: In the same way, among human Chandalas.

analyzed: evam vaṇijeṣu gaṇikāsu
translated: In the same way, among merchants and courtesans.

analyzed: yathārūpeṣu ca bhagavan sattvāḥ kuleṣu upapadyante
translated: In whatever forms, Blessed One, beings are born into families,

analyzed: yathārūpaḥ ca teṣām ātma bhāva pratilābhaḥ
translated: and in whatever forms they attain a body,

original: yathārūpeṇa ca sattvāḥ karmapratyayena sukhāṃ vedanāṃ duḥkhāṃ vā pratisaṃvedayanti /
analyzed: yathārūpeṇa ca sattvāḥ karma pratyayena sukhām vedanām duḥkhām vā pratisaṃvedayanti
translated: and in whatever forms beings experience pleasant or painful feelings due to the power of karma,

analyzed: yathārūpeṣu ca śilpasthāna karmasthāneṣu prasaktāḥ
translated: and in whatever forms they are engaged in the arts, crafts, and occupations,

analyzed: tathārūpam ātma bhāvam nirmiṇitvā tathārūpa śilpasthāna karmasthāneṣu udyogam nidarśayeyam
translated: having created a body in such a form, I would demonstrate exertion in such arts, crafts, and occupations.

analyzed: tathārūpeṇa cakṣara vyāhāreṇa sattvānām cittam ārādhayeyam
translated: And with such a form of verbal expression, I would delight the minds of beings.

original: dharmaṃ ca deśayeyaṃ /🔽anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: dharmam ca deśayeyam  anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: And I would teach the Dharma.🔽I would inspire, introduce, and establish them in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: a vaivartikān ca sthāpayeyam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And I would establish them as irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tāvadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvacārikāṃ cariṣyāmi yathā daśasu sarvabuddhakṣetrasahasreṣu
analyzed: tāvat aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi yathā daśasu sarva buddhakṣetra sahasreṣu
translated: Blessed One, I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva for as long as in ten thousand buddha-fields in all directions,

original: sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ cittasantatiṃ tathā pariśodhayeyaṃ yathā pūrvakarmakleśāṃ na kuryuḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām sattvānām citta santatim tathā pariśodhayeyam yathā pūrva karma kleśām na kuryuḥ
translated: I will purify the mind-streams of all beings so that they will not create karma and afflictions as before.

analyzed: yat eka sattvasya api kpsū
translated: Even for a single being,

analyzed: catvārāḥ mārāḥ citta santati patham na prajānīyuḥ
translated: the four Maras will not be able to understand the path of the mind-stream.

analyzed: tat aham daśa buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi evaṃrūpām pariśuddhām sthāpayeyam
translated: I will establish ten thousand buddha-fields in such a pure way.

analyzed: yathā prabhāsa virajā samucchraya gandheśvara rājajyotiḥ tathāgatasya nīlagandha prabhāsa viraje buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ tathā bhaveyam
translated: Just as in the buddha-field of the Tathagata Prabhasa-Viraja-Samucchraya-Gandhesvara-Raja-Jyoti, the qualities and arrays of the buddha-field are pure with blue light, may I also be like that.

original: evaṃ mayā svabuddhakṣetrasya svaparṣāyā ca yathā siṃhagandhena bodhisattvena praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evam mayā sva buddhakṣetrasya sva parṣāyā ca yathā siṃhagandhena bodhisattvena praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Thus, I have made the aspiration like the bodhisattva Singh-Gandha for my own buddha-field and my own assembly.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā daśasu buddhakṣetrasahasreṣu sattvānāṃ sarvaduḥkhāni praśāmyantu /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā daśasu buddhakṣetra sahasreṣu sattvānām sarva duḥkhāni praśāmyantu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of aspiration of mine is fulfilled, then may all the sufferings of beings in the ten thousand buddha-fields be pacified.

analyzed: sarve ca mṛdu cittāḥ bhavantu
translated: And may all beings become gentle-minded.

analyzed: karmaṇi acittāḥ bhavantu
translated: May they become pliable-minded.

analyzed: svaka svakāyāḥ caturdvīpikāyāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ buddhān paśyantu
translated: May they see the buddhas while remaining in their own four continents.

analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām vicitra ratnāḥ vicitra puṣpa gandha vilepana cūrṇa chatra dhvaja patākāḥ prādurbhavantu
translated: And may those beings have various jewels, various flowers, incense, ointments, powders, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: yena te sattvāḥ tān buddhān pūjayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yena te sattvāḥ tān buddhān pūjayeyuḥ
translated: By which those beings may worship those Buddhas.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may they generate the mind of enlightenment for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ahaṃ ca bhagavan darśanavyūhasamādhānabalena svayaṃ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: aham ca bhagavan darśana vyūha samādhāna balena svayam paśyeyam
translated: And I, Blessed One, by the power of the array of vision concentration, may myself see.

original: sahodīritayāṃ vācāsminnevameva svayaṃ paśyati yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ iti /
analyzed: saha udīritayām vācā asmin evam eva svayam paśyati yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam iti
translated: As soon as the words are uttered, he himself sees just as he has made the vow.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, son of noble family!

original: yastvaṃ kulaputra samantake ca svake ca buddhakṣetre daśabuddhakṣetrasahasrāṇi pariśuddhāni sthāpayiṣyasi /🔽aprameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ KpSū
analyzed: yaḥ tvam kula putra samantake ca svake ca buddhakṣetre daśa buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi pariśuddhāni sthāpayiṣyasi  aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām kp sū
translated: You, son of noble family, will establish ten thousand pure buddha-fields in your own buddha-field and in the surrounding ones.🔽And you will purify the continuums of immeasurable, incalculable

analyzed: ca sattvānām santatim pariśodhayiṣyasi
translated: beings.

analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām buddhānām bhagavatām aprameya asaṃkhyeyāyām pūjāyām autsukyam āpatsyase
translated: In this way, you will be eager to make immeasurable, incalculable offerings to immeasurable, incalculable Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

original: tena tvaṃ kulaputra samantabhadro nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: tena tvam kula putra samantabhadraḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, you should be called Samantabhadra.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ samantabhadrānāgate 'dhvani atikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye🔽parivartāvaśiṣṭe dvitīya uttarāyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrāt ṣaṣṭigaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam samantabhadra anāgate dhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye  parivarta avaśiṣṭe dvitīye uttarāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt ṣaṣṭi gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni
translated: You will become Samantabhadra in the future, after an incalculable eon equal to the sands of the Ganges has passed,🔽when only one transformation remains, in the second northern Buddha-field from here, after sixty Ganges river sands have passed,🔽

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramitvā tatra jñānatāpasuviśuddhaguṇā nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, beyond a number of eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, when only one remains, in the northern direction from this buddha-field, after passing sixty buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, there will be a world-system named Jñānātapa-suviśuddha-guṇa.

analyzed: tatra tvam samantabhadra anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, Samantabhadra, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: jñānavajravijṛmbhiteśvaraketurnāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: jñāna vajra vijṛmbhita īśvaraketuḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be known as Jñāna-vajra-vijrmbhita-īśvara-ketu, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samantabhadro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta
translated: Then, noble son, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha with the five points.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgatastvāha 🔽uttiṣṭha surata suvrata dāntacittā sattvāna santati viśodhya dṛḍhapratijñatvaṃ /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ tu āha  uttiṣṭha surata suvrata dānta citta sattvāna santati viśodhya
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: kpsū
translated: Rise, O good one, of good vows, with a tamed mind, having purified the continuum of beings, be firm in your vow.

original: sattvān tāraya kleśanadīsughorān tvaṃ jñāna ulkadhara bheṣyasi buddha loke //
analyzed: sattvān tāraya kleśa nadī su ghorān tvam jñāne ulka dhara bheṣyasi buddha loke
translated: You will be a light-maker with knowledge, saving beings from the terrible river of afflictions in the world.

original: tena khalu punaḥ kulaputra samayena daśakuśīdaprāṇasahasrāṇi ekakaṇṭhena vācaṃ babhāṣire /
analyzed: tena khalu punar kula putra samayena daśa kuśīda prāṇa sahasrāṇi eka kaṇṭhena vācam babhāṣire
translated: Then, noble son, at that time, ten thousand beings who had committed the five acts of immediate retribution spoke with one voice,

original: bhaviṣyāma vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan te pariśuddheṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: bhaviṣyāma vayam bhadanta bhagavan te pariśuddheṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we will be those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in those pure buddha-fields.

original: yāṃ suviśuddhāśayāḥ samantabhadro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhisattvacārikāṃ carāmāṇaḥ pariśuddhāṃ sthāpayati /
analyzed: yām su viśuddha āśayāḥ samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhisattva cārikām carāmāṇaḥ pariśuddhām sthāpayati
translated: We will establish the pure intentions of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra who practices the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: evaṃ ca vayaṃ ṣaṭpāramitāḥ paripūrayitvā tatra buddhakṣetra upapadyema /
analyzed: evam ca vayam ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ paripūrayitvā tatra buddhakṣetre upapadyema
translated: In this way, having fulfilled the six perfections, we will be reborn in that buddha-field.

original: evaṃ kulaputra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena daśaprāṇisahasrā vyākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: evam kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena daśa prāṇi sahasrāḥ vyākṛtāḥ
translated: Thus, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave prophecies to ten thousand beings.

original: yadā samantabhadro 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate tadā yūyaṃ teṣu sāmantakeṣu lokadhātuṣvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyadhve
analyzed: yadā samantabhadraḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate tadā yūyam teṣu sāmantakeṣu lokadhātuṣu anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyadhve
translated: When Samantabhadra attains the highest complete enlightenment, then you will attain the highest complete enlightenment in those neighboring world systems.

original: sahasraikanāmakāstathāgatā bhaviṣyathaḥ yaduta sahasraṃ jvālakuṇḍeśvaraghoṣā nāma bhaviṣyatha tathāgatāḥ / aparaṃ KpSū
analyzed: sahasra eka nāmakāḥ tathāgatāḥ bhaviṣyathaḥ yat uta sahasram jvālakuṇḍeśvaraghoṣāḥ nāma bhaviṣyatha tathāgatāḥ aparam
translated: You will become Tathāgatas with the same thousand names, namely Jvālakuṇḍeśvaraghosa.

original: sahasraṃ saṃvṛtīśvaraghoṣā nāmāno bhaviṣyanti /🔽aparaṃ sahasraṃ suvimalaghoṣeśvararājanāmā bhaviṣyanti tathāgatāḥ /
analyzed: sahasram saṃvṛtīśvaraghoṣāḥ nāmānaḥ bhaviṣyanti  aparam sahasram suvimalaghoṣeśvara rāja nāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti tathāgatāḥ
translated: Another thousand will have the name Saṃvṛtīśvaraghoṣa.🔽Another thousand will be named Suvimalaghoṣeśvara-rāja, Tathāgatas.

analyzed: uttiṣṭhata ca dṛḍha nāga nardatā kriyatā śubha dravya saṃcayam

analyzed: udyujitaḥ pāramitāsu vegatāḥ bhaviṣyatha asura nara loka nāyakāḥ

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo navamaṃ rājaputramāmantrayate sma amighaṃ nāma /🔽peyālaṃ / sa prāha tathārūpamahaṃ bodhisattvacārikāṃ cariṣyāmi yathā me daśasu
