analyzed: dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ yāpayantaḥ
translated: and so on. He said, I will practice the conduct of the bodhisattvas in such a way that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are abiding and living for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges River in the worlds in the ten directions,

original: buddhā bhagavanto bodhicārikāṃ carataḥ sākṣibhūtā bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ /
analyzed: buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhicārikām carataḥ sākṣi bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti bodhisattva caryāyām
translated: will be witnesses to my practice of the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: yadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan tvatpurato bodhāya cittamutpādayāmi /
analyzed: yat aham bhadanta bhagavan tvad puratas bodhāya cittam utpādayāmi
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when I generate the mind of awakening in front of you,

analyzed: yāvat ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye
translated: and as long as I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: atrāntareṇa me bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇasya na vipratisāracittamutpadyeta /
analyzed: atrā antareṇa me bodhisattva caryām caramāṇasya na vipratisāra cittam utpadyeta
translated: in the meantime, while practicing the conduct of the bodhisattvas, may I not give rise to a regretful mind.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya dṛḍha pratijñaḥ bhaveyam yathāvādī tathākārī
translated: From now until the end of enlightenment, I will be firm in my vows, acting as I speak.

original: na cānyasya sattvasya cittasaṃkṣobho bhaveyaṃ / na KpSū
analyzed: na ca anyasya sattvasya citta saṃkṣobhaḥ bhaveyam na
translated: And I will not cause the minds of other beings to be disturbed.

analyzed: ca me śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāne cittam utpadyeta
translated: And I will not give rise to the thought of the Śrāvaka or Pratyekabuddha vehicles.

analyzed: mā ca kāma rāga citta caitasikāḥ utpadyeran
translated: Let not thoughts and mental states of lustful desire arise.

original: mā styānamiddhasahagatā mauddhatyasahagatā mā kaukṛtyasahagatā na vicikitsāsahagatā🔽na prāṇātipātaṃ nādattādānaṃ nābrahmacaryaṃ na mṛsāvādaṃ na paiśunyaṃ na pāruṣyaṃ
analyzed: mā styānamiddha sahagatā mā auddhatya sahagatā mā kaukṛtya sahagatā na vicikitsā sahagatā  na prāṇa atipātam na a datta ādānam na abrahmacaryam na mṛsāvādam na paiśunyam na pāruṣyam
translated: Let not those accompanied by sloth and torpor, those accompanied by restlessness, those accompanied by remorse, those accompanied by doubt,🔽Let not there be killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech,

original: nābhidhyā na vyāpādaṃ na mithyādṛṣṭiḥ na saṃbhinnapralāpaṃ na mātsaryasahagataṃ na
analyzed: na abhidhyā na vyāpādam na mithyādṛṣṭiḥ na saṃbhinnapralāpam na mātsarya sahagatam na
translated: Let not there be covetousness, ill-will, wrong views, frivolous speech, or those accompanied by stinginess,

analyzed: dharme gaurava citta tā na visaṃvādana citta tā
translated: Let there not be a mind lacking respect for the Dharma or a mind of deception.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantān mama bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇasya ime dharmā na saṃvidyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantāt mama bodhisattva caryām caramāṇasya ime dharmāḥ na saṃvidyeyuḥ
translated: From now until the end of enlightenment, while I am practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, let not these dharmas exist.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya padavī iti hārakam api buddha anusmṛtiḥ nityam citta caitasikāḥ pravarteran
translated: From now until the end of enlightenment, even while walking, let the recollection of the Buddha always arise in my mind and mental factors.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantena nāhaṃ buddhadarśanena virahito bhaveyaṃ na dharmaśravaṇena na saṅghopasthānena /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na aham buddha darśanena virahitaḥ bhaveyam na dharma śravaṇena na saṅgha upasthānena
translated: Until the end of enlightenment, may I not be separated from seeing the Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, or from serving the Saṅgha.

analyzed: sarvatra ca jātiṣu pravrajyām pratilabheyam
translated: In all births, may I obtain going forth.

analyzed: sarvāsu jātiṣu pāṃśukūlikaḥ bhaveyam
translated: In all births, may I be one who wears cast-off rags.

original: traicīvarikaḥ vṛkṣamūlikaḥ naiṣadyikaḥ āraṇyakaḥ piṇḍapātikaḥ alpecchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ dharmadeśakaḥ ādeyavākyaḥ aparimāṇapratibhānasaṃpanno bhaveyaṃ
analyzed: traicīvarikaḥ vṛkṣamūlikaḥ naiṣadyikaḥ āraṇyakaḥ piṇḍapātikaḥ alpa icchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ dharma deśakaḥ ādeya vākyaḥ aparimāṇa pratibhāna saṃpannaḥ bhaveyam
translated: May I be one who wears the three robes, one who stays at the foot of a tree, one who sits in one place, one who stays in the forest, one who eats almsfood, one who has few desires, one who is content, one who teaches the Dharma, one whose speech is accepted, and one endowed with immeasurable eloquence.

analyzed: na ca mūla āpattim āpadyeyam
translated: May I not commit the root downfalls.

analyzed: na mṛṣāvāda sahagataiḥ mantraiḥ parapravādinaḥ
translated: May I not debate with opponents using false speech.

analyzed: śūnyatā pratisaṃyuktam ca mātṛgrāmasya dharmam deśayeyam
translated: May I teach the Dharma to women connected with emptiness.

original: śūnyatāmanaskāreṇa ca mātṛgrāmasya na dantavidarśanaṃ kuryāt / KpSū
analyzed: śūnyatā manaskāreṇa ca mātṛgrāmasya na danta vidarśanam kuryāt
translated: And with the attention of emptiness, may I not show my teeth to women.

analyzed: na hasta vikāreṇa dharmam deśayeyam
translated: May I not teach the Dharma with gestures of the hands.

analyzed: nityam ca aham mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām śāstṛ saṃjñām utpādayeyam
translated: And may I always generate the perception of being a teacher towards bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: yasya cāhaṃ dharmabhāṇakasya sakāśāddharmaṃ śṛṇuyāṃ śāstṛsaṃjñān tasyāntike utpādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yasya ca aham dharma bhāṇakasya sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyām śāstṛ saṃjñān tasya antike utpādayeyam
translated: And I would generate the perception of a teacher toward any Dharma teacher from whom I hear the Dharma.

original: satkṛtya cāhaṃ taṃ dharmabhāṇakaṃ yathā tathāgataṃ tathā satkuryāṃ gurukuryāṃ mānayeyaṃ pūjayeyaṃ yāvadātmamāṃsairapi dharmabhāṇakamupasthiteyaṃ
analyzed: satkṛtya ca aham tam dharma bhāṇakam yathā tathāgatam tathā satkuryām gurukuryām mānayeyam pūjayeyam yāvat ātma māṃsaiḥ api dharma bhāṇakam upasthitā iyam
translated: And I would honor that Dharma teacher in various ways, just as I would honor and respect the Tathāgata, and I would venerate him with my own flesh.

original: na cāhaṃ pātramapātraṃ cāvekṣya dānaṃ dadyāṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham pātram apātram ca avekṣya dānam dadyām
translated: And I would not give gifts while discriminating between worthy and unworthy recipients.

analyzed: na mama dharma dāna mātsarikā citta caitasikāḥ utpadyeyuḥ
translated: And I would not generate stingy thoughts or mental states with regard to the gift of the Dharma.

analyzed: sva jīvita dānena aham bodhyarthikān sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: I would protect those beings who seek enlightenment by giving up even my own life.

original: svavīryabalapraṇidhānopārjitena cāhaṃ dravyena vyasanagatān sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sva vīrya bala praṇidhāna upārjitena ca aham dravyena vyasana gatān sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyam
translated: And I would liberate beings who are in misfortune from their misfortunes with wealth that I have acquired through my own effort, strength, and vows.

original: na cāhaṃ pravrajitaliṅginaṃ vā gṛhasthaliṅginaṃ vā āpattyānāpattyā vā codayeyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham pravrajita liṅginam vā gṛhastha liṅginam vā āpattyā anāpattyā vā codayeyam
translated: And I would not accuse anyone who has the appearance of a renunciant or the appearance of a householder, whether they have faults or not.

analyzed: nityam ca aham lābha satkāra śloke gni viṣa śastra saṃjñām utpādayeyam
translated: And I would always generate the perception of gain, honor, and fame as being like fire, poison, and weapons.

original: yadi ca me bhadanta bhagavannime praṇidhānā yāvadbodhiparyantamupādāya saṃṛdhyeyuḥ yathā bhagavataḥ purataḥ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadi ca me bhadanta bhagavan ime praṇidhānāḥ yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya saṃṛdhyeyuḥ yathā bhagavataḥ puratas praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, these aspirations of mine are to be fulfilled up to the end of enlightenment, as I have made aspirations in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: tadubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ divyāścakraratnāḥ prādurbhavantu sahasrārāḥ sanābhikāḥ sanemikāḥ ādityavarṇaprabhāsvarāḥ /
analyzed: tat ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām divyāḥ cakra ratnāḥ prādurbhavantu sahasra arāḥ sa nābhikāḥ sa nemikāḥ āditya varṇa prabhāsvarāḥ
translated: then may these divine wheel-jewels appear in both my hands, with a thousand spokes, with naves and rims, shining with the radiance of the sun.

original: sahabhāṣitāyāṃ asyāṃ vāci amighena rājaputreṇobhāyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ tathārūpāṇi cakrāṇi KpSū
analyzed: saha bhāṣitāyām asyām vāci amighena rāja putreṇa ubhāyām pāṇibhyām tathārūpāṇi cakrāṇi
translated: As soon as these words were spoken, two such wheels appeared in both hands of Prince Amiघa,

analyzed: prādurbhūtāni yathā yācitāḥ
translated: just as requested.

original: punarāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yāvadbodhiparyantena tadime cakrāḥ śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gacchantu /
analyzed: punar āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yāvat bodhi paryantena tat ime cakrāḥ śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gacchantu
translated: He said again, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled up to the end of enlightenment, then may these wheels go to the empty buddha-fields with the five degenerations,

original: evaṃrūpeṇoccaśabdena yathā nandopanandā nāgarājā gacchanti tathā sarvāvantaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa ucca śabdena yathā nanda upanandāḥ nāga rājāḥ gacchanti tathā sarvāvantam buddhakṣetram
translated: and may they announce with such a loud sound as the Nandin and Upanandin nagas go, the entire buddha-field

analyzed: svareṇa vijñāpayantu bodhisattva vyākaraṇa smṛti a saṃpramoṣa jñāna darśana śūnyatā bhāvanā pracāra buddha viṣayam
translated: with a voice that proclaims the knowledge and insight of the bodhisattvas' prediction and unforgetfulness, the practice of cultivating emptiness, and the domain of the buddhas,

analyzed: dharmaparyāyam cārayitum
translated: and to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāsteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ śrotrendriyeṣvayaṃ dharmaparyāyamābhāsamāgacchatu /🔽nipatitamātre ca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ rāgaḥ praśamatu /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ teṣām sarveṣām śrotra indriyeṣu ayam dharmaparyāyam ābhāsam āgacchatu  nipatita mātre ca teṣām sattvānām rāgaḥ praśamatu
translated: And may this Dharma discourse appear in the ear faculty of all those beings who have been reborn there.🔽And as soon as it has fallen upon them, may their passion be pacified.

analyzed: dveṣaḥ mohaḥ māna īrṣyā mātsaryaḥ praśamatu
translated: May their hatred, delusion, pride, envy, and stinginess be pacified.

analyzed: sarva buddha anusmṛti manasikāreṇa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayantu
translated: May they generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through the mental attention of recollecting all the Buddhas.

original: preṣitau ca kulaputrāmighena rājaputreṇa tau dvau cakraratnau tau caivaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchatastadyathā buddhā bhagavanto buddhajavena gacchanti /
analyzed: preṣitau ca kulaputra amighena rāja putreṇa tau dvau cakra ratnau tau ca evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchataḥ tat yathā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ buddha javena gacchanti
translated: And, noble son, having been sent by Prince Amiṭa, those two wheel-jewels went with such speed as if the Blessed Buddhas were going with the speed of the Buddhas.

original: evameva tau dvau cakraratnau gacchataḥ daśasu diśāsvaprameyeśvasaṃkhyeyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu
analyzed: evam eva tau dvau cakra ratnau gacchataḥ daśasu diśāsu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu

translated: and having gone there, they turned the wheel of the Dharma discourse on the bodhisattva's prediction, mindfulness, non-forgetfulness, and the practice of meditation on the knowledge that is included within the Buddha-dharmas for the beings.

analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām ayam
translated: And for those beings, this

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ rāgo yāvan mātsaryacittacaitasikāḥ praśāntāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām rāgaḥ yāvat mātsarya citta caitasikāḥ praśāntāḥ
translated: For all of them, desire and so forth, up to the mind and mental factors of stinginess, were pacified.

analyzed: sarve ca buddha jñāna viṣayam manaskāreṇa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditavantaḥ
translated: And all of them, with a mental focus on the domain of the Buddha's wisdom, generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: muhūrta mātreṇa ca te cakrāḥ pratinivṛtya amighasya rāja putrasya puratas sthitāḥ

analyzed: bodhau ca samādāpitāni
translated: And they have been inspired towards enlightenment.

analyzed: tena tvam kula putra akṣobhyaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, noble son, you should be called Akṣobhya.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam akṣobhyaḥ lokasya pariṇāyakaḥ
translated: You will be the guide of the world, Akṣobhya.

analyzed: gṛhṇa tvam akṣobhya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāni yādṛṣāni ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Take, Akshobhya, the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field as you wish.

original: akṣobhya āha tādṛśamahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhamākāṅkṣāmi yathā sarvalokasvarṇabhūrbhavet /
analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ āha tādṛśam aham bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham ākāṅkṣāmi yathā sarva loka svarṇa bhūḥ bhavet
translated: Akshobhya said, I wish, Venerable Blessed One, for a Buddha-field with such adornments of qualities as all the worlds would be made of gold,

original: samāpāṇitalopamā divyamaṇiratnavyavakīrṇā apagataśarkarakaṭhallā apagataśilāstaṃbhapāṣāṇaparvatā mṛdukā kācalindikasukhasaṃsparṣā /

analyzed: nikṣipte pāda tale vanamet utkṣipte pāda tale punar unnamet
translated: when the foot is put down it sinks down and when the foot is lifted up it rises up again.

analyzed: na ca atra naraka tiryagyoni yama loka preta viṣayām
translated: And there, in that Buddha-field, the realms of hell, animals, hungry ghosts,

analyzed: prajñāyeyuḥ

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre durgandhā bhāvā bhaveyuḥ /🔽divyātikrāntena gandhena tadbuddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre durgandhāḥ bhāvāḥ bhaveyuḥ  divya atikrāntena gandhena tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam bhavet

analyzed: divyaiḥ ca māndārava mahā māndāravaiḥ puṣpaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ jarāvyādhimaraṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām jarā vyādhi maraṇam bhavet
translated: And there, the beings would not have old age, sickness, or death.

original: na ca parasparabhayaṃ na ca parasparaviheṭhā na ca sattvānāmakālamaraṇaṃ vipratisāramaraṇaṃ nāsamāhitamaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: na ca paraspara bhayam na ca paraspara viheṭhā na ca sattvānām akāla maraṇam vipratisāra maraṇam na asamāhita maraṇam

analyzed: buddha anusmṛti manaskāreṇa tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Beings there would be mindful of the Buddha.

analyzed: na ca durgatiṣu upapadyeyuḥ
translated: They would not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: na pañcakaṣāyeṣu śūnyesu buddhakṣetreṣūpapadyeyuryāvadbodhiparinirvāṇāt buddhadarśanāvirahitā bhaveyurdharmaśravaṇena saṅghopasthānenāvirahitā
analyzed: na pañca kaṣāyeṣu śūnyesu buddhakṣetreṣu upapadyeyuḥ yāvat bodhi parinirvāṇāt buddha darśana avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ dharma śravaṇena saṅgha upasthānena avirahitāḥ
translated: They would not be reborn in empty Buddha-fields with the five degenerations, and until their enlightenment and parinirvāṇa, they would not be separated from seeing the Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, from serving the Saṅgha.

analyzed: alpa rāgāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ alpa dveṣāḥ alpa mohāḥ
translated: And beings there would have little passion, little hatred, and little delusion.

original: sarve ca tatra daśakuśalāṃ karmapathān samādāya varteyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra daśa kuśalām karma pathān samādāya varteyuḥ

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ śīlpagrahaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām śīlpa grahaṇam bhavet
translated: And in that Buddha-field, beings would not have to learn crafts.

analyzed: na nāma nimittam

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ mārāvatāraṃ mārgena /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām māra avatāram mārgena

analyzed: na ca tatra sattvāḥ durvarṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ

original: na ca tatra sattvā vaimātra bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvāḥ vaimātra bhaveyuḥ

analyzed: yat uta āryaḥ vā dāsaḥ vā

analyzed: amamāḥ aparigrahāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ

analyzed: na ca tatra śrāvakānām bodhisattvānām vā śukla mokṣaṇam bhavet
translated: And there would be no releasing of the white [reins] for the śrāvakas or bodhisattvas there.

analyzed: antatas svapna antara gatānām api kpsū
translated: Even those who have entered into sleep.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā dharmakāmā dharmaparyeṣṭiparā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ dharma kāmāḥ dharma paryeṣṭi parāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all the beings there would be desirous of the Dharma and devoted to seeking the Dharma.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetra ekasattvo 'pi viparītadṛṣṭiko bhavet na cānyatīrthiko /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre eka sattvaḥ pi viparīta dṛṣṭikaḥ bhavet na ca anya tīrthikaḥ

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ kāyaklamatā bhavet cittaklamatā vā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām kāya klama tā bhavet citta klama tā vā bhavet

original: sarve ca te tatra sattvāḥ pañcābhijñā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te tatra sattvāḥ pañca abhijñāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all those beings there would have the five higher knowledges.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ tṛṣṇā vā bhukṣā vā viheṭhayet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām tṛṣṇā vā bhukṣā vā viheṭhayet
translated: And neither thirst nor hunger would afflict the beings there.

original: yādṛśaṃ cāhāramākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśaṃ ratnabhājaneṣu purataḥ prādurbhavet yathā kāmāvacarāṇāṃ devānāṃ /

translated: And whatever kind of food they would desire, that would appear before them in jeweled vessels, just like for the gods in the desire realm.

original: na coccāraprasrāvakheṭasiṅghāṇamaśru vā kāye svedo vā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca uccāra prasrāva kheṭa siṅghāṇam aśru vā kāye svedaḥ vā bhavet
translated: And there would be no excrement, urine, mucus, phlegm, tears, or sweat in the body.

analyzed: na ca tatra śītam na uṣṇam bhavet

analyzed: sugandham ramaṇīyam bhavet

analyzed: mṛdu saṃsparśāḥ ca vāyavaḥ
translated: And the winds would blow with a soft touch.

analyzed: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu sapta ratna mayāḥ paryaṅkāḥ stritāḥ

translated: And those beings who would hear that sound, with dispassionate minds, would attain mindfulness.

analyzed: na ca bhūyas rakta cittam utpādayeyuḥ

translated: Just as the Thirty-Three Gods rejoice, delight, and experience bodily and mental bliss,

translated: And those pregnant women would experience such bliss,

original: na caiva sā strī duḥkhāṃ pratyanubhaved /
analyzed: na ca eva sā strī duḥkhām pratyanubhavet
translated: And that woman would not experience any suffering.

original: ubhau ca puṣkariṇīmavataritvā snātvā ca sā strī evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabheta /
analyzed: ubhau ca puṣkariṇīm avataritvā snātvā ca sā strī evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabheta
translated: Both of them would enter a lotus pond, bathe, and that woman would attain such mindfulness,

original: yayā virāgaśubhaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheta /🔽tena ca samādhinā mārakarmaṇā KpSū
analyzed: yayā virāga śubham samādhim pratilabheta  tena ca samādhinā māra karmaṇā
translated: by which she would attain the concentration of passionless beauty.

analyzed: parimucyeta
translated: And by that concentration, she would be liberated from the deeds of Māra.

analyzed: satata samāhitā bhavet
translated: She would always be in meditative concentration.

original: yacca pūrvajanmani tathārūpaṃ karmakṛtamupacitaṃ bhavedyena ca bahukalpakoṭīstrībhāvamanubhavitavyaṃ tena samādhinābhinirvṛtena strībhāvaṃ
analyzed: yat ca pūrva janmani tathārūpam karma kṛtam upacitam bhavet yena ca bahu kalpa koṭī strī bhāvam anubhavitavyam tena samādhinā abhinirvṛtena strī bhāvam
translated: And whatever karma in the form of deeds and accumulations has been done in previous lives, by which one would experience the female state for many millions of eons, by the attainment of that samādhi, the female state

analyzed: ca sarveṇa sarvam parikṣayam gacchet
translated: would be completely exhausted.

original: yāvat parinirvāṇaṃ na bhūyaḥ strībhāvaṃ pratilabhet /
analyzed: yāvat parinirvāṇam na bhūyas strī bhāvam pratilabhet
translated: Up to parinirvāṇa, one would not again obtain the female state.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ tathārūpaṃ karmakṛtamupacitaṃ bhavet yad gaṇanātikrāntān kalpān nityagarbhavāsena pratyājāyeyurduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavitavyaṃ
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām tathārūpam karma kṛtam upacitam bhavet yat gaṇanā atikrāntān kalpān nitya garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ duḥkham pratyanubhavitavyam
translated: And for those beings who have done and accumulated karma in such a way that they would be reborn in the womb for more than countless eons and experience suffering,

original: te bodhiprāptasya me nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ prasādaṃ ca pratilabheyuste tataścyavitvā
analyzed: te bodhi prāptasya me nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ prasādam ca pratilabheyuḥ te tatas cyavitvā
translated: when they hear my name upon attaining enlightenment and obtain faith, after passing away from there,

original: mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyurgarbhavāsena ca pratyājāyeyustatra sarveṇa sarvaṃ tatkarmaparikṣayaṃ
analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ garbha vāsena ca pratyājāyeyuḥ tatra sarveṇa sarvam tad karma parikṣayam

original: gaccheyuryāvadbodhiparyantena na bhūyaste sattvā garbhavāsena pratyājāyeyurye sattvā
analyzed: gaccheyuḥ yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyas te sattvāḥ garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ ye sattvāḥ
translated: up to the end of enlightenment. No longer would those beings be reborn in the womb. Those beings

analyzed: avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ te padmeṣu pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: who have planted the roots of virtue would be reborn in lotuses.

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ an avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ te garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: Those beings who have not planted the roots of virtue would be reborn in the womb.

original: karmaparikṣayena mama buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmo vā garbhavāso vā prajñāyeta ekāntasukhasamarpitāste sattvāstatra buddhakṣetre bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: karma parikṣayena mama buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmaḥ vā garbha vāsaḥ vā prajñāyeta ekānta sukha samarpitāḥ te sattvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre bhaveyuḥ
translated: By the exhaustion of karma, in my Buddha-field, neither women nor the womb would be known. Those beings would be endowed with one-sided happiness in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: sumanā tālavṛkṣaiḥ vāyu samīritaiḥ evaṃrūpaḥ ramaṇīyaḥ nirghoṣaḥ niścaret duḥkham anityam anātma śūnya śabdā
translated: From the trees of the Sumana flowers, when stirred by the wind, such a delightful sound would issue forth: 'Suffering, impermanence, non-self, emptiness.'

analyzed: niścareyuḥ
translated: That sound would issue forth.

analyzed: tena ca śabdena tatra kpsū
translated: And by that sound, there

original: manuṣyā ulkāvatīṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabheyustena ca samādhinā te sattvāḥ śūnyatāvabhāsāṃ gambhīrān dharmān avabudhyeyuḥ /

translated: the humans would attain the samadhi called 'Possessing a Torch,' and by that samadhi, those beings would understand the profound dharmas that appear as emptiness.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre kāmopasaṃhitaḥ śabdo bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre kāma upasaṃhitaḥ śabdaḥ bhavet
translated: And in that Buddha-field, there would be no sound connected with desire.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūlaniṣaṇṇaścāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan muhūrtenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ prāpnūyāṃ /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣa mūla niṣaṇṇaḥ ca aham bhadanta bhagavat muhūrtena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prāpnūyām
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, as soon as I sit at the foot of the Bodhi tree, I would attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me tatra buddhakṣetre na bhūyaścandrasūryāṇāṃ prabhā prajñāyeta /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me tatra buddhakṣetre na bhūyas candra sūryāṇām prabhā prajñāyeta
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, in that Buddha-field, the light of the sun and moon would no longer be known.

analyzed: anyatra kusuma saṃkocanena
translated: Except for the closing of flowers.

original: evaṃrūpāṃ cāhaṃ prabhāṃ pramuñceyaṃ yena divyena cakṣuṣāprameyāsaṃkhyeyairanyairbuddhakṣetraistiṣṭhato buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyaṃ /

translated: And may I emit such radiance that with that divine eye I may see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in immeasurable and incalculable other Buddha-fields.

original: bodhiprāptaścāhamevaṃrūpeṇa svareṇa dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ yena svareṇa trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ buddhakṣetramāpūrayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham evaṃrūpeṇa svareṇa dharmam deśayeyam yena svareṇa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram buddhakṣetram āpūrayeyam
translated: And may I teach the Dharma with such a voice when I have attained enlightenment that with that voice I may fill the Buddha-field of the great trichiliocosm.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ syuḥ te sarve buddhānusmṛtiṃ pratilabheyuste yena yena gaccheyuḥ caṃkrameyurniṣīdeyurvā parivarteyurvā /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ syuḥ te sarve buddha anusmṛtim pratilabheyuḥ te yena yena gaccheyuḥ caṃkrameyuḥ niṣīdeyuḥ vā parivarteyuḥ vā
translated: And may all the beings who are there attain the recollection of the Buddha, and wherever they go, whether walking, standing, sitting, or reclining,

original: te satatasamitaṃ māṃ paśyeyuryathārūpeṣu dharmeṣu dharmasaṃśayā bhaveyuḥ teṣāṃ mama darśanamātreṇa vyavalokanamātreṇa ca teṣāṃ saṃśayā vigaccheyuḥ
analyzed: te satata samitam mām paśyeyuḥ yathārūpeṣu dharmeṣu dharma saṃśayāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām mama darśana mātreṇa vyavalokana mātreṇa ca teṣām saṃśayāḥ vigaccheyuḥ
translated: they may always see me, and whatever doubts they may have regarding the Dharma may be dispelled merely by seeing me and merely by looking at me.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me ye sattvā daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vānuttarayānikā vā mama
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me ye sattvāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā anuttara yānikāḥ vā mama
translated: And may those beings who are in the ten directions, in immeasurable and incalculable Buddha-fields, whether they are followers of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, or the unsurpassed vehicle, who are sick, suffering,

analyzed: nāmam vā varṇam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: Or hear my name or a verse.

analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā kpsū
translated: Having passed away from there,

analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: they would be reborn in my buddha field.

original: te tatra mama dharmaṃ śrutvā ye śrāvakayānikāste 'ṣṭavimokṣadhyāyino 'rhanto bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te tatra mama dharmam śrutvā ye śrāvaka yānikāḥ te ṣṭa vimokṣa dhyāyinaḥ rhantaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Those who are followers of the Śrāvakayāna, having heard the Dharma from me there, would become arhats who meditate on the eight liberations.

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhayānikāḥ te pratyekāṃ bodhimabhigaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ te pratyekām bodhim abhigaccheyuḥ
translated: And those who are followers of the Pratyekabuddhayāna would attain individual enlightenment.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvā mahāyānikāste mat sakāśāddharmaṃ śrutvā gambhīrāṃ samādhikṣāntidhāraṇīṃ ca pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ mahāyānikāḥ te mat sakāśāt dharmam śrutvā gambhīrām samādhi kṣānti dhāraṇīm ca pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas who are followers of the Mahāyāna, having heard the Dharma from me, would attain profound meditative absorption, patience, and retention.

analyzed: te tatra eva a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They would become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment right there.

original: aprameyaśca me śrāvakasaṅgho bhaved yo na śakyaṃ kenacidgaṇayituṃ anyatra svayaṃ tathāgatena /
analyzed: aprameyaḥ ca me śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet yaḥ na śakyam kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra svayam tathāgatena
translated: And my assembly of śrāvakas would be immeasurable, such that no one would be able to count them, except for the Tathāgata himself.

original: bodhiprāptaścāhaṃ yena yena gaccheyaṃ yatra yatra ca pādatalena pṛthivīṃ spṛśeyaṃ tatra tatra sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni suvarṇāvabhāsāni prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham yena yena gaccheyam yatra yatra ca pāda talena pṛthivīm spṛśeyam tatra tatra sahasra patrāṇi padmāni suvarṇa avabhāsāni prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, wherever I go, wherever I touch the ground with the soles of my feet, there thousands of lotus flowers with golden luster would appear.

original: te ca padmāḥ śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā mama varṇaśabdaṃ ghoṣaṃ niścārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca padmāḥ śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā mama varṇa śabdam ghoṣam niścārayeyuḥ
translated: And may those lotuses, going to empty buddha-fields, emit my praise, sound, and voice.

original: te ca sattvā mama nāma varṇaṃ yaśaśca śrutvā prītiprasādaprāmodyamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ mama nāma varṇam yaśaḥ ca śrutvā prīti prasāda prāmodyam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may those beings, having heard my name, praise, and fame, generate joy, faith, and delight.

analyzed: te prasāda jātāḥ mama buddhakṣetre upapattim ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: Having generated faith, may they aspire to be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: tatra ca tāni kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayeyuḥ
translated: And may they dedicate those wholesome roots there.

analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: Having passed away from there, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: apagata śramaṇa malaḥ ca me śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: May my assembly of disciples be free from the stain of ascetics,

analyzed: apagata śramaṇa vākya apagata śramaṇa kauṭilya apagata śramaṇa śāṭhyāḥ apagata parṣā kpsū
translated: free from the words of ascetics, free from the crookedness of ascetics, free from the deceitfulness of ascetics, free from the assembly of ascetics,

analyzed: bhavet dharma gurukā na pariṣkāra gurukā na lābha satkāra gurukā
translated: may it be devoted to the Dharma, not devoted to material things, not devoted to gain and honor.

original: anityaduḥkhānātmaśūnyatābhiratā ārabdhavīryā ca sā parṣadbhaveddharmaśravaṇā saṅghaprāgbhārā /
analyzed: anitya duḥkha anātma śūnyatā abhiratāḥ ārabdha vīryā ca sā parṣad bhavet dharma śravaṇā saṅgha prāgbhārā
translated: May that assembly be devoted to the impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and emptiness of phenomena, may it be energetic, may it listen to the Dharma, may it be devoted to the Saṅgha.

original: ye ca tatrāvaivartikā bodhisattvā bhaveyuste 'nāgatapraviṣṭāḥ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyuste jātivyativṛttā prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāṃ kathāṃ kathayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra avaivartikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ te na āgata praviṣṭāḥ smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ te jāti vyativṛttā prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktām kathām kathayeyuḥ
translated: And those irreversible bodhisattvas who would be there, having entered the future, would attain mindfulness. Having passed beyond birth, they would speak a discourse connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantena te dharmā na saṃpramoṣaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena te dharmāḥ na saṃpramoṣam gaccheyuḥ
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, those dharmas would not be forgotten.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham daśa mahā kalpa sahasrāṇi tiṣṭheyam
translated: And I would remain for ten thousand great eons, up to the attainment of enlightenment.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me kalpa sahasram saddharmaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for a thousand eons after my parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma would remain.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, good man!

analyzed: pariśuddham te buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: You have taken up a pure buddha-field.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamakṣobhyānāgate 'dhvani atikrānte hyekasmin gaṅgānadīvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeya 'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyāṃ diśi /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam akṣobhya anāgate dhvani atikrānte hi ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā same nupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyām diśi
translated: You will be the unshakable one in the future, after passing beyond a number of eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, having entered the second, in the eastern direction.

analyzed: atas sahasrime buddhakṣetre bhiratiḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: From there, in the thousandth buddha-field, the world system named Abhirati will be,

original: evaṃrūpayā guṇavyūhayā saṃpannā yathā tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpayā guṇa vyūhayā saṃpannā yathā tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: with such a form and arrangement of qualities as you have made a vow.

analyzed: tatra tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There you will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evamevākṣobhyo nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: evam eva akṣobhyaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: And you will be named Akṣobhya, a Tathāgata, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: akṣobhya āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tatsarvatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ skandhadhātvāyatanaparigṛhītā KpSū
analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat sarvatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ skandha dhātu āyatana parigṛhītā
translated: Akṣobhya said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, then in all the world systems, the beings included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: ye ca sattvāḥ sattvasaṃgraheṇa saṃgṛhītāste sarve maitracittā bhavantvavairacittā
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ sattva saṃgraheṇa saṃgṛhītāḥ te sarve maitra cittāḥ bhavantu a vaira cittā
translated: and those beings included in the category of beings, may they all have loving minds, non-hostile minds,

original: akaluṣacittāste evaṃrūpaṃ kāyasukhaṃ saṃvedayeyuḥ tadyathāpi nāma daśabhūmisthitasya
analyzed: akaluṣa cittāḥ te evaṃrūpam kāya sukham saṃvedayeyuḥ tat yathā api nāma daśa bhūmi sthitasya
translated: and unpolluted minds. May they experience this kind of bodily bliss, just as a bodhisattva dwelling on the tenth stage

analyzed: bodhisattvasya padma samādhim samāpannasya yena āśaya prahāṇa viśuddhiḥ bhavati
translated: who has entered the lotus samādhi experiences, by which there is purity of abandonment according to intention.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa sattvāḥ kāyacaitasikena sukhena samārpitā bhavantu /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa sattvāḥ kāya caitasikena sukhena samārpitāḥ bhavantu
translated: May beings be endowed with this kind of bodily and mental bliss.

original: yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandeta tadā sarvapṛthivī svarṇāvabhāsā bhavatu /
analyzed: yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandeta tadā sarva pṛthivī svarṇa avabhāsā bhavatu
translated: When I pay homage to the Blessed One's feet with the five points of my body, may the entire earth then appear golden.

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā ca tasmin samaye sarvasattvā evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitā yathā
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā ca tasmin samaye sarva sattvāḥ evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ yathā
translated: And when that noble one bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, at that time all beings were endowed with such happiness as

analyzed: praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: had been made by the vow.

analyzed: tadā dharaṇī sarvā svarṇa avabhāsā dṛśyate
translated: Then the entire earth was seen to be shining with gold.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said:

original: uttiṣṭha pravaramati akṣobhya cakrasaṃsthita karatala pravaracakra /🔽sthāpitā bahutṛṣṇā karuṇacitte bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ śubhamati jagati śāstā //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara mati akṣobhya cakra saṃsthita kara tala pravara cakra  sthāpitā bahu tṛṣṇā karuṇa citte bhaviṣyasi tvam śubha mati jagati śāstā
translated: Rise up, O best of minds, O Akṣobhya, established in the wheel, O palm, O best of wheels.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: Many cravings are established in the mind of compassion. You will become the teacher of the world, O good-minded one.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo daśamaṃ rājaputraṃ himaṇiṃ nāmāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ daśamam rāja putram himaṇim nāma āmantrayate sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brāhmaṇa Sāgara­rendra addressed the tenth prince named Himaṇi:

original: peyālaṃ himaṇī rājaputra evaṃrūpaṃ praṇidhānamakārṣīt tadyathākṣobhyena kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam himaṇiḥ rāja putraḥ evaṃrūpam praṇidhānam akārṣīt tat yathā akṣobhyena kṛtam
translated: The prince Himaṇi made a vow of the same kind as Akṣobhya had made.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan nevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tatsarvasattvā buddhālaṃbanamanaskāraṃ pratilabhantu /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavat na evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat sarva sattvāḥ buddha ālaṃbana manaskāram pratilabhantu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then may all beings obtain the mental attention focused on the Buddha.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca uraga sāra candana gandhaḥ haste prādurbhavatu
translated: May the scent of uragasāra sandalwood appear in the hands of all.

original: te ca sarve taṃ gandhaṃ buddhavigraheṣu pariṇāmayantu /
analyzed: te ca sarve tam gandham buddha vigraheṣu pariṇāmayantu
translated: And may they all transform that scent into the forms of Buddhas.

analyzed: te ca mama antike pravrajeyuḥ

analyzed: tribhiḥ ca yānaiḥ aham sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: And I will teach the Dharma to beings through the three vehicles.

translated: and let a five-part musical instrument sound from all the trees.

original: yadā ca kulaputra samudreśvarabhuvirmāṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatrārāme lohitamuktimayavarṣaṃ
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra samudreśvara bhuviḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra ārāme lohita mukti maya varṣam

translated: and a five-part musical instrument sounded from all the trees.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratna-garbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha sattva anukaṃpaka hita iṣiṇa maitra cittā

analyzed: saḥ evam vadati yathā samudreśvara bhuviḥ

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha tvam api māṇavotpalasantīraṇe syām cāturdvīpikāyām
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, You too, Maṇḍavotpalasantiraṇa, in this four-continent world

original: lokadhātau baliṣṭhe buddhakṣetre vardhamānāśītivarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ vairocanakusumo
analyzed: lokadhātau baliṣṭhe buddhakṣetre vardhamāna aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām vairocana kusumaḥ

analyzed: nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: up to being a buddha, a blessed one.

original: peyālaṃ / tṛtīyastvāha dvivarṣasahasrasya jyotigandho nāma bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /

analyzed: vyākaraṇam peyālam

original: evaṃ sumanastathāgataḥ śailarājā saṃvṛtalocano brahmottaro jambūcchāyaḥ pūrṇamuttaro
analyzed: evam sumanaḥ tathāgataḥ śaila rājā saṃvṛta locanaḥ brahma uttaraḥ jambu chāyaḥ pūrṇamuttaraḥ
translated: Thus the Tathāgata Sumanas, Śaila-rāja, Saṃvṛta-locana, Brahma-uttara, Jambū-chāya, Pūrṇa-uttara,

original: ratnaśailaḥ samudragarbho nārāyaṇaḥ śikhī kanakamunirmunīndraḥ kauṇḍinyaḥ siṃhavikramo
translated: Ratna-śaila, Samudra-garbha, Nārāyaṇa, Śikhin, Kanaka-muni, Muni-indra, Kauṇḍinya, Siṃha-vikrama,

translated: Jñānadhvaja, Buddhaśrava, Aparājita, Vikasit, Ujja, Hiteśī, Prajñāloka, Mahendra, Śāntaprajñākara,

analyzed: sundaḥ brahmarṣabhaḥ praṇādaḥ dharmacandraḥ
translated: Sundara, Brahṛṣabha, Praṇāda, Dharmacakra,

original: arthadarśī yaśonandī yaśottaraḥ abhirūpaḥ sugandhaścaturaḥ pravaralocanaḥ sunijastaḥ
analyzed: artha darśī yaśaḥ nandī yaśa uttaraḥ abhirūpaḥ sugandhaḥ caturaḥ pravara locanaḥ
translated: Arthadarśin, Yaśonandin, Yaśottara, Abhirūpa, Sugandha, the four, Pravara, Locana, Sunīti,

original: sārthavrataḥ sumanoratho varaprajñaḥ kanakadhvajaḥ sunetro devaśuddhaḥ śuddhodanaḥ
translated: Sārthavrata, Sumanoratha, Varaprajña, Kanakadhvaja, Sunetra, Devashuddha, Shuddhodana,

original: sudarśanaḥ virūḍhadhvajo virūpākṣo brahmasvaraḥ śrīsaṃbhavaḥ śrīmahāvirajo maṇibhadraḥ
translated: Sudarshana, Virudhaketu, Virupaksha, Brahmasvara, Shri-sanbhava, Shri-mahavirja, Manibhadra,

analyzed: mārīciḥ śākyamuniḥ ghoṣeśvaraḥ satyasaṃbhavaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ saṃbhavapuṣpaḥ sukusumaḥ akṣobhyaḥ

translated: Suryagarbha, Ratishvara, Nagadanta, Vajraprabhasa, Kirtiraja, Vyagrarashmi, Sanetyajnan-sanbhava,
Gandhasvara, Sālende, Nārāyaṇa, and Jyotigarbha.

original: yastu tatra kulaputra sarvapaścimakaḥ purohitaputraḥ vigatabhyasaṃtāpo nāma /
analyzed: yaḥ tu tatra kula putra sarvapaścimakaḥ purohita putraḥ vigatabhyasaṃtāpaḥ nāma

analyzed: sa ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purutas sthitvā āha
translated: stood in front of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and said:

analyzed: ime bhadanta bhagavan ekonāśītiḥ māṇavakāḥ sarve vyākṛtāḥ utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe vardhamāna dvaye nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: O Bhadanta Bhagavān, these seventy-nine young men are all prophesied to attain supreme perfect enlightenment in the second Bhadrakalpa, in the Utpalasamvartanī kalpa.

analyzed: utpādayāmi aham bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: I generate the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment, O Bhagavān.

analyzed: kṣīyamāṇe bhadanta bhagavan utpala saṃtīraṇe kpsū
translated: O Bhadanta Bhagavān, in the Utpalasamvartanī kalpa, which is decreasing,

analyzed: kalpe sarva paścimakaḥ ham vara agra bodhim spṛśeyam
translated: I will be the last to attain the supreme excellent enlightenment.

original: yāntakaṃ teṣāmekonāśītīnāṃ buddhānāmāyuḥpramāṇaṃ tāntakaṃ mamaikasya bodhiprāptasya bhavet /
analyzed: yā antakam teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām āyuḥ pramāṇam tā antakam mama ekasya bodhi prāptasya bhavet
translated: May my lifespan as the one who has attained enlightenment be equal to the lifespan of those seventy-nine Buddhas.

original: yāntakāśca teṣāṃ vaineyā bhaveyustāntakā mamaikasya bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yāntakāḥ ca teṣām vaineyāḥ bhaveyuḥ tāntakāḥ mama ekasya bhaveyuḥ
translated: May my disciples be equal to the disciples of those [Buddhas].

analyzed: yathā ca te tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayeyuḥ
translated: And may I teach the Dharma with the three vehicles, just as they do.

analyzed: yathā ca teṣām śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: And how their assembly of hearers would be.

analyzed: tāntakaḥ mama bodhi prāptasya eka śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: May my assembly of hearers be like that when I attain enlightenment.

original: ye ca teṣāmekonāśītīnāṃ buddhānāmutpannānāṃ sattvāstasminnutpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe manuṣyalābhaṃ pratigṛhṇīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām utpannānām sattvāḥ tasmin utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe manuṣya lābham pratigṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: And may the beings who receive human birth in that Utpalāsaṃsāra eon when those seventy-nine buddhas appear

original: kṣīyamāṇe kalpe 'hamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvāṃstān sattvāṃstribhiryānairniyatāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: kṣīyamāṇe kalpe ham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvān tān sattvān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ niyatām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: When the eon is coming to an end, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and establish all those beings in the three vehicles.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadvyākuruṣva māṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat vyākuruṣva mām bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of aspiration of mine is fulfilled, then, Venerable Blessed One, please prophesy my unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato vigatabhayasaṃtāpasya sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ vigata bhaya saṃtāpasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave his approval to Vigataśoka:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: Good, good! Good man,

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntānām sattvānām kāruṇika hita karaḥ ca utpannaḥ
translated: you have arisen with compassion and benefit for beings beyond number.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka anāgate dhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye
translated: You will become a buddha named 'Ratnaśikhin,' a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Blessed One, in the future, after an incalculable eon equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.

analyzed: anupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye tatra utpala saṃtīraṇe kalpe kṣīyamāṇe
translated: When the second incalculably long eon has passed, and the eon of Utpalâsana is coming to an end,

analyzed: sarva paścimakaḥ tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: you will attain the highest perfect enlightenment.

original: viagatarajasamudgatābhyudgatarājā nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: viagatarajasamudgatābhyudgatarājā nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the Tathâgata named Vimalagatarajasamudgata-abhyudgata-râja, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

analyzed: yathā ca teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām ardha kalpam āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And just as the life of those eighty-four thousand Buddhas will be half an eon,

analyzed: evam tava eva ekasya āyuḥ ardha kalpam bhaviṣyati
translated: so your life will be half an eon.

original: yāvat sarve te tvatpraṇidhānāḥ saṃpatsyante yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /🔽sa āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandāmi tadā sarvatrāsmin buddhakṣetre
analyzed: yāvat sarve te tvad praṇidhānāḥ saṃpatsyante yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam  saḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandāmi tadā sarvatra asmin buddhakṣetre
translated: And all your vows will be fulfilled just as you have made them.

analyzed: nīla kusumāḥ pravarṣantu parama sugandhā
translated: He said, Venerable Blessed One, if my hopes are to be fulfilled in this way, then when I pay homage to the Blessed One with the five-part prostration, may blue flowers rain down everywhere in this Buddha-field, with the most exquisite fragrance.

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ gandhamāghrāyeyuḥ teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ dhātavaḥ prasannā aviruddhā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam gandham āghrāyeyuḥ teṣām sarveṣām dhātavaḥ prasannāḥ a viruddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And may all beings who smell that fragrance have all their elements clear and unobstructed.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca sarva vyādhyaḥ praśāmyeyuḥ
translated: And all diseases of all beings would be pacified.

original: yadā ca kulaputra vigatabhayasaṃtāpo māṇavo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra tasmin buddhakṣetre nīlakusumavṛṣṭiḥ
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra vigata bhaya saṃtāpaḥ māṇavaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra tasmin buddhakṣetre nīla kusuma vṛṣṭiḥ
translated: And when, son of good family, the young man, free from fear and distress, bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with the five points of his body, then in all that Buddha-field a rain of blue flowers fell,

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ gandhaṃ ghrātavantasteṣāṃ sarve dhātavaḥ samā aviruddhāḥ saṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam gandham ghrātavantaḥ teṣām sarve dhātavaḥ samāḥ a viruddhāḥ saṃsthitāḥ
translated: and all those beings who smelled that fragrance, all their elements became balanced and in harmony.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā arogā alpābādhāśca saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ arogāḥ alpa ābādhāḥ ca saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: And all the beings there became free from disease and had little illness.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratna-garbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha karuṇa vrata dānta cittā pūjayiṣyasi loka nāthān  kpsū
translated: Rise up, you whose mind is disciplined by the vow of compassion, you will worship many lords of the world.

analyzed: chetsyasi dṛḍhām śaṭha kleśa bandhanām bhaviṣyase śubha vara prajña kośaḥ
translated: You will cut the strong bonds of the afflictions of deceit, and you will become a treasure of excellent and sublime wisdom.

original: tasya ca kulaputra brāhmaṇasya trayaḥ koṭyo 'ntavāsināmārāmadvāre niṣaṇṇāste āgatāṃ sattvāṃstriśaraṇagamane sthāpayanti /
analyzed: tasya ca kula putra brāhmaṇasya trayaḥ koṭyaḥ ntavāsinām ārāma dvāre niṣaṇṇāḥ te āgatām sattvān triśaraṇa gamane sthāpayanti
translated: And, son of good family, that brāhmaṇa had three koṭis of residents in his hermitage sitting at the gate of the park. They established the beings who came there in the threefold refuge.

analyzed: bodhāya ca samādāpayanti
translated: And they inspired them to strive for enlightenment.

analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tām śiṣyān āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the brāhmaṇa Sāgara­meghas addressed his disciples:

analyzed: utpādayatha bho māṇavakāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: “Come, young men, generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: gṛhṇatha buddhakṣetra guṇām yādṛśān ākāṅkṣatha
translated: Take up the qualities of a buddha field as you wish.

analyzed: kuruta bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānam yādṛśam eva ākāṅkṣatha
translated: Make a vow in the presence of the Blessed One as you wish.”

analyzed: tatra jyotikṣabhakaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ
translated: There was a young brāhmaṇa named Jyotiṣka.

original: sa āha kīdṛśena mārgeṇa kīdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa kīdṛśyā caryayā kīdṛśyā saṃṛtyā bodhirlabhyate / /
analyzed: saḥ āha kīdṛśena mārgeṇa kīdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa kīdṛśyā caryayā kīdṛśyā saṃṛtyā bodhiḥ labhyate
translated: He asked, “By what kind of path, by what kind of accumulation, by what kind of practice, by what kind of attainment is enlightenment obtained?”

original: purohita āha catvāra ime māṇavakā bodhimārgapratipannena bodhisattvenākṣayakośāḥ samudānayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: purohitaḥ āha catvāraḥ ime māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga pratipannena bodhisattvena akṣaya kośāḥ samudānayitavyāḥ
translated: The priest said, “Young men, these four inexhaustible treasuries should be accumulated by a bodhisattva who has entered the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: akṣayaḥ puṇya saṃbhāraḥ  akṣayaḥ jñāna saṃbhāraḥ
translated: The inexhaustible accumulation of merit,🔽the inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom,

analyzed: akṣayaḥ prajñā saṃbhāraḥ akṣayaḥ
translated: the inexhaustible accumulation of insight, and

analyzed: sarva dharna samudānayana saṃbhāraḥ
translated: the inexhaustible accumulation of gathering all dharmas.

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kulaputra mārgaḥ
translated: Such is the path, son of good family.

original: uktaṃ caivaṃ māṇava tathāgatena saṃbhāraviśuddhisaṅgraho nāma saṃsārottaraṇadharmadvāraṃ /
analyzed: uktam ca evam māṇava tathāgatena saṃbhāraviśuddhisaṅgrahaḥ nāma saṃsāra uttaraṇa dharma dvāram
translated: And thus, young man, the Tathāgata has taught the Dharma door called The Collection of Pure Provisions for Crossing Over Saṃsāra.

analyzed: dāna saṃbhāram bodhisattvāḥ ye parityajanti
translated: The bodhisattvas who give up the provisions of generosity

original: sa ca vaineyasattvaparipācanāya saṃvartate /🔽śīlasaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāṃ praṇidhānapūryai saṃvartate /
analyzed: sa ca vaineya sattva paripācanāya saṃvartate  śīla saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām praṇidhāna pūryai saṃvartate
translated: lead to the ripening of beings to be trained.🔽The bodhisattvas' provisions of morality lead to the fulfillment of vows.

analyzed: kṣānti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana paripūryai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of patience lead to the perfection of the major and minor marks.

analyzed: vīrya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kāma karaṇāya saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of effort lead to the accomplishment of all desires.

analyzed: dhyāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām ājāneya citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of meditation lead to the state of mind of those who are well-bred.

analyzed: prajñā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kleśa parijñāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of wisdom lead to the thorough knowledge of all afflictions.

analyzed: śruta saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām asaṅga pratibhāna tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of learning lead to unobstructed eloquence.

analyzed: puṇya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva sattva upajīvya tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of merit lead to being supported by all beings.

analyzed: jñāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām asaṃśaya jñāna tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of wisdom lead to the knowledge free from doubt.

analyzed: śamatha saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām karmaṇā citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of tranquility of the bodhisattvas leads to the purification of action and mind.

original: vipaśyanāsaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāṃ vigatakathaṃkathāyai saṃvartate / KpSū 🔽maitrīsaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāmapratihatacittatāyai saṃvartate /
analyzed: vipaśyanā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vigata kathaṃkathāyai saṃvartate  maitrī saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām apratihata citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of insight of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of doubt.🔽The accumulation of loving-kindness of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of a hostile mind.

analyzed: karuṇā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vaineya ākheda tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of compassion of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of weariness with regard to those to be trained.

analyzed: muditā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dharma ārāma rati ramaṇa tāyai saṃvartate

analyzed: upekṣā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām anunaya pratigha prahāṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of equanimity of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of attachment and aversion.

analyzed: dharma śravaṇa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām nivaraṇa prahāṇāya saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of listening to the Dharma of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of obscurations.

analyzed: naiṣkramya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva parigraha avasaraṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of renunciation of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of all possessions.

analyzed: araṇya vāsa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kṛta kuśala mūla karma a vipraṇāśa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of dwelling in the forest of the bodhisattvas leads to the non-destruction of wholesome roots and actions.

analyzed: kuśala vṛddhi bhāvana tā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kuśala tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the cultivation of the increase of wholesomeness of the bodhisattvas leads to all that is wholesome.

analyzed: smṛti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dhāraṇī pratilābha tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of mindfulness of the bodhisattvas leads to the attainment of dhāraṇīs.

analyzed: mati saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām bodhi prabhedana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of understanding of the bodhisattvas leads to the discernment of enlightenment.

analyzed: dhṛti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām artha gati anubudhyana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of firmness of the bodhisattvas leads to the realization of the meaning and purpose.

analyzed: smṛti upasthāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kāya vedanā citta dharma pratyavekṣaṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the foundations of mindfulness of the bodhisattvas leads to the investigation of body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.

analyzed: samyak prahāṇa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kuśala dharma bhāvanā paripūraṇāya
translated: The accumulation of right efforts of the bodhisattvas leads to the fulfillment of the cultivation of all wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: saṃvartate
translated: It leads to that.

analyzed: ṛddhipāda saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kāya citta laghu tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the bases of spiritual power of the bodhisattvas leads to lightness of body and mind.

analyzed: indriya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām saṃvara paripūryai
translated: The accumulation of the faculties of the bodhisattvas leads to the fulfillment of restraint.

analyzed: saṃvartate
translated: It leads to that.

analyzed: bala saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kleśa avamardana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the powers of the bodhisattvas leads to the subjugation of all afflictions.

analyzed: bodhyaṅga saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dharma svabhāva avabodhana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the factors of awakening of the bodhisattvas leads to the realization of the nature of dharmas.🔽It leads to that.

analyzed: ṣaṣ parāyaṇīya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vaineya sattva pariśodhana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The six perfections, which are the requisites for the bodhisattvas, lead to the purification of the beings to be trained.

analyzed: ayam māṇavakāḥ saṃbhāraviśuddhimukhasaṃgrahaḥ nāma saṃsāra uttaraṇa dharma dvāram
translated: This, young brahmins, is the Dharma door for crossing over saṃsāra, called the collection of the requisites for purification.

analyzed: saḥ āha dāna saṃbhāraḥ bhagavatā mahā bhoga mahā parivāra tāya a yuktaḥ
translated: He said, The Blessed One has declared that the requisite of generosity leads to great wealth and a large retinue.

analyzed: śīlam svarga upapattaye
translated: Morality leads to rebirth in heaven.

analyzed: śrutam mahā prajña tāyai
translated: Learning leads to great wisdom.

analyzed: śraddhā jīva bhāvanā bhagavatā svaṃsāra uttaraṇa artham nirdiṣṭā
translated: Faith and livelihood have been taught by the Blessed One for crossing over saṃsāra.

original: purohitā āha ye māṇavāḥ saṃsārābhiratā dānaṃ dadanti /
analyzed: purohitāḥ āha ye māṇavāḥ saṃsāra abhiratāḥ dānam dadanti
translated: The priests said, Young brahmins, those who delight in saṃsāra and give gifts,

analyzed: evam etat yathā uktam
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: ye māṇavaka kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā bodhimārgapratipannāstairdānaṃ damacittatayā dātavyaṃ /
analyzed: ye māṇavaka kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā bodhi mārga pratipannāḥ taiḥ dānam dama citta tayā dātavyam
translated: Young brahmins, those sons or daughters of good family who have entered the path to enlightenment should give gifts with a mind of self-control.

analyzed: śīlam śamatha citta tayā rakṣitavyam  śrutam akaluṣa citta tayā paryeṣitavyam
translated: They should guard morality with a mind of tranquility.🔽They should seek learning with an untroubled mind.

analyzed: bhāvanā mahā karuṇā citta tāyai bhāvayitavyā
translated: They should cultivate meditation with a mind of great compassion.

analyzed: pariśeṣā kpsū
translated: The remaining

analyzed: dharmāḥ prajñā jñāna upāya saṃbhāra samudānaya tāyai paryeṣṭavyāḥ
translated: dharmas should be sought for the accumulation of wisdom, knowledge, and skillful means.

analyzed: ayam māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ
translated: This, young man, is the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: īdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa bodhiḥ labhyate iti  īdṛśī bhāvanā
translated: Enlightenment is attained by such a collection.🔽Such is meditation.

analyzed: īdṛśī smṛtiḥ
translated: Such is mindfulness.

analyzed: īdṛśī māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga caryā
translated: Such, young man, is the practice of the path to enlightenment.

original: janayata māṇavakā bodhau chandaṃ /🔽śuddho māṇavakā bodhimārga āśayena praṇidhānaṃ kartavyaṃ paripūryate /
analyzed: janayata māṇavakāḥ bodhau chandam  śuddhaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ āśayena praṇidhānam kartavyam paripūryate
translated: Young man, generate the aspiration for enlightenment.🔽Young man, the path to enlightenment should be made pure by aspiration and fulfilled by vow.

analyzed: prasannaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ āśaya viśuddhyā
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is clear by the purity of aspiration.

analyzed: ṛjukāḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga a śaṭhya viśuddhi kleśa pravāhaṇa tayā
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is straightforward by the purity of non-deception and the removal of afflictions.

analyzed: yogakṣemaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ anuttara nirvāṇa paryavasānaḥ
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is secure by the ultimate nirvana.

analyzed: kuruta praṇidhānam
translated: Make the vow.

analyzed: gṛhṇata buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham pariśuddham apariśuddham vā yathā abhipretā
translated: Take the pure or impure Buddha-field adornment as you wish.

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotikṣabhako māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyāgrato dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāha /🔽utpādayāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotikṣabhakaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya agratas dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya āha 🔽utpādayāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Then, noble sir, the young brahmin Jyotiska, in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, placed his right knee on the ground and said:

original: asmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre maṇḍarāgāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ maṇḍadveṣāṇāṃ maṇḍamohānāṃ askhalitāluḍitacittānāṃ
analyzed: asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre maṇḍa rāgāṇām sattvānām maṇḍa dveṣāṇām maṇḍa mohānām a skhalita a luḍita cittānām
translated: In this defiled buddha-field, for beings with strong passion, strong hatred, and strong delusion, with untroubled and unconfused minds,

analyzed: avaira cittānām īrṣyā mātsarya citta vivarjitānām mithyādṛṣṭi parivarjita cittānām samyak dṛṣṭi vyavasthita cittānām
translated: with minds free from enmity, jealousy, and stinginess, with minds free from wrong views and established in right views,

analyzed: kuśala cittānām kuśala paryeṣṭi cittānām apāya patha vivarjita cittānām
translated: with wholesome minds, with minds seeking what is wholesome, with minds free from the paths to the lower realms,

original: triḥsvargapathodyuktacittānāṃ tribhiḥ puṇyakriyāvastubhiḥ samudānītakuśalamūlānāṃ triṣu yāneṣu prayuktacittānāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ
analyzed: tris svarga patha udyukta cittānām tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ samudānīta kuśala mūlānām triṣu yāneṣu prayukta cittānām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: with minds devoted to the three paths to heaven, with wholesome roots accomplished through the three bases of meritorious action, with minds engaged in the three vehicles, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadā me ubhayoḥ pāṇyorhastināgāḥ prādurbhavantu /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadā me ubhayoḥ pāṇyoḥ hasti nāgāḥ prādurbhavantu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of wish of mine is to be fulfilled, then may elephants appear in both my hands.

original: sahapravyāhṛte vākye bhagavato 'nubhāvena ubhayoḥ pāṇyorhastināgāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sarvaśvetāḥ saptāṅgasupratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: saha pravyāhṛte vākye bhagavataḥ nubhāvena ubhayoḥ pāṇyoḥ hasti nāgāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sarva śvetāḥ sapta aṅga su pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: As soon as he spoke these words, by the Blessed One's power, elephants appeared in both his hands, all white, with well-proportioned seven limbs.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā āha gacchata yūyam gagana talam
translated: Seeing them, he said, Go to the sky.

original: sarvāvantamidaṃ buddhakṣetramaṣṭāṅgopetena varṣeṇa paramasugandhena sarvasattvānito buddhakṣetrāt prabodhayata /
analyzed: sarvāvantam idam buddhakṣetram aṣṭa aṅga upetena varṣeṇa parama sugandhena sarva sattvān itas buddhakṣetrāt prabodhayata
translated: With a rain of eight qualities and a supreme fragrance, awaken all beings in this buddha field.

original: yeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ kāye tato bindu nipate ye vā gandhamājighreyusteṣāṃ pañcanīvaraṇāḥ prahīyantu /
analyzed: yeṣām sattvānām kāye tatas bindu nipate ye vā gandham ājighreyuḥ teṣām pañca nīvaraṇāḥ prahīyantu
translated: For those beings whose bodies are touched by those drops or who smell that fragrance, may the five hindrances be abandoned.

analyzed: tat yathā kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam prahīyatu
translated: Namely, may the hindrance of sensual desire be abandoned.

analyzed: vyāpādaḥ tyānam iddha auddhatya kaukṛtya vicikitsā nīvaraṇam prahīyatu
translated: May the hindrances of malice, sloth and torpor, restlessness and remorse, and doubt be abandoned.

original: sahapravyāhṛte vākye nāgā uparyantarīkṣe evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchanti /
analyzed: saha pravyāhṛte vākye nāgāḥ upari antarīkṣe evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchanti
translated: As soon as those words were spoken, the elephants went with such speed in the sky above,

original: tadyathāpi nāma balavān puruṣaḥ prasāritāṃ bāhu saṃkocayet saṃkocitaṃ bāhu prasārayet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma balavān puruṣaḥ prasāritām bāhu saṃkocayet saṃkocitam bāhu prasārayet
translated: just as a strong man might stretch out or bend an arm.

original: evameva te hastināgāḥ kṛtakāryā yathā pūrvoktaṃ vivarttitvā tasyāgrataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva te hasti nāgāḥ kṛta kāryāḥ yathā pūrva uktam vivarttitvā tasya agratas sthitāḥ
translated: In the same way, those elephants, having accomplished their task as described before, returned and stood in front of him.

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotikṣabho māṇavakaḥ paramaprītimanāḥ / KpSū
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotikṣabhaḥ māṇavakaḥ parama prīti manāḥ
translated: Then, noble son, the young brahmin Jyotiska, with the utmost joy,

original: taṃ ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ kulaputrānāgate 'dhvani anupraviṣṭe
analyzed: tam ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam kula putra anāgate dhvani anupraviṣṭe
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said to him, Noble son, in the future, when the age of conflict has entered,

original: dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye ratnaprabhāse kalpe ratnasañcayaṃ nāma buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye ratnaprabhāse kalpe ratnasañcayam nāma buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: In the second incalculable eon, in the kalpa called Ratnaprabhasa, equal to the sands of the Ganges, the buddha-field will be called Ratnasamcaya.

original: asmiṃ cāturdvīpike ratnacchatrābhyudgataraśmirbhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: asmin cāturdvīpike ratna chatra abhyudgata raśmiḥ bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: And in this four-continent world, you will be the Tathagata called Ratnachchhatrabyudgarasmi up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: atha kulaputra jyotikṣabho bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipapāta /
analyzed: atha kula putra jyotikṣabhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipapāta
translated: Then, noble son, the bodhisattva Jyotiska, with his five limbs, bowed his head at the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said:

original: uttiṣṭha vigatarajā śuddhasattvā vyākṛta bahusattvakoṭīḥ sā /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha vigata rajā śuddha sattvā vyākṛta bahu sattva koṭīḥ sā
translated: Rise up, you who are free from dust, you who are pure in mind, you who have been prophesied for many millions of beings,

original: bhaviṣyasi varaśuddhamārgaḥ bodhaye bhaviṣyasi varajinaḥ sattvanāyakaḥ //
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi vara śuddha mārgaḥ bodhaye bhaviṣyasi vara jinaḥ sattva nāyakaḥ
translated: you will be the supreme pure path, you will be the supreme victor, the leader of beings for the sake of enlightenment.

original: peyālaṃ / sahasro māṇavakānāṃ trayaḥ koṭyo māṇavakānāṃ yairasmin buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau KpSū 🔽praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam sahasraḥ māṇavakānām trayaḥ koṭyaḥ māṇavakānām yaiḥ asmin buddhakṣetre nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The same is to be said up to the thousand young brahmins and the three kotis of young brahmins who in this buddha-field made the aspiration for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sarve ca te ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāḥ
translated: And all of them were prophesied by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

original: yāvadvipaśyī śikhī viśvabhuvaḥ paścimā buddhā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vipaśyī śikhī viśvabhuvaḥ paścimāḥ buddhāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Up to Vipashyin, Shikhi, and Vishvabhu, who were the last buddhas.

analyzed: sarve māṇavakāḥ vyākṛtāḥ
translated: All the young brahmins were prophesied.

original: tatra sahasravedapāṭhakānāṃ brāhmaṇānāṃ yasteṣāṃ jyeṣṭhaḥ gurusaṃmato vāyuviṣṇurnāma /
analyzed: tatra sahasra veda pāṭhakānām brāhmaṇānām yaḥ teṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ guru saṃmataḥ vāyuviṣṇuḥ nāma
translated: Among them, the eldest of the brahmins who had mastered the Vedas, respected as their teacher, was named Vāyuviṣṇu.

original: sa āha ahaṃ punaḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ spṛśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: saḥ āha aham punar pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim spṛśyeyam
translated: He said, I, on the other hand, will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in a Buddha-field with five degenerations.

original: tīvrarāgānāṃ tīvradveṣāṇāṃ tīvramohānāṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tīvra rāgānām tīvra dveṣāṇām tīvra mohānām sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: I will teach the Dharma to beings with intense passion, intense hatred, and intense delusion.

analyzed: jyotipālaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ
translated: There was a young brahmin named Jyotipāla.

original: sa āha kimarthavaśaṃ samanupaśyamāno 'yaṃ bho upādhyāya vāyuviṣṇuḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhāti / /
analyzed: saḥ āha kim artha vaśam samanupaśyamānaḥ yam bho upādhyāya vāyu viṣṇuḥ pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhāti
translated: He said, Seeing what benefit, O teacher, does this Vāyuviṣṇu aspire to a Buddha-field with five degenerations?

original: purohita āha sakalamahākaruṇāsamanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre bodhimanuprāpnoti /
analyzed: purohitaḥ āha sakala mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre bodhim anuprāpnoti
translated: The priest said, A bodhisattva endowed with great compassion attains enlightenment in a Buddha-field with five degenerations.

analyzed: atrāṇānām aparāyaṇānām kleśaiḥ upadrutānām dṛṣṭi vyasana prāptānām sattvānām artha karaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one who benefits beings who are without protection, without refuge, afflicted by afflictions, and fallen into the calamity of wrong views.

analyzed: trāṇam parāyaṇam bhavati
translated: He becomes their protection and refuge.

analyzed: janma samudrāt ca sattvān uttārayati
translated: He delivers beings from the ocean of birth.

analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭyām ca sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: And he establishes beings in right view.

original: nirvāṇāmṛtarasena sattvān saṃtarpayati /🔽iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahākaruṇā dṛśyata ye pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhanti /
analyzed: nirvāṇa amṛta rasena sattvān saṃtarpayati  iyam bodhisattvasya mahā karuṇā dṛśyata ye pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhanti
translated: He satisfies beings with the nectar-like taste of nirvana.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: This is the great compassion of the bodhisattva, which is seen in those who make aspirations in a buddha-field with five degenerations.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vāyuviṣṇo atikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāmavaśiṣṭe🔽dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame 'saṃkhyeye purastimāyāṃ diśāyāṃ buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāni
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam vāyuviṣṇo atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām avaśiṣṭe  dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye purastimāyām diśāyām buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni
translated: Ratnagarbha, the Tathagata said, You will become Vayu-Vishnu. After incalculable eons, one more than the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River,

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramitvā tatra kaṣāyadhvaja nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: in the east, beyond buddha-fields equal in number to the atoms in a buddha-field, there will be a world system called Kshaya-Dhwaja.

analyzed: tatra tvam sat puruṣa anutarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, good man, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: śālendrarājo nāma tathāgato bhavisyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /🔽vāyuviṣṇurāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ
analyzed: śālendrarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhavisyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān  vāyu viṣṇuḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yadā aham bhagavataḥ
translated: You will become the Tathagata named Shali-Indra-Raja, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.🔽Vayu-Vishnu said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of aspiration is fulfilled, when I pay homage at the Blessed One's feet with the five-part prostration, may the Blessed One then

original: pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vande tadā me bhagavān chatapuṇyalakṣaṇālaṅkṛtāvubhau caraṇau
analyzed: pañca maṇḍalena pādau vande tadā me bhagavān śata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtau ubhau caraṇau
translated: place his two feet, adorned with the marks of a hundred merits,

analyzed: mūrdhni sthāpayatu
translated: Place it on your head.

original: yadā kulaputra vāyuviṣṇurmāṇavo bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta tadā ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ ubhau caraṇau vāyuviṣṇorbodhisattvasya mūrdhni
analyzed: yadā kula putra vāyuviṣṇuḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta tadā ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ubhau caraṇau vāyuviṣṇoḥ bodhisattvasya mūrdhni  /
translated: When the young man Vāyuviṣṇu bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, at that time the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha placed both feet on the head of the bodhisattva Vāyuviṣṇu

analyzed: sthāpayitvā āha
translated: and said:

original: uttiṣṭha karuṇāśaya tīkṣṇaprajña carāhi caryā varabodhikāraṇāt /🔽chindāhi dhirādṛdhakleśabandhanaṃ bheṣyasi buddha hitānukampī //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha karuṇa āśaya tīkṣṇa prajña carāhi caryāḥ vara bodhi kāraṇāt  chindāhi buddha hita anukampī
translated: Rise up, one of compassionate resolve, sharp wisdom, practice for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: Cut the bonds of the firm and rigid afflictions, you will become a compassionate and benevolent buddha.

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotipālo māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotipālaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam
translated: Then, noble sir, the young man Jyotipāla placed the right side of his knee

original: pṛthvyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāha utpādayāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: pṛthvyām pratiṣṭhāpya āha  utpādayāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: on the ground and said, Venerable Blessed One, I generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: asmin buddhakṣetre rāga dveṣa moha sa bhāga cittānām avyavasthita kuśala akuśala āśayānām sattvānām catvāriṃśat varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām anuttarām
translated: In this buddha-field, among beings whose minds are equal in desire, hatred, and delusion, whose intentions regarding wholesome and unwholesome are unstable, in a population with a lifespan of forty thousand years, I will attain

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha 'atikrāntānāṃ ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ avaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahā nāmāyaṃ lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahā nāma ayam lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said, 'After incalculable eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, in the second remaining one, this world system will be called Saha.

analyzed: kena kāreṇena saha iti ucyate
translated: Why is it called Saha?

original: ' sahāste sattvā rāgasya sahāste dveṣasya sahāste mohasya sahāste kleśabandhanānāṃ /
analyzed: saha āste sattvāḥ rāgasya saha āste dveṣasya saha āste mohasya saha āste kleśa bandhanānām
translated: Beings there endure desire, endure hatred, endure delusion, endure the bonds of afflictions.

analyzed: tena kāreṇena sā lokadhātuḥ sahā iti ucyate
translated: For that reason, that world system is called Saha.

original: tatra sahāyāṃ lokadhātau bhadrako nāma bhaviṣyati mahākalpaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sahāyām lokadhātau bhadrakaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati mahā kalpaḥ
translated: In that Saha world system, there will be a great eon called Bhadra.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena ucyate bhadrakaḥ iti
translated: For what reason is it called Bhadra?

original: bhadrake mahākalpe rāgadveṣamohacaritānāṃ sattvānāṃ sahasraṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmutpatsyate /
analyzed: bhadrake mahākalpe rāga dveṣa moha caritānām sattvānām sahasram mahā kāruṇikānām buddhānām bhagavatām utpatsyate
translated: In the Bhadra great eon, a thousand Buddhas, Blessed Ones, of great compassion will appear, for beings who practice desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: tvamapi satpuruṣānupraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe catvāriṃśadvarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ KpSū
analyzed: tvam api sat puruṣa anupraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe catvāriṃśat varṣa sāhasrikāyām kpsū
translated: You, good man, having entered the Bhadra great eon, when the lifespan of beings is forty thousand years,

analyzed: prajāyām sarva prathamam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: will first attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: krakutsando nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavāṃstribhiryānairdharmaṃ deśayiṣyasi /
analyzed: krakutsandaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayiṣyasi
translated: You will become the Tathāgata named Krakucchanda, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha, who will teach the Dharma with the three vehicles.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntān sattvān saṃsāra nadyām uhyamānān uttārayiṣyasi
translated: You will liberate beings beyond count who are drowning in the river of saṃsāra.

analyzed: nirvāṇa pāre ca sthāpayiṣyasi
translated: And you will establish them on the other shore of nirvāṇa.'

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotipālo bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte 'tikramya tasthau /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotipālaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte tikramya tasthau
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Jyotipāla bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with the five points, and after circumambulating him, he stood to one side.

original: atha khalu kulaputra dvitīyastumbururnāma māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣaṇṇaḥ /
