analyzed: atha khalu kula putra dvitīyaḥ tumburuḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, the second young brahmin named Tuṃburu sat in front of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha.

original: bhaviṣyāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan krakutsandasya tathāgatasyānusaṃdhau triṃsadvarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ buddho loke /
analyzed: bhaviṣyāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan krakutsandasya tathāgatasya anusaṃdhau triṃsat varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām buddhaḥ loke
translated: 'Reverend Blessed One, I will become a Buddha in the world in the continuation of the Tathāgata Krakucchanda's lineage, when the lifespan of beings is thirty thousand years.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavakātikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka atikrāntaḥ eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same
translated: The Tathāgata Ratna-garbha said, 'Young brahmin, after one eon has passed,

analyzed: saṃkhyeye dvitīye nadi gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye sahe buddhakṣetre nupraviṣṭe
translated: In the second innumerable eon remaining, in the Saha world system with its four continents, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, having entered,

analyzed: bhadra kalpe krakutsandasya tathāgatasya anusaṃdhau triṃśat varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām
translated: in the Fortunate Eon, in the time of the Tathagata Krakucchanda, in the time when the lifespan of beings is thirty thousand years,

original: kanakamunirnāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddho vighuṣṭaśabdo lokasya /
analyzed: kanakamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vighuṣṭa śabdaḥ lokasya
translated: you will become the Tathagata named Kanakamuni, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, whose fame will spread in the world.

analyzed: sa bhagavataḥ sakāśāt vyākaraṇam śrutvā
translated: Having heard the prophecy from that Blessed One,

original: ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyābhimukhamāsthāt /
analyzed: ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya abhimukham āsthāt
translated: he bowed his head at the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, circumambulated him, and stood in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: puṣpaiḥ bhagavataḥ kāyam avakiramāṇaḥ prañjali bhūtaḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ tuṣṭhāva
translated: Scattering flowers on the body of the Blessed One, with palms joined he praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: susahita sumudita sumadhura vacanā askhalita aluḍita akaluṣa vimalā /
analyzed: su sahita su mudita su madhura vacanā askhalita aluḍita akaluṣa vimalā
translated: Well-accompanied, well-rejoiced, with sweet words, unfaltering, undeluded, stainless,

original: abhiśaya atiyati atimati matimā ṛṣivara jvala tuma munivara vṛṣabhī //
analyzed: abhiśaya atiyati atimati matimā ṛṣi vara jvala tuma muni vara vṛṣabhī
translated: overpowering, surpassing, with superior wisdom, best of sages, shining, best of sages, bull.

original: bahu tuma guṇadada guṇaśata bharitā sukhakara munivara naramanu namitā /🔽na hi anyu sattva vidyati tvayi samu tṛbhave tvayi adyi bahusattva bodhimārgi vyākṛtā //
analyzed: bahu guṇa dada guṇa śata bharitā sukha kara muni vara nara manu namitā  na hi anyu sattva tvayi tvayi adyi bahusattva bodhimārgi vyākṛtā
translated: You who give many qualities, filled with hundreds of qualities, bringing happiness, best of sages, bowed to by humans and gods,

analyzed: kpsū
translated: There is no other being like you in the three worlds. Today, in you, many beings have been prophesied on the path to enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra viśvagupto nāma māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ saptaratnamayaṃ pīṭhaṃ sthāpayitvā śatasahasramūlyena prajñapanena
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra viśvaguptaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sapta ratna mayam pīṭham sthāpayitvā śata sahasra mūlyena prajñapanena
translated: Then, noble sir, a young brahmin named Viśvagupta, in front of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, set up a throne made of the seven precious substances, with a canopy worth a hundred thousand,

original: tatra pīṭhe suvarṇapātraṃ sthāpayitvā saptaratnaparipūrṇasuvarṇamayaṃ bhṛṅgāraṃ saptaratnamayā yaṣṭirbuddhapramukhe bhikṣusaṅghe niyojitavān
analyzed: tatra pīṭhe suvarṇa pātram sthāpayitvā sapta ratna paripūrṇa suvarṇa mayam bhṛṅgāram sapta ratna mayā yaṣṭiḥ buddha pramukhe bhikṣu saṅghe niyojitavān
translated: and on that throne, having placed a golden vessel, filled with the seven precious substances, a golden water pot, and seven precious substances, he dedicated it to the Saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: sa āha bhaviṣyāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanāgate 'dhvanyatikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame
analyzed: saḥ āha bhaviṣyāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anāgate dhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same
translated: He said, Venerable Blessed One, in the future, after one Ganges river's worth of eons have passed,

analyzed: saṃkhyeye dvitīye tasmin ca bhadra kalpe tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: in the second incalculably long eon that remains, in that fortunate eon, I will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno hīyamāne āyuṣi utpanne kaliyuganimitte tīvrarāgadveṣamohamānerṣyāmātsaryaparyutthitānāṃ🔽sattvānāṃ mithyādṛṣṭyakalyāṇamitrasanniśritānāṃ sattvānāmakuśalamūlaparyutthitacittānāṃ
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ hīyamāne āyuṣi utpanne kali yuga nimitte tīvra rāga dveṣa moha māna īrṣyā mātsarya paryutthitānām  sattvānām mithyādṛṣṭi akalyāṇa mitra sanniśritānām sattvānām akuśala mūla paryutthita cittānām
translated: When the lifespan is decreasing, when the signs of the Kali Yuga have arisen, and beings are agitated by intense passion, hatred, delusion, pride, jealousy, and stinginess,🔽when beings rely on wrong views and unwholesome friends, when beings' minds are agitated by the roots of non-virtue,

analyzed: kuśala mūla parihīṇa cittānām samyak dṛṣṭi vivarjita cittānām mithyājīva akuśala cittānām
translated: when beings' minds are deprived of the roots of virtue, when beings' minds are devoid of right views, when beings' minds are unwholesome due to wrong livelihood,

original: parinirvṛte kanakamunau tathāgate saddharme 'ntarhite 'ndhe loke 'nāyake viṃśativarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ ahamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ
analyzed: parinirvṛte kanakamunau tathāgate saddharme ntarhite ndhe loke nāyake viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: when the Tathāgata Kanakamuni has passed into parinirvāṇa, when the true Dharma has disappeared, when the world is blind and without a leader, and when the lifespan of beings is twenty thousand years, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tasya kulaputra viśvaguptasya brāhmaṇasya ratnagarbhastathāgata āha sādhu sādhu brāhmaṇa mahāvidvān jñānasamanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya kula putra viśvaguptasya brāhmaṇasya ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha sādhu sādhu brāhmaṇa mahā vidvān jñāna samanvāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata Ratna-garbha said to the brāhmaṇa Viśva-gupta, Excellent, excellent, O brāhmaṇa! You are greatly learned and endowed with knowledge.

analyzed: tvam sat puruṣa utpanne kali yuga nimitte kpsū
translated: O good man, when the signs of the Kali Yuga have arisen,

analyzed: yāvat viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām andhe loke nāyake praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: and when the lifespan of beings is twenty thousand years, you have made a vow in the blind world without a leader.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa vidvagañjakaruṇāśrayo nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa vidvas añja karuṇāśrayaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, good man, you should be named Vidagandhakaruṇāśraya.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vidvas añja karuṇā āśraya anāgate dhvani atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām avaśiṣṭe
translated: You will be named Vidagandhakaruṇāśraya in the future, when one Ganges river's worth of eons has passed,

original: dvitīye sahāyāṃ lokadhātau anupraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe viṃśativarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ
analyzed: dvitīye sahāyām lokadhātau anupraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām
translated: in the second Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is twenty thousand years,

original: kāśyapo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: kāśyapaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: you will become the Tathāgata named Kāśyapa, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vidvagañjakaruṇāśrayo bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte 'sthāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vidvas añja karuṇāśrayaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte sthāt
translated: Then, noble son, the bodhisattva Vidagandhakaruṇāśraya bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha with the five points, and stood to one side.

analyzed: ratnagarbham tathāgatam puṣpa mālya gandha cūrṇaiḥ avakirati
translated: He scattered flowers, garlands, incense, and powders over the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha,

analyzed: ābhiḥ ca gāthābhiḥ abhistavamānaḥ
translated: and praised him with these verses:

analyzed: nara vara hita kara rati kara janaka
translated: O best of men, benefactor, delighter, giver of joy,

analyzed: smita mukha pramudita su madhura vacanā
translated: with a smiling face, full of joy, with very sweet speech,

analyzed: sthāna jñāna kuśala hita karā
translated: skilled in the knowledge of abodes, benefactor, bearer of the ten powers, supreme,

analyzed: jñāna dhyāna vimokṣa pāramitā namaḥ stu te sugate
translated: perfected in knowledge, meditation, and liberation, homage to you, O Sugata!

analyzed: vikasita vadanā vyākṛtā
translated: Having practiced many austerities, with a blossoming face, you were prophesied for incomparable enlightenment.

original: tvayā bahubodhisattvanayutā vandāma te naravarā sugatā /🔽iti //
analyzed: tvayā bahu bodhisattva nayutāḥ vandāma te nara varā sugatā  iti
translated: We praise you, O best of men, O Sugata, you who have prophesied many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: Thus it is said.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturthaṃ vimalavaiśāyanaṃ māṇavakaṃ saṃcodayāṃ āsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturtham vimalavaiśāyanam māṇavakam saṃcodayān āsa
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrarenu exhorted the fourth young brahmin Vimala-Vaishāyana.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vimalavaiśāyano māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ sthitvāha evamevāhamasmin bhadrake kalpe bodhimākāṅkṣāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vimalavaiśāyanaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sthitvā āha evam eva aham asmin bhadrake kalpe bodhim ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: Then, noble son, the young brahmin Vimala-Vaishāyana, standing before the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, said, In the same way, I aspire for enlightenment in this fortunate eon.

analyzed: na ca kevalam evaṃrūpam kali yuge
translated: And not only in such a degenerate age,

original: yathā kāśyapasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya daśavarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ dānadamaparikṣīṇāśayānāṃ
analyzed: yathā kāśyapasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya daśa varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām dāna dama parikṣīṇa āśayānām
translated: but also when the lifespan is ten thousand years after the Tathagata Kashyapa has passed into parinirvana, for beings whose intentions are exhausted in giving and self-control,

analyzed: sattvānām sapta dhana virahitānām akalyāṇa mitre śāstṛ saṃjñā pratipanna cittāḥ bhavanti
translated: who are devoid of the seven riches, who have the notion of a teacher towards an unwholesome friend,

analyzed: anarthikāḥ tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ bhavanti
translated: who are not interested in the three bases of meritorious action,

analyzed: virahitāḥ tribhiḥ su caritaiḥ udyuktāḥ triṣu duṣcariteṣu kleśa andhakāra vyākula cittāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are devoid of the three good conducts, devoted to the three bad conducts, and their minds are agitated by the darkness of afflictions.

analyzed: anarthikāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ na śakyam tad kālam kenacid bodhi caryām niṣpādayitum
translated: They are not interested in the three vehicles, and at that time no one is able to accomplish the practice of enlightenment.🔽How much less so in a thousand years?

analyzed: kim punar varṣa sahasrikāyām yāvat te
translated: As long as those

analyzed: sattvāḥ varṣa śata āyuṣkāḥ bhavanti
translated: beings have a lifespan of one hundred years,

analyzed: tad kālam sattvānām kuśala mūlasya na asti nāma
translated: at that time beings do not even have the name of roots of virtue.

analyzed: kim punar kuśala mūla caryā
translated: How much less so the practice of roots of virtue?

original: tāvat pañcakaṣāye loke hāyamānā daśavarṣāyuṣkā bhavanti /
analyzed: tāvat pañca kaṣāye loke hāyamānāḥ daśa varṣa āyuṣkāḥ bhavanti
translated: As long as in the world of five corruptions, declining, they have a lifespan of ten years,

original: śastrāntarakalpe pratyupasthite tatkālamahaṃ devebhyo 'vatīrya sattvān paritrāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: śastra antara kalpe pratyupasthite tad kālam aham devebhyaḥ vatīrya sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: when the intermediate eon of warfare is imminent, at that time I will descend from the gods and protect beings.

analyzed: akuśalam riñcitvā kuśale niyojayeyam
translated: Having abandoned unwholesomeness, I will engage them in wholesomeness.

analyzed: yāvat daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: As long as I will establish beings in the ten wholesome courses of action,

analyzed: kleśān ca sattvānām kuśalebhiḥ karma pathebhiḥ pariśodhayeyam
translated: and purify the afflictions of beings through the wholesome courses of action,

analyzed: pañca kaṣāyam ca parihāyeyam
translated: and abandon the five corruptions,

analyzed: yāvat aśīti varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: “For as long as the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years, may I attain supreme and perfect awakening.

analyzed: manda rāga dveṣa mohānām avidyā īrṣyā matsariṇām sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: May I teach the Dharma to beings with weak passion, aggression, and delusion, who are ignorant, jealous, and stingy.

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu saṃniyojayeyam
translated: May I lead them to the three vehicles.

original: yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta vyākarotu māṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta vyākarotu mām bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If, Blessed One, this kind of aspiration is fulfilled, may the Blessed One, O Venerable One, prophesy my unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ na lapsyāmi /🔽na śrāvakabhūmiṃ prārthayāmi na ca pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ yena yānena śīghraṃ saṃsārādvimucyāmi /
analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpam vyākaraṇam na lapsyāmi  na śrāvaka bhūmim prārthayāmi na ca pratyekabuddha bhūmim yena yānena śīghram saṃsārāt vimucyāmi
translated: If, O Venerable Blessed One, I do not obtain such a prophecy,

analyzed: kpsū
translated: I will not aspire to the stage of the hearers or the stage of the solitary buddhas, by which vehicle I will quickly be liberated from saṃsāra.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha catvārīmāni brāhmaṇa bodhisattvānāṃ kuśīdavastūni /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha catvāri imāni brāhmaṇa bodhisattvānām kuśīda vastūni
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said, “Brahmin, these are the four things for bodhisattvas that lead to laziness.

original: yaiḥ kuśīdavastubhiḥ samanvāgatā ekatyā bodhisattvā dīrghasaṃsāralābhino dṛṣṭiprapāte saṃsāracārake duḥkhānyanubhavanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ kuśīda vastubhiḥ samanvāgatāḥ ekatyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ dīrgha saṃsāra lābhinaḥ dṛṣṭi prapāte saṃsāra cārake duḥkhāni anubhavanti
translated: By these things that lead to laziness, some bodhisattvas attain saṃsāra for a long time, and experience suffering in the abyss of views, in the prison of saṃsāra.

analyzed: na ca kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāpnuvanti
translated: And they do not quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: katamāni catvāri
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: iha ekatyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ hīna ācāraḥ bhavati  hīna sahāyaḥ  hīna parityāgaḥ
translated: Here, a certain bodhisattva has inferior conduct.🔽He has inferior companions.🔽He has inferior renunciation.

analyzed: hīna praṇidhiḥ
translated: He has inferior aspirations.

analyzed: katham ca bodhisattvaḥ hīna ācāraḥ bhavati
translated: And how does a bodhisattva have inferior conduct?

analyzed: iha ekatyaḥ duḥśīlaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, a certain one is of bad character.

analyzed: kāya vāc manasā ca asaṃvṛta cārī bhavati
translated: He is not restrained in body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ sārdham saṃsarga cārī bhavati
translated: He associates with those of the Śrāvaka and Pratyekabuddha vehicles.

original: na ca sarvaparityāgī na sarvatraparityāgī bhavati /
analyzed: na ca sarva parityāgī na sarvatra parityāgī bhavati
translated: And he is not one who renounces everything, not one who renounces everywhere.

analyzed: deva manuṣya śrī sukha abhilāṣī dānam dadāti
translated: Desiring the glory and happiness of gods and humans, he gives gifts.

original: na cādhyāśayena buddhakṣetraguṇavyuhān pratigṛhṇāti vaineyamanavekṣya praṇidhānaṃ pratigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na ca adhyāśayena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhān pratigṛhṇāti vaineyam an avekṣya praṇidhānam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: And with a superior intention, he does not accept the adornments of the Buddha-field. Without considering the disciples, he accepts the aspiration.

original: ebhiścaturbhirdharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kuśīdo bodhisattvaḥ ciraṃ saṃsāracārake duḥkhamanubhavati /
analyzed: ebhiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kuśīdaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ciram saṃsāra cārake duḥkham anubhavati
translated: Endowed with these four dharmas, the lazy bodhisattva experiences suffering for a long time in the cycle of existence,

analyzed: na ca kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāpnoti
translated: and he does not quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses four dharmas quickly attains supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: katamaiḥ caturbhiḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: śīlavān bhavati kāya vāc manaḥ saṃvṛta cārī
translated: He is moral, practicing restraint over body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: mahāyāna saṃprasthitaiḥ sārdham saṃsarga cārī bhavati
translated: He practices association with those who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: sarvaparityāgī sarvatraparityāgī sattvānāṃ duḥkhaparimocanārthaṃ karuṇācittotpādaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sarva parityāgī sarvatra parityāgī sattvānām duḥkha parimocana artham karuṇā citta utpādam dadāti
translated: He gives up everything, gives up everywhere, out of compassion for beings in order to liberate them from suffering.

analyzed: adhyāśayena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān vaineyam avekṣya praṇidhānam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: With superior intention, he takes up the vow to create a Buddha-field and to develop disciples, looking to the future.

analyzed: ebhiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃsaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses these four dharmas quickly attains supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ime dharmāḥ bodhisattva mārgasya upastambha karāḥ
translated: These four dharmas support the bodhisattva path.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: pāramitāsu abhiyogaḥ  sattvānām saṃgraha vastu utsargaḥ
translated: Intense practice of the perfections.🔽Giving up the means of gathering beings.

analyzed: brahmavihāra abhiniṣpādana tā
translated: Accomplishing the divine abodes.

analyzed: abhijñā vikrīḍanā tā
translated: Playing with the superknowledges.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ bodhisattvena atṛpta vihāriṇā bhavitavyam
translated: A bodhisattva should dwell with four kinds of insatiable practice.

original: dānātṛptatayā dharmaśravaṇātṛptatayā bhāvanātṛptatayā sattvebhyaḥ saṅgrahavastvatṛptatayā viharatavyaṃ /
analyzed: dāna atṛpta tayā dharma śravaṇa atṛpta tayā bhāvanā atṛpta tayā sattvebhyaḥ saṅgraha vastu atṛpta tayā viharatavyam
translated: One should dwell with insatiable generosity, insatiable listening to the Dharma, insatiable meditation, and insatiable practice of the four means of gathering disciples for the sake of sentient beings.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ime bodhisattvena akṣayāḥ nidhayaḥ paripūrayitavyāḥ
translated: These four inexhaustible treasures should be fulfilled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: śraddhā bodhisattvena akṣayaḥ nidhiḥ paripūrayitavyaḥ
translated: Faith is an inexhaustible treasure to be fulfilled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: dharma deśanā pariṇāmanā daridra sattva parigrahaḥ ca akṣayaḥ nidhiḥ paripūrayitavyaḥ
translated: Teaching the Dharma, dedicating [merit], and taking care of poor sentient beings are inexhaustible treasures to be fulfilled.

analyzed: catasraḥ imāḥ bodhisattva pariśuddhiḥ
translated: These are the four purities of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katamāḥ catasraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: nairātmya tayā śīla pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of morality through selflessness.

analyzed: niḥsattva tayā samādhi pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of concentration through being without sentient beings.

analyzed: nirjīva tayā prajñā pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of wisdom through being without a living being.

analyzed: niṣpudgala tayā vimukti pariśuddhiḥ vimukti jñāna darśana tayā ca
translated: Purity of liberation through being without a person, and the purity of the knowledge and vision of liberation.

analyzed: catvāraḥ dharmāḥ bodhisattvena paripūrayitavyāḥ
translated: Four dharmas should be fulfilled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: yaiḥ bodhisattvāḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyanti
translated: Through which bodhisattvas quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ākāśa cakram pravartayanti
translated: They turn the wheel of space.

original: acintyacakramatulyacakraṃ anabhilāpyacakraṃ nairyāṇikacakraṃ nairvedhikacakraṃ apravṛtticakraṃ pravartayanti /
analyzed: acintya cakram atulya cakram anabhilāpya cakram nairyāṇika cakram nairvedhika cakram apravṛtti cakram pravartayanti
translated: They turn the inconceivable wheel, the incomparable wheel, the inexpressible wheel, the wheel of deliverance, the penetrating wheel, the wheel of non-arising.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vimala vaiśāyana anāgate dhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye
translated: In the future, O Vimalavaiśāyanā, after one asaṃkhyeya eon has passed,

original: 'cirapraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe praśānte pañcakaṣāye kāle vardhamāne āyuṣi aśītivarṣasahasrikāyāṃ
analyzed: cira praviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe praśānte pañca kaṣāye kāle vardhamāne āyuṣi aśīti varṣa sahasrikāyām
translated: when the Bhadrakalpa has just begun, when the five degenerations have subsided, when the lifespan is increasing, when the lifespan is eighty thousand years,

analyzed: prajāyām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: maitreyo nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be called Maitreya, a Tathāgata, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: atha vimalavaiśāyano brāhmaṇo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvaikānte sthitvā puṣpamālyacurṇairbhagavataḥ pūjodyukto
analyzed: atha vimalavaiśāyanaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā ekānte sthitvā puṣpa mālya curṇaiḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā udyuktaḥ
translated: Then the brāhmaṇa Vimalavaiśāyana, having bowed at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with his five limbs, stood to one side, and being eager to make offerings to the Blessed One with flowers, garlands, and powders,

analyzed: gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭauti
translated: he praised him with these verses:

analyzed: bhava nātha lalāṭa viśālā rucira ūrṇā hima varṇā
translated: O Lord, your forehead is broad, with a beautiful curl, white like snow,

analyzed: sadṛśā astu manāthā
translated: like the peak of a golden mountain, O you who are without a mind of your own.

original: kaste na nayu muni vṛṣabhā lokapradīpā guṇaśatabharitā
analyzed: kaḥ te na muni vṛṣabhā loka pradīpā guṇa śata bharitā
translated: Who is your spiritual friend, best of sages, lamp of the world, filled with hundreds of virtues?

analyzed: kālaḥ yam me uktam  kpsū
translated: This is my time, O Buddha, speak!

original: sarve samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena purohitena sahasraṃ vedapāṭhakānāṃ bodhau samādāpitāṃ /
analyzed: sarve samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena purohitena sahasram vedapāṭhakānām bodhau samādāpitām
translated: All of them were inspired for enlightenment by Samudrarenu, the royal priest, together with a thousand reciters of the Vedas.

original: yathā krakutsandaḥ kanakamuniḥ kāśyapo maitreyo vyākṛta evaṃ siṃhaḥ pradyotaḥ yāvaddvirūnaṃ
analyzed: yathā krakutsandaḥ kanakamuniḥ kāśyapaḥ maitreyaḥ vyākṛtaḥ evam siṃhaḥ pradyotaḥ yāvat dvis ūnam
translated: Just as Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, Kashyapa, and Maitreya were prophesied, so were Simha, Pradyota, and so on.

original: sahasraṃ vedapāṭhakānāṃ māṇavakānāṃ sarve 'smin bhadrake kalpe 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau🔽praṇidhānaṃ kṛtavantaḥ /
analyzed: sahasram vedapāṭhakānām māṇavakānām sarve smin bhadrake kalpe nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  praṇidhānam kṛtavantaḥ
translated: A thousand young men who were reciters of the Vedas, all in this fortunate eon, made aspirations for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sarve ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatenāsminneva bhadrake kalpe 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyavasthāpitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena asmin eva bhadrake kalpe nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyavasthāpitāḥ
translated: All of them were established by Tathagata Ratnagarbha in supreme perfect enlightenment in this very fortunate eon.

analyzed: yaḥ teṣām sarva kanyasaḥ purohitena saṃcoditaḥ
translated: The youngest of them was urged by the royal priest:

analyzed: kim bho mahā bala vega dhārī dīrgham nirīkṣase
translated: Why do you look so long, O bearer of great strength and speed?

analyzed: utpādayasva sattveṣu mahā karuṇām
translated: Arouse great compassion for beings.

analyzed: imābhiḥ ca gāthābhiḥ vijñāpayati
translated: And he made this request with these verses:

original: ye sattvā jarāvyādhimṛtyubhirbhayā tṛṣṇā nadī patitā /🔽KpSū
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ jarā vyādhi mṛtyubhiḥ bhayā tṛṣṇā nadī patitā  kpsū
translated: Those beings who are terrified by old age, sickness, and death, fallen into the river of craving,

original: prakṣiptā bhavacārake pratibhayaṃ skandhe niviṣṭā narāḥ /
analyzed: prakṣiptāḥ bhava cārake pratibhayam skandhe niviṣṭāḥ narāḥ
translated: Thrown into the terrifying prison of existence, men attached to the aggregates,

analyzed: pītvā kleśa viṣam paraspara vadham duḥkha arṇave saṃsthitā
translated: Having drunk the poison of afflictions, killing each other, dwelling in the ocean of suffering,

analyzed: mohe andhe praṇaṣṭa mārge aśubha saṃsāra yantre bhraman
translated: Wandering in the blind darkness of delusion, lost on the path, turning in the inauspicious wheel of existence,

original: duḥkhena jālitabhūta sarvatribhaveya mithyāya dṛṣṭi sthitāḥ /
analyzed: duḥkhena sarva tri bhaveya sthitāḥ
translated: Burning with suffering everywhere in the three realms, abiding in wrong views,

analyzed: sarvaprāṇa bhramanti pañca gatibhiḥ cakram yathā vartate
translated: All beings wander in the five destinies, like a turning wheel.

original: dharmā cakṣu vihīna pañcagatibhiratrāṇa sattvān smarī /
analyzed: sattvān
translated: Remembering the beings in the five destinies, lacking the eye of Dharma, without protection,

original: bhāve prajña jahitvā kaṅkṣavimati bodhāya candaṃ jane /
analyzed: bhāve prajña jahitvā kaṅkṣavimati bodhāya candam jane
translated: Having abandoned wisdom and existence, generating the aspiration for enlightenment, free from doubt and hesitation,

analyzed: tṛṣṇā śoka nudaḥ bhavāhi bandhuḥ bhavā  kpsū
translated: May you become the remover of craving and sorrow, a friend to beings in the world.

original: kleśabandhanamokṣaṇārthaṃ jagato bodhāya cittaṃ name /🔽dharmacakṣurvihīna mohavigatamārgaṃ ca śreṣṭa dada /
analyzed: kleśa bandhana mokṣaṇa artham jagataḥ bodhāya cittam name  dharma cakṣuḥ vihīna moha vigata mārgam ca śreṣṭa dada
translated: In order to liberate the world from the bonds of afflictions, I bow my mind to enlightenment.🔽Giving the supreme path free from delusion to those who lack the eye of Dharma,

analyzed: saṃsāra bhava cārakeṣu jvalitām dharma rasena tarpayā
translated: Satisfying with the nectar of Dharma those burning in the prison of existence and cyclic existence,

original: tvaṃ śīghraṃ upasaṃkramya hitakarapādā nipatyaṃ mune /
analyzed: tvam śīghram upasaṃkramya hita kara pādā nipatyam mune
translated: You should quickly approach and bow your head to the feet of the Benefactor, the Sage.

original: sarvā bho praṇidhi praśastra sudṛḍha buddho bhava nāyakaḥ /
analyzed: bho su dṛḍha buddhaḥ bhava nāyakaḥ
translated: You should quickly approach and bow at the feet of the Benefactor, the Sage, and make this excellent and firm aspiration: May I become a Buddha, a leader,

analyzed: sattva śvāsa karaḥ bhavāhi jagataḥ sattva arṇavāḥ uddhare
translated: who gives relief to beings, who rescues the world from the ocean of existence,

analyzed: mokṣa mārga praṇītaḥ indriya bala bodhyaṅga dātā bhavet
translated: who bestows the excellent path of liberation, the faculties, powers, and factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: dharma varṣam utsṛja dharma jaladam duḥkham śamet
translated: May I release the rain of Dharma, and may the cloud of Dharma pacify the suffering of beings.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahābalavegadhārī māṇavaka āha KpSū
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahā bala vega dhārī māṇavakaḥ āha
translated: And that young brahmin Mahābala-vegadhārin said:

analyzed: na aham bho upādhyāya saṃsāra abhirāmām śrīm ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: Sir, teacher, I do not desire the pleasures of cyclic existence.

analyzed: na ca punar śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna abhilāśī
translated: And I do not aspire to the Hearer or Solitary Buddha vehicles.

analyzed: anuttara yānam ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: I aspire to the unsurpassed vehicle.

analyzed: muhūrtam bho upādhyāya pratīkṣāhi
translated: Sir, teacher, please wait a moment.

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva yathā aham siṃha nādam nadāmi
translated: Listen as I roar the lion's roar.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastato 'bhiniṣkramya svakāṃ pañcabrāhmaṇadārakānupasthāyakānāmantrayitvovāca bho dārakā utpādayatānuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tatas bhiniṣkramya svakām pañca brāhmaṇa dārakān upasthāyakān āmantrayitvā uvāca bho dārakāḥ utpādayata anuttarāyām
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudra-reṇu, having gone forth, addressed his five young brahmin attendants, saying: Gentlemen, generate the intention for unsurpassed

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: te pi āhuḥ
translated: They also said:

original: nāsmākaṃ kiñcid asti yad vayaṃ buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayāmaḥ /
analyzed: na asmākam kiñcid asti yat vayam buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayāmaḥ
translated: We have nothing that we can offer to the Saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha.

analyzed: katham ca vayam anavarupta kuśala mūlāḥ bodhi cittam utpādayāmaḥ
translated: How then can we, whose wholesome roots are not yet planted, generate the mind of awakening?

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo 'grapurohitaḥ prathamaḥ karabhujo nāmopasthāyakaḥ tasya saptaratnamayaṃ karṇavibhūṣaṇaṃ datvā /🔽dvitīyaḥ sthālabhujo nāmopasthāyakaḥ tasya dvitīyaṃ saptaratnamayaṃ karṇaveṭhakaṃ datvā /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gra purohitaḥ prathamaḥ karabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam karṇa vibhūṣaṇam da tvā  dvitīyaḥ sthālabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya dvitīyam sapta ratna mayam karṇa veṭhakam da tvā
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, the chief priest, first gave to his attendant named Karabhuja a jeweled earring made of the seven precious substances.🔽Second, he gave to his attendant named Sthālabhuja a second jeweled earring made of the seven precious substances.

original: tṛtīyaḥ jalabhujo nāmopasthāyakastasya saptaratnamayaṃ pīṭhaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ jalabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam pīṭham dadāti
translated: Third, he gave to his attendant named Jalabhuja a jeweled seat made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: ceturthaḥ vega bhujaḥ kpsū
translated: Fourth, he gave to his attendant named Vegabhuja

analyzed: nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam daṇḍam dadāti
translated: a jeweled staff made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: pañcamaḥ sārabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sarva sauvarṇa bhṛṅgāram da tvā uvāca
translated: Fifth, he gave to his attendant named Sārabhuja a golden alms bowl and said:

original: gacchata yūyaṃ māṇavakā imāni vastūni buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayitvānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayatha /
analyzed: gacchata yūyam māṇavakāḥ imāni vastūni buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayitvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayatha
translated: Go, young brahmins, offer these things to the Buddha and the community of monks headed by him, and generate the mind of unexcelled perfect awakening.

original: atha te pañcopasthāyakā gatvā bhagavatsakāśaṃ tāni vastuni yathā nikṣiptāni buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayitvaivamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te pañca upasthāyakāḥ gatvā bhagavat sakāśam tāni vastuni yathā nikṣiptāni buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayitvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those five attendants went and offered those things to the Blessed One, as they had been placed, to the community of monks headed by the Buddha, and said this:

analyzed: vyākarotu asmākam bhagavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May the Blessed One prophesy us for unexcelled perfect awakening.

analyzed: tasmin ca bhadrake kalpe vayema anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyamahi
translated: And in that auspicious eon, may we attain unexcelled perfect awakening.

original: peyālaṃ / vyākṛtāḥ kulaputra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena karabhujo māṇavako bodhāya bhadrakalpe dṛḍhasvaro nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: peyālam vyākṛtāḥ kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena karabhujaḥ māṇavakaḥ bodhāya bhadra kalpe dṛḍhasvaraḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: Peyaṃ. The young brahmin Karabhuja was prophesied by the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha for awakening in the auspicious eon, and will be the Tathāgata named Dṛḍhaśvara.

analyzed: sthālabhujaḥ tad antare sukhendriyamatiḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: In the next, Sthālabhuja will be the Tathāgata named Sukhendramatī.

analyzed: tasya anantare jalabhujaḥ sārthavādiḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: In the next after that, Jalabhuja will be the Tathāgata named Sārthavādin.

original: tasyānusaṃdheḥ vegabhujaḥ priyaprasanno nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ / KpSū
analyzed: tasya anusaṃdheḥ vegabhujaḥ priyaprasannaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata named Priyaprasanna will arise from that aspiration.

original: tasyānusaṃdheḥ sārabhujo nāma māṇavako haripatracūḍo nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya anusaṃdheḥ sārabhujaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ haripatracūḍaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: The young brahmin named Sārabhūja will become the Tathāgata named Haripatracuḍa.

original: samanantaravyākṛtāste pañcabhadrakalpikā māṇavakāḥ purohitaḥ punarapi mahābalavegadhāriṇamāha mahābalavegadhārī gṛhṇāhi buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān /
analyzed: samanantara vyākṛtāḥ te pañcabhadra kalpikāḥ māṇavakāḥ purohitaḥ punar api mahā bala vega dhāriṇam āha mahā bala vega dhārī gṛhṇāhi buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān
translated: Immediately after those five young men of the Fortunate Eon were prophesied, the family priest again said to Mahābalavegadhārin, Mahābalavegadhārin, take up the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field.

analyzed: karohi praṇidhānam bhagavataḥ sakāśāt yādṛśam ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Make a vow in the presence of the Blessed One, as you desire.

analyzed: nimantrayāhi sarva sattvān dharma rasena
translated: Invite all beings with the nectar of the Dharma.

analyzed: carāhi ca dṛḍha vīryeṇa svakam bodhi cārikām
translated: Practice with firm vigor your own course of conduct for enlightenment.

analyzed: mā bhūyas dīrgham nirīkṣasva
translated: Do not look too far ahead.

analyzed: bāhunā ca gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ ntikam upanītaḥ
translated: And taking him by the arm, he was brought into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahābalavegadhārī māṇavako bhagavataḥ purato niṣaṇṇaścāha kiyadbahavo bhagavannanāgate 'dhvani munibhāskarā asmin bhadrakalpe
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahā bala vega dhārī māṇavakaḥ bhagavataḥ puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ ca āha kiyat bahavaḥ bhagavan anāgate dhvani muni bhāskarāḥ asmin bhadra kalpe
translated: And that young brahmin Mahābalavegadhārin, sitting in front of the Blessed One, said, How many future suns of sages will there be in this Fortunate Eon, Blessed One?

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha tasmin māṇavaka bhadrake kalpe caturuttaraṃ sahasraṃ munibhāskarāṇāṃ udayaḥ /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha tasmin māṇavaka bhadrake kalpe catur uttaram sahasram muni bhāskarāṇām udayaḥ
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, In that Bhadrakalpa, young man, there will be an arising of one thousand and four suns of sages.

original: māṇavaka āha yāvatteṣāṃ bhadanta bhagavan bhadrake mahākalpe nirvṛtānāṃ jinasūryāṇāṃ paścimako sārabhujo KpSū
analyzed: māṇavakaḥ āha yāvat teṣām bhadanta bhagavan bhadrake mahākalpe nirvṛtānām jina sūryāṇām
translated: The young man said, Bhadant Bhagawan, after the Nirvanas of those suns of Jinas in that Bhadrakalpa, who will be the last?

original: nāma māṇavako 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate haripatracūḍo nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgata /
analyzed: nāma māṇavakaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate haripatracūḍaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgata
translated: The young man named Sarabha will attain supreme perfect enlightenment and will become the Tathagata named Haripatracuddha.

analyzed: tāvat ciram aham bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi vividha vrata tapa caryā dāna dama saṃyama śruta vīrya kṣānti sauratya puṇya prajñā saṃbhāram samudānayamānaḥ
translated: For that long, I will practice the conduct of a Bodhisattva, accumulating the various perfections of austerities, giving, self-control, restraint, learning, diligence, patience, gentleness, merit, and wisdom.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca bhadrakalpikānāmacirābhisaṃbuddhānāṃ prathamaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ dadyāṃ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca bhadrakalpikānām acira abhisaṃbuddhānām prathamam piṇḍapātam dadyām
translated: And I will offer the first alms to all the Bhadrakalpika Buddhas who have attained enlightenment,

analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca śarīra pūjām kuryām
translated: and I will make offerings to their bodies after their Parinirvanas.

analyzed: teṣām ca saddharma dhārakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: And I will be the preserver of their true Dharma.

original: śīlavirahitān sattvān śīlasaṃpadi samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: śīla virahitān sattvān śīla saṃpadi samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I will inspire, introduce, and establish beings who lack morality in the perfection of morality.

original: dṛṣṭivirahitān saṅkaṭaprāptān sattvān samyakdṛṣṭyāṃ samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /🔽evamāśayavirahitān samyagāśaye pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi virahitān saṅkaṭa prāptān sattvān samyakdṛṣṭyām samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam  evam āśaya virahitān samyak āśaye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I would establish in right view those beings who are deprived of right view and have fallen into misfortune.🔽In the same way, I would establish in right aspiration those who are deprived of right aspiration.

analyzed: evam ācāra virahitā anācāre pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: In the same way, I would establish in right conduct those who are deprived of right conduct.

analyzed: nānāvidhānām sattvānām kuśala caryām nidarśayeyam
translated: I would show the practice of virtue to beings of various kinds.

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmacirāstāṅgate saddharme punarahaṃ saddharmanetrī saddharmaparigrahaṃ saddharmasyotpādaṃ saddharmapradīpaṃ loke
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām acira asta aṅgate saddharme punar aham saddharma netrī saddharma parigraham saddharmasya utpādam saddharma pradīpam loke
translated: And when those Buddhas, those Blessed Ones, have passed away, I would light the lamp of the true Dharma, the acceptance of the true Dharma, the arising of the true Dharma, the lamp of the true Dharma in the world.

analyzed: jvālayeyam
translated: I would light it.

original: śastrāntarakalpakālasamaye sattvān prāṇātipātavairamaṇyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ yāvat samyagdṛṣṭyāṃ /
analyzed: śastra antara kalpa kāla samaye sattvān prāṇa atipāta vaira maṇyām pratiṣṭhāpayeyam yāvat samyagdṛṣṭyām
translated: At the time of the intermediate eon of weapons, I would establish beings in abstention from killing, up to right view.

analyzed: daśā kuśala karma pathebhyaḥ sattvān kumārgāt uddhṛtya samyakpathe sthāpayeyam
translated: Having lifted beings from the ten unwholesome courses of action, I would establish them in the right path.

analyzed: duścarita andhakāram kpsū  ca nāśayeyam
translated: I would destroy the darkness of misconduct.

analyzed: su carita ālokam ca nidarśayeyam
translated: I would show the light of good conduct.

analyzed: kalpa kaṣāyam yāvat ca āyuḥ dṛṣṭi kleśa kaṣāyam ca loke nāśayeyam
translated: I would destroy the impurity of the eon, up to the impurity of lifespan, and the impurity of views and afflictions in the world.

original: durbhikṣāntarakalpakālasamaye 'haṃ sattvāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ niyojayeyaṃ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: durbhikṣa antara kalpa kāla samaye ham sattvām dāna pāramitāyām niyojayeyam yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam
translated: At the time of an interval eon of famine, I will engage beings in the perfection of generosity and so forth up to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ṣaṣ pāramitāsu aham sattvān niyojayamānaḥ sarva durbhikṣa andhakāra kali kaluṣa raṇa vaira vigraha vivādam śamayeyam
translated: Engaging beings in the six perfections, I will pacify all famines, darkness, quarrels, defilements, conflicts, disputes, and hostilities.

analyzed: sattvānām santatau kleśa analam śamayeyam
translated: I will extinguish the fire of afflictions in the continuum of beings.

analyzed: roga antara kalpa kāla samaye ca aham sattvām ṣaṣ pārāyaṇīyeṣu samādāpayeyam
translated: At the time of an interval eon of disease, I will encourage beings to take up the six perfections.

analyzed: caturṣu saṅgraha vastuṣu niyojayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I will engage and establish them in the four means of gathering disciples.

analyzed: roga andhakāram ca sattvānām vidhvaṃsayeyam
translated: I will destroy the darkness of disease for beings.

analyzed: yāvat sattvānām santatau kleśam praśamayeyam
translated: Up to pacifying the afflictions in the continuum of beings.

original: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrakalpe sattvānevaṃrūpairvyasanaiḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre bhadra kalpe sattvān evaṃrūpaiḥ vyasanaiḥ parimocayeyam
translated: In all the Buddha-fields of the Sahā world, I will liberate beings from such calamities in the fortunate eon.

original: yadā caturuttaraṃ sahasraṃ buddhā bhagavanto bhadrake mahākalpe utpannā nirvṛtāśca bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yadā catur uttaram sahasram buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhadrake mahā kalpe utpannāḥ nirvṛtāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: When the four thousand and one Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have arisen and passed into Nirvāṇa in the fortunate great eon,

original: sarveṇa sarvaṃ ca saddharmanetrī antarhitā bhavet /
analyzed: sarveṇa sarvam ca saddharmanetrī antarhitā bhavet
translated: The entire and complete Dharma method would disappear.

analyzed: tatas paścāt aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Only then would I fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: yāvāṃścaturuttarasahasrāṇāṃ bhadrakalpikānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmāyurbhavet tāntakam mama bodhiprāptasya dīrghamāyurbhavet /
analyzed: yāvān catur uttara sahasrāṇām bhadra kalpikānām buddhānām bhagavatām āyuḥ bhavet tāntakam mama bodhi prāptasya dīrgham āyuḥ bhavet
translated: May my lifespan be as long as that of the Blessed Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, up to the four-plus-four Buddhas. May my lifespan be long when I attain enlightenment.

original: yāvāṃśca teṣāṃ śrāvakasaṅgho bhavet tāvān mamaikasya śrāvakasaṅghaḥ syāt / KpSū
analyzed: yāvān ca teṣām śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet tāvān mama ekasya śrāvaka saṅghaḥ syāt
translated: May my assembly of disciples be as numerous as all those Buddhas' assemblies of disciples.

analyzed: yāvataḥ ca te kalpaiḥ catur uttaram
translated: For as many eons as it takes the four-plus-four

original: buddhasahasraṃ sattvān viniyet tāvataḥ sattvān ahaṃ vinayeyaṃ /
analyzed: buddha sahasram sattvān tāvataḥ sattvān aham vinayeyam
translated: thousand Buddhas to guide beings, may I guide that many beings.

original: ye ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śrāvakaśikṣāyāṃ skhaleyurdṛṣṭiprapāte vā prapateyurbuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśe 'gauravacittāḥ praduṣṭacittā🔽dharme saṅghe ca skhalitacittā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śrāvaka śikṣāyām skhaleyuḥ dṛṣṭi prapāte vā prapateyuḥ buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśe gaurava cittāḥ praduṣṭa cittāḥ  dharme saṅghe ca skhalita cittāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Those who stumble in the training of the disciples of those Blessed Buddhas, who fall into the abyss of wrong views, who have disrespectful or hostile minds toward the Blessed Buddhas,

original: rāgacittā āryāpavādāḥ ānantaryakārāśca bhaveyurbodhiprāptaścāhaṃ sarvān saṃsārapaṅkāduddhareyaṃ /
analyzed: rāga cittāḥ ārya apavādāḥ ānantarya kārāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham sarvān saṃsāra paṅkāt uddhareyam
translated: who have minds that stumble regarding the Dharma and the Sangha, who have minds of passion, who slander noble ones, and who commit the acts of immediate retribution - may I liberate them all from the mire of cyclic existence when I attain enlightenment.

analyzed: abhayapure ca nirvāṇa nagare prāveśayeyam
translated: And in the city of Nirvana, which is the city of fearlessness, I would cause them to enter.

original: yāvan mama parinirvṛtasya saddharmakṣayo na bhavet tāvad bhadrakamahākalpe 'kṣayo bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat mama parinirvṛtasya saddharma kṣayaḥ na bhavet tāvat bhadraka mahā kalpe kṣayaḥ bhaveyam
translated: As long as the destruction of the true Dharma does not occur after my parinirvana, for that long I would be inexhaustible in the auspicious great kalpa.

analyzed: niṣṭhite mama saddharme niṣṭhite bhadra kalpe
translated: When my true Dharma has ceased and the auspicious kalpa has ended,

original: ye mama dhātavo janmaśarīraḥ te 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāstathāgatavigrahāḥ saṃtiṣṭheran dvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtagātrāḥ /
analyzed: ye mama dhātavaḥ janma śarīraḥ te prameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ saṃtiṣṭheran dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛta gātrāḥ
translated: may my relics, my birth body, remain as immeasurable and innumerable Tathagata forms adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

analyzed: ekaikam lakṣaṇam aśītibhiḥ anuvyañjanaiḥ samalaṅkṛtam bhavet
translated: And may each mark be adorned with the eighty minor characteristics.

original: te ca tathāgatavigrahā daśasu dikṣvaprameyebhyo 'saṃkhyeyebhyaḥ śūnyebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo KpSū
analyzed: te ca tathāgata vigrahāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyebhyaḥ saṃkhyeyebhyaḥ śūnyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ
translated: And may those Tathagata forms, having gone to immeasurable and innumerable empty Buddha fields in the ten directions,

original: gatvā ekaiko buddhavigraho 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāṃ tribhiryānaiḥ sattvān samādāpayet niveśayet pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: gatvā ekaikaḥ buddha vigrahaḥ prameya asaṃkhyeyām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ sattvān samādāpayet niveśayet pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: may each Buddha form inspire, establish, and confirm immeasurable and innumerable beings in the three vehicles.

original: yatra buddhakṣetre 'ntarakalpe na nāśo bhavet tatra tathāgatavigrahaḥ sattvān paritrāyedyathā pūrvoktaṃ tathā paścāccintāmaṇiḥ prādurbhavet /
analyzed: yatra buddhakṣetre ntara kalpe na nāśaḥ bhavet tatra tathāgata vigrahaḥ sattvān paritrāyet yathā pūrva uktam tathā paścāt cintāmaṇiḥ prādurbhavet
translated: In those buddha-fields where there is no destruction of the intermediate eon, there the Tathāgata's body would protect beings as previously stated, and later a wish-fulfilling gem would appear.

original: yeśu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvā ratnavirahitā bhaveyuḥ teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā ratnavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣānnidhayaśca saṃdarśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ ratna virahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā ratna vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣāt nidhayaḥ ca saṃdarśayeyuḥ
translated: In those buddha-fields where beings are devoid of jewels, going to those buddha-fields they would cause a rain of jewels to fall and reveal treasure troves.

original: yeṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ kuśalakriyāvirahitā bhaveyuḥ vyādhibhīḥ kliṣṭāsteṣu buddhakṣetresu gośīrṣoragasārakālānusārī gandhavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ kuśala kriyā virahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ vyādhi bhīḥ kliṣṭāḥ teṣu buddhakṣetresu gośīrṣa uraga sāra kāla anusārī gandha vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣeyuḥ
translated: And in those buddha-fields where beings are devoid of wholesome actions and are afflicted by the fear of illness, in those buddha-fields a rain of fragrant water from the head of a cow, from agaru wood, and from black aloeswood would fall.

original: sā ca gandhavṛṣṭiḥ sattvānāṃ kleśavyādhīrdṛṣṭivyādhīḥ kāyavyādhīśca praśamayet /
analyzed: sā ca gandha vṛṣṭiḥ sattvānām kleśa vyādhīḥ dṛṣṭi vyādhīḥ kāya vyādhīḥ ca praśamayet
translated: And that rain of fragrance would pacify the afflictions, the illnesses of view, and the illnesses of the body of beings.

original: tataste sattvāḥ puṇyakriyāvastuṣvabhiyuktā bhaveyuḥ svargaparāyaṇā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatas te sattvāḥ puṇya kriyā vastuṣu abhiyuktāḥ bhaveyuḥ svarga parāyaṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Then those beings would be devoted to the bases of meritorious action and would be intent on heaven.

original: evaṃrūpamahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhi cārikām caramāṇaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: In this way, Venerable Blessed One, while practicing the conduct for enlightenment, I would protect beings.

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham evaṃrūpam buddha kāryam kuryām
translated: And having attained enlightenment, I would perform such buddha-work.

analyzed: parinirvṛtaḥ ca aham eva ananta aparyantebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: And after my parinirvāṇa, I would protect beings from the infinite and boundless buddha-fields.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannaivaṃrūpā āśā paripūryetā na ca sattvānāṃ bhaiṣajyabhūto KpSū
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan na evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryetā na ca sattvānām
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, and I do not become a medicine for beings,

original: bhaveyaṃ / visaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyurye daśasu dikṣvanatāparyanteṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ
analyzed: bhaveyam visaṃvāditāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaveyuḥ ye daśasu dikṣu anatā paryanteṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānām dharmam
translated: then may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who dwell, remain, and live in the world-realms in the ten directions, infinite and boundless, be deceived by me.

analyzed: mā me bhagavān vyākuryāt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May the Blessed One not prophesy me for supreme and perfect awakening.

original: ye 'pi te saṃpratipannāṃ bhagavan bahuprāṇakoṭyo 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ sattvāstān ahaṃ buddhān bhagavato virādhayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye pi te saṃpratipannām bhagavan bahu prāṇa koṭyaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ sattvāḥ tān aham buddhān bhagavataḥ virādhayeyam
translated: And those many millions of beings who are presently prophesied by the Blessed One for supreme and perfect awakening, those beings, I would obstruct those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: mā ca ārādhayeyam
translated: And I would not please them.

original: mā ca me bhūyo bodhihetoḥ saṃsāre saṃsāramāṇasya buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ kuśalaśabdaḥ kuśalakarmakriyāśabdaḥ śrotrapatheṣu nipatet /
analyzed: mā ca me bhūyas bodhi hetoḥ saṃsāre saṃsāramāṇasya buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ kuśala śabdaḥ kuśala karma kriyā śabdaḥ śrotra patheṣu nipatet
translated: And may the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of wholesome actions and wholesome deeds never reach my ears as I wander in cyclic existence for the sake of awakening.

analyzed: nityam aham avīci paryāpannaḥ bhaveyam
translated: I would always be in the Avīci hell.

analyzed: yadi me bhagavat na evaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta
translated: If, Blessed One, my aspiration is fulfilled in this way,

analyzed: atha ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ mahā bala vega dhāriṇaḥ māṇavakasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave the young brahmin Mahābalavegadhārin the approval:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: Good, good! O good man!

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa sattvānāṃ bhaiṣajyabhūtaḥ duḥkhebhyaśca parimocakastena tvaṃ satpuruṣa bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalo nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa sattvānām bhaiṣajya bhūtaḥ duḥkhebhyaḥ ca parimocakaḥ tena tvam sat puruṣa bhaiṣajya rāja jyotiḥ vimalaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: You will become the medicine for sentient beings, the liberator from suffering. Therefore, good man, you should be called Bhaiṣajyarāja-jyoti-vimala.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam bhaiṣajya rāja jyotiḥ vimala anāgate kpsū
translated: You will be, Bhaiṣajyarāja-jyoti-vimala, in the future,

analyzed: dhvani ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye tikrānte nu praviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same
translated: in the second incalculably long aeon, when one aeon of the Ganges river's sand has passed, and the second aeon of the Ganges river's sand has been entered,

analyzed: saṃkhyeye bhadrake kalpe caturuttarasya buddha sahasrasya acira abhisaṃbuddhānām piṇḍapātam
translated: in the Bhadrakalpa, you will offer alms-food to the four Buddhas and one thousand Buddhas who have just attained supreme enlightenment,

analyzed: dāsyasi yāvat yathā svayam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: and you will make the vow yourself, up to the end.

original: nirvṛtasya ca haripatracūḍabhadrasya tathāgatasya saddharme 'ntarhite 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /

translated: And when the Tathāgata Hari-patra-cūḍa-bhadra has passed into Nirvāṇa, and the True Dharma has disappeared, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: rocaśca nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: rocaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the Tathāgata named Rocana, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

analyzed: ardha kalpam ca te āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Your lifespan will be half a kalpa.

original: yāvacca tasya caturuttarasya buddhasahasrasya bhadrakalpikānāṃ śrāvakasaṅgho bhaviṣyati tāvacca tavaikasya śrāvakasaṅgho bhaviṣyati /

translated: And your assembly of disciples will be as great as the assembly of disciples of the four Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, up to the assembly of disciples of the one thousand Buddhas.

analyzed: tāvataḥ ca sattvān vinayiṣyasi
translated: And you will guide that many beings.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca saddharmāntardhānaṃ bhadrakasya mahākalpasya kalpakṣayo na bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca saddharma antardhānam bhadrakasya mahā kalpasya kalpa kṣayaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: And after your parinirvāṇa, the disappearance of the true Dharma will not be the destruction of the eon for the Fortunate Great Eon.

analyzed: etāvantaḥ ca buddha vigrahāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And there will be that many Buddha images.

original: yāvacchūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gandhavṛṣṭiḥ sattvānāṃ kleśavyādhirdṛṣṭivyādhīḥ kāyavyādhīśca śamayiṣyati /

translated: And as long as the empty Buddha-fields are rained upon with perfume, the afflictions, views, and physical illnesses of beings will be pacified.

original: triṣu caiva puṇyakriyāvastuṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti svargaparāyaṇāṃśca /🔽KpSū
analyzed: triṣu ca eva puṇya kriyā vastuṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti svarga parāyaṇān ca  kpsū
translated: And they will establish beings in the three meritorious activities, and in the highest heaven.

analyzed: atha khalu kula putra bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yadi me bhadanta
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-rāja-jyoti-viśuddha said, If, reverend

analyzed: bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā me bhagavān sata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtena pāṇinā  mūrdhānām sparśatu

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ śatapuṇyalakṣaṇālaṅkṛtena pāṇinā bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalasya bodhisattvasya mūrdhānaṃ parimārjayitvā
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ śata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtena pāṇinā bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalasya bodhisattvasya mūrdhānam parimārjayitvā
translated: Then, Noble Son, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, with his hand adorned with the marks of a hundred merits, stroked the head of the Bodhisattva Bhaisajyarajavimoksha,

analyzed: tasthau

original: atha khalu kulaputra bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalo bodhisattvastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra bhaiṣajyarājajyotiḥ vimalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ
translated: Then, Noble Son, the Bodhisattva Bhaisajyarajavimoksha, being pleased, elated, and overjoyed,

analyzed: pramudita cittaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā tikramya sthitam

translated: The Brahmin Samudrarena covered him with divine silk garments and said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa

analyzed: śobhanam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have made an excellent aspiration.

analyzed: na bhūyas tvayā mama upasthānam kartavyam
translated: You should not serve me again.

analyzed: yathā sukham eva viharasva
translated: Dwell happily!

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyaitadabhavat mayā bahavaḥ prāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni /🔽yathedaṃ KpSū
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya etat abhavat mayā bahavaḥ prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni  yathā idam kpsū
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu thought, “I have inspired many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of living beings to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: sarvāvantaṃ parṣadaṃ paśyāmi sarvaiścemairmahāsattvairudārodārāṇi praṇidhānāni kṛtāni
analyzed: sarvāvantam parṣadam paśyāmi sarvaiḥ ca imaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ udāra udārāṇi praṇidhānāni kṛtāni
translated: As I see this entire assembly, and as all these great beings have made vast and extensive aspirations,

original: prasannāni ca buddhakṣetrāṇi parigṛhītāni sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunānyairbodhisattvaiḥ
analyzed: prasannāni ca buddhakṣetrāṇi parigṛhītāni sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunā anyaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: and as they have chosen pure buddha-fields, except for Vayuviṣṇu and the other bodhisattvas,

analyzed: kali yugam parivarjitam
translated: and as they have avoided the Kaliyuga,

translated: I too, in the time of the Kaliyuga, will satisfy living beings with the taste of the Dharma.

analyzed: dṛdhaḥ ca vyavasāyaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: I must make my resolve firm.

original: tathārūpeṇa ca mayā praṇidhānena siṃhanādo naditavyaḥ /
analyzed: tathārūpeṇa ca mayā praṇidhānena siṃhanādaḥ naditavyaḥ
translated: I must make my aspiration roar like a lion,

analyzed: yathā iyam sarvā bodhisattva parṣad āścarya prāptā bhavet
translated: so that this entire assembly of bodhisattvas will be amazed.

original: sarvāvatī ceyaṃ parṣā sadevagandharvamāṇuṣāsuraśca loko 'yaṃ māṃ prāñjalībhūto namasyeta pūjāṃ ca kuryād /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca iyam parṣā sa deva gandharva māṇuṣa asuraḥ ca lokaḥ yam mām prāñjalībhūtaḥ namasyeta pūjām ca kuryāt
translated: And may this entire assembly, and the world with its gods, gandharvas, humans, and asuras, join their palms in respect and bow to me, and make offerings to me.”

original: ayaṃ ca me buddho bhagavān sādhukāramanuprayacchet vyākuryāt /
analyzed: ayam ca me buddhaḥ bhagavān sādhukāram anuprayacchet vyākuryāt
translated: And may this Buddha, the Blessed One, give his approval and predict (my enlightenment).

original: tathā ye ca daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti te 'pi buddhā bhagavanto mama siṃhanādaṃ nadataḥ
analyzed: tathā ye ca daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānām dharmam deśayanti te pi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama siṃhanādam nadataḥ  /
translated: Likewise, may those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who dwell and maintain themselves in the ten directions, teaching the Dharma to beings, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, give their approval to my lion's roar

analyzed: sādhukāram pradadyuḥ
translated: and proclaim it.

analyzed: vyākuryuḥ ca anutarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may they predict (my enlightenment) in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: dūtāṃśca preṣayeyuryat sarvāvatīyaṃ parṣat śṛṇuyāt tāṃśca dūtān paśyet /
analyzed: dūtān ca preṣayeyuḥ yat sarvāvatī iyam parṣad śṛṇuyāt tān ca dūtān paśyet
translated: And may they send messengers so that this entire assembly may hear and see those messengers.

original: ye 'pi ca tasyāṃ paścātkāle mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatā bodhisattvāste 'pyevaṃrūpaṃ kliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ mahākaliyugakāle bodhiṃ KpSū
analyzed: ye pi ca tasyām paścātkāle mahā karuṇā samanvāgatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ te pi evaṃrūpam kliṣṭam buddhakṣetram mahā kali yuga kāle bodhim
translated: And those Bodhisattvas who in the future will be endowed with great compassion, they too will accept such a troubled Buddha-field with a great Kali-age, with a prediction for enlightenment,

analyzed: praṇidhānena pratigṛhṇīyuḥ dharma durbhikṣa kāntāre kleśa oghaiḥ uhyamānān sattvān paritrāyeyuḥ
translated: and will rescue beings who are being carried away by the flood of afflictions in the wilderness of famine for the Dharma.

analyzed: buddha kāryam ca kuryuḥ
translated: And they will perform the Buddha's work.

analyzed: sattvānām dharmam deśayeyuḥ
translated: And they will teach the Dharma to beings.

original: yāvat parinirvṛtasyāpi me 'cintyāḥ kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrātikrānte daśasu dikṣvatulyebhyo
analyzed: yāvat parinirvṛtasya api me cintyāḥ kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra atikrānte daśasu dikṣu atulyebhyaḥ
translated: Even after my parinirvāṇa, countless eons, nayutas, hundreds of thousands of eons will have passed, and in the ten directions, incomparable,

analyzed: parimāṇebhyaḥ ca buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ parimāṇāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama parinirvṛtasya varṇam bhāṣeran
translated: “When I have passed into nirvāṇa, may countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas in worlds in the ten directions that are beyond measure and beyond thought, and in buddha realms that are beyond measure and beyond thought, proclaim my praises.

analyzed: yaśaḥ ca ghoṣam ca cārayeyuḥ
translated: May they cause my fame, renown, and glory to spread.

analyzed: bodhisattvānām ca agratas mama praṇidhāna netrīm udbhāvayeyuḥ
translated: May they proclaim my aspiration prayer in the presence of bodhisattvas.

original: te ca bodhisattvā mama karuṇāparibhāvitādhiṣṭānaṃ praṇidhānaṃ śrutvā paramāścaryaprāptā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ mama karuṇā paribhāvita adhiṣṭānam praṇidhānam śrutvā parama āścarya prāptāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: May those bodhisattvas, having heard my aspiration prayer, which is suffused with compassion, be astonished.

analyzed: te pi sattvebhyaḥ mahā karuṇām sarjayeyuḥ
translated: May they generate great compassion for beings.

original: tataśca te evaṃrūpaṃ eva praṇidhānaṃ pratigṛhṇīyuryathāhametarhi pratigṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: tatas ca te evaṃrūpam eva praṇidhānam pratigṛhṇīyuḥ yathā aham etarhi pratigṛhṇāmi
translated: May they then adopt an aspiration prayer that is just like the one that I have now adopted.

analyzed: te pi evaṃrūpe kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ
translated: May they attain enlightenment in a buddha realm that is just like this, which is afflicted in this way.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ oghaiḥ sattvān pratyuhyamānān uttārayeyuḥ
translated: May they liberate beings who are swept away by the four rivers.

analyzed: tribhiḥ ca yānaiḥ vinayeyuḥ
translated: May they guide them with the three vehicles.

analyzed: yāvat nirvāṇa pathe sthāpayeyuḥ
translated: May they establish them on the path to nirvāṇa.”

original: evaṃrūpaṃ kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo agrapurohito mahākaruṇāparibhāvaṃ praṇidhānaṃ sarjayitvā /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ agra purohitaḥ mahā karuṇā paribhāvam praṇidhānam sarjayitvā
translated: In this way, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, having made this aspiration of great compassion,

original: ekāṃśaṃ cīvaraṃ prāvṛtya yena ratnagarbhastathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmati KpSū sma /
analyzed: eka aṃśam cīvaram prāvṛtya yena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: put on his upper robe over one shoulder, and approached the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahudevakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi gaganatale divyāni tūryakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi vādyanti puṣpavṛṣṭiśca pravarṣitā /

translated: At that time, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of devas in the sky played hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of divine musical instruments, and a rain of flowers fell.

analyzed: eka kaṇṭhena ca udāharanti
translated: With one voice they said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa

analyzed: upasaṃkrama tvam bhagavataḥ sakāśam
translated: Go to the Blessed One.

analyzed: gṛhṇa tvam pravara praṇidhānam
translated: Take the best aspiration.

original: kleśavyākule loke praśamayiṣyasi duḥkhaskandhaṃ sattvānāṃ jñānatoyena praśamayiṣyasi /
analyzed: kleśa vyākule loke praśamayiṣyasi duḥkha skandham sattvānām jñāna toyena praśamayiṣyasi
translated: In the world afflicted by afflictions, you will extinguish the mass of suffering of beings with the water of knowledge.

original: sarvāvatī sā parṣatprāñjalībhūtā abhimukhā ekakaṇṭhena vadati /
analyzed: sarvāvatī sā parṣad prāñjalībhūtā abhimukhā eka kaṇṭhena vadati
translated: The entire assembly, with palms joined, turned towards him and with one voice said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: Good, good, good man!

analyzed: pravara paṇḍita asmākam hita kara kuruṣva dṛḍha praṇidhānam pravara buddhi mayam śṛṇomaḥ
translated: You are the best of the wise, you do what is beneficial for us. Make a firm aspiration, we will listen to it, which is full of the best wisdom.

original: purohitaścopasaṃkrāmati yadā ca nikṣiptaṃ purohitena bhagavataḥ sakāśe jānumaṇḍalaṃ /
analyzed: purohitaḥ ca upasaṃkrāmati yadā ca nikṣiptam purohitena bhagavataḥ sakāśe jānu maṇḍalam
translated: And when the priest places his knee-cap in front of the Blessed One,🔽to that extent this entire trichiliocosm, this entire Buddha-field of the Tathāgata, shakes, quakes, and trembles with a great quake.

original: tāvaccāyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ sarvāvatīdaṃ saṃtaraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ kaṃpati prakaṃpati calati pracalati kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati 🔽vedhati pravedhati /
analyzed: tāvat ca ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ sarvāvatī idam saṃtaraṇam buddhakṣetram kaṃpati prakaṃpati calati pracalati kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati  vedhati pravedhati
translated: It shudders, shudders violently,

analyzed: a ghaṭṭitāni tūryāni pravādyanti
translated: and unstruck musical instruments play.

original: ye ca mṛgapakṣiṇaste sarve manojñaṃ snigdhaṃ ca śabdamudīrayanti /
analyzed: ye ca mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ te sarve manojñam snigdham ca śabdam udīrayanti

analyzed: sama cittam upasthihi mātar iva jaga nitya anugṛhṇasi mitrar iva
translated: You attend with an impartial mind, like a mother, O Sage. You always help the world, like a friend, O Sage.
