analyzed: anuśāsanī prātihārya alaṅkṛtā yathāvat anuśāsanī pradāyakā
translated: Adorned with the miracle of instruction, they are givers of proper instruction.

analyzed: ṛddhi prātihārya alaṅkṛtāḥ catur ṛddhipāda parama pāramitā prāptāḥ
translated: Adorned with the miracle of psychic power, they have attained the supreme perfection of the four bases of psychic power.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna alaṅkṛtāḥ tathāgata guhya anupraviṣṭā
translated: Adorned with the consecration of all Tathāgatas, they have penetrated the secrets of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: dharma aiśvarya alaṅkṛtāḥ apara adhīna jñāna pratilabdhāḥ
translated: Adorned with sovereignty over the Dharma, they have attained knowledge that is not dependent on others.

analyzed: sarva kuśala dharma pratipatti sāra alaṅkṛtāḥ yathāvādi tathākāri sarvatas nava marditāḥ bhaveyuḥ iti
translated: Adorned with the essence of the practice of all wholesome dharmas, they are invincible in every way.

original: apramāṇāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ sattvānāmekapadavyāhāreṇāhaṃ mahatā kuśalaviśodhanasaṃnicayena saṃtarpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: apramāṇa asaṃkhyeyānām mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām sattvānām eka pada vyāhāreṇa aham mahatā kuśala viśodhana saṃnicayena saṃtarpayeyam
translated: With a single utterance, I would satisfy countless beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle with a great accumulation of purified wholesome actions.

analyzed: tatas te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarva dharmeṣu apara pratyaya jñānam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: Then those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas would attain knowledge that is not dependent on others regarding all dharmas.

analyzed: mahatā ca dharma avabhāsena samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They would be endowed with a great illumination of the Dharma.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ iti
translated: And they would quickly attain the highest complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: ye 'pi te bhadanta bhagavan sattvā bhaveyuranyeṣu lokadhātuṣvānantaryakārakā yāvanmūlāpattisāparādhikā
analyzed: ye pi te bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat mūla āpatti sa aparādhikā
translated: Those beings, Venerable Blessed One, who in other world systems have committed the crimes with immediate retribution, up to those who have committed root downfalls,

original: dagdhasantānāḥ śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vā anuttaramahāyānikā vā praṇidhānavaśena
analyzed: dagdha santānāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā anuttara mahā yānikāḥ vā praṇidhāna vaśena
translated: whose mind-streams are burned, whether they are of the Śrāvakayāna, Pratyekabuddhayāna, or unsurpassed Mahāyāna, by the power of their vows,

analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: may be reborn in my Buddha-field.

original: akuśalamūlasamavadhānā rukṣāḥ pāpecchāḥ KpSū 🔽krūrakhaṭuṅkasantānā viparītabuddhaya āgṛhītasantānāḥ teṣāṃ cāhaṃ caturaśītiścittarutasahasrāṃ deśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: akuśala mūla samavadhānāḥ rukṣāḥ pāpa icchāḥ  krūra khaṭuṅka santānāḥ viparīta buddhayaḥ āgṛhīta santānāḥ teṣām ca aham caturaśītiḥ citta ruta sahasrām deśayeyuḥ
translated: Those who are bound to the roots of non-virtue, who are harsh, of evil desire,🔽of rough and agitated mind-streams, of perverted understanding, of grasped mind-streams, for them I would teach the eighty-four thousand mental purities.

original: yāvat kuśīdacittānāṃ sattvānāmahaṃ caturaśītidharmaskandhasahasrāṇi vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat kuśīdacittānām sattvānām aham caturaśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi vistareṇa deśayeyam
translated: For those beings of lazy mind, I would teach in detail the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā anuttaramahāyānikā bhaveyuḥ teṣāṃ cāhaṃ vistareṇa ṣaṭpāramitādharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ anuttara mahāyānikāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām ca aham vistareṇa ṣaṣ pāramitā dharmam deśayeyam
translated: Those beings there who would be of the unsurpassed Mahāyāna, for them I would teach in detail the Dharma of the six perfections.

original: dānapāramitāṃ vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāṃ vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitām vistareṇa deśayeyam yāvat prajñāpāramitām vistareṇa deśayeyam
translated: I would teach in detail the perfection of generosity, up to I would teach in detail the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye ca punastatra sattvāḥ śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca punar tatra sattvāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those beings there who would be in the Śrāvakayāna or the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

analyzed: an avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: who would not have planted the roots of virtue,

analyzed: śāstāra abhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: who would desire a teacher,

analyzed: tān ca aham triśaraṇa gamanena vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the threefold refuge.

original: paścāt pāramitāsu niyojayeyaṃ /🔽vihiṃsāratānāṃ prānātipātavairamaṇyāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /🔽viṣamalobhābhibhūtānāmadattādānavairamaṇyāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: paścāt pāramitāsu niyojayeyam  vihiṃsā ratānām prāna atipāta vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam  viṣama lobha abhibhūtānām adatta ādāna vairamaṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: Afterwards I would engage them in the perfections.🔽I would establish those who delight in violence in refraining from killing.🔽I would establish those overwhelmed by unjust greed in refraining from taking what is not given.

analyzed: adharma rāga raktām kāma mithyā ācāra vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam  paraspara paruṣa vacana bhāṣiṇaḥ mṛṣāvāda vairamaṇyām kpsū  vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish those passionate with unrighteous lust in refraining from sexual misconduct.🔽I would establish those who speak harsh words to each other in refraining from false speech.

analyzed: unmatta abhiratān surā maireya madya pramāda vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish those who delight in intoxication in refraining from intoxicating drinks.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ sarvapañcadoṣā bhaveyustāṃ pañcadoṣavairamaṇyopāsakasaṃvare vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām sarva pañca doṣāḥ bhaveyuḥ tām pañca doṣa vaira maṇya upāsaka saṃvare vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: And those beings who would have all five faults, I would establish them in the lay follower's restraint with the five precepts.

original: ye sattvā anabhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu tāṃścāhaṃ rātriṃdivasamaṣṭāṅge śīle pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ an abhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu tān ca aham rātriṃdivasam aṣṭa aṅge śīle pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Those beings who are not devoted to wholesome dharmas, I would establish them in the eightfold noble path of the noble ones day and night.

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ parītta kuśala mūla abhirata cittāḥ tān ca api aham su ākhyāte dharma vinaye upaśleṣayeyam
translated: Those beings who delight in the roots of virtue that are limited, I would also bring them into the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

analyzed: pravrajyā saṃvare daśa śikṣā pade brahmacarye sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the ten precepts of the vow of going forth and in celibacy.

original: ye sattvāḥ kuśalān dharmān paryeṣṭukāmāstānapyahaṃ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu samādāpya sakale brahmacaryavāse pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ kuśalān dharmān paryeṣṭu kāmāḥ tān api aham kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu samādāpya sakale brahmacarya vāse pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Those beings who desire to seek wholesome dharmas, I would also inspire them in wholesome dharmas and establish them in the complete abode of celibacy.

original: evaṃrūpānāmānantaryakārakānāṃ yāvad āgṛhītasantānānāṃ sattvānāmarthe cāhaṃ bahuvividhanānārthapadavyañjanaprātihāryairdharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpānām ānantarya kārakānām yāvat āgṛhīta santānānām sattvānām arthe ca aham bahu vividha nānā artha pada vyañjana prātihāryaiḥ dharmam deśayeyam
translated: For the sake of such beings as those who have committed the acts of immediate retribution, up to those whose minds are seized, I would teach the Dharma through various kinds of miracles with words and phrases.

analyzed: anitya duḥkha anātma śūnya skandha dhātu āyatanāni darśayeyam
translated: I would show them the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self.

original: kuśale kṣeme śive śānte 'bhayapure nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: kuśale kṣeme śive śānte bhayapure nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the wholesome, the secure, the auspicious, the peaceful, the city of fearlessness, and in nirvana.

original: evamahaṃ caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam aham caturṇām parṣadām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: In this way, I would teach the Dharma to the four assemblies of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers.

original: ye ca vādārthino bhaveyusteṣāṃ ahaṃ dharmavādaśāstraṃ prakāśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca vāda arthinaḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām aham dharma vāda śāstram prakāśayeyam
translated: And for those who would seek to debate, I would reveal the treatise on the Dharma of debate.

original: ye ca nābhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu teṣāṃ cāhaṃ KpSū
analyzed: ye ca na abhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu teṣām ca aham
translated: And for those who are not devoted to wholesome dharmas, I would point out to them

analyzed: vaiyāvṛtya karmāṇi nirdiśeyam
translated: the duties of service.

analyzed: svādhyāya abhiratānām eka aṃśena śūnyatām dhyāna vimukti gāminām nirdeśayeyam
translated: For those devoted to recitation, I would teach emptiness in one part, leading to meditation and liberation.

analyzed: ekaikasya sattvasya arthāya aham bahu yojana śata sahasrāṇi pradbhyām gaccheyam
translated: For the sake of each being, I would go on foot for many hundreds of thousands of yojanas.

analyzed: bahu vividha nānā prakāra artha pada vyañjana upāya prātihāryaiḥ akhedam utsaheyam
translated: With many various kinds of meanings, words, and syllables, I would be able to bear the non-exhaustion through the display of skillful means.

analyzed: yāvat nirvāṇe sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them up to nirvāṇa.

analyzed: yāvat samādhāna balena aham pañcama bhāgam āyuḥ saṃskārāṇām avasṛjeyam
translated: Up to the power of concentration, I would give up five parts of the life-formations.

analyzed: parinirvāṇa kāla samaye ca aham svayam eva sva śarīra sarṣapa phala pramāṇa mātram bhindeyam
translated: At the time of parinirvāṇa, I would myself break my body into the size of a mustard seed.

analyzed: sattvānām kāruṇya arthe ca aham paścāt parinirvāpayeyam
translated: And for the sake of compassion for beings, I would later attain parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me varṣa sahasram saddharmaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for a thousand years after my parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma would remain.

analyzed: pañca punar varṣa śatāni saddharma pratirūpakaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for five hundred years after that, a counterfeit of the true Dharma would remain.

original: ye ca sattvā mama parinirvṛtasya śarīreṣu pūjautsukyamāpadyeyū ratnairyāvadvādyairantaśa ekabuddhanāmaikavandanā ekapradakṣinīkaraṇena ekāñjalikarmaṇā
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mama parinirvṛtasya śarīreṣu pūjā autsukyam āpadyeyuḥ ratnaiḥ yāvat vādyaiḥ antaśas eka buddha nāma eka vandanāḥ eka pradakṣinīkaraṇena eka añjali karmaṇā  /
translated: And those beings who, after my parinirvāṇa, would be eager to worship my relics with jewels up to musical instruments, even by offering a single Buddha name, a single act of homage, a single circumambulation, a single act of joining the palms,

analyzed: eka puṣpeṇa pūjām kurvīran
translated: or by worshipping with a single flower,

analyzed: sarve te vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ yathā abhiprāyāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ
translated: all of them would become irreversible from the three vehicles according to their aspirations.

original: ye ca sattvā mama parinirvṛtasya śāsane 'ntaśa ekaśikṣāpadamapi gṛhṇīyuryathoktaṃ samādāya varteyuryāvaccatuṣpadagāthāṃ paryavāpnuyurvācayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mama parinirvṛtasya śāsane eka śikṣā padam api gṛhṇīyuḥ yathā uktam samādāya varteyuḥ yāvat catuṣpada gāthām paryavāpnuyuḥ vācayeyuḥ
translated: And those beings who, in my teaching after my parinirvāṇa, would take up even a single precept as taught, and would practice accordingly, up to those who would master and recite a four-line verse,

analyzed: pareṣām ca deśayeyuḥ
translated: and would teach it to others,

analyzed: ye pi śṛṇuyuḥ cittam
translated: and those who would hear it and rejoice in their minds,

original: vā prasādayeyurdharmabhāṇakasya vā pūjāṃ kuryurantaśa ekapuṣpeṇāpi ekavandanenāpi /
analyzed: vā prasādayeyuḥ dharma bhāṇakasya vā pūjām kuryuḥ antaśas eka puṣpeṇa api eka vandanena api
translated: or would make an offering to the Dharma teacher, even with a single flower or a single act of homage,

analyzed: sarve te vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ yathā abhiprāyā
translated: all of them would become irreversible from the three vehicles according to their aspirations.

original: yāvat saddharme 'ntarhite saddharmolkāyāṃ nirvāpitāyāṃ dharmadhvaje patite te ca
analyzed: yāvat saddharme ntarhite saddharma ulkāyām nirvāpitāyām dharma dhvaje patite te ca
translated: Until the true Dharma has disappeared, until the torch of the true Dharma has been extinguished, until the Dharma banner has fallen, and until the true Dharma has disappeared,

original: mama janmaśarīramavatareyuryāvat kāñcanacakre tiṣṭheyuryasmin kāle sahe buddhakṣetre
analyzed: mama janma śarīram avatareyuḥ yāvat kāñcana cakre tiṣṭheyuḥ yasmin kāle sahe buddhakṣetre
translated: may they descend into my birth body and remain on the golden wheel until that time when in the Buddha-field of Saha

original: ratnadurbhikṣaṃ bhavet tasmin samaye ketumatirnāma maṇivaiḍuryamayaṃ agninirbhāsaṃ tiṣṭhet /
analyzed: ratna durbhikṣam bhavet tasmin samaye ketumatiḥ nāma maṇi vaiḍurya mayam agni nirbhāsam tiṣṭhet
translated: there is a famine of jewels, at that time a jewel called Ketumatī, made of beryl and shining like fire, will appear.

original: tacca tato 'bhyudgamyorddhvaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavane sthitvā vividhāṃ puṣpavṛṣṭiṃ pravarṣet /🔽māndāravamahāmāndāravapārijātakamañjuṣakamahāmañjuṣakarocamahārocamānapūrṇācandravimalāśatapatrasahasrapatraśatasahasrapatrasamantaprabhāsamantagandhāsurucirasadāphalāhṛdayanayanābhiramyājyotiprabhājyotirasānantavarṇānantagandhānantaprabhānāṃ
analyzed: tat ca tatas bhyudgamya ūrddhvam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavane sthitvā vividhām puṣpa vṛṣṭim pravarṣet  māndārava mahāmāndārava pārijātaka mañjuṣaka mahāmañjuṣaka roca mahārocamāna pūrṇā candra vimalā śatapatra sahasrapatra śatasahasrapatra samantaprabhā samantagandhā surucira sadāphalā hṛdayanayana abhiramyā jyotiprabhā jyotirasā anantavarṇā anantagandhā anantaprabhānām
translated: And having risen up from there, it will remain above, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, and will rain down various flower showers.🔽It will rain down showers of flowers such as māndārava, mahāmāndārava, pārijātaka, mañjuṣaka, mahāmañjuṣaka, rocam, mahārocam, pūrṇacandra, vimalā, śatapatra, sahasrapatra, śatasahasrapatra, samantप्रभास, समन्तगन्ध, सुरुचिर, सदाफल, हृदयनयनाभिरम्या, ज्योतिप्रभा, ज्योतिरसा, अनन्तवर्ण, अनन्तगन्ध, अनन्तप्रभा,

analyzed: kpsū
translated: Kṣaṇa

analyzed: evaṃrūpānām puṣpa varṣam abhipravarṣet
translated: it will rain down such flower showers.

original: tataśca puṣpavarṣādvividhā śabdā niścareyustadyathā buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabda
analyzed: tatas ca puṣpa varṣāt vividhā śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ tat yathā buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabda
translated: And from that rain of flowers, various sounds would come forth, namely the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha,

analyzed: upāsaka saṃvara śabdaḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga samanvāgata upoṣadha upavāsa śabdaḥ daśa pravrajyā śikṣā pada saṃvara śabdaḥ
translated: the sound of the lay devotee's precepts, the sound of the eightfold noble path, the sound of the Upavāsa fast, the sound of the ten precepts for going forth,

analyzed: dāna śabdaḥ śīla śabdaḥ sakala brahmacarya paripūrṇa upasaṃpadā śabdaḥ vaiyāvṛtti śabdaḥ dhyayana śabdaḥ
translated: the sound of giving, the sound of morality, the sound of the complete fulfillment of the pure life, the sound of ordination, the sound of service, the sound of study,

analyzed: pratisaṃlayana śabdaḥ yoni śomanasikāra śabdaḥ śubha śabdaḥ āna apāna smṛti śabdaḥ
translated: the sound of meditative seclusion, the sound of proper mental attention, the sound of impurity, the sound of mindfulness of breathing, the sound of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,

analyzed: ākiñcanya āyatana śabdaḥ vijñāna ānantya āyatana śabdaḥ ākāśa ānantya āyatana śabdaḥ bhibhava āyatana śabdaḥ
translated: the sound of the sphere of nothingness, the sound of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sound of the sphere of infinite space, the sound of the sphere of subjugation,

analyzed: kṛtsna āyatana śabdaḥ śamatha vipaśyanā śabdaḥ śūnyatā praṇihita śabdaḥ nimitta śabdaḥ pratītyasamutpāda śabdaḥ
translated: the sound of the sphere of totality, the sound of tranquility and insight, the sound of emptiness, the sound of wishlessness, the sound of signlessness, the sound of dependent origination,

analyzed: sakala śrāvaka piṭaka śabdaḥ ca niścaret
translated: and the sound of the entire canon of the disciples would come forth.

analyzed: sakala pratyekabuddha yānapiṭaka śabdaḥ niścaret
translated: The sound of the entire canon of the Solitary Buddhas' Vehicle would come forth.

analyzed: sakala mahāyāna kathā ṣaṣ pāramitā śabdaḥ te puṣpāḥ avakireyuḥ
translated: The sound of the six perfections, the entire Mahāyāna discourse, would be scattered as those flowers.

original: sarve ca rūpāvacarā devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ KpSū
analyzed: sarve ca rūpa avacarāḥ devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ kpsū
translated: And all the gods in the form realm would hear it.

analyzed: svaka svakāni pūrva kṛtāni kuśala mūlāni anusmareyuḥ
translated: They would remember their own individual roots of virtue created in the past.

original: sarvakuśaleṣu dharmeṣu mahāsattvā ajugupsanīyāste tato 'vatareyuḥ sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyāṃ daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu niyojayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
analyzed: sarva kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu mahāsattvāḥ a jugupsanīyāḥ te tatas vatareyuḥ sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyām daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu niyojayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
translated: Those great beings, who are not to be despised in all wholesome dharmas, would descend from there and all in the Sahā world system would be directed and established in the ten wholesome courses of action by humans.

original: evameva sarve kāmāvacarā devāḥ śṛṇuyusteṣāṃ ca tṛṣṇāsaṃyojanaratikrīḍāsaumanasyābhiratāṃścittacaitasikāṃ sarvān praśrambhayeyuḥ /
analyzed: evam eva sarve kāmāvacarāḥ devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ teṣām ca tṛṣṇā saṃyojana rati krīḍā saumanasya abhiratān citta caitasikām sarvān praśrambhayeyuḥ
translated: In the same way, all the gods in the desire realm would hear it, and their minds and mental factors of attachment, bondage to craving, delight, play, and mental satisfaction would be completely pacified.

analyzed: te sarve svakāni pūrva kṛtāni kuśala mūlāni anusmareyuḥ
translated: They would all remember their own individual roots of virtue created in the past.

original: te ca devalokādavatīrya sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyāṃ daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca deva lokāt avatīrya sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyām daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
translated: And having descended from the god realms, all of them would encourage and establish humans in the Sahā world system in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: te ca puṣpā ākāśe vividhā ratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca puṣpāḥ ākāśe vividhāḥ ratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: And those flowers would appear in the sky as various jewels.

analyzed: tat yathā bhadanta bhagavan rūpya hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa rajata jātarūpa aśmagarbha dakṣiṇāvartāḥ
translated: For example, Blessed One, silver, gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, silver, natural gold, onyx, and right-turning shells.

original: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpāṃ ratnavṛṣṭiṃ abhipravarṣeyuḥ /🔽sarve ca sahe buddhakṣetre kalikalahavivādadurbhikṣarogaparacakraparuṣavāgrukṣaviṣaṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ praśameyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpām ratna vṛṣṭim abhipravarṣeyuḥ  sarve ca sahe buddhakṣetre kali kalaha vivāda durbhikṣa roga para cakra paruṣa vāc rukṣa viṣam sarveṇa sarvam praśameyuḥ
translated: May all such a rain of jewels fall in the Sahā Buddha-field.🔽And may all quarrels, disputes, famines, diseases, invasions by foreign powers, harsh words, and poisons in the Sahā Buddha-field be completely pacified.

original: kṣemārogyā akalahābandhanavigrahāḥ subhikṣāḥ sarve sahe buddhakṣetre saṃsthiheyuḥ /
analyzed: kṣema ārogyāḥ a kalaha a bandhana vigrahāḥ subhikṣāḥ sarve sahe buddhakṣetre saṃsthiheyuḥ
translated: May the Sahā Buddha-field be established in peace, health, freedom from strife, bondage, and war, and in abundance.

original: KpSū yāni ca sattvāni tāni ratnāni paśyeyuḥ spṛśyeyuḥ upabhogakarma vā kurvīran
analyzed: yāni ca sattvāni tāni ratnāni paśyeyuḥ spṛśyeyuḥ upabhoga karma vā kurvīran
translated: Those beings who see those jewels, touch them, or use them

original: te sarve tribhiryānairavaivartyā bhaveyuste ca punaradho yāvat kāñcanacakre sthiheyurevameva
analyzed: te sarve tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartyāḥ bhaveyuḥ te ca punar adhas yāvat kāñcana cakre sthiheyuḥ evam eva
translated: may all of them become irreversible from the three vehicles. And moreover, may they be established below up to the golden wheel, just as

original: bhadanta bhagavan śastrāntarakalpakāle samaye punasta indranīlamaṇiratnāḥ saṃsthiheyurūrdhvaṃ
analyzed: bhadanta bhagavan śastra antara kalpa kāle samaye punar te indranīla maṇi ratnāḥ saṃsthiheyuḥ ūrdhvam
translated: Blessed One, at the time of the intermediate eon of weapons, may those sapphire jewels be established above

analyzed: yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryante
translated: up to the end of the Akaniṣṭha realm.

analyzed: sthitvā vividhām puṣpa vṛṣṭim abhipravarṣeyuḥ
translated: Having remained there, they would rain down various flowers.

original: tadyathā māndāravamahāmāndāravapāriyātrā yāvadevānantaprabhāstasmācca puṣpavarṣādvividhā manojñāḥ śabdā niścareyustadyathā buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ
analyzed: tat yathā māndārava mahāmāndārava pāriyātrāḥ yāvat eva ananta prabhāḥ tasmāt ca puṣpa varṣāt vividhāḥ manojñāḥ śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ tat yathā buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ
translated: Namely, the coral tree, great coral tree, and pāriyātra flowers, up to the endless light. And from that rain of flowers, various delightful sounds would emerge, namely the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma,

analyzed: saṅgha śabdaḥ yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: the sound of the Saṅgha, up to what was said before.

original: te punaḥ śarīrā adho yāvat kāñcanacakre sthiheyuḥ /
analyzed: te punar śarīrāḥ adhas yāvat kāñcana cakre sthiheyuḥ
translated: And those bodies would remain below up to the golden wheel.

original: evaṃ tasmiṃ samaye durbhikṣāntarakalpakāle punaste śarīrā ūrdhvamudgaccheyuryāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyantaṃ puṣpavṛṣṭiryāvat pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: evam tasmin samaye durbhikṣa antara kalpa kāle punar te śarīrāḥ ūrdhvam udgaccheyuḥ yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryantam puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: Thus at that time, during the famine-interval eon, those bodies would rise up again, up to the end of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and a rain of flowers would fall, up to what was said before.

analyzed: yāvat roga antara kalpam yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to the disease-interval eon, as was said before.

original: yathā bhadrake mahākalpe mama parinirvṛtasya śarīrāstṛkāryaṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: yathā bhadrake mahā kalpe mama parinirvṛtasya śarīra āstṛ kāryam kuryuḥ
translated: As in the Bhadrakalpa, after my parinirvāṇa, they would perform the duties of my body.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntān vaineyām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartikān sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish beyond count those to be trained in the three vehicles in the irreversible [state].

original: evaṃ pañcabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairmahākalpe vartamānairmama śarīrāḥ sattvān vineyustribhiryānairavaivartikāṃ sthāpayeyuḥ / yadā KpSū
analyzed: evam pañca buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ mahākalpe vartamānaiḥ mama śarīrāḥ sattvān vineyuḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartikām sthāpayeyuḥ yadā
translated: In this way, for as many great kalpas as there are atoms in the five buddha-fields, they would guide beings with their bodies, establish them in the three vehicles and in irreversibility.

original: paścāt sahasragaṅgānadīvālikāsamairasaṃkhyeyairatikrāntairdaśasu dikṣvaprameyairasaṃkhyeyairanyonyebhyo🔽lokadhātubhyaste buddhā bhagavanta utpadyeyurye mayā bodhisattvabhūtenānuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: paścāt sahasra gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ anyonyebhyaḥ  lokadhātubhyaḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ utpadyeyuḥ ye mayā bodhisattva bhūtena anuttarāyām
translated: When, after passing through asaṃkhyeyas equal to the sands of the Ganges river, in the ten directions, in immeasurable and incalculable other world systems,🔽those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, would appear, whom I, while being a Bodhisattva, while practicing the conduct for highest complete enlightenment,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau caryāṃ caratā prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ syuḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau caryām caratā prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ syuḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: first inspired and established in highest complete enlightenment,

original: mayā ca ṣaṭpāramitāsu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: mayā ca ṣaṣ pāramitāsu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ syuḥ
translated: and whom I inspired, introduced, and established in the six perfections,

original: bodhiprāptaścāhamapi sattvānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham api sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: and after attaining enlightenment, I would also inspire beings in highest complete enlightenment, introduce them, and establish them.

original: ye ca punaḥ parinirvṛtasya śarīravikurvaṇenāpi sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: ye ca punar parinirvṛtasya śarīra vikurvaṇena api sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And even after my parinirvāṇa, by the transformation of my body, I would inspire beings in highest complete enlightenment,

analyzed: cittam utpādayeyuḥ te pi paścāt sahasra gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ vartamānaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ daśasu
translated: They would generate the mind [for enlightenment] later, after innumerable eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River, in the present and past, in the ten

original: dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhā
analyzed: dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: directions, in immeasurable and innumerable world systems, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, would attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: mama varṇaṃ bhāṣyayeyuḥ śrāvayeyurghoṣaṃ codīrayeyuryacciraṃ bhadrako nāma kalpo babhūva /
analyzed: mama varṇam bhāṣyayeyuḥ śrāvayeyuḥ ghoṣam ca udīrayeyuḥ yat ciram bhadrakaḥ nāma kalpaḥ babhūva
translated: They would speak my praises, proclaim them, and utter a cry, saying, For a long time there was a kalpa named Bhadra.

original: tasmiṃśca bhadrake mahākalpe 'nupraviṣṭe caturthe jinabhāskara evaṃnāmā tathāgato babhūva /
analyzed: tasmin ca bhadrake mahā kalpe nupraviṣṭe caturthe jinabhāskaraḥ evaṃnāmā tathāgataḥ babhūva
translated: And in that Bhadra, the great kalpa, having entered the fourth, the sun of the victors, the Tathagata of that name, appeared.

original: yena vayaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā KpSū 🔽niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: yena vayam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā  niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: By whom we were first inspired, established, and settled in supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: dagdhasantānā akuśalasamavadhānagatā ānantaryakārakā yāvanmithyādṛṣṭikāstena vayaṃ ṣaṭpāramitāsu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: dagdha santānāḥ akuśala samavadhāna gatāḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat mithyādṛṣṭikāḥ tena vayam ṣaṣ pāramitāsu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: With our continuums burned, having come together with the unwholesome, having committed the acts of immediate retribution, up to having wrong views, by him we were inspired, established, and settled in the six perfections.

original: yena vayametarhi sarvajñāḥ sarvākāradhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayāmaḥ /
analyzed: yena vayam etarhi sarvajñāḥ sarva ākāra dhārmikam dharma cakram pravartayāmaḥ
translated: By whom we now, being omniscient, turn the Dharma wheel with all aspects and in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nirvarte tu gaticakre bahusattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrān svarge mokṣaphale ca pratiṣṭhāpayāmaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: nirvarte tu gati cakre bahu sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrān svarge mokṣa phale ca pratiṣṭhāpayāmaḥ syuḥ
translated: But when the wheel of rebirth is set in motion, we establish many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings in the fruit of heaven and liberation.

original: ye ca sattvā bodhyarthikāsteṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ sakāśe mama varṇakīrtiyaśaśca śṛṇuyuste taṃ tathāgataṃ pṛccheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ bodhi arthikāḥ teṣām tathāgatānām sakāśe mama varṇa kīrti yaśaḥ ca śṛṇuyuḥ te tam tathāgatam pṛccheyuḥ
translated: And those beings who are intent on enlightenment, having heard my praise, fame, and glory in the presence of those Tathāgatas, would ask that Tathāgata:

original: kamarthavaśaṃ sampaśyamānaḥ sa bhagavāṃstathāgata evaṃ pañcakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāne 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: kam artha vaśam sampaśyamānaḥ sa bhagavān tathāgataḥ evam pañca kaṣāye kali yuge vartamāne nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: What purpose did the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, see, that he attained supreme perfect enlightenment in this time of the five degenerations and the kali-age?

original: te ca tathāgatāsteṣāṃ bodhyarthikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā imaṃ mama mahākaruṇāsamanvāgataṃ
analyzed: te ca tathāgatāḥ teṣām bodhyarthikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā imam mama mahā karuṇā samanvāgatam
translated: And those Tathāgatas would explain to those sons and daughters of good family who are intent on enlightenment my great compassion,

original: prathamacittotpādaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ praṇidhānapūrvayogaṃ ca bhāṣeyuste ca
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham praṇidhāna pūrva yogam ca bhāṣeyuḥ te ca
translated: my first production of the thought of enlightenment, the array of qualities of the Buddha-field, and the former practice of vows. And those

original: bodhyarthikāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā āścaryaprāptā bhaveyuste 'pyudārādhimuktikā
analyzed: bodhyarthikāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā āścarya prāptāḥ bhaveyuḥ te pi udāra adhimuktikā
translated: sons and daughters of good family who are intent on enlightenment would be astonished. They would also have lofty aspirations.

original: bhaveyuste 'pyevaṃrūpāṃ mahākaruṇāṃ sattveṣūtpādayeyurevaṃrūpaṃ ca praṇidhānaṃ kurvīran /
analyzed: bhaveyuḥ te pi evaṃrūpām mahā karuṇām sattveṣu utpādayeyuḥ evaṃrūpam ca praṇidhānam kurvīran
translated: They would also produce such great compassion for beings and make such vows.

original: evaṃrūpe tīvrapañcakaṣāye kleśakaṣāye kaliyuge buddhakṣetre ānantaryakārakāṃ yāvadakuśalasamavadhānāṃ vaineyāṃ KpSū
analyzed: evaṃrūpe tīvra pañca kaṣāye kleśa kaṣāye kali yuge buddhakṣetre ānantarya kārakām yāvat akuśala sama vadhānām vaineyām
translated: In such a world realm with five degenerations, in an age of strife with afflictions as the sixth degeneration, they would accept those disciples who commit the crimes with immediate retribution up to those who are unskillful,

original: pratigṛhṇīyuste ca buddhā bhagavantastān mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatāṃ bodhyarthikāṃ kulaputrān
analyzed: pratigṛhṇīyuḥ te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tān mahā karuṇā samanvāgatām bodhyarthikām kula putrān
translated: and those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, would accept those sons of good family or daughters of good family endowed with great compassion who are seeking enlightenment,

original: vā kuladuhitṝn vā evaṃrūpeṇa vyākareṇana vyākuryuryathābhiprāyāṃ taiḥ kulaputraiḥ
analyzed: vā kula duhitṝn vā evaṃrūpeṇa vyākareṇana vyākuryuḥ yathā abhiprāyām taiḥ kula putraiḥ
translated: and would prophesy them with such a prophecy as they had intended.

original: kuladuhitṛbhirvā tīvrapañcakaṣāye kleśe kaliyuge praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā tīvra pañca kaṣāye kleśe kali yuge praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Those sons of good family or daughters of good family had made a vow in an age of strife with five degenerations and afflictions.

original: apare buddhā bhagavanto mama śarīravivartanebhiḥ pūrvayogaiḥ sattvānāṃ bodhyarthikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā vistareṇa bhāṣayeyuḥ /
analyzed: apare buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama śarīra vivartanebhiḥ pūrva yogaiḥ sattvānām bodhyarthikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā vistareṇa bhāṣayeyuḥ
translated: Other Buddhas, Blessed Ones, would speak in detail about my previous lives and the turning of my body, for the sake of those sons of good family or daughters of good family who seek enlightenment for beings.

analyzed: evam ciram evaṃnāmā jina sūryaḥ babhūva
translated: Thus, for a long time, the Jina Sun was named so-and-so.

original: parinirvṛtasya śarīrebhirevaṃ ciramevaṃrūpaṇāṃ duḥkhitānāṃ sattvānāmarthāya evaṃrūpāṇi
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya śarīrebhiḥ evam ciram evaṃrūpaṇām duḥkhitānām sattvānām arthāya evaṃrūpāṇi
translated: For the sake of those suffering beings, for a long time, with the bodies of the one who has attained final nirvana, he manifested such forms as these.

original: vividhāni prātihāryāṇi vividhā ca nānāprakārā vikurvaṇākṛtāstasya śarīravikurvaṇābhirvayaṃ🔽prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃcoditāḥ /
analyzed: vividhāni prātihāryāṇi vividhā ca nānā prakārāḥ vikurvaṇā kṛtāḥ tasya śarīra vikurvaṇābhiḥ vayam  prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃcoditāḥ
translated: We were first inspired towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by the various miracles and various kinds of transformations that he performed with his body.

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vayaṃ kuśalamūlasamavadhānān prathamacittotpādādidaṃ pāramitāsu codyogaḥ kṛtaḥ /🔽yāvadyathā pūrvoktaṃ vistareṇa /🔽atha khalu samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo 'grapurohito ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ sadevagandharvamānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ imāṃ mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatāṃ
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vayam kuśala mūla samavadhānān prathama citta utpādāt idam pāramitāsu ca udyogaḥ kṛtaḥ  yāvat yathā pūrva uktam vistareṇa  atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gra purohitaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sa deva gandharva mānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ imām mahā karuṇā samanvāgatām
translated: We were first inspired towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by the connection with the roots of virtue, and from the arising of the first thought, we made this effort in the perfections, as has been said before in detail.

original: pañcaśatāni praṇidhānāni KpSū 🔽kṛtavān / sa evamāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā cāhamanāgate
analyzed: pañcaśatāni praṇidhānāni kpsū  kṛtavān saḥ evam āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā ca aham anāgate
translated: Then the brāhmaṇa Samudrarenu, the chief priest, in the presence of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and the people with devas, Gandharvas and humans, made these five hundred aspirations endowed with great compassion.

original: 'dhvani bhadarake kalpe tīvrakleṣe raṇakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāṇe 'ndhaloke 'nāyake
analyzed: dhvani bhadarake kalpe tīvra kleṣe raṇa kaṣāye kali yuge vartamāṇe ndha loke nāyake
translated: He said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then, in the future, in the Bhadrakalpa, when afflictions are intense, when the world is in a state of conflict and degeneration, when the Kali age is in progress, in a world without a leader, without a guide,

analyzed: pariṇāyake dṛṣṭi vyasana andhakāra prakṣipte loke ānantarya kārakānām yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: In a world where the guide has been cast into the darkness of the calamity of views, I will perform the immediate actions, up to what was said before.

original: yadi cāhaṃ śaktaḥ sakalamevaṃ buddhakāryaṃ niṣpādayituṃ yathā ca me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadi ca aham śaktaḥ sakalam evam buddha kāryam niṣpādayitum yathā ca me praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And if I am able to accomplish all this Buddha activity as I have made my vow,

analyzed: na ca visarāmi bodhau praṇidhānam
translated: and I do not abandon my vow for enlightenment,

analyzed: na ca anya kṣetre kuśala mūlam pariṇāmayāmi
translated: and I do not dedicate my roots of virtue to another field,

analyzed: evam eva bhadanta bhagavan vyavasāyam
translated: in the same way, Venerable Blessed One, I will strive.

original: na ca punarahaṃ anena kuśalamulena pratyekabuddhayānaṃ prārthayāmi /
analyzed: na ca punar aham anena kuśala mulena pratyekabuddha yānam prārthayāmi
translated: And I do not seek the Pratyekabuddha vehicle with this root of virtue,

original: na ca śrāvakayānaṃ prārthayāmi /🔽na devamanuṣyaloke rājatvaṃ prārthayāmi /
analyzed: na ca śrāvaka yānam prārthayāmi  na deva manuṣya loke rāja tvam prārthayāmi
translated: nor do I seek the Śrāvaka vehicle,🔽nor do I seek kingship in the world of gods and humans,

analyzed: na deva manuṣya loke aiśvaryam prārthayāmi
translated: nor do I seek sovereignty in the world of gods and humans,

analyzed: na pañca kāmaguṇa paribhoga artham
translated: nor for the enjoyment of the five sense pleasures,

analyzed: na deva upapattim prārthayāmi
translated: nor do I seek rebirth as a god,

analyzed: na gandharva asura yakṣa rākṣasa nāga garūḍa upapattim prāthayāmi
translated: nor do I seek rebirth as a gandharva, asura, yakṣa, rākṣasa, nāga, or garuḍa.

analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena upariṣṭhāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt dve śata sahasre buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramitvā
translated: At that time, from the upper direction, beyond two hundred thousand buddha-fields,

original: tatra saṃkusumitā nāma lokadhātustatra saṃkusumite buddhakṣetre prasphulitakusumavairocano
analyzed: tatra saṃkusumitā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra saṃkusumite buddhakṣetre prasphulita kusuma vairocanaḥ
translated: There is a world system called Saṃkusumita, and in that Saṃkusumita Buddha-field there is a Tathāgata named Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana,

original: nāma tathāgata yāvad buddho bhagavāṃstiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: nāma tathāgata yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: up to: a Buddha, a Blessed One, who abides and maintains himself.

analyzed: caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He teaches the Dharma to the four assemblies with the three vehicles.

original: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau prativasata /
analyzed: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau prativasata
translated: In that Buddha-field there were two Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas dwelling.

original: ekaḥ svaviṣayasaṃkopitaviṣayo nāma dvitīyo dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopito nāma bodhisattvastau dvau satpuruṣau prasphulitakusumavairocanaṃ tathāgataṃ 🔽pṛṣṭavantau /
analyzed: ekaḥ sva viṣaya saṃkopita viṣayaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopitaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ tau dvau sat puruṣau prasphulitakusumavairocanam tathāgatam  pṛṣṭavantau
translated: One was named Svaviṣayasaṃkopaviṣaya, and the second was named Dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopita. Those two good men asked the Tathāgata Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana,

original: ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya KpSū
analyzed: kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya
translated: What is the cause, Bhadanta Blessed One, what is the condition for the great earthquake to appear in the world,

analyzed: mahatyāḥ ca puṣpa vṛṣṭeḥ
translated: and for the great rain of flowers?

original: prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgata āha asti kulaputrādho diśīto buddhakṣetrāt
analyzed: prasphulita kusuma vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ āha asti kula putra adhas diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt
translated: The Tathāgata Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana said, There is, noble sons, below from this Buddha-field,

original: dve śatasahasre buddhakṣetrāṇāmatikramya tatra saṃtīraṇo nāma lokadhātustatra ratnagarbho
analyzed: dve śata sahasre buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramya tatra saṃtīraṇaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra ratnagarbhaḥ
translated: Two hundred thousand buddha-fields away from here, there is a world system called Saṃtīraṇa, where there is a buddha named Ratnagarbha,🔽

original: nāma tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavāṃstiṣṭhati dharmaṃ ca deśayati sma /🔽bahusattvakoṭyo vyākarotyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau bodhisattvaviṣayakṣetrasandarśanapraṇidhānaviṣayavyūhasamādhiviṣayadhāraṇīmukhaniryūhaṃ
analyzed: nāma tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tiṣṭhati dharmam ca deśayati sma  bahu sattva koṭyaḥ vyākaroti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bodhisattva viṣaya kṣetra sandarśana praṇidhāna viṣaya vyūha samādhi viṣaya dhāraṇī mukha niryūham
translated: Two hundred thousand buddha-fields away from here, in the world system called Investigating, there is a tathagata named Ratnagarbha, up to: a buddha, a bhagavat, who abides and teaches the Dharma.

analyzed: dharmaparyāyam bhāṣamāṇa
translated: He is prophesying many millions of beings to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, while teaching the Dharma discourse called The Array of the Domain of Bodhisattvas, the Display of the Domain of Vows, the Domain of Meditative Absorptions, and the Emanations of the Gateways of Dharanis.

original: ekaśca tatra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sa evaṃrūpaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: ekaḥ ca tatra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saḥ evaṃrūpam praṇidhānam kṛtavān
translated: And there, a certain great compassionate bodhisattva mahasattva had made such a vow.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā paribhāvitā vācā bhāṣitā
translated: He spoke with words permeated by great compassion.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇa nirdeśam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: The prediction and teaching of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the bodhisattva mahasattvas.

analyzed: yathārūpā praṇidhāna netrī udbhāvitā yathā bahu bodhisattva koṭībhiḥ buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The vow that was made in such a way, the display of the eye of the vow, as many millions of bodhisattvas made the vow for the buddha-field.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ vaineya sattvāḥ ca parigṛhītāḥ
translated: The qualities and arrays of the buddha-field, and the beings to be trained, were accepted.

original: sa caiko mahākaruṇāsamanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ sarvāvatiṃ parṣadamabhibhūya kliṣṭaṃ pañcakaṣāyaṃ kleśāraṇikaliyugaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ KpSū
analyzed: sa ca ekaḥ mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarvāvatim parṣadam abhibhūya kliṣṭam pañca kaṣāyam kleśa araṇi kali yugam buddhakṣetram
translated: And that one bodhisattva endowed with great compassion, outshining the entire assembly, in a Buddha-field afflicted with the five degenerations, with afflictions, with the Kali-age,

analyzed: parigṛhītam
translated: And that one bodhisattva endowed with great compassion, outshining the entire assembly, accepted a defiled buddha-field with five degenerations, an age of strife afflicted by afflictions.

original: sarve cānantaryakārakā yāvad akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasaṃtānā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha saṃtānāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: He accepted all the perpetrators of the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those whose mind-streams are burned by the roots of unwholesome actions, as his disciples.

original: sarvāvatīrca sā parṣā sadevagandharvāsuramānuṣaśca loko ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya
analyzed: sarvāvatīḥ ca sā parṣā sa deva gandharva asura mānuṣaḥ ca lokaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya
translated: The entire assembly, the world with its gods, gandharvas, asuras, and humans, having abandoned worship of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha,

original: pūjāmapahāya tasya mahākāruṇikasya pūjākarmaṇe udyuktāḥ pañcamaṇḍalena vanditvā prāñjalibhūtāḥ
analyzed: pūjām apahāya tasya mahā kāruṇikasya pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ pañca maṇḍalena vanditvā prāñjali bhūtāḥ
translated: were devoted to worshipping that Greatly Compassionate One. Having bowed with the five parts of the body, with palms joined

analyzed: sthitvā varṇam bhāṣante sma
translated: they stood and spoke praise.

original: sa ca mahāsattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣaṇṇo vyākaraṇaṃ śṛṇvānaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mahāsattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ vyākaraṇam śṛṇvānaḥ
translated: And that Great Being, seated in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, was listening to the prophecy.

original: yadā ca tena mahāsattvena tasya bhagavataḥ purato dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ nikṣiptaṃ tadā tena bhagavatā tathārūpaṃ smitaṃ prāviṣkṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadā ca tena mahāsattvena tasya bhagavataḥ puratas dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām nikṣiptam tadā tena bhagavatā tathārūpam smitam prāviṣkṛtam
translated: When that Great Being placed his right knee-cap on the ground in front of that Blessed One, then that Blessed One emitted a smile of that kind.

original: yadā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu mahāpṛthivī ṣaḍvikāraṃ calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kaṃpitā yāvat puṣpavṛṣṭiḥ
analyzed: yadā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu mahā pṛthivī ṣaṣ vikāram calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kaṃpitā yāvat puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ
translated: When in the worlds in the ten directions, equal to the atoms in a great buddha-field, the great earth shook in six ways, shook strongly, shook intensely, trembled, trembled strongly, trembled intensely, up to a rain of flowers

analyzed: pravarṣitā
translated: was poured down.

original: sarvebhyaśca tebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prabodhanārthaṃ /
analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ ca tebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prabodhana artham
translated: And from all those buddha-fields, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, for the sake of awakening,

analyzed: mahā kāruṇyā bodhisattva praṇidhāna caryā nidarśana artham
translated: out of great compassion, for the sake of showing the practice of bodhisattva vows,

original: bodhisattvā mahāsattvā buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamebhyo lokadhātubhyo daśabhyo digbhyastatra buddhakṣetre sannipatanārthaṃ /🔽bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ samādhānamukhanirdeśacaryāvaiśāradyaṃ🔽dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣaṇārthaṃ tena tathāgatenaivaṃrūpāṇi KpSū
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ tatra buddhakṣetre sannipatana artham  bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām samādhāna mukha nirdeśa caryā vaiśāradyam  dharmaparyāyam bhāṣaṇa artham tena tathāgatena evaṃrūpāṇi kpsū
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas from world systems equal to the atoms in a buddha-field in the ten directions gathered in that buddha-field.🔽For the sake of teaching the Dharma discourse called the Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas' Fearlessness in the Practice of the Door of Samādhis,🔽those kinds of

analyzed: prātihāryāṇi darśitāni
translated: miraculous manifestations were shown by that Tathāgata.

original: tau ca kulaputra dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau svaviṣayasaṃkopitaviṣayaśca dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopitaśca taṃ prasphulitakusumavairocanaṃ 🔽tathāgataṃ paripṛcchataḥ sma /
analyzed: tau ca kula putra dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau sva viṣaya saṃkopita viṣayaḥ ca dhāraṇī saṃpraharṣaṇa vikopitaḥ ca tam prasphulita kusuma vairocanam  tathāgatam paripṛcchataḥ sma
translated: Those two bodhisattva mahāsattvas, the one with the domain contracted to their own realm and the one with the domain expanded by dhāraṇī, asked the Tathāgata Prasbuddhakusumavairocana:

original: kiyaccirotpāditaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃstena mahākāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhāya cittaṃ /
analyzed: kiyat cira utpāditam bhadanta bhagavan tena mahā kāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhāya cittam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, how long ago did that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika generate the mind of awakening?

original: kiyacciraṃ vā sa mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhicārikāṃ cīrṇaṃ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram vā sa mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhi cārikām cīrṇam
translated: For how long has that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika practiced the conduct for awakening?

original: yena pañcakaṣāye loke tīvrakleśaraṇike kaliyuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhīta ānantaryakārakā yāvad akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasaṃtānā vaineyāḥ
analyzed: yena pañca kaṣāye loke tīvra kleśa raṇike kali yuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhītaḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha saṃtānāḥ vaineyāḥ
translated: By whom the time was taken in a world with five degenerations, in a time of fierce afflictions and troubles, in the Kali Yuga, and who took as disciples those who commit heinous acts, up to those whose continuums are burned by the roots of non-virtue and are bound to evil rebirths,

analyzed: parigṛhītāḥ
translated: and who were taken as disciples.

original: prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgata āha saṃprati kulaputra tena mahākāruṇikena prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaṃ /
analyzed: prasphulitakusumavairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ āha saṃprati kula putra tena mahā kāruṇikena prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: The Tathāgata Prasbuddhakusumavairocana said, Son of noble family, it is just now that the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika first generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: gacchata kulaputrā yūyaṃ santīraṇaṃ lokadhātuṃ tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: gacchata kula putrāḥ yūyam santi īraṇam lokadhātum tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: Go, sons of good family, to the world system Sāntīraṇa, to the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One.🔽

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya taṃ ca samādhānamukhanirdeśaṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya tam ca samādhāna mukha nirdeśam
translated: Go, sons of good family, to the world system called Sāntiranī, to see, to worship, to attend upon the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Ratnagarbha,

analyzed: caryā vaiśāradyam dharmaparyāyam śravaṇāya
translated: and to listen to the Dharma discourse called 'The Entrance Gate to the Samādhi'🔽and 'The Fearlessness of Practice,'

original: taṃ ca mahākāruṇikaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ mama vacanena pṛcchatha evaṃ ca vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: tam ca mahā kāruṇikam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam mama vacanena pṛcchatha evam ca vaktavyaḥ
translated: and ask that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika on my behalf, saying:

analyzed: prasphulitakusumavairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ tvām
translated: The Tathāgata Vairocana of the Blossoming Flower asks about you,

original: satpuruṣa pṛcchate candrarocavimalaṃ puṣpaṃ preṣitaṃ sādhukāraścānupradattaḥ /
analyzed: sat puruṣa pṛcchate candrarocavimalam puṣpam preṣitam sādhukāraḥ ca anupradattaḥ
translated: O good man, and sends you the moon-bright immaculate flower, and gives his approval.

original: evaṃ ca tvayā satpuruṣa prathamacittotpādena mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaḥ śabdenāpūritāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca tvayā sat puruṣa prathama citta utpādena mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ śabdena āpūritāḥ
translated: And thus, O good man, by your first production of the thought, with the utterance of great compassion, the worlds in the ten directions, as many as there are atoms in a Buddha-field, have been filled with your voice.

original: mahākaruṇāśabdaśca pratilabdhastena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śabdaḥ ca pratilabdhaḥ tena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu bhūyas
translated: And the sound of great compassion has been attained. Therefore, O good man, it is good that you should do it again.

original: paścimakānāṃ mahākaruṇāmahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa praṇidhānanetrīdhvajāmucchrepayasi /
analyzed: paścimakānām mahā karuṇā mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa praṇidhāna netrī dhvajām ucchrepayasi
translated: For the future bodhisattvas, the great beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle of great compassion, you raise the banner of the guide of vows with the proclamation of great compassion.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu bhūyastvaṃ satpuruṣa buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāgatā🔽asaṃkhyeyakalpabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā daśadiśa lokadhātavo yaśaḥkīrtiśabdenāpūritāstena
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu bhūyas tvam sat puruṣa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāna āgatā  asaṃkhyeya kalpa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ daśa diśaḥ lokadhātavaḥ yaśaḥ kīrti śabdena āpūritāḥ tena
translated: Therefore, good man, well done! You, good man, have inspired as many future bodhisattvas as there are atoms in a buddha-field🔽to set out for supreme perfect enlightenment. The ten directions of the world-realms, equal to the number of atoms in an incalculably many buddha-fields, have been filled with your fame, renown, and praise.

analyzed: tvam sat puruṣa bahu asaṃkhyeya sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Therefore, good man, you have inspired many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of incalculably many beings

analyzed: samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: to set out for supreme perfect enlightenment, to settle in it, and to establish themselves in it.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ sakāśam upanītā
translated: You have brought them into the presence of the Blessed One,

analyzed: a vaivartikāḥ ca sthāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and established them as irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: kaiścittatraiva bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānena buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ parigṛhītā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ svakaruṇāraśmibhirācchāditā / KpSū
analyzed: kaiścid tatra eva bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ sva karuṇā raśmibhiḥ ācchāditā
translated: Some of them, right there in the presence of the Blessed One, have taken up vows of aspiration and have accepted the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field, and have been covered with the rays of your own compassion, and have been inspired to set out for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ye tvayānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā na ca vyākaraṇapratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: ye tvayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ na ca vyākaraṇa pratilabdham
translated: Those whom you have inspired to highest genuine full Awakening, but who have not yet attained the prediction,

analyzed: te pi paścāt vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante
translated: they too will later attain the prediction.

analyzed: sarve te paścāt yāvat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ daśasu dikṣu
translated: All of them, later, for as many eons as there are atomic particles in a buddha-field, in the ten directions,

original: buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhatvaṃ prāpya dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ
analyzed: buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddha tvam prāpya dhārmikam dharmacakram
translated: in buddha-fields equal to the atomic particles of a buddha-field, having attained buddhahood, having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

analyzed: pravartayitvā tvām eva ārabhya varṇam bhāṣiṣyanti
translated: will speak praise, beginning with you.

original: etena tṛtīyena kāraṇena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu /
analyzed: etena tṛtīyena kāraṇena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu
translated: For this third reason, good man, you are good.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahubodhisattvakoṭya evamūcurvayamapi bhadanta bhagavaṃstatra saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre gacchema /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bahu bodhisattva koṭyaḥ evam ūcuḥ vayam api bhadanta bhagavan tatra saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre gacchema
translated: Then at that time many millions of bodhisattvas said, “We too, reverend Lord, will go to that Buddha-field of Sāgara,

original: tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: in order to see, to worship, to attend upon the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratna-garbha,

original: taṃ ca satpuruṣaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: tam ca sat puruṣam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: and to see that good man, in order to see, to worship, to attend upon him.”

translated: just as those Brahmins in the flower field, this great assembly of the Mahayana should be seen.

original: yathā sūryodgamanakāle pratyupasthite te puṣpā visaritā prasphulitā bhavanti tapanti virocanti kecidyojanaśatamuccatvena kecid yāvad yojanasahasramuccatvena /
analyzed: yathā sūrya udgamana kāle pratyupasthite te puṣpāḥ visaritā prasphulitāḥ bhavanti tapanti virocanti kecid yojana śatam ucca tvena kecid yāvat yojana sahasram ucca tvena
translated: Just as when the time for the rising of the sun is near, those flowers spread out and bloom, shining, warming, and illuminating, some up to a hundred yojanas in height, some up to a thousand yojanas in height,

analyzed: bahunām sattvānām vividha rogāḥ praśamanti
translated: and various illnesses of many beings are cured,

original: evameva satpuruṣāḥ tathāgato buddhasūryo loka udapādi /
analyzed: evam eva sat puruṣāḥ tathāgataḥ buddha sūryaḥ loke udapādi
translated: in the same way, O good man, when the Tathagata, the Buddha-sun, arose in the world,

original: yathā te puṣpāḥ sūryoditasya asya raśmibhirvikasitā bhāsanti
analyzed: yathā te puṣpāḥ sūrya uditasya asya raśmibhiḥ vikasitāḥ bhāsanti
translated: just as those flowers, when the sun rises, are opened by its rays and shine

analyzed: tapanti virocanti
translated: and warm,

analyzed: vividha roga upahatānām sattvānām roga upaśamaḥ bhavati
translated: the illnesses of beings afflicted with various illnesses are cured.

original: evamevāhaṃ satpuruṣa loka utpannaḥ sattvāṃ kāruṇyaraśmibhiḥ chādayitvā vikasitvā bhūyaḥ sattvāṃstriṣu puṇyakriyāvastuṣu niyojayāmi /
analyzed: evam eva aham sat puruṣa loke utpannaḥ sattvām kāruṇya raśmibhiḥ chādayitvā vikasitvā bhūyas sattvān triṣu puṇya kriyā vastuṣu niyojayāmi
translated: In the same way, O good man, I have arisen in the world, covering beings with the rays of compassion, opening them up, and further engaging beings in the three bases of meritorious action.

original: tvayāpyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveṣitāḥ
analyzed: tvayā api aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveṣitāḥ
translated: You have also inspired, established, and brought to maturity innumerable beings in unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: pratiṣṭhāpitā mama ca sakāśamupanītāstaiśca sattvairmama sakāśe svakasvakāni praṇidhānāni
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ mama ca sakāśam upanītāḥ taiḥ ca sattvaiḥ mama sakāśe svaka svakāni praṇidhānāni
translated: Those beings have made their own individual aspirations in my presence

analyzed: kṛtāni buddhakṣetrāṇi ca parigṛhītāni
translated: and have taken possession of buddha-fields.

analyzed: kecid pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ kecid apariśuddhāḥ
translated: Some have taken possession of pure buddha-fields, some of impure ones.

analyzed: tathā ca evam mayā vyākṛtāḥ
translated: And I have prophesied accordingly.

original: yaiḥ satpuruṣairmama sakāśāt pariśuddhā buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāstaiḥ śuddhāśayāḥ suvineyā avaruptakuśalamūlā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītā /
analyzed: yaiḥ sat puruṣaiḥ mama sakāśāt pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ taiḥ śuddha āśayāḥ su vineyāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Those good men who have taken possession of pure buddha-fields have taken possession of beings with pure intentions, who are well-disciplined, who have planted the roots of virtue, and who are to be trained.

analyzed: na te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ucyante
translated: Those are not called bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

analyzed: na ca teṣām mahāpuruṣa kāryam
translated: They do not have the work of great men.

analyzed: na ca teṣām mahā karuṇā citta caitasikeṣu pravartate
translated: And their great compassion does not operate in their minds and mental factors.

original: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ sarvasattvānāṃ karuṇārthāyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ paryeṣante /
analyzed: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ sarva sattvānām karuṇā arthāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim paryeṣante
translated: And those bodhisattvas do not seek unsurpassed and perfect awakening for the sake of compassion for all beings.

analyzed: ye pi te pariśuddham buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇanti
translated: And those who take possession of a pure buddha-field

analyzed: utsṛṣṭa kṛpāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas who abandon compassion.

analyzed: ye śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ parivarjitam buddhakṣetram ākāṅkṣanti
translated: Those who desire a buddha-field devoid of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ kuśala jñāna āśaya bhūtā
translated: Those bodhisattvas are not born from the intention of skillful knowledge.

original: yeṣāmevaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ yathā vayaṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhavarjitā akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatairmātṛgrāmairvivarjite
analyzed: yeṣām evam praṇidhānam kṛtam yathā vayam śrāvaka pratyekabuddha varjitāḥ akuśala mūla samavadhāna gataiḥ mātṛgrāmaiḥ vivarjite
translated: For those who have made the vow thus: Just as we, devoid of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, devoid of women who have gone to the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama,

analyzed: naraka tiryagyoni yama loka vivarjite buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām
translated: in a buddha-field free from the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, may we attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhaparivarjitāṃ śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām śrāvaka pratyekabuddha parivarjitām śuddhām mahāyāna kathām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: May I teach the pure Mahāyāna Dharma, the Mahāyāna discourse, to the bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham dīrgha āyuṣkaḥ bhaveyam cira sthāyī
translated: And when I attain enlightenment, may I have a long life, be long-lasting,

original: bahūni kalpāni śūddhāśayānāṃ suvinītānāṃ kuśalamūlasamavadhānagatānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bahūni kalpāni śūddha āśayānām su vinītānām kuśala mūla samavadhāna gatānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: and teach the Dharma for many eons to those of pure intention, those who are well-disciplined, and those who have gone to the roots of virtue.

analyzed: tena te bodhisattvāḥ na kuśala jñāna āśaya saṃbhūtā
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattvas are not born from the intention of skillful knowledge.

analyzed: na mahāsattvāḥ iti ucyate
translated: They are not called great beings.

analyzed: kpsū
translated: KPSū

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato bāhuṃ prasārayitvā pañcabhiraṅgulībhirnānāvarṇā anekavarṇā anekaśatasahasravarṇā raśmayaḥ prāmuñcan /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ bāhum prasārayitvā pañcabhiḥ aṅgulībhiḥ nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ aneka śata sahasra varṇāḥ raśmayaḥ prāmuñcan
translated: And that Ratnagarbha Tathāgata extended his arm with five fingers, and emitted rays of various colors, of many colors, of many hundreds of thousands of colors.

original: te gatvā raśmayo 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyā purimāyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrān avabhāsayitvā /
analyzed: te gatvā raśmayaḥ prameyā asaṃkhyeyā purimāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrān avabhāsayitvā
translated: Those rays went and illuminated immeasurable and countless buddha-fields in the eastern direction.

analyzed: tatra aṅguṣṭhāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: In that place, there was a world system called Aṅguṣṭhamātra.

original: tatrāṅguṣṭhāyāṃ lokadhātau daśavarṣāyuṣkā manuṣyā durvarṇā drohoḍimakā akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā aṅguṣṭhamātramuccatvena /
analyzed: tatra aṅguṣṭhāyām lokadhātau daśa varṣa āyuṣkāḥ manuṣyāḥ durvarṇāḥ droha uḍimakāḥ akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ aṅguṣṭha mātram ucca tvena
translated: In that world system called Aṅguṣṭhamātra, humans had a lifespan of ten years, were ugly, quarrelsome, engaged in unwholesome roots, and were only one aṅgula in height.

analyzed: tatra jyotīrasaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There was a Tathāgata named Jyotirasa, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: sa ca kaliyugapramāṇānāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ hastapramāṇena hastamekaṃ tathāgata ūrdhvatvena hastaśca /
analyzed: sa ca kali yuga pramāṇānām manuṣyāṇām hasta pramāṇena hastam ekam tathāgataḥ ūrdhva tvena hastaḥ ca
translated: And that Tathāgata, for humans whose measure was the Kali age, was one handspan in height according to the measure of the hand, and the Tathāgata was one handspan in height.

analyzed: aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām puruṣānām pramāṇena sapta aṅguṣṭhāni
translated: For humans who were one aṅgula in size, he was seven aṅgulas in size.

original: sa ca tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyati yāpayati caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ tribhiryānairdharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: sa ca tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyati yāpayati caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: And that Tathāgata abided, sustained, and caused to endure, teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies with the three vehicles.

original: atha khalu kulaputra tacca buddhakṣetraṃ tāṃśca manuṣyāṃstaṃ ca tathāgataṃ sarvāvatī ca sā parṣādrākṣīt /🔽ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha āha anena jyotīrasena tathāgatenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairatikrāntaiḥ prathamacittamutpāditamanuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra tat ca buddhakṣetram tān ca manuṣyān tam ca tathāgatam sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā adrākṣīt  ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ āha anena jyotīrasena tathāgatena aprameya asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ prathama cittam utpāditam anuttarāyām
translated: Then, noble sir, that buddha-field, those humans, and that Tathagata were seen by the entire assembly.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau kpsū
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, said, 'By the Tathagata Jyotiska, after immeasurable and countless eons have passed, the thought of highest complete enlightenment was first generated

analyzed: ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya agratas
translated: in the presence of the Tathagata Ratnachchhraya-abhyudgata-avabhasa.

analyzed: bahu prāṇa koṭī nayutāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni niveśitāni pratiṣṭhāpitāni
translated: Many thousands of millions of living beings were inspired, introduced, and established in highest complete enlightenment.

original: yathābhiprāyāṃ sattvaistasya tathāgatasya purataḥ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yathā abhiprāyām sattvaiḥ tasya tathāgatasya puratas praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In accordance with their aspirations, living beings made vows in the presence of that Tathagata.

original: kecidbuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ pariśuddhāḥ kecidapariśuddhāḥ pañcakaṣāyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: kecid buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ pariśuddhāḥ kecid apariśuddhāḥ pañca kaṣāyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: Some accepted the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field, some pure, some impure, some accepted the five corruptions.

original: tatra ca tena mahāsattvenāhaṃ samādāpito niveśitaścānuttarāyāṃ samyaksabodhau /
analyzed: tatra ca tena mahāsattvena aham samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ ca anuttarāyām samyaksabodhau
translated: And there, by that great being, I was inspired and introduced to highest complete enlightenment.

original: tatra ca mayā ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya purato 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānaṃ
analyzed: tatra ca mayā ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya puratas nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam
translated: And in the presence of the Tathāgata Ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsa, I made the vow for the adornment of the qualities of a buddha field in the five-hundred-year life-span, for the sake of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa ca me tathāgataḥ sādhukāramadāsīt vyākṛtaścāhamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sa ca me tathāgataḥ sādhukāram adāsīt vyākṛtaḥ ca aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And that Tathāgata applauded me and I was prophesied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yo 'sāvasmākaṃ bodhāya samādāyakaḥ kalyāṇamitro 'tīva satpuruṣastīvrapañcakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāne kāle pratikliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: saḥ asmākam bodhāya samādāyakaḥ kalyāṇa mitraḥ tīva sat puruṣaḥ tīvra pañca kaṣāye kali yuge vartamāne kāle pratikliṣṭam buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: That good friend who exhorted us to enlightenment, that most excellent man, in the age of strife with its fivefold degeneration, took possession of a buddha field that was afflicted.

analyzed: ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha santānāḥ saṃsāra aṭavī kāntāra saṅkaṭa prāptāḥ
translated: He took possession of disciples who were to be trained, who were committing the crimes with immediate retribution, who were in association with the roots of nonvirtue, whose continuums were burned, who had fallen into the dangerous wilderness of cyclic existence,

original: vaineyasattva praṇidhānaḥ parigṛhītastasya satpuruṣasya daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyebhyo🔽'nyonyalokadhātubhyastiṣṭhanto KpSū
analyzed: vaineya sattva praṇidhānaḥ parigṛhītaḥ tasya sat puruṣasya daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ  nyonya lokadhātubhyaḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ kpsū
translated: and who were from other immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions, who were abiding,

original: yāpayanto buddhā bhagavantaḥ sādhukāraṃ pradattavantaḥ preṣitavanto /
analyzed: yāpayantaḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sādhukāram pradattavantaḥ preṣitavantaḥ
translated: who were causing to last, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, gave their approval and sent them.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā vairocana saumyaḥ nāma kṛtam
translated: He was given the name Mahākaruṇāvairocanasaurabhya.

original: sa ca mahākaruṇāvairocanasaumyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'smākaṃ kalyāṇamitro hitakara etarhyacirābhisaṃbuddho 'ṅguṣṭhavatyāṃ lokadhātau aṅguṣṭhapramāṇānāṃ 🔽puruṣāṇāṃ madhye /
analyzed: sa ca mahā karuṇā vairocana saumyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ smākam kalyāṇa mitraḥ hita karaḥ etarhi acira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ ṅguṣṭhavatyām lokadhātau aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām  puruṣāṇām madhye
translated: And that great compassionate, radiant, gentle Bodhisattva Mahasattva, our spiritual friend and benefactor, has just now attained enlightenment in the world system called Anguṣṭhavatī, among people the size of a thumb.🔽Among those very people the size of a thumb, the height of that Tathagata is the size of a hand.

original: teṣāṃ evāṅguṣṭhapramāṇānāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ hastapramāṇena hastapramāṇakaḥ sa tathāgato daśavarṣāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartitavān /
analyzed: teṣām eva aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām puruṣāṇām hasta pramāṇena hasta pramāṇakaḥ sa tathāgataḥ daśa varṣa āyuṣkāyām prajāyām dhārmikam dharma cakram pravartitavān
translated: In a world where people live for ten years, he has turned the Dharma wheel of Dharma.

original: tasyāpi bodhiprāptasya daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyebhyo lokadhātubhyastiṣṭhadbhiryāpayadbhistaistairbuddhairbhagavadbhirdūtāḥ preṣitāḥ pūjanārthāya /
analyzed: tasya api bodhi prāptasya daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ tiṣṭhadbhiḥ yāpayadbhiḥ taiḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dūtāḥ preṣitāḥ pūjana arthāya
translated: When he attained enlightenment, messengers were sent by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, from immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions, who were abiding and living, for the purpose of worship.

original: ye tena prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye tena prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Those who were first inspired, introduced, and established by him in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ye tena prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāstairbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ
analyzed: ye tena prathamam dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: Those who were first inspired, introduced, and established by him in the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom, by those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,🔽and so on.

analyzed: pūrva kṛtajña tām anusmaraṇa māṇaiḥ tasya tathāgatasya puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ
translated: Remembering his previous gratitude, they sent flowers to that Tathāgata.

original: paśya brāhmaṇa yathā te buddhā bhagavataḥ sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dīrgheṇāyuṣā pariśuddhāśayānāṃ sukhavihāriṇāṃ sattvānāṃ buddhakāryaṃ KpSū
analyzed: paśya brāhmaṇa yathā te buddhāḥ bhagavataḥ sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dīrgheṇa āyuṣā pariśuddha āśayānām sukha vihāriṇām sattvānām buddha kāryam
translated: See, Brahmin, how those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in all the Buddha-fields, with a long lifespan, perform the Buddha's work for beings of pure intention who dwell in happiness.

original: kurvanti / sa ca jyotīrasastathāgata evaṃ pratikruṣṭe pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre buddhatvaṃ prāptavān /
analyzed: kurvanti sa ca jyotīrasaḥ tathāgataḥ evam pratikruṣṭe pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre buddha tvam prāptavān
translated: And that Tathāgata Jyotirāsa attained Buddhahood in such a despicable Buddha-field with the five degenerations.

original: ānantaryakārakānāṃ yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatānāṃ sattvānāmevālpakenāyuṣā bahvatirekaṃ buddhakāryaṃ karoti /
analyzed: ānantarya kārakānām yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatānām sattvānām eva alpakena āyuṣā bahu atirekam buddha kāryam karoti
translated: He performs the Buddha's work with a very long lifespan for beings who have committed the acts with immediate retribution, up to those who have the roots of non-virtue combined.

analyzed: an ujjhitvā śrāvakām pratyekabuddhān ca dharmam deśayari
translated: Without abandoning the Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas, he teaches the Dharma.

original: evameva tvayā satpuruṣa sarvāmimāṃ bodhisattvaparṣāmabhibhūya viśiṣṭataraṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva tvayā sat puruṣa sarvām imām bodhisattva parṣām abhibhūya viśiṣṭataram praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In the same way, good man, you have surpassed this entire assembly of Bodhisattvas and made a superior aspiration.

original: pratikruṣṭe buddhakṣetre pañcakaṣāye vartamāne ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: pratikruṣṭe buddhakṣetre pañca kaṣāye vartamāne ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: In a despicable Buddha-field, in the presence of the five degenerations, you have taken on disciples who have committed the acts with immediate retribution, up to those who have the roots of non-virtue combined.

original: ye ca te mahāsattvā yaiḥ pariśuddhā buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītā narakatiryagyoniparivarjitāḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhaparivarjitāḥ
analyzed: ye ca te mahāsattvāḥ yaiḥ pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ naraka tiryagyoni parivarjitāḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddha parivarjitāḥ
translated: And those great beings who have taken up purified buddha-fields, free from the destinies of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, free from śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

translated: It is just as,

translated: When you accepted as disciples those who commit the five heinous crimes up to those who have the roots of nonvirtue cut off, you accepted a buddha field with intense five degenerations.

original: mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa tvaṃ satpuruṣa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ sādhukāro datto /

translated: O good man, by your utterance of great compassion, the Buddhas, the World-Honored Ones, as numerous as atoms in the buddha-fields in the ten directions, have given you the approval.

analyzed: dūtāḥ ca preṣitā
translated: And messengers have been sent.

analyzed: mahā kāruṇikaḥ ca te nāma kṛtam

analyzed: sarvā ca iyam parṣad tava eva pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ mahākāruṇikānāgate 'dhvanyatikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ kalpānāṃ parīttāvaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame

translated: You will become a great compassionate one in the future, after countless eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River have passed, when only a little remains of the second eon equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

translated: You will become a great compassionate one in the future, after countless eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River have passed, with only a little remaining, in the second eon equal to the sands of the Ganges River, in that very Sahā Buddha-field, in the Bhadra kalpa, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred and twenty years,

analyzed: jarā maraṇa ādi adhike buddhakṣetre ndha loke nāyake kuśala mūla samavadhāna gate ku mārge

analyzed: vihanyamānānām mahā saṅkaṭa prāptānām sattvānām ānantarya kārakānām ārya apavādakānām saddharma pratikṣepakānām
translated: to the beings who are being harmed, who have reached a great calamity, who commit heinous acts, who slander the noble ones, who reject the true Dharma,

analyzed: mūla āpatti samāpannānām yāvat yathā pūrva uktam ākīrṇe
translated: who have fallen into the fundamental transgressions, and so on, as previously stated, in a world that is

analyzed: loke tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: crowded, you will become a Tathāgata, perfected in knowledge and conduct, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: vivartitagaticakraḥ pravartitadharmacakraḥ vivartitavaśavartimārakleśamāraśca anantāparyantāni daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi śabdenāpūrayitvā /

translated: Having turned the wheel of rebirth, having set in motion the wheel of Dharma, having turned back the Māra of sense pleasures and the Māra of afflictions, having filled the endless and limitless Buddha-fields in the ten directions with sound,

analyzed: mahāśrāvaka sannipātaḥ ca te bhaviṣyanti yat uta ardhatrayodaśaiḥ bhikṣu śataiḥ

analyzed: anupūrveṇa pañcacatvāriṃśatibhiḥ varṣaiḥ evaṃrūpam sakalam buddha kāryam paripūrayiṣyasi

analyzed: yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam

analyzed: sakalam mahābuddha kāryam kariṣyasi
translated: in the same way, O Greatly Compassionate One, in that Sahā Buddha-field, in the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred and twenty years, in forty-five years, you will accomplish all the activities of a great Buddha,

analyzed: śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi

original: parinirvṛtasya ca te satpuruṣānuttaraparinirvāṇenādhikaṃ varṣasahasraṃ saddharmaḥ sthāsyate /

analyzed: yathā svayam praṇidhānam kṛtam

analyzed: evam ciram sattvān vinayiṣyasi

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam

analyzed: tad kāle kaitapure brāhmaṇaḥ āsīt
