original: sa evamāha teṣu teṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu tava satpuruṣa bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇasyāhaṃ nityopasthāyaka upakaraṇamaitryānukūlaḥ sahāyako

analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca te sat puruṣa agra dānapatiḥ bhaveyam

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca mām vyākuryāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may you, upon attaining enlightenment, prophesy me for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: te ubhaye pyāhatuḥ
translated: They both said,

analyzed: vayam api bho mahā kāruṇika teṣu teṣu yāvat  bodhi prāptasya ca te vayam śrāvaka yuga prajñāvantaḥ

analyzed: ṛddhimantaḥ ca bhavemaḥ

analyzed: aparaḥ cāritracaraṇa sudarśayūthikaḥ nāma śakraḥ
translated: There was another Shakra named Charitracharanasudarshayoothik.

analyzed: aparā śikhara devatā saurabhyākiṃśukā nāma
translated: There was another celestial being named Shikharedevata Saurabhyakinshuka.

original: sāpyāha ahaṃ te mahākāruṇika tāsu tāsu jātiṣu bhāryā bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: sā api āha aham te mahā kāruṇika tāsu tāsu jātiṣu bhāryā bhaveyam
translated: She also said, I, O Greatly Compassionate One, in those births, up to, may be your wife.

original: bodhiprāptaśca tvaṃ satpuruṣa māṃ vyākuryā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca tvam sat puruṣa mām vyākuryāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And, O Good Man, upon attaining enlightenment, may you prophesy me for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kaduścaraḥ nāma asura indraḥ
translated: There was a lord of the asuras named Kaduchara.

original: so 'pyāha ahaṃ te mahākāruṇikā teṣu teṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu satpuruṣa bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇasyāhamupakaraṇamaitryānukulaḥ sahāyo
analyzed: sā u pi āha aham te mahā kāruṇikā teṣu teṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu sat puruṣa bodhi cārikām caramāṇasya aham upakaraṇa maitryā anukulaḥ sahāyaḥ
translated: He also said, I, O greatly compassionate one, in those immeasurable and countless eons, O good man, while you are practicing the conduct for enlightenment, I will be your helpful companion, favorable to loving-kindness, as a means.

analyzed: caramabhavikasya aham te upasthāyakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: In your final existence, I will be your attendant.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca te satpuruṣa dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartane 'dhyayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca te sat puruṣa dhārmikam dharmacakram pravartane dhyayeyam
translated: And, O good man, when you have attained enlightenment, I will study the turning of the wheel of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ahaṃ ca te dharmadeśanāṃ prathamāṃ saphalāṃ kuryāṃ /
analyzed: aham ca te dharma deśanām prathamām saphalām kuryām
translated: And I will make your teaching of the Dharma fruitful from the very beginning.

analyzed: dharma rasam ca piveyam
translated: I will drink the taste of the Dharma.

analyzed: amṛtam ca oṣadhim gaccheyam
translated: I will go to the ambrosia medicine.

analyzed: yāvat sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam prāpnuyām
translated: Until I attain arhatship through the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: peyālaṃ / gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāśca tatra devanāgāsurā mahākāruṇikasyānupravṛtticaryāya KpSū
analyzed: peyālam gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ ca tatra deva nāga asurāḥ mahā kāruṇikasya anupravṛtti caryāya
translated: The same as the Ganges river sands, the devas, nagas, and asuras there made aspirations to follow the conduct of the greatly compassionate one,

analyzed: praṇidhānam kṛtavantaḥ vaineyam upanyastā
translated: and presented themselves as disciples.

analyzed: ekaḥ ca tatra saṃjñā vikaraṇabhīṣmaḥ nāma ājīvikaḥ
translated: And there was one there named Saṃjñāvikarana Bhīṣma, a practitioner of austerities.

analyzed: saḥ āha aham te bho mahā brāhmaṇa bahu upakaraṇa sahāyakaḥ bhaviṣyāmi

analyzed: nityam aham te prameyeṣu kalpeṣu sa phala cārikā upajīvī jñātikaḥ bhaveyam
translated: May I always be your kinsman for immeasurable eons, supporting myself on your fruitful path.

analyzed: nityam ca tvad sakāśam upasaṃkrameyam vastu yācana artham śayyā āsana vāhana hasti aśva ratha grāma nigama nagara kula putra duhitṛ māṃsa rudhira carma asthi hasta pāda jihvā karṇa nāsa nayana śīrṣāṇi
translated: And may I always approach you to request things, such as beds, seats, vehicles, elephants, horses, chariots, villages, towns, cities, families, sons, daughters, flesh, blood, skin, bones, hands, feet, tongue, ears, nose, eyes, and head.

analyzed: ca yāceyam
translated: And may I request these.

analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ ham tava mahā brāhmaṇa dāna pāramitā sahāyakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: In this way, great Brahmin, may I be your companion in the perfection of giving.

analyzed: yāvat prajñāpāramitā sahāyakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: And may I be your companion in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃrūpo 'haṃ mahābrāhmaṇa bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇasya tava ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sahāyako bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ ham mahā brāhmaṇa bodhi cārikām caramāṇasya tava ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sahāyakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: In this way, great Brahmin, may I be your companion in the six perfections while you practice the conduct for enlightenment.

original: yāvattvaṃ bodhiṃ prāpnuyā ahaṃ ca te śrāvakasthānamāsādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat tvam bodhim prāpnuyāḥ aham ca te śrāvaka sthānam āsādayeyam
translated: And may I attain the state of being one of your disciples while you attain enlightenment.

analyzed: aśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi udgṛhṇīyām pṛṣṭhaḥ ca dharma deśakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: May I uphold eighty thousand Dharma aggregates and become a Dharma teacher.

original: tvaṃ ca māṃ vyākuryā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /

analyzed: candra dhvaja ketuḥ samādhiḥ sarva samādhīnām dhvajam dhārayati
translated: There is the concentration called Moon-Banner-Top, which holds the banner of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma udgataḥ samādhiḥ sarva samādhayaḥ ntargacchanti
translated: There is the concentration called All-Dharma-Udgata, into which all concentrations enter.

original: vilokitamudro nāma samādhiḥ sarvasamādhīnāṃ murdhānaṃ vyavalokayati /
analyzed: vilokitamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ sarva samādhīnām murdhānam vyavalokayati
translated: There is the concentration called Looking-at-the-Seal, which looks at the top of all concentrations.

original: dharmadhātuvigatasamādhau sthito bodhisattvaḥ sarvadharmadhātuviniścayāya KpSū gacchati /🔽niyatadhvajaketau samādhau sthitaḥ sarvasamādhīnāṃ dhvajaṃ dhārayati /
analyzed: dharmadhātu vigata samādhau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva dharmadhātu viniścayāya kpsū  / niyata dhvaja ketau samādhau sthitaḥ sarva samādhīnām dhvajam dhārayati
translated: The bodhisattva abiding in the concentration called Gone to the Dharma Realm goes to the ascertainment of all the realm of dharmas.🔽Abiding in the concentration called Banner-Top of Certainty, he holds the banner of all concentrations.

analyzed: vajre samādhau sthitaḥ sarva samādhīn nirbhinatti
translated: Abiding in the concentration called Diamond, he shatters all concentrations.

analyzed: dharma praveśa mudre samādhau sthitaḥ sarva dharmān mudrayati
translated: Abiding in the concentration called Seal of Entry into Dharma, he seals all dharmas.

original: samādhirājasupratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu rājatvena pratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: samādhirājasupratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu rājatvena pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: By means of the concentration called Well-Established King of Concentrations, he becomes established as king over all concentrations.

analyzed: raśmi muktena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu raśmayaḥ
translated: By means of the Rasmukta concentration, light rays enter all concentrations.

analyzed: bala vīryeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu bala vīrya tām kārayati
translated: By means of the Balavīrya concentration, he causes strength and heroism in all concentrations.

original: samudgatena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣūdgacchati /🔽niruktinirdeśena samādhinā sarvasamādhivacanapraveśāṃ praviśati /
analyzed: samudgatena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu udgacchati  nirukti nirdeśena samādhinā sarva samādhi vacana praveśām praviśati
translated: By means of the Samudgata concentration, he ascends in all concentrations.🔽By means of the Niruktinirdeśa concentration, he enters the verbal expressions of all concentrations.

analyzed: adhivacana praveśena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām nāmadheyāni anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Adhivacanapraveśa concentration, he enters the names of all concentrations.

analyzed: diś vilokena samādhinā sarva samādhīn avalokayati
translated: By means of the Digviloka concentration, he surveys all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma prabhedena samādhinā sarva dharma prabheda tām anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Sarvadharmavibhanga concentration, he enters the analysis of all dharmas.

analyzed: dhāraṇī mudreṇa samādhinā sarva samādhīnām mudrān dhārayati
translated: By means of the Dhāraṇīmudra concentration, he holds the seals of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma viviktena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu viveka dharmatām anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Sarvadharmavivikta concentration, he enters the dharma of seclusion in all concentrations.

analyzed: asaṃpramoṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ na muṣyanti
translated: By means of the Asampramoșa concentration, all concentrations are not lost.

analyzed: sarva dharma acalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu acala tāyai saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: By means of the Sarvadharmācalā concentration, he abides unshakably in all concentrations.

original: sarvadharmasamavasaraṇasāgaramudre KpSū 🔽samādhau sarvasamādhayaḥ saṃgrahaṃ samavasaraṇaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: sarva dharma samavasaraṇa sāgara mudre kpsū  samādhau sarva samādhayaḥ saṃgraham samavasaraṇam gacchanti
translated: In the ocean mudra of the convergence of all dharmas,🔽all samadhis are included and converge.

analyzed: sarva dharma āmanyane samādhau sarva samādhayaḥ udaya vyaya āmanyana tām gacchanti
translated: In the samadhi of non-discrimination of all dharmas, all samadhis are seen as arising and ceasing.

analyzed: ākāśa spharaṇena samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ ākāśe sphuranti
translated: With the samadhi of filling space, all samadhis shine in space.

analyzed: sarva dharma ācchedanena samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ na upacchedam gacchanti
translated: With the samadhi of cutting off all dharmas, all samadhis are uninterrupted.

analyzed: vajra maṇḍalena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām maṇḍalam dhārayati
translated: With the vajra mandala samadhi, he holds the mandala of all samadhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma eka rasena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām rasam dhārayati
translated: With the samadhi of the single taste of all dharmas, he holds the taste of all samadhis.

analyzed: raṇam samādhinā sarva upakaraṇa kleśām jahāti
translated: With the samadhi of abandoning strife, he abandons all the afflictions of equipment.

analyzed: sarva dharma anutpādena samādhinā sarva dharma anutpāda anirodham darśayati
translated: With the samadhi of the non-arising of all dharmas, he shows the non-arising and non-cessation of all dharmas.

original: vairocanena samādhinā sarvasamādhīn bhāvayati tapati virocati /
analyzed: vairocanena samādhinā sarva samādhīn bhāvayati tapati virocati
translated: With the Vairocana samadhi, he cultivates, warms up, and shines with all samadhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma anirodhena samādhinā sarva samādhīn
translated: With the samadhi of the non-cessation of all dharmas, all samadhis🔽are not seen as ceasing.

original: vibhajati / animiṣeṇa samādhinā sarvasamādhayo na kadācit samādhidharmā eṣante /
analyzed: vibhajati animiṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ na kadācid samādhi dharmāḥ eṣante
translated: He distinguishes. By the unwavering concentration, he never seeks the dharmas of concentration in all concentrations.

original: aniketena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu na kadācid KpSū
analyzed: aniketena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu na kadācid
translated: By the non-abiding concentration, he never dwells in any concentration.

analyzed: dharma sthitim samanupaśyati
translated: He sees the stability of dharmas.

analyzed: gagana kalpena samādhinā sarva samādhīn gagana svabhāva asāra tvāya samanupaśyati
translated: By the space-like concentration, he sees all concentrations as having the nature of space.

original: niścittena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu cittacaitasikā dharmāḥ prahīyante /
analyzed: niścittena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu citta caitasikāḥ dharmāḥ prahīyante
translated: By the no-mind concentration, the dharmas of mind and mental factors cease in all concentrations.

analyzed: rūpa aparyantena samādhinā rūpam avabhāsayati
translated: By the infinite form concentration, he illuminates form.

analyzed: vimala pradīpena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām pradīpam karoti
translated: By the stainless lamp concentration, he illuminates all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma aparyantena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu aparyanta jñānam darśayati
translated: By the infinite all dharmas concentration, he shows infinite knowledge in all concentrations.

analyzed: vidyut unmiṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu aparyantam jñānam darśayati
translated: By the lightning flash concentration, he shows infinite knowledge in all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva prabhaṃkareṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu prabhaṃkara mukham upadarśayati
translated: By the all-illuminating concentration, he shows the door of illumination in all concentrations.

analyzed: dhātu paryantena samādhinā sarva samādhīn a paryanta vijñāpanāya upadarśayati
translated: With the concentration called Limit of the Elements, he shows the endlessness of all concentrations.

analyzed: samādhi śuddha sāreṇa samādhinā śūnyatām samādhi dharmeṣu anuprāpnoti
translated: With the concentration called Pure Essence of Concentration, he attains emptiness in the dharmas of concentration.

analyzed: meru citreṇa samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu ṛktatām saṃdarśayati
translated: With the concentration called Meru Image, he shows the voidness in all dharmas.

analyzed: vimala prabhena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām malam apakarṣayati
translated: With the concentration called Pure Light, he removes the impurities of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma asaṃprabhedena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām vyupakṛṣṭa tām saṃdarśayati
translated: With the concentration called Non-distinction of All Dharmas, he shows the sublimity of all concentrations.

original: KpSū ratikareṇa samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu ratiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: rati kareṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ratim pratilabhate
translated: With the concentration called Pleasing, he attains delight in all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma svabhāva vikrīḍitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu rūpa anupalabdhim darśayati
translated: With the concentration called Play in the Nature of All Dharmas, he shows the non-apprehension of form in all concentrations.

analyzed: vidyut vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu alakṣaṇa tvam darśayati
translated: With the concentration called Lightning Display, he shows the signlessness of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma a nikṣepa virajena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām virajam jñānam upadarśayati
translated: With the concentration called Dustless Abandonment of All Dharmas, he shows the dustless knowledge of all concentrations.

original: akṣayavatena samādhinā sarvasamādhīnāṃ na kṣayaṃ nākṣayaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: akṣayavatena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām na kṣayam na akṣayam darśayati
translated: With the concentration called Inexhaustible, he shows the non-exhaustion and non-inexhaustibility of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma acintya śuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmām pratibhāsa upamām darśayati
translated: With the inconceivable purity of all dharmas samādhi, he shows all dharmas to be like a reflection.

analyzed: tejovatā samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu jñānam jvālayati
translated: With the radiant samādhi, he illuminates the knowledge in all samādhis.

analyzed: kṣaya apagatena samādhinā sarva samādhīn a kṣaya an upagatām darśayati
translated: With the samādhi of the exhaustion and removal of all dharmas, he shows all samādhis to be inexhaustible and unremoved.

original: aniñjitena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu neñjati na vepati na prapañcayati /
analyzed: an iñjitena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu na iñjati na vepati na prapañcayati
translated: With the unshakable samādhi, he does not shake, tremble, or elaborate in any dharma.

original: vivardhanena samādhinā sarvasamādhisamāpattiṣu vivardhamānāṃ jñeyaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽sūryapradīpena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu raśmimukhānyavakirati /
analyzed: vivardhanena samādhinā sarva samādhi samāpattiṣu vivardhamānām jñeyam samanupaśyati  sūrya pradīpena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu raśmi mukhāni avakirati
translated: With the increasing samādhi, he sees the knowable as increasing in all samādhi attainments.🔽With the sun-lamp samādhi, he scatters the light rays in all samādhis.

analyzed: candravimalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ālokam karoti
translated: With the pure moon samādhi, he illuminates all samādhis.

original: śuddhapratibhāsena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu catasraḥ pratisaṃvidāḥ pratilabhate /
analyzed: śuddha pratibhāsena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu catasraḥ pratisaṃvidāḥ pratilabhate
translated: With the pure radiance samādhi, he attains the four analytical knowledges in all samādhis.

original: kārākāreṇa samādhinā kāravihārakriyāṃ karoti jñānaketuṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: kāra ākāreṇa samādhinā kāra vihāra kriyām karoti jñāna ketum samanupaśyati
translated: With the form-form samādhi, he performs the activity of dwelling in forms and sees the sign of knowledge.

original: vajropamena samādhinā sarvadharmānnirvedhīkaroti yasya vedhamapi na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: vajra upamena samādhinā sarva dharmān nirvedhīkaroti yasya vedham api na samanupaśyati
translated: With the Diamond-like Concentration, he penetrates all dharmas, not seeing even that penetration.

analyzed: citta sthitena samādhinā cittam na calati
translated: With the Concentration on Mental Stability, the mind does not move,

original: na vedhati na pratibhāsati na vighātamāpadyate /
analyzed: na vedhati na pratibhāsati na vighātam āpadyate
translated: does not penetrate, does not appear, does not undergo destruction.

analyzed: na ca asya evam bhavati cittam etat iti
translated: And it does not occur to him that this is the mind.

analyzed: samanta ālokena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ālokam samanupaśyati
translated: With the All-Illuminating Concentration, he sees illumination in all concentrations.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu su pratiṣṭhita tve pratiṣṭhati
translated: With the Well-Established Concentration, he is established in the well-established nature of all concentrations.

original: ratnakūṭena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu ratnakūṭa iva saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: ratnakūṭena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ratnakūṭaḥ iva saṃdṛśyate
translated: With the Jewel-Peak Concentration, he is seen as a jewel-peak in all concentrations.

analyzed: vara dharma mudreṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ mudritāḥ bhavanti
translated: With the Seal of the Supreme Dharma Concentration, all concentrations are sealed.

original: dharmasamatayā na kaṃciddharmaṃ samatānirmuktaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽ratiṃ KpSū jahena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu ratiṃ jahāti /
analyzed: dharma samatayā na kaṃcid dharmam samatā nirmuktam samanupaśyati  ratim samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu ratim jahāti
translated: By the Equality of Dharmas, he does not see any dharma apart from equality.🔽With the Concentration of Abandoning Delight, he abandons delight in all dharmas.

analyzed: dharma ulkena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu a sa māra kṛtām pratilabhate
translated: With the Torch of Dharma Concentration, he attains non-attachment to all dharmas.

analyzed: akṣara apagatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu eka akṣaram api na upalabhate
translated: By the samādhi of the disappearance of letters, one does not perceive even a single letter in all dharmas.

analyzed: ālaṃbana chedena samādhinā sarva ālaṃbanām vyupacchinatti
translated: By the samādhi of cutting off the objective support, one cuts off all objective supports.

analyzed: avikāreṇa samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām vikāram na upalabhate
translated: By the unchanging samādhi, one does not perceive any change in all dharmas.

original: prakṛtiviśuddhena samādhinā sarvadharmāṇāmupakāraṃ nopalabhate /🔽aniketacareṇa samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu niketaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: prakṛti viśuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām upakāram na upalabhate  aniketa careṇa samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu niketam na upalabhate
translated: By the naturally pure samādhi, one does not perceive any benefit in all dharmas.🔽By the samādhi of moving without abode, one does not perceive any abode in all dharmas.

analyzed: timira apagatena samādhinā sarva samādhi caraṇam na samanupaśyati
translated: By the samādhi of the disappearance of darkness, one does not see the practice of any samādhi.

analyzed: tamaḥ viṣayam samatikrāmati
translated: One transcends the realm of darkness.

analyzed: sarva guṇa saṃcaya gatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu sannicayam jahāti
translated: By the samādhi of going to the accumulation of all qualities, one abandons the accumulation in all dharmas.

analyzed: sthita niścittena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu cittam iti na upalabhate
translated: By the samādhi of the mind of stability, one does not perceive the mind in all dharmas.

analyzed: bodhyaṅga gatena samādhinā sarva dharmām budhyati
translated: By the samādhi of going to the factors of enlightenment, one awakens to all dharmas.

analyzed: smṛti vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asaṃkhyeya pratibhānam 🔽pratilabhate
translated: By the samādhi of the discrimination of mindfulness, one attains immeasurable eloquence in all dharmas.

analyzed: tad kara jñāna viśuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asama asama tām pratilabhate
translated: By the samādhi of the knowledge of doing that, one attains equality and equivalence in all dharmas.

original: jñānaketusamādhinā sarvatraidhātukamatikrāmati /🔽jñānopacchedasamādhinā sarvadharmavyavacchedaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽jñānavikaraṇena samādhinā sarvadharmavikaraṇatāmanuprāpnoti /
analyzed: jñānaketu samādhinā sarva traidhātukam atikrāmati  jñāna upaccheda samādhinā sarva dharma vyavacchedam samanupaśyati  jñāna vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharma vikaraṇa tām anuprāpnoti
translated: By the knowledge banner samādhi, one transcends the entire three realms.🔽By the knowledge obstruction samādhi, one sees the obstruction of all dharmas.🔽By the knowledge disintegration samādhi, one attains the disintegration of all dharmas.

analyzed: niradhiṣṭhānena samādhinā sarva dharmām anāśraya bhūtām samanupaśyati
translated: By the no base samādhi, one sees all dharmas as having no basis.

analyzed: eka vyūhena samādhinā na kaṃcid dharma dvayam samanupaśyati
translated: By the single array samādhi, one does not see any duality of dharmas.

analyzed: ākāra nirhāravatā samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām an ākāra nirhāram samanupaśyati
translated: By the form accomplishment samādhi, one sees the accomplishment of all dharmas as formless.

analyzed: sarva adhikāra sarva bhava tala vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu nirvedha jñānam praviśati
translated: By the destruction of all realms and all worldly realms samādhi, one enters the knowledge of penetration in all dharmas.

analyzed: yasya anupraveśāt na kaṃcid pratilabhate
translated: By entering which one does not attain anything.

analyzed: saṅketa ruta praveśena samādhinā sarva ruta saṅketeṣu anupraviśati
translated: By the entry into conventional sounds samādhi, one enters into all sounds and conventions.

analyzed: ghoṣa vāgbhiḥ akṣara vimuktena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu akṣara vimuktim
translated: With the Speech of Sound, Liberated from Syllables samādhi, he sees the liberation from syllables in all dharmas.

analyzed: samanupaśyati
translated: He sees the non-existence of syllables in all dharmas.

original: jñānolkāmatā samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu tena bhāsati tapati virocati /🔽varajñānalakṣaṇavijṛṃbhitena🔽samādhinā sarvadharmeṣvapariśuddhaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: jñāna ulkāmatā samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu tena bhāsati tapati virocati  vara jñāna lakṣaṇa vijṛṃbhitena  samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu apariśuddham lakṣaṇam darśayati
translated: With the Light of Knowledge samādhi, he shines, burns, and radiates in all samādhis.🔽With the Manifestation of the Characteristics of Supreme Knowledge samādhi, he displays the unpurified characteristics in all dharmas.

analyzed: anabhijñā lakṣaṇavatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu an abhilakṣaṇa artham samanupaśyati
translated: With the Characteristic of Non-apprehension samādhi, he sees the meaning of the non-apprehensible characteristic in all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva ākāra vara upatena samādhinā sarva dharma samādhiṣu sarva ākāra vara upetaḥ bhavati
translated: With the Endowed with All Aspects and Excellence samādhi, he becomes endowed with all aspects and excellence in all dharmas and samādhis.

analyzed: sarva duḥkha su jahena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu a niśriyam samanupaśyati
translated: With the All Suffering Easily Abandoned samādhi, he sees the non-reliance in all dharmas.

analyzed: akṣaya kāraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu akṣayam na samanupaśyati
translated: With the Cause of Inexhaustibility samādhi, he does not see the exhaustion in all dharmas.

analyzed: dhāraṇa padena samādhinā sarva samādhīm sarva dharmān ca dhārayati
translated: With the Dharani Gate samādhi, he upholds all samādhis and all dharmas.

analyzed: samyaktva mithyātvam na samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see rightness and wrongness.

original: nirodhavidhapraśamena samādhinā sarvadharmānurodhavirodhāṃ na KpSū 🔽samanupaśyati /🔽vimalaprabhāsena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu saṃskṛtavimalaṃ na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: nirodha vidha praśamena samādhinā sarva dharma anurodha virodhām na  samanupaśyati  vimala prabhāsena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu saṃskṛta vimalam na samanupaśyati
translated: By the samādhi of the cessation of pacification, one does not see any contradiction with any Dharma.🔽One does not perceive any impurity in any samādhi.

analyzed: sāra anugatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asāram na upalabhate
translated: By the samādhi of following the essence, one does not find any lack of essence in any Dharma.

analyzed: pūrṇa candra vimalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu guṇa paripūrṇaḥ bhavati
translated: By the samādhi of the pure full moon, one becomes complete in all virtues in all samādhis.

analyzed: mahāvyūhena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu mahāvyūha samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: By the samādhi of the great array, one becomes endowed with the great array in all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva loka prabhedena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu jñānena avabhāsayati
translated: By the samādhi of distinguishing all worlds, one illuminates all Dharmas with knowledge.

original: samādhisamatāvirocanena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣvekāgratāṃ pratilabhate /🔽araṇena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu na raṇati /
analyzed: samādhi samatā virocanena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ekāgra tām pratilabhate  araṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu na raṇati
translated: By the samādhi of shining with the equality of samādhis, one attains one-pointedness in all samādhis.🔽By the samādhi of non-conflict, one does not conflict with any Dharma.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena prāmodyaprasādena viṃśativarṣasadṛśaḥ kumārabhūtaḥ saṃvṛtto /🔽ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddho 'sthāt /🔽sa ca kulaputra rājāmṛtaśuddhaḥ sārdhaṃ KpSū 🔽putrasahasreṇāśītibhiśca koṭṭarājasahasrairanyaiśca dvānavatibhiḥ prāṇakoṭibhiḥ sārdhaṃ niṣkramya pravrajitaḥ śīlaśrutasamādhisauratyairabhiyogakṛtavān

translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika, the son of the Victorious One, having attained the supreme and highest enlightenment, became known as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in wisdom and conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the world, the Leader of men to be tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One named Mahākaruṇācintin.🔽And that bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika, the son of the Victorious One, having attained the supreme and highest enlightenment, became known as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in wisdom and conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the world, the Leader of men to be tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One named Mahākaruṇācintin.🔽And that bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika, the son of the Victorious One, having attained the supreme and highest enlightenment, became known as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in wisdom and conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the world, the Leader of men to be tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One named Mahākaruṇācintin.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nupūrveṇa caturaśītidharmaskandhasahasrāṇi ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśācchrāvakayānakathāṃ
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nupūrveṇa caturaśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt śrāvaka yāna kathām
translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika, the son of the Victorious One, having attained the supreme and highest enlightenment, became known as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in wisdom

analyzed: paṭhitavān paryavāptavān ca
translated: He recited and mastered them.

analyzed: navati dharma skandha sahasrāṇi pratyekabuddha yāna kathām uddiṣṭavān paṭhitavān paryavāptavān
translated: He recited and mastered ninety thousand Dharma aggregates of the teachings of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: tataḥ śatasahasramanuttaramahāyānakathāyāṃ tathā kāyasmṛtyupasthānakathāyāmuddiṣṭavān paṭhitavān paryavāptavāṃśca /
analyzed: tatas śata sahasram anuttara mahāyāna kathāyām tathā kāya smṛti upasthāna kathāyām uddiṣṭavān paṭhitavān paryavāptavān ca
translated: Then he recited and mastered one hundred thousand teachings on the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, as well as on the teachings on the mindfulness of the body.

analyzed: śata sahasram vedanā smṛti upasthāna kathāyām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the mindfulness of feelings.

analyzed: śata sahasram citta smṛti upasthāna kathāyām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the mindfulness of the mind.

analyzed: śata sahasram dharma smṛti upasthāna kathāyām uddiṣṭā paṭhitā paryavāptāḥ ca  śata sahasram dhātu skandha kathām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the mindfulness of phenomena were recited and mastered.🔽One hundred thousand teachings on the aggregates of elements.

analyzed: śata sahasram āyatana skandha kathām  śata sahasram rāga saṃyojana prahāṇa skandha kathām  śata sahasram dveṣa saṃyojana prahāṇa skandha kathām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the aggregates of sense bases.🔽One hundred thousand teachings on the abandonment of the fetter of desire.🔽One hundred thousand teachings on the abandonment of the fetter of hatred.

analyzed: śata sahasram moha prahāṇa pratītyasamutpāda skandha kathām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the dependent origination for the abandonment of delusion.

analyzed: śata sahasram samādhi vimokṣa skandha kathām
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the aggregates of concentration and liberation.

analyzed: śata sahasram kpsū
translated: One hundred thousand teachings on the aggregates of the path.

analyzed: bala vaiśāradya āveṇika buddha dharma skandha kathām uddiṣṭavān paṭhitavān paryavāptavān ca
translated: He recited and mastered the discourses on the aggregates of the powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of the Buddha.

analyzed: yāvat daśa dharma skandha śata sahasram ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt udgṛhītavān paryavāptavān ca
translated: Up to ten thousand times one hundred thousand aggregates of the Dharma, he received and mastered in the presence of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

original: yāvadapareṇa kālasamayena ratnagarbhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho 'nupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa kāla samayena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ n upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Then, at another time, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, passed into parinirvana in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvaḥ nānāvidhāprameyāsaṃkhyeyā vādyapuṣpacūrṇāmālyagandhavilepanacchatradhvajapatākāratnaiḥ pūjāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ nānāvidha aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ vādya puṣpa cūrṇā mālya gandha vilepana chatra dhvaja patākā ratnaiḥ pūjām kṛtavān
translated: And that great compassionate Bodhisattva made offerings with various kinds of immeasurable and countless musical instruments, flowers, powders, garlands, incense, ointments, parasols, banners, flags, and jewels.

analyzed: nānā gandhaiḥ ca snāpanam kṛtavān
translated: And he made ablutions with various fragrances.

original: śarīrapratiṣṭhāpanaṃ ca saptaratnamayaṃ stūpaṃ kṛtavān pañcayojanamuccatvenārdhayojanaṃ vistāreṇa /
analyzed: śarīra pratiṣṭhāpanam ca sapta ratna mayam stūpam kṛtavān pañca yojanam uccatvena ardha yojanam vistāreṇa
translated: He erected a stupa made of the seven precious substances, five yojanas high and half a yojana wide, to enshrine the body.

analyzed: tatas sapta divasāni aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ vādya puṣpa mālya gandha vilepana chatra dhvaja patākā ratnaiḥ ca pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Then, for seven days, he made offerings with immeasurable and countless musical instruments, flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, parasols, banners, flags, and jewels.

original: punarapi tatrāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāstriṣu yāneṣu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: punar api tatra aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ triṣu yāneṣu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Again, there he inspired, introduced, and established countless beings in the three vehicles.

original: sa teṣāṃ saptānāṃ divasānāmatyayena caturaśītibhiḥ prāṇasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ niṣkramya
analyzed: sa teṣām saptānām divasānām atyayena caturaśītibhiḥ prāṇa sahasraiḥ sārdham niṣkramya
translated: After seven days had passed, together with eighty-four thousand beings, he went forth,

analyzed: keśa śmaśrūṇi avatārya kāṣāyāni vastrāṇi ācchādya samyak eva śraddhayā āgārāt anāgarikām
translated: shaved his head and beard, put on saffron robes, and with right faith left home for homelessness,

original: pravrajya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śāsanaṃ jvālitavān /
analyzed: pravrajya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śāsanam jvālitavān
translated: and after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, he rekindled the teachings.

analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi kpsū
translated: For ten thousand years

original: saddharmadhārako babhūva /🔽tatra cāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāṃ sattvāṃstribhiryānaiḥ samādāpayāmāsa niveśayāmāsa pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: saddharma dhārakaḥ babhūva  tatra ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyām sattvān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ samādāpayāmāsa niveśayāmāsa pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: he was a holder of the true Dharma.🔽And there he inspired, introduced, and established countless beings in the three vehicles,

analyzed: triśaraṇa gamane ca pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: and established them in going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: upāsakasaṃvare ca śrāmaṇerasaṃvare upasaṃpadāyāṃ bhikṣubhāve brahmacaryavāsasaṃvare niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: upāsaka saṃvare ca śrāmaṇera saṃvare upasaṃpadāyām bhikṣu bhāve brahmacarya vāsa saṃvare niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: He introduced and established them in the lay precepts, the novice precepts, full ordination, the state of a monk, and in the vow of celibacy.

original: sa bahūni prāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi abhijñarddhikauśalye ca niyojayitvā sauratyabrahmacaryavāse
analyzed: sa bahūni prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi abhijñā ṛddhi kauśalye ca niyojayitvā sauratya brahmacarya vāse
translated: Having caused many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings to attain the higher knowledges, miraculous powers, and skills, and having caused them to be established in the practice of the holy life of friendliness,

original: niyojayitvā śatrubhūteṣu ca skandhesu parijñāyāṃ niyojayitvā śūnyagrāmāyatanaparijñāyāṃ
analyzed: niyojayitvā śatru bhūteṣu ca skandhesu parijñāyām niyojayitvā śūnya grāma āyatana parijñāyām
translated: having caused them to be established in the thorough knowledge of the aggregates that are the enemies, and having caused them to be established in the thorough knowledge of the empty villages and sense-spheres,

analyzed: niyojayitvā pratītyasamutpannāḥ sarva dharmāḥ saṃskṛta jñāna parijñāyām niyojayitvā
translated: having caused them to be established in the thorough knowledge of all phenomena that arise dependently as being conditioned,

analyzed: pratibhāsa upamān marīci upamān daka candra upamān sarva dharmān darśayitvā anutpāda anirodha apratisaṃdhi nirodha śānta praśānta upaśānta parama praṇīta nirodha nirvāṇa parijñānam
translated: having shown that all phenomena are like a reflection, like a mirage, like the moon in water, and having shown the thorough knowledge of cessation that is peaceful, calm, tranquil, supremely calm, and the cessation of non-arising, non-cessation, and non-connection,

original: darśayitvā āryāṣṭāṅge mārge pratiṣṭhāpayitvā kālaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: darśayitvā ārya aṣṭāṅge mārge pratiṣṭhāpayitvā kālam kṛtavān
translated: having established them in the noble eightfold path, he passed away.

original: evameva ca te sattvāstasya mahākāruṇikasya mahāśramaṇasya śarīreṣu śarīrapūjāṃ kṛtavanto /
analyzed: evam eva ca te sattvāḥ tasya mahā kāruṇikasya mahā śramaṇasya śarīreṣu śarīra pūjām kṛtavantaḥ
translated: In the same way, those beings made offerings to the body of that greatly compassionate great ascetic,

analyzed: yathā rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ śarīreṣu śarīra pūjā kriyate
translated: just as offerings are made to the body of a wheel-turning king.

original: evameva tasmin samaye te sattvā mahākāruṇikasya mahāśramaṇasya śarīreṣu śarīrapūjāṃ kṛtavanto /
analyzed: evam eva tasmin samaye te sattvāḥ mahā kāruṇikasya mahā śramaṇasya śarīreṣu śarīra pūjām kṛtavantaḥ
translated: In the same way, at that time, those beings performed the body worship of the body of the Greatly Compassionate One, the Great Ascetic.

analyzed: yasmin ca divase
translated: And on the very day when the Greatly Compassionate One,

original: mahāśramaṇaḥ kālagatastasmin divase ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya saddharmo 'ntarhitastaiśca bodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ praṇidhānavaśenānyatra
analyzed: mahāśramaṇaḥ kālagataḥ tasmin divase ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya saddharmaḥ ntarhitaḥ taiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ praṇidhāna vaśena anyatra
translated: the Great Ascetic, passed away, on that very day the True Dharma of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha disappeared, and those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, by the power of their vows, accepted rebirth in other

analyzed: lokadhātuṣu upapattiḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: worlds.

analyzed: kecid praṇidhāna vaśena tuṣita bhavane upapannāḥ
translated: Some, by the power of their vows, were reborn in the Tusita heaven.

original: kecin manusyeṣu kecinnāgeṣu kecidasureṣu kecit praṇidhānena vividhāsu tiryagyoniṣūpapannāḥ //
analyzed: kecid manusyeṣu kecid nāgeṣu kecid asureṣu kecid praṇidhānena vividhāsu tiryagyoniṣu upapannāḥ
translated: Some among humans, some among nagas, some among asuras, some by vow were reborn in various animal wombs.

original: kālagataśca kulaputra mahākāruṇiko mahāśramaṇaḥ praṇidhānavaśena dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśāyāmito
analyzed: kālagataḥ ca kula putra mahā kāruṇikaḥ mahā śramaṇaḥ praṇidhāna vaśena dakṣiṇāyām diśāyām itas
translated: And, noble son, the Greatly Compassionate One, the Great Ascetic, having passed away, by the power of his vow, in the southern direction,

analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt daśa buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramya tatra saṃkarṣaṇaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ aśīti varṣa āyuṣkāḥ ca
translated: beyond ten Buddha-fields from this Buddha-field, there in the world-system called Saṃkarṣaṇa, where the lifespan is eighty thousand years,

original: tatra manuṣyā akuśalamūlasamavadhānā raudrā lohitapāṇayaḥ pāpaniviṣṭā adayāpannaḥ
analyzed: tatra manuṣyāḥ akuśala mūla samavadhānāḥ raudrāḥ lohita pāṇayaḥ pāpa niviṣṭāḥ adayā āpannaḥ
translated: There, humans, due to the roots of non-virtue, were fierce, bloody-handed, engaged in evil, and had fallen into cruelty.

analyzed: sarva sattveṣu a mātṛ jñāḥ a pitṛ jñāḥ apara loka bhaya ādarśinaḥ
translated: They were disrespectful to mothers, fathers, and did not see fear in the next world.

original: praṇidhānavaśena mahākāruṇiko mahāśramaṇastatra saṃkarṣaṇe buddhakṣetre caṇḍālakula upapanno 'bhūt /
analyzed: praṇidhāna vaśena mahā kāruṇikaḥ mahā śramaṇaḥ tatra saṃkarṣaṇe buddhakṣetre caṇḍāla kule upapannaḥ bhūt
translated: By the power of his aspiration, the greatly compassionate one, the great ascetic, was reborn in the Caṇḍāla caste in that Buddha-field of Saṃkarṣaṇa.

original: sa cātīvadīrghaśarīro 'bhūdatīvabalavān atīvavegavān atīvasmṛtimān atīvapratibhānavān atīvajavasamanvāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa ca atīva dīrgha śarīraḥ bhūt atīva balavān atīva vegavān atīva smṛtimān atīva pratibhānavān atīva java samanvāgataḥ bhūt
translated: And he became extremely tall, extremely strong, extremely swift, extremely mindful, extremely eloquent, and extremely endowed with speed.

original: sa dṛḍhena balavegena sattvān saṃgṛhītvāha yadi yūyaṃ bho sattvā adattādānāt prativiramata /
analyzed: sa dṛḍhena bala vegena sattvān saṃgṛhītvā āha yadi yūyam bho sattvāḥ a datta ādānāt prativiramata
translated: With firm strength and speed, he gathered beings and said, If you, beings, will refrain from taking what is not given,

analyzed: kāma mithyā ācārāt yāvan kpsū
translated: from sexual misconduct, up to

analyzed: mithyā dṛṣṭyāḥ prativiramata
translated: from wrong view,

original: tadahaṃ yuṣmākaṃ jīvitaṃ prayacchāmi jīvitopakaraṇāni ca dāsyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham yuṣmākam jīvitam prayacchāmi jīvita upakaraṇāni ca dāsyāmi
translated: then I will give you life and the requisites of life.

analyzed: atha ca punar na prativiramata
translated: But if you do not refrain,

analyzed: aham jīvitāt vyaparopayitvā prakramiṣyāmi
translated: then I will deprive you of life and leave.

analyzed: tatas te sattvāḥ añjalim pragṛhya āhuḥ
translated: Then those beings, with palms joined, said:

original: vayamidānīn tava nāthasya vacanenādyāgreṇa yāvajjīvamadattādānādyāvan mithyādṛṣṭyāḥ prativiramāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam idānīn tava nāthasya vacanena adya agreṇa yāvajjīvam adatta ādānāt yāvat mithyādṛṣṭyāḥ prativiramāmaḥ
translated: We now, by the word of our lord, from today onward for as long as we live, will abstain from taking what is not given, up to and including wrong views.”

original: sa balacaṇḍālo gatvā rājño vā rājabhaṭṭānāṃ vā nivedayati /
analyzed: sa bala caṇḍālaḥ gatvā rājñaḥ vā rāja bhaṭṭānām vā nivedayati
translated: That powerful caṇḍāla went and informed the king or the king’s men:

original: jīvitopakaraṇena me prayojanamannena vā pānena vā khādyena vā bhojyena vā peyavastraśayyāgandhahiraṇyasuvarṇamaṇimuktavaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravāḍarajatajātarūpeṇa
analyzed: jīvita upakaraṇena me prayojanam annena vā pānena vā khādyena vā bhojyena vā peya vastra śayyā gandha hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi mukta vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa rajata jātarūpeṇa
translated: ‘I have need of the requisites for life, whether food, drink, edibles, chewables, lickables, clothes, bedding, seats, perfumes, gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryls, conch shells, quartz, coral, or bronze.

analyzed: vā prabhūtāni jīvita upakaraṇāni dadata mama
translated: Give me many requisites for life.’

original: sa balacaṇḍālaḥ sattvān yāvajjīvaṃ daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: sa bala caṇḍālaḥ sattvān yāvajjīvam daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: That powerful caṇḍāla established beings in the ten wholesome courses of action for as long as they lived.

analyzed: tatas te manuṣyāḥ pañca varṣa śata āyuṣkāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Then those humans became five hundred years old.

original: yaśca tatra rājā sa kālagataḥ tatastai rājāmātyaiḥ sa balacaṇḍālo rājābhiṣekenābhiṣicya rājye pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ puṇyabalo nāma saṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tatra rājā sa kālagataḥ tatas taiḥ rāja amātyaiḥ sa bala caṇḍālaḥ rāja abhiṣekena abhiṣicya rājye pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ puṇyabalaḥ nāma saṃskṛtaḥ
translated: When the king there died, then those king’s ministers consecrated that powerful caṇḍāla as king, established him in the kingdom, and gave him the name Puṇyabala.

original: atha kulaputra rājā puṇyabalo na cireṇaiva taṃ viṣayamanuśāsitavān /
analyzed: atha kula putra rājā puṇya balaḥ na cireṇa eva tam viṣayam anuśāsitavān
translated: Then, noble sir, King Puṇyabala did not rule that realm for long.

analyzed: dṛḍha vīrya parākrameṇa dvitīyam  viṣayam samanuśāsitavān
translated: with firm diligence and valor, he ruled the second continent.🔽up to: the king named Puṇyabala, who ruled the third continent.🔽up to: the king named Puṇyabala, who ruled the fourth continent.

original: yāvad rājā puṇyabalo na cireṇa sarvajambūdvīpe rājā balacakravartī babhūva /
analyzed: yāvat rājā puṇyabalaḥ na cireṇa sarva jambūdvīpe rājā bala cakravartī babhūva

analyzed: ye kecid yācanakāḥ anna arthikāḥ yāvat ratna arthikāḥ vā te sarve āgacchantu 🔽aham sarva dānāni dāsyāmi
translated: up to: the king named Puṇyabala, who ruled the twenty

original: tato 'pareṇa kālasamayena sarvajambūdvīpikāḥ sattvā āgatvā rājānaṃ puṇyabalaṃ yācitavantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pareṇa kāla samayena sarva jambūdvīpikāḥ sattvāḥ āgatvā rājānam puṇya balam yācitavantaḥ
translated: Then, at another time, all the beings of the entire Jambudvīpa came and requested King Puṇyabala.

analyzed: rājā api puṇya balaḥ tāni ārabhya vividhāni dānāni dattavān
translated: And King Puṇyabala, beginning with them, gave various gifts.

analyzed: tatra pāṃśughoṣaḥ nāma ājīvikaḥ rājānam puṇya balam upasaṃkramya āha
translated: There, an Ājīvika named Pāṃśughoṣa approached King Puṇyabala and said:

original: yadi tvaṃ mahārāja vividhaṃ mahādānaparityāgaṃ parityajasi /
analyzed: yadi tvam mahā rāja vividham mahā dāna parityāgam parityajasi
translated: If you, great king, abandon various great gifts and offerings,

analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ākāṅkṣasi
translated: and aspire for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: yadi tvam mahā rāja mama āśām paripūrayiṣyasi
translated: if you, great king, will fulfill my hopes,

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ mahārāja lokapradīpo jina iti /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam mahā rāja loka pradīpaḥ jinaḥ iti
translated: you will become a world-illuminating Victor, O great king.

analyzed: rājā āha kena te kpsū rthaḥ
translated: The king said, What do you want?

original: pāṃśughoṣa ājīvika āha ahaṃ mahārāja vidyādharatvamicchāmi mahāsurasaṃgrāmapramardanakalpaṃ sādhayituṃ /
analyzed: pāṃśughoṣaḥ ājīvikaḥ āha aham mahā rāja vidyādhara tvam icchāmi mahā asura saṃgrāma pramardana kalpam sādhayitum
translated: The Ājīvika Pāṃśughoṣa said, O great king, I wish to attain the state of a vidyādhara, to accomplish the means of conquering in the great battle with the asuras.

original: tenāhaṃ tava purataḥ sthitvā vijñāpayāmi jīvataḥ puruṣasya carmaṇā prayojanaṃ cakṣuṣā ca prayojanaṃ /
analyzed: tena aham tava puratas sthitvā vijñāpayāmi jīvataḥ puruṣasya carmaṇā prayojanam cakṣuṣā ca prayojanam
translated: Therefore, standing before you, I inform you that the skin and eyes of a living person are needed.

original: atha kulaputra rājā puṇyabala evaṃ cintayati /
analyzed: atha kula putra rājā puṇya balaḥ evam cintayati
translated: Then, noble sir, King Puṇyabala thought:

analyzed: pratilabdham mayā bala cakravarti rāja tvam
translated: I have attained the status of a powerful universal monarch.

original: gaṇanātikrāntaśca sattvā daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāstriṣu ca yāneṣu niyojitā /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntaḥ ca sattvāḥ daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ triṣu ca yāneṣu niyojitā
translated: I have established beings beyond count in the ten wholesome actions and engaged them in the three vehicles.

analyzed: aprameyam ca me dānam dattam
translated: I have given immeasurable gifts.

original: ayaṃ ca me kalyāṇamitro 'sārāt kāyāt sāramādadāmi /
analyzed: ayam ca me kalyāṇamitraḥ sārāt kāyāt sāram ādadāmi
translated: And this good friend will extract the essence from my body, which is devoid of essence.

original: sa rājāha tuṣṭo bhava dadāmi te imaṃ prākṛtamāṃsacakṣustenāhaṃ labheyānuttaraṃ dharmacakṣuḥ /
analyzed: sa rājā āha tuṣṭaḥ bhava dadāmi te imam prākṛta māṃsa cakṣuḥ tena aham labheya anuttaram dharma cakṣuḥ
translated: The king, pleased, said, Be happy. I give you this ordinary flesh eye. By it I may attain the unsurpassed Dharma eye.

original: dadāmi te imaṃ svakaṃ carma prasannacittena /
analyzed: dadāmi te imam svakam carma prasanna cittena
translated: I give you my own skin with a clear mind.

analyzed: tena ca aham lapsye nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: By that I shall attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha kulaputra rājā puṇyabalo dakṣiṇena hastenobhau netrāvutpādyājīvikasya datvā rudhiramrakṣitena mukhenāha /
analyzed: atha kula putra rājā puṇyabalaḥ dakṣiṇena hastena ubhau netrau utpādya ājīvikasya da tvā rudhira mrakṣitena mukhena āha
translated: Then, son of noble family, King Puṇyabala, with his right hand, gouged out both eyes and gave them to the physician, with a face wet with blood, he said:

original: śṛṇvantu me iha devayakṣamaharddhikā ye kecinnarā ye 'surā ye ca bhūtā ihāgatāḥ khecarā bhūmau sthitā ye narā /
analyzed: śṛṇvantu me iha deva yakṣa maharddhikāḥ ye kecid narāḥ ye surāḥ ye ca bhūtāḥ iha āgatāḥ khecarāḥ bhūmau sthitāḥ ye narāḥ
translated: Listen to me here, you gods and yakshas of great power, you who are humans, you who are asuras, and you who are beings who have come here through the sky or who are on the ground.

original: bodhāya mayā dānaṃ nāmitaṃ śubhaṃ prāpsye 'haṃ śāntaṃ padaṃ /
analyzed: bodhāya mayā dānam nāmitam śubham prāpsye haṃ śāntam padam
translated: For the sake of enlightenment, I have given this gift, which is called virtue. I shall attain the peaceful state.

analyzed: sattvān tārayeyam
translated: I shall liberate beings.

original: ghorāt saṃsārārṇavāt pāre 'nuttare nirvāṇe śive sthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ghorāt saṃsāra arṇavāt pāre nuttare nirvāṇe śive sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them on the other shore of the terrible ocean of saṃsāra, in the auspicious nirvāṇa that is unsurpassed.

analyzed: punar āha
translated: Again he said:

analyzed: yadi aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prāpnuyām
translated: If I were to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: tāvacciraṃ mama jīvitendriyaṃ mā nirudhyeta mā ca me smṛtirnaśyeta mā ca me vipratisāro bhaved /
analyzed: tāvat ciram mama jīvita indriyam mā nirudhyeta mā ca me smṛtiḥ naśyeta mā ca me vipratisāraḥ bhavet
translated: may my life faculty not cease for that long, may my memory not be lost, and may I not have any regrets.

original: yāvacciramasyājīvikasya sā vidyā na siddhā bhavet /
analyzed: yāvat ciram asya ājīvikasya sā vidyā na siddhā bhavet
translated: For as long as the success of that livelihood's knowledge has not been accomplished.

analyzed: āha gṛhṇāhi carma
translated: He said, Take the skin.

original: sa ca kulaputra pāṃśughoṣājīvikastīkṣṇaṃ śastraṃ gṛhītvā rājño dhriyataḥ kāyaccarmamapanetvā carma gṛhītvā vidyāṃ sādhayitvā /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra pāṃśu ghoṣa ājīvikaḥ tīkṣṇam śastram gṛhītvā rājñaḥ dhriyataḥ kāyat carmam apanetvā carma gṛhītvā vidyām sādhayitvā
translated: And that son of good family, the livelihood of Paṃsughosa, taking a sharp weapon, removed the skin from the body of the king who was standing, took the skin, accomplished the knowledge,

original: tathā saptadivasāni rājñaḥ puṇyabalasya jīvitendriyaṃ na niruddhaṃ /
analyzed: tathā sapta divasāni rājñaḥ puṇya balasya jīvita indriyam na niruddham
translated: and for seven days the life faculty of King Puṇyabala did not cease.

analyzed: na ca smṛtiḥ pramuṣṭā
translated: And his memory was not lost.

original: na ca tāṃ duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ vedayati /
analyzed: na ca tām duḥkhām vedanām vedayati
translated: He did not experience that painful feeling.

analyzed: na ca asya eka kṣaṇam api vipratisāraḥ jātaḥ
translated: And for not even a moment did he have any regrets.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve kulaputrānyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahākāruṇiko nāma babhūva /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve kula putra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahā kāruṇikaḥ nāma babhūva
translated: What do you think, son of good family? Was there anyone else at that time and at that moment named Mahākāruṇika?

original: na cānyo draṣṭavyo 'haṃ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahākāruṇiko nāma babhūva ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pitā /
analyzed: na ca anyaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ ham sa tena kālena tena samayena mahā kāruṇikaḥ nāma babhūva ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pitā
translated: And you should not think that anyone else was the father of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha at that time, for I was he.

analyzed: ayam me prathama citta utpādaḥ bhūta anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: That was my first production of the thought of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: prathamacittotpādena ca me gaṇānātikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ samādāpitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: prathama citta utpādena ca me gaṇa an atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ samādāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And by my first production of the thought of enlightenment, more than a countless number of sentient beings were inspired to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: ayaṃ me prathamaḥ śūrabhāvaḥ śūrakāryaṃ ca /
analyzed: ayam me prathamaḥ śūra bhāvaḥ śūra kāryam ca
translated: That was my first heroism and heroic deed.

original: so 'haṃ praṇidhānavaśena tataścyavitvā saṃkarṣaṇe buddhakṣetra upapannaścaṇḍālakule dvitīyaḥ śūrabhāvaḥ śūrakāryaṃ ca /
analyzed: saḥ ham praṇidhāna vaśena tatas cyavitvā saṃkarṣaṇe buddhakṣetre upapannaḥ caṇḍāla kule dvitīyaḥ śūra bhāvaḥ śūra kāryam ca
translated: By the power of that vow, when I passed away from there, I was reborn in the Buddha-field Saṃkarṣaṇa in a caṇḍāla family. That was my second heroism and heroic deed.

analyzed: tadā me caṇḍāla vaṃśe
translated: Then, remaining in that caṇḍāla family,

original: sthitvā sattvāṃ kuśale niyojya svabalaparākrameṇa yāvadbalacakravartitvaṃ prāptaṃ /
analyzed: sthitvā sattvām kuśale niyojya sva bala parākrameṇa yāvat bala cakravarti tvam prāptam
translated: I engaged sentient beings in virtue, and by the power of my own strength and valor, I attained the status of a powerful universal monarch.

analyzed: sarva jaṃbūdvīpe ca kali kaluṣa kalahāḥ praśamitā
translated: And in all Jambudvīpa, quarrels, strife, and disputes were pacified.

analyzed: āyuḥ ca vardhāpitāḥ
translated: And life was extended.

analyzed: ayam ca me prathamaḥ ātma parityāgaḥ
translated: And that was my first abandonment of self.

original: yadā ca me svanetrāḥ parityaktāḥ svacarmaparityāgaśca /
analyzed: yadā ca me sva netrāḥ parityaktāḥ sva carma parityāgaḥ ca
translated: And when I gave away my own eyes and my own skin,

original: so 'haṃ tataścyutastatraiva saṃkarṣaṇe kṣetre dvitīye dvīpe praṇidhānavaśena caṇḍālakula upapannaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ham tatas cyutaḥ tatra eva saṃkarṣaṇe kṣetre dvitīye dvīpe praṇidhāna vaśena caṇḍāla kule upapannaḥ
translated: I, having passed away from there, was reborn in that very same Saṃkarṣaṇa world system, on a second continent, in a caṇḍāla family, by the power of my vow.

original: peyālaṃ / tatra ca mayaivaṃrūpeṇa dṛḍhavīryaparākrameṇa sattvānniyojayitvā kuśaleṣu karmeṣu /
analyzed: peyālam tatra ca mayā evaṃrūpeṇa dṛḍha vīrya parākrameṇa sattvān niyojayitvā kuśaleṣu karmeṣu
translated: The same as before. And there, having thus engaged beings with firm heroic effort in wholesome actions,

analyzed: yāvat bala cakravarti tvam me prāptam
translated: I attained the state of a powerful universal monarch.

analyzed: tatra ca kali kaluṣa kalaha vaira vigrahāḥ praśamitā
translated: And there, quarrels, impurities, disputes, enmities, and conflicts were pacified.

analyzed: āyuḥ ca vardhāpitam
translated: And my lifespan was extended.

original: tatra ca svaśarīrāt jihvā karṇau ca parityaktau /
analyzed: tatra ca svaśarīrāt jihvā karṇau ca parityaktau
translated: And there, my tongue and ears were given away.

original: yāvat sarvan tatsaṃkarṣaṇaṃ mahāsāhasraṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarvadvīpeṣvevaṃ puruṣakāraṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat sarvan tat saṃkarṣaṇam mahā sāhasram buddhakṣetram sarva dvīpeṣu evam puruṣakāram kṛtam
translated: Up to that, in the entire Saṃkarṣaṇa great one-thousand-fold buddha field, in all the continents, such manly deeds were done.

original: praṇidhānadṛḍhavīryaparākrameṇānuprabandhena praṇidhānavaśena gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu evaṃrūpaṃ mahāpuruṣakāraṃ
analyzed: praṇidhāna dṛḍha vīrya parākrameṇa anuprabandhena praṇidhāna vaśena gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu evaṃrūpam mahā puruṣakāram
translated: By the power of the firm heroic effort of my vow, in buddha fields with five degenerations as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, such great manly deeds were done

analyzed: sattvāḥ ca kuśaleṣu niyojitāḥ
translated: and beings were engaged in wholesome actions.

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu samādāpitāḥ
translated: And they were inspired in the three vehicles.

analyzed: kali kaluṣa kala haraṇa vigrahāḥ śamitāḥ
translated: Quarrels, impurities, disputes, enmities, and conflicts were pacified.

original: ityarthaṃ kulaputrānyeṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ /
analyzed: iti artham kula putra anyeṣām buddhānām bhagavatām buddhakṣetram pariśuddham
translated: For this reason, noble sir, the buddha-field of those Buddha-Bhagavans is pure.

original: yadā te buddhā bhagavantaḥ pūrve 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhicaryāṃ caramāṇā na parāmāpattyā KpSū
analyzed: yadā te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pūrve nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhi caryām caramāṇāḥ na parām āpattyā
translated: When those Buddha-Bhagavans in the past were practicing the conduct for the highest complete enlightenment, they did not accuse others of downfalls,

original: codayanti / na ca parasya bhayaṃ darśayanti /
analyzed: codayanti na ca parasya bhayam darśayanti
translated: and they did not show fear to others.

analyzed: na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāne sattvām samādāpayanti
translated: They did not encourage beings in the Hearer Vehicle or the Solitary Buddha Vehicle.

original: ityarthaṃ teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ paripūrṇābhiprāyāṇāṃ pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: iti artham teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām paripūrṇa abhiprāyāṇām pariśuddham buddhakṣetram bhavati
translated: For this reason, the buddha-fields of those Buddha-Bhagavans, whose intentions are fulfilled, are pure.

analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre āpatti nāma
translated: And in those buddha-fields there are no downfalls.

analyzed: na śikṣā grahaṇasya  na ca paruṣa vacanam śrūyate
translated: There is no taking up of training.🔽And no harsh words are heard.

analyzed: na ca akuśala śabdaḥ
translated: And there is no unwholesome noise.

analyzed: anyatra dharma śabdena tat buddhakṣetram apagata amanāpa śabdena sphuṭam bhavati
translated: Rather, that buddha-field is filled with the sound of Dharma, with no sound of unwholesome things.

analyzed: tatra ca sattvāḥ yathākāma karaṇīyāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the beings there are able to do as they wish.

original: na ca tatra śrāvakapratyekabuddhayānasya nāma prajñaptiprādurbhāvo 'sti /
analyzed: na ca tatra śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānasya nāma prajñapti prādurbhāvaḥ sti
translated: And there is no designation, no appearance, no mention of the Hearer Vehicle or the Solitary Buddha Vehicle.

original: yadā ca mayā gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu mahākalpeṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu
analyzed: yadā ca mayā gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu mahā kalpeṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu
translated: And when, in great eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, in empty worlds with the five degenerations,

original: buddhakṣetreṣu paruṣavacanabhayena sattvāḥ prāṇātipātavairamaṇye samādāpitā yāvattriṣu
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṣu paruṣa vacana bhayena sattvāḥ prāṇa atipāta vaira maṇye samādāpitāḥ yāvat triṣu
translated: through the fear of harsh words, beings were caused to abstain from taking life, and were caused to be established in the three

analyzed: yāneṣu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: vehicles, and caused to enter and be established in them,

original: KpSū tena karmāvaśeṣeṇa ma etarhyevaṃ parikliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ akuśalaśabdenāpūritaṃ akuśalamūlasamavadhānagataiḥ sattvaiḥ paripūrṇaṃ /
analyzed: tena karma avaśeṣeṇa me etarhi evam parikliṣṭam buddhakṣetram akuśala śabdena āpūritam akuśala mūla samavadhāna gataiḥ sattvaiḥ paripūrṇam
translated: by the remaining karma from that, now this Buddha-field is so afflicted, filled with the sound of unwholesome things, and full of beings engaged in the roots of unwholesomeness.

analyzed: tribhiḥ ca yānaiḥ dharmam deśayāmi
translated: And I teach the Dharma with the three vehicles.

original: yathā ca me pūrvaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tathārūpaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: yathā ca me pūrvam praṇidhānam kṛtam tathārūpam buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: And just as I made a vow in the past, I have taken possession of a Buddha-field of that kind.

original: yādṛśāśca me sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāstadṛśenaiva balavīryodyogena bodhicārikāḥ cīrṇāḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ ca me sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ tadṛśena eva bala vīrya udyogena bodhi cārikāḥ cīrṇāḥ
translated: And just as I took possession of beings to be trained of that kind, with that very strength, vigor, and exertion, I practiced the conduct leading to enlightenment.

original: yādṛśaṃ caiva bījaṃ prakṣiptaṃ tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: yādṛśam ca eva bījam prakṣiptam tādṛśam buddhakṣetram pratilabdham
translated: And just as the seed was sown, I have obtained a Buddha-field of that kind.

analyzed: yathārūpam mayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And just as I made a vow,

original: saṃkṣiptena te kulaputra dānapāramitāṃ kathayiṣyāmi yathā mayā bodhisattvacārikāṃ caramāṇena dānaparityāgaḥ parityaktaḥ /
analyzed: saṃkṣiptena te kula putra dāna pāramitām kathayiṣyāmi yathā mayā bodhisattva cārikām caramāṇena dāna parityāgaḥ parityaktaḥ
translated: In brief, O son of noble family, I will tell you about the perfection of generosity, how, while practicing the bodhisattva conduct, I relinquished the gift.

original: na kenacit pūrvaṃ bodhisattvenaivaṃrūpaḥ dānaparityāgaḥ parityaktaḥ /
analyzed: na kenacid pūrvam bodhisattvena evaṃrūpaḥ dāna parityāgaḥ parityaktaḥ
translated: No bodhisattva before me has ever relinquished such a gift.

original: na ca punaḥ kaścidbodhisattvo bhaviṣyati ya evaṃrūpaṃ dānaparityāgaṃ bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ parityajati /
analyzed: na ca punar kaścid bodhisattvaḥ bhaviṣyati yaḥ evaṃrūpam dāna parityāgam bodhi cārikām caramāṇaḥ parityajati
translated: And no bodhisattva will ever be found who, while practicing the bodhisattva conduct, will relinquish such a gift as I have.

original: yathā mayā bodhisattvacārikāṃ caramāṇena dānaṃ parityaktaṃ /
analyzed: yathā mayā bodhisattva cārikām caramāṇena dānam parityaktam
translated: As I, while practicing the bodhisattva conduct, relinquished the gift.

analyzed: anyatra aṣṭau sat puruṣāḥ
translated: Except for eight good men.

original: dharaṇidatto nāma satpuruṣo babhūva /🔽dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśāyāṃ KpSū
analyzed: dharaṇidattaḥ nāma sat puruṣaḥ babhūva  dakṣiṇāyām diśāyām kpsū
translated: There was a good man named Dharaṇidatta.

original: sarvaghoṣāyāṃ lokadhātāvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ saṃkaramardārcirnāma tathāgato varṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati
analyzed: sarvaghoṣāyām lokadhātau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ saṃkaramardārciḥ nāma tathāgataḥ varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām dharmam deśayati
translated: In the southern direction, in the world system called Sarvaghosa, he attained supreme perfect enlightenment. The Tathāgata named Saṃkara Mardārci is teaching the Dharma to a people whose lifespan is one hundred years.

analyzed: sa saptame divase parinirvāsyati
translated: He will attain final nirvāṇa in seven days.

analyzed: evam vīryasaṃcodanaḥ nāma babhūva bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Thus there was a bodhisattva named Vīryasaṃcodana.

analyzed: yaḥ purimāyām diśāyām ajayavatyām lokadhātau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: He who attained supreme perfect enlightenment in the eastern world system called Ajavatī,

original: varṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtavān gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā kalpātikrāntāḥ /
analyzed: varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām buddha kāryam kṛtavān gaṅgā nadī vālikā samā kalpa atikrāntāḥ
translated: and performed the deeds of a Buddha for a hundred years of human lifespan, and passed more eons than the sands of the Ganges.

analyzed: yadā sa tathāgataḥ nuttara parinirvāṇena parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: When that Tathāgata attained parinirvāṇa through unsurpassed parinirvāṇa,

original: adyāpi tasya mahākāruṇikasya śarīrāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakāryaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: adya api tasya mahā kāruṇikasya śarīrāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddha kāryam kurvanti
translated: even now the relics of that Greatly Compassionate One perform the deeds of a Buddha in empty Buddha-fields with the five degenerations.

original: evaṃ ca vadanti sārakusumito bodhisattvo dṛḍhavīryasamādhāno balavegaparityāgena bodhisattvacārikāṃ carati /🔽daśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamairmahākalpairatikrāntaiḥ paścāt sa tatrottarāyāṃ diśāyāṃ sahetusaṃkarṣaṇo
analyzed: evam ca vadanti sārakusumitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ dṛḍha vīrya samādhānaḥ bala vega parityāgena bodhisattva cārikām carati  daśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ mahā kalpaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ paścāt sa tatra uttarāyām diśāyām sa hetu saṃkarṣaṇaḥ
translated: And they say, 'The bodhisattva Sārakusumita, with firm diligence and concentration, practices the bodhisattva conduct through the renunciation of powerful energy.🔽After ten great eons equal to the sands of the Ganges have passed, he will become the Buddha named Sahetu-saṃkṣaṇa

original: nāma bhaviṣyati pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre tatrāsau satpuruṣo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyati /
analyzed: nāma bhaviṣyati pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre tatra asau sat puruṣaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyati
translated: in the world system called Saṃkṣarṇa, with the five degenerations. There, that good man will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.'

original: sahetukṛṣṇavidhvaṃsanarājo nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: sa hetu kṛṣṇavidhvaṃsanarājaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, named Sahetukrishnavidhvansanarāja, up to the Buddha, the Blessed One.

analyzed: prajñā arciḥ saṃkopita daṣṭaḥ k p sū
translated: The bodhisattva named Prajñārcisankopitadaṣṭa,

original: nāma bodhisattvaḥ satpuruṣa ekasya mahākalpasyātyayena paścimāyāṃ diśi bhairavatī
analyzed: nāma bodhisattvaḥ sat puruṣaḥ ekasya mahākalpasya atyayena paścimāyām diśi bhairavatī
translated: a good man, after the passing of one great eon, in the western direction, in the world system named Bhairavatī,

original: nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati pañcakaṣāye varṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati pañca kaṣāye varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: in an age of five degenerations, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred years, will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sūryagarbhārcivimalendro nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: sūryagarbha arci vimala indraḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, the Blessed One named Sūryagarbha-arcci-vimaleśvara.

original: ayaṃ punaḥ saṃrocano gaṇanātikrāntaiḥ kalpairnirdiṣṭitairuparimasyāṃ diśi kṣāravarcanikuñjitāyāṃ🔽lokadhātau pañcakaṣāye tīvrakaluṣasaṃkṣobhaṇe kalpe 'sau saṃrocanaḥ pūrvapraṇidhānena
analyzed: ayam punar saṃrocanaḥ gaṇanā atikrāntaiḥ kalpaiḥ nirdiṣṭitaiḥ uparimasyām diśi kṣāravarcani kuñjitāyām  lokadhātau pañca kaṣāye tīvra kaluṣa saṃkṣobhaṇe kalpe sau saṃrocanaḥ pūrva praṇidhānena
translated: This Saṃrocana, after incalculable eons, in the upper direction, in the world system named Kṣāravarcchanikuñjitā,🔽in an age of five degenerations, in a turbulent age of intense defilements, by his previous vow,

original: pañcāśadvarṣāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ tatra kṣāravarcanikuñjite buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ KpSū
analyzed: pañcāśat varṣa āyuṣkāyām prajāyām tatra kṣāravarcanikuñjite buddhakṣetre nuttarām
translated: in the Buddha field named Kṣāravarcchanikuñjitā, when the lifespan of beings is fifty years, will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: He will attain perfect enlightenment.

original: acintyarocano nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyati yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: acintyarocanaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be the Tathāgata named Acintya-Rocana, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: sa pūrvapraṇidhānena daśavarṣāni sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā parinirvāsyati
analyzed: sa pūrva praṇidhānena daśa varṣāni sakalam buddha kāryam kṛtvā parinirvāsyati
translated: By his previous vow, after accomplishing all the Buddha's work for ten years, he will attain final nirvāṇa.

analyzed: tatra eva divase tasya tathāgatasya saddharmaḥ ntardhāsyati
translated: On that very day, the True Dharma of that Tathāgata will disappear.

analyzed: daśa varṣāṇi punar tam buddhakṣetram śūnyam bhaviṣyati
translated: For ten years, that Buddha-field will be empty.

original: tataḥ paścādasau prahasitabāhurbodhisattvastatra ca kṣāravarcanikuñjite buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
analyzed: tatas paścāt asau prahasita bāhuḥ bodhisattvaḥ tatra ca kṣāravarca nikuñjite buddhakṣetre nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: After that, the bodhisattva Prahasitabaha will attain perfect enlightenment in that very salty and twisted Buddha-field.

analyzed: vairocanadharmaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: He will be the Tathāgata named Vairocana-Dharma, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: so 'pi daśavarṣāṇi sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvānupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: saḥ pi daśa varṣāṇi sakalam buddha kāryam kṛtvā an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvāsyati
translated: He too, after accomplishing all the Buddha's work for ten years, will attain final nirvāṇa in the nirvāṇa element without remainder.

original: tasya ca parinirvṛtasya pūrvapraṇidhānena saptavarṣāṇi saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tasya ca parinirvṛtasya pūrva praṇidhānena sapta varṣāṇi saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: And after his final nirvāṇa, by his previous vow, the True Dharma will remain for seven years.

original: atra dvau satpuruṣau labdhapūrvavyākaraṇau labdhāsvādāvanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: atra dvau sat puruṣau labdha pūrva vyākaraṇau labdha āsvādau anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Here, two good men, who had previously received predictions and had tasted the deathless nectar of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: bhagavataḥ purataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā prītisaumanasyaprāmodyena saptatālamātrapramāṇamuparyantarīkṣe
analyzed: bhagavataḥ puratas pādau śirasā vanditvā prīti saumanasya prāmodyena sapta tāla mātra pramāṇam upari antarīkṣe
translated: bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and with joy, happiness, and delight, rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees,

analyzed: bhyudgamya prāñjalībhūtau sthitvā bhagavantam eka svareṇa gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣatām
translated: and standing there with folded hands, they addressed the Blessed One in one voice with these verses:

original: virocase buddha yathaiva sūrya abhyudgato merurimasmiṃ loke /
analyzed: virocase buddha yathā eva sūrya abhyudgataḥ meruḥ imasmin loke
translated: You shine, O Buddha, like the sun, risen above Mount Meru in this world.

original: viśuddhacakṣurvirajā vināyakā ālokabhūtā sugatā namo 'stu te //
analyzed: viśuddha cakṣuḥ virajāḥ vināyakāḥ āloka bhūtā sugatā namaḥ stu te
translated: O you with pure eyes, free from dust, O guide, O light of the world, O Sugata, homage to you!

original: bahūni kalpāna ti vīryabhāvitā paryeṣamāṇena ti agrabodhi /🔽KpSū
analyzed: bahūni vīrya bhāvitā  kpsū
translated: For many eons, you have cultivated diligence, seeking this supreme enlightenment.

original: bahujinā pūjitā pūrve ye tvayā na caiva te vyākarṣīmatitanāyakāḥ //
analyzed: bahu jinā pūjitā pūrve ye tvayā na ca eva te
translated: Many Jinas have been worshipped by you in the past, but they did not give you a prediction, O future leader!

original: prahīṇarāgā parimuktacittā kṛtaṃ ti kāryamiha sarvaloke /
analyzed: prahīṇa rāgā parimukta cittā kṛtam kāryam iha sarva loke
translated: Your passions are destroyed, your mind is liberated, and all your duties in this world have been done.

original: praṇaṣṭamārgāṇa deśesi dharmaṃ sattvāṃśca uttārayase bhavārṇavāt //
analyzed: deśesi dharmam sattvān ca uttārayase bhava arṇavāt
translated: For those who have lost the path, you teach the Dharma, and you deliver beings from the ocean of existence.🔽The Blessed One said to the two good men:

original: vayaṃ pi pravrajya svayaṃbhūśāsane yā prātimokṣa jina śikṣa deśitā /
analyzed: vayam pi pravrajya svayaṃbhū śāsane yā prātimokṣa jina śikṣa deśitā
translated: We too, having gone forth in the teaching of the Self-Existent One, will train in the Prātimokṣa that the Victor taught,

original: vayaṃ pi śikṣitva samāhitendriyā tavaiva āsanna sadā bhavemaḥ //🔽KpSū
analyzed: vayam samāhita indriyā tava eva āsan sadā bhavemaḥ  kpsū
translated: And having trained in that, with our faculties concentrated, we will always be close to you.

analyzed: a niśritā jīvita karma kāmā śāstāram ājñāya dharmam
translated: Not relying on livelihood, desiring to act, having understood the Teacher and heard the Dharma,

analyzed: āsvāda lapsyāmi abhiseka bhūmi jinaḥ idam eva artham
translated: I will attain the taste of the consecration ground. The Victor proclaimed this very meaning.

original: bhagavānāha tau ca kulaputra dvau anutpāditabodhicittau /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tau ca kula putra dvau an utpādita bodhi cittau
translated: The Blessed One said, And those two, O son of noble family, had not yet given rise to the mind of awakening.

analyzed: imau ca saṃrocanaḥ prahasita bāhuḥ
translated: And these two, Samrocana and Prahasitabaghu.

original: te catvāro dharaṇidatto vīryasaṃcodanaḥ sārakusumitaḥ prajñārciḥsaṃkopitadaṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: te catvāraḥ dharaṇidattaḥ vīrya saṃcodanaḥ sāra kusumitaḥ prajñā arciḥ saṃkopita daṣṭaḥ
translated: And those four, Dharanidatta, Vīryasaṃcodana, Sārakuसुmit, and Prajñārcisankopitadaṣṭa.

original: ime ṣaṭsatpuruṣā mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitāstāṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: ime ṣaṭ sat puruṣāḥ mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitāḥ tām śṛṇu
translated: These six good men were the first to be inspired by me towards awakening. Listen to that.

analyzed: bhūta pūrvam kula putra atīte dhvanya saṃkhyeyaiḥ apramāṇaiḥ kalpaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ
translated: In the past, O sons of good family, in a time gone by, after innumerable, incalculable eons had passed,

original: yadāsīttena kālena tena samayenedaṃ buddhakṣetramarajamerujugupsitaṃ nāmābhut /
analyzed: yadā āsīt tena kālena tena samayena idam buddhakṣetram arajamerujugupsitam nāma abhut
translated: at that time and in those days, this buddha-field was called Araja-Meru-Jugupsita.

original: tadāhaṃ mahākalpe vartamāne varṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsane saddharmapratirūpake KpSū
analyzed: tadā aham mahā kalpe vartamāne varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsane saddharma pratirūpake
translated: At that time, in the course of a great eon, when the lifespan of beings was one hundred years, during the counterfeit Dharma of the teaching of the Tathāgata Gandhaprabha,

original: vartamāne 'haṃ ca kulaputra tena kālena durdhano nāma babhūva balacakravartī jambūdvīpavijayī sahasraṃ putrāṇāṃ babhūva /
analyzed: vartamāne ham ca kula putra tena kālena durdhanaḥ nāma babhūva bala cakravartī jambūdvīpa vijayī sahasram putrāṇām babhūva
translated: I was a powerful universal monarch named Durdhana, who had conquered Jambudvīpa, and had a thousand sons.

analyzed: tān api aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitavān
translated: I inspired them towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: te 'pyapareṇa samayena niṣkramya gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsane pravrajitāste ca bhūyasyā mātrayā gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsanaṃ jvālitavantaḥ /
analyzed: te pi apareṇa samayena niṣkramya gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsane pravrajitāḥ te ca bhūyasyā mātrayā gandhapadmasya tathāgatasya śāsanam jvālitavantaḥ
translated: Later, they renounced [home life], went forth in the teaching of the Tathāgata Gandhaprabha, and further spread the teaching of the Tathāgata Gandhaprabha.

original: sthāpayitvā ṣaṭputrāṃ ye na pravrajitā na cecchanti bodhicittamutpādayituṃ /🔽ahaṃ ca punaḥ punarvijñāpayāmi /
analyzed: sthāpayitvā ṣaṣ putrām ye na pravrajitāḥ na ca icchanti bodhi cittam utpādayitum  aham ca punar punar vijñāpayāmi
translated: Except for six sons who did not go forth and did not wish to arouse the mind of awakening.

analyzed: kaḥ yuṣmākam abhiprāyaḥ yat yūyam bodhi cittam na utpādayatha
translated: I again and again requested them, 'What is your intention in not arousing the mind of awakening?

analyzed: na ca pravrajatha
translated: And in not going forth?'

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said,

analyzed: na vayam pravrajāmaḥ
translated: 'We will not go forth.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yaḥ kṣayāntakāle saddharmapratirūpake vartamāne pravrajito 'śaktaḥ sakalaṃ śīlaskandhamārādhayituṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ kṣaya anta kāle saddharma pratirūpake vartamāne śaktaḥ sakalam śīla skandham ārādhayitum
translated: One who goes forth at the time of the end of the eon, when counterfeit true Dharma is prevalent, and is unable to practice the entire aggregate of morality,

analyzed: sa ca sapta dhana virahitaḥ bhavati
translated: and who lacks the seven riches,

analyzed: magnaḥ saṃsāra paṅke
translated: sinks in the mud of saṃsāra,

analyzed: punar ca sa deva manuṣya śrīḥ kadācid labhati
translated: and sometimes obtains the glory of gods and humans,

analyzed: nityam triṣu apāyeṣu paribhramati
translated: but always wanders in the three lower realms,

analyzed: buddha śikṣāyām na samādāya vartate
translated: and does not practice according to the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: iti artham vayam na parivrajāmaḥ
translated: For this reason, we do not go forth.

analyzed: tān aham punar pṛṣṭavān
translated: I then asked them again,

analyzed: kim punar yūyam bodhau cittam na utpādayatha
translated: Why then do you not arouse the mind of enlightenment?

original: ta āhuryadyasmākaṃ sarvaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ dadyādevaṃ KpSū
analyzed: te āhuḥ yadi asmākam sarvam jambūdvīpam dadyāt evam
translated: They said, If someone were to give us the entire Jambudvīpa, then

analyzed: vayam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayemaḥ
translated: we would arouse the mind of enlightenment for supreme, perfect enlightenment.
