analyzed: evam eva etarhi pūrvasyām diśi aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pravartita dhārmika dharma cakrāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ yāpayantaḥ dharmam deśayantaḥ drakṣam
translated: in the same way, in the present, in the eastern direction, I see those immeasurable, incalculable Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have set in motion the wheel of the Dharma, who abide, who endure, who teach the Dharma,

original: ye mayā prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: those whom I first inspired to the highest complete enlightenment, established, and settled

analyzed: evam yāvat ṣaṭsu pāramitāṣu vaktavyam
translated: in the same way, up to the six perfections, it should be said.

analyzed: evam dikṣu vaktavyam
translated: In the same way, it should be said for the southern, western, northern, lower, and upper directions.

original: paśyāmyahaṃ kulaputra purime digbhāge ito buddhakṣetrādekanavatibuddhakṣetraśatasahasrāṇyatikramya KpSū
analyzed: paśyāmi aham kula putra purime digbhāge itas buddhakṣetrāt ekanavati buddhakṣetra śata sahasrāṇi atikramya kpsū
translated: Noble son, I see in the eastern direction, beyond nine hundred thousand buddha-fields from here,

original: saṃpuṣpite lokadhātau vimalatejaguṇarājo nāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmaṃ ca deśayati /
analyzed: saṃpuṣpite lokadhātau vimalatejaguṇarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmam ca deśayati
translated: in the world system called Adorned with Flowers, the Tathagata named Vimalatejaguṇarāja, who abides, sustains, and teaches the Dharma.

original: mayā sa bhagavān pūrvaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaḥ samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ /
analyzed: mayā sa bhagavān pūrvam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditaḥ samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ
translated: By me, that Blessed One was first inspired to generate the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment, was encouraged, established, and confirmed.

original: mayā dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ prathamaṃ samādāpitāḥ / peyālaṃ /
analyzed: mayā dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām prathamam samādāpitāḥ peyālam
translated: By me, they were first encouraged in the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom. The same should be said.

original: purimāyāṃ diśi abhiratye buddhakṣetre akṣobhyo nāma tathāgato /
analyzed: purimāyām diśi abhiratye buddhakṣetre akṣobhyaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the eastern direction, in the Buddha-field of Abhirati, the Tathagata Akshobhya.

analyzed: jambūnade buddhakṣetre sūryagarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Jambunada, the Tathagata named Suryagarbha.

analyzed: ratīśvare buddhakṣetre ratīśvaraghoṣajyotiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Ratishvara, the Tathagata named Ratishvaragho-shujyoti.

original: sūryapratiṣṭhite buddhakṣetre jñānabhāskaro nāma tathāgataḥ /🔽jayavaiśraye buddhakṣetre nāganinardito nāma tathāgataḥ /🔽saṃjīvane buddhakṣetre vajrakīrtirnāma tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: sūryapratiṣṭhite buddhakṣetre jñānabhāskaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  jayavaiśraye buddhakṣetre nāganinarditaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  saṃjīvane buddhakṣetre vajrakīrtiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Suryaprasthita, the Tathagata named Jnanabhaskara.🔽In the Buddha-field of Jayavaishravana, the Tathagata named Naganirdita.🔽In the Buddha-field of Sanjivana, the Tathagata named Vajrakirti.

analyzed: svaraje buddhakṣetre vyāghraraśmiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Svaraja, the Tathagata named Vyagrarashmi.

analyzed: aratīye buddhakṣetre sūryagarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Arati, the Tathagata named Suryagarbha.

analyzed: vairaprabhe buddhakṣetre kīrtiśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Vaipra, the Tathagata named Kirti-shvararaja.

analyzed: meruprabhe buddhakṣetre kpsū
translated: in the Buddha-field Meru-prabha,

analyzed: acintyarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: the Tathagata named Acintya-raja;

analyzed: saṃvare buddhakṣetre jyotiśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: in the Buddha-field Samvara, the Tathagata named Jyotis-srl;

analyzed: kusumaprabhe buddhakṣetre prabhāketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: in the Buddha-field Kusuma-prabha, the Tathagata named Prabha-ketu;

analyzed: kṣamottare buddhakṣetre meru svara sandarśana meruḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: in the Buddha-field Ksama-uttara, the Tathagata named Meru-svara-sanda-rsana-meru;

analyzed: dharaṇāvatyām buddhakṣetre jñānabimbaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: in the Buddha-field Dharana-vati, the Tathagata named Jñana-bimba;

analyzed: kusumavicitre buddhakṣetre vimalanetraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: in the Buddha-field Kusuma-vicitra, the Tathagata named Vimalanetra;

original: etāṃ pūrvaṃgamāṃ kṛtvā kulaputra purimāyāṃ diśyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavatastiṣṭhato yāpayato dharmaṃ deśayato buddhacakṣuṣā paśyāmi
analyzed: etām pūrvaṃgamām kṛtvā kula putra purimāyām diśi aprameya asaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ dharmam deśayataḥ buddha cakṣuṣā paśyāmi
translated: having made these foremost, O son of noble family, I see with my Buddha-eye immeasurable and innumerable Buddhas, Blessed Ones, abiding and living in the eastern direction, teaching the Dharma,

original: ye 'nutpāditabodhicittāḥ pūrve 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā mayā ca prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpitāḥ
analyzed: ye n utpādita bodhi cittāḥ pūrve n uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ mayā ca prathamam dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpitāḥ
translated: those who have not yet generated the mind of enlightenment, whom I have previously inspired towards supreme perfect enlightenment, and who have been inspired by me to practice the perfection of generosity, up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: mayā ca prathamaṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśamupanītā yatra taiḥ sarvaprathamaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabdhaṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: mayā ca prathamam tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśam upanītāḥ yatra taiḥ sarva prathamam vyākaraṇam pratilabdham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And I first brought them to the presence of the Blessed Buddhas, who were abiding and living, where they first received the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha tasyāṃ velāyāṃ saṃpuṣpitāyāṃ lokadhātau tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasyāsanaṃ prakaṃpitaṃ /🔽ye tatra bodhisattvāste tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya KpSū
analyzed: atha tasyām velāyām saṃpuṣpitāyām lokadhātau tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasya āsanam prakaṃpitam  ye tatra bodhisattvāḥ te tasya vimala guṇa teja rājasya
translated: Then at that time, in the world system called Adorned with Flowers, the seat of the Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja shook.

original: tathāgatasyāsanaṃ prakaṃpitaṃ dṛṣṭvā tameva tathāgataṃ pṛṣṭavantaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgatasya āsanam prakaṃpitam dṛṣṭvā tam eva tathāgatam pṛṣṭavantaḥ
translated: Those Bodhisattvas there, having seen the seat of that Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja shaking, asked that very Tathagata:

original: ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadi idamadṛṣṭapūrvaṃ bhagavata āsanaṃ prakaṃpitam /iti /
analyzed: kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yadi idam adṛṣṭa pūrvam bhagavataḥ āsanam prakaṃpitam iti
translated: What is the cause, O Blessed One, what is the reason that this previously unseen seat of the Blessed One is shaking?

original: sa tathāgatastānavocat asti kulaputrāḥ paścime digbhāge ito buddhakṣetrādekonanavatibuddhakṣetrānatikramya
analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ tān avocat asti kula putrāḥ paścime digbhāge itas buddhakṣetrāt ekonanavati buddhakṣetrān atikramya
translated: That Tathagata said to them: There are, O sons of good family, in the western direction, beyond ninety-nine Buddha-fields from here,

original: tatra sahā nāma lokadhātustatra śākyamunirnāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: tatra sahāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: a world system called Saha, where a Tathagata named Shakyamuni resides, is present, and lives.

original: sa etarhi caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ pūrvayogamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: saḥ etarhi caturṇām parṣadām pūrva yogam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: He is now teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies, beginning with his past connections.

original: tena tathāgatena pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūtenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādapitāḥ /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena pūrvam bodhisattva bhūtena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādapitāḥ
translated: Those who were inspired by that Tathāgata in the past when he was a bodhisattva to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: yena me prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpannam
translated: by whom my first thought of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment arose,

original: tena tathāgatenāhaṃ prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpito yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena aham prathamam dāna pāramitāyām samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: by that Tathāgata I was first inspired, established, and confirmed in the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tena tathāgatena pūrvabodhisattvacaryāṃ caratāhaṃ prathamaṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśamupanīto /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena pūrva bodhisattva caryām caratā aham prathamam tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśam upanītaḥ
translated: By that Tathāgata who previously practiced the conduct of a bodhisattva, I was first brought into the presence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide and live,

original: yatra me prathamaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabdhamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yatra me prathamam vyākaraṇam pratilabdham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: where I first obtained the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa ca me śākyamunistathāgataḥ kalyāṇamitraḥ sahe lokadhātau tiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: sa ca me śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ kalyāṇa mitraḥ sahe lokadhātau tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: And that good friend, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, abides and lives in the Sahā world system.

original: sa evaṃ caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ imaṃ pūrvayogamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: saḥ evam caturṇām parṣadām imam pūrva yogam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: He is teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies, beginning with this past connection.

analyzed: tena tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena mama asanam kaṃpate
translated: By the empowerment of that Tathāgata, my seat is shaking.

analyzed: kaḥ yuṣmākam kula putra utsahate
translated: Who among you, noble sons, is eager

original: madvacanāt sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ gantuṃ śākyamunestathāgatasyārogyakauśalyaṃ paripṛcchanāya / /
analyzed: mad vacanāt saham buddhakṣetram gantum śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya ārogya kauśalyam paripṛcchanāya
translated: to go to the Buddha-field of Sahā at my request to inquire about the well-being and health of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni?

analyzed: tatas te bodhisattvāḥ vimala guṇa teja rājānam tathāgatam āhuḥ
translated: Then those Bodhisattvas said to the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja,

original: ya iha bhadanta bhagavan saṃpuṣpite buddhakṣetre ṛddhimantaḥ sarvabodhisattvaguṇapāramitāprāptāste
analyzed: ye iha bhadanta bhagavan saṃpuṣpite buddhakṣetre ṛddhimantaḥ sarva bodhisattva guṇa pāramitā prāptāḥ te
translated: Those who here, in this blossoming Buddha-field, possess miraculous powers and have attained all the perfections of a Bodhisattva,

analyzed: pūrvāhna samaye mahāntam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā anyasmāt buddhakṣetrāt vikurvya abhyāgataḥ tena ayam
translated: they have today, in the forenoon, seen a great light and have come here by their miraculous power from another Buddha-field.

analyzed: muhūrtam pṛthivīcālaḥ puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ ca
translated: This is why there was an earthquake and a rain of flowers for a moment.

original: te ca bodhisattvā āhuḥ /🔽vayamapi bhadanta bhagavan gamiṣyāmastaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ taṃ śākyamuniṃ vandanāya paryupasanāya taṃ ca sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ āhuḥ  vayam api bhadanta bhagavan gamiṣyāmaḥ tam saham buddhakṣetram tam śākyamunim vandanāya paryupasanāya tam ca sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam
translated: And those Bodhisattvas said,

analyzed: dharmaparyāyam śravaṇāya
translated: We too, Venerable Blessed One, will go to that Sahā Buddha-field to pay homage to that Śākyamuni and to attend upon him, and to hear that Dharma discourse called 'The Entry into the Gate of Dhāraṇīs and Aspects of Omniscience.'

analyzed: te bahu bodhisattva śata sahasrāḥ svena ṛddhi anubhāvena tatas buddhakṣetrāt saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Those many hundreds of thousands of Bodhisattvas set out from that Buddha-field by their own miraculous power.

analyzed: te na avagacchanti kva gantavyam
translated: They do not know where to go.

analyzed: te pi āhuḥ
translated: They also said:

original: tāmapi vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan diśaṃ na jānīmo yatra sahā lokadhātuḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: tām api vayam bhadanta bhagavan diśam na jānīmaḥ yatra sahā lokadhātuḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we do not know that direction where the Sahā world system, the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, is located.

original: tataḥ sa vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgato bāhuṃ prasārya pañcabhyo 'ṅgulibhyo vividhānyarciṃṣi pramumoca /
analyzed: tatas sa vimala guṇa teja rājaḥ tathāgataḥ bāhum prasārya pañcabhyaḥ ṅgulibhyaḥ vividhāni arciṃṣi pramumoca
translated: Then the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja extended his arm and emitted various flames from his five fingers.

analyzed: tatas tad arciṣaḥ ekona navati buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi avabhāsitavān
translated: Then those flames illuminated ninety-nine thousand Buddha-fields.

analyzed: yāvat ca imam saham buddhakṣetram avabhāsitavān
translated: And they illuminated this Sahā Buddha-field.

original: yataste bodhisattvāḥ paśyanti sarvāvadimaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ bodhisattvairgaganatale ca devanāgayakṣāsuraiḥ sphuṭaṃ /
analyzed: yatas te bodhisattvāḥ paśyanti sarvāvat imam saham buddhakṣetram sphuṭam bodhisattvaiḥ gagana tale ca deva nāga yakṣa asuraiḥ sphuṭam
translated: There the Bodhisattvas saw the entire Sahā Buddha-field filled with Bodhisattvas, and the sky filled with gods, Nāgas, Yakṣas, and Asuras.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaste bodhisattvāstaṃ vimalaguṇatejarājānaṃ tathāgatamevamāhuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar te bodhisattvāḥ tam vimala guṇa teja rājānam tathāgatam evam āhuḥ
translated: And having seen that, those Bodhisattvas said to the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja:

original: paśyāmo vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarvāvantaṃ sphuṭaṃ /
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ vayam bhadanta bhagavan saham buddhakṣetram sarvāvantam sphuṭam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we see the entire Sahā Buddha-field filled.

original: nāsti tatrāvakāśo 'ntaśo daṇḍanikṣepaṇamātramapi yanna sphuṭaṃ bodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: na asti tatra avakāśaḥ daṇḍa nikṣepaṇa mātram api yat na sphuṭam bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: There is no space there, not even enough room to drop a staff, where the bodhisattvas are not well known.

original: paśyāmaḥ śākyamunistathāgato 'smān nirīkṣate dharmaṃ ca deśayati /
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ u smān nirīkṣate dharmam ca deśayati
translated: We see the Tathāgata Śākyamuni looking at us and teaching the Dharma.

original: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgatasteṣāṃ bodhisattvānāmevamāha samantacakṣuḥ kulaputrāḥ śākyamunistathāgato /
analyzed: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ tathāgataḥ teṣām bodhisattvānām evam āha samantacakṣuḥ kula putrāḥ śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: And that Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja says to those bodhisattvas, 'Sons of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has all-seeing eyes.

original: ye kecit kulaputrāḥ sahe lokadhātau sattvā bhūmisthitā vā antarīkṣasthitā vā tataścaikaikaḥ sattva evaṃ saṃjānāti /
analyzed: ye kecid kula putrāḥ sahe lokadhātau sattvāḥ bhūmi sthitāḥ vā antarīkṣa sthitāḥ vā tatas ca ekaikaḥ sattvaḥ evam saṃjānāti
translated: Whatever beings there are, sons of noble family, in the Sahā world system, whether on the ground or in the sky, each one of those beings thinks thus:

original: maṃ śākyamunistathāgataḥ sarvacetasā nirīkṣate mamaikamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: mam śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ sarva cetasā nirīkṣate mama ekam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni looks at me with all his heart and teaches the Dharma with me alone in mind.

original: sarvavarṇaṃśca sa kulaputra śākyamunistathāgato dharmaṃ deśayati ekavarṇasthānaṃ /
analyzed: sarva varṇan ca sa kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati eka varṇa sthānam
translated: And, son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni teaches the Dharma with all colors, in a place of one color.

original: KpSū ye ca tatra kulaputra sattvā brāhmabhaktāste śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ brahmāṇaṃ samanupaśyanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra kula putra sattvāḥ brāhma bhaktāḥ te śākyamunim tathāgatam brahmāṇam samanupaśyanti
translated: And, son of noble family, those beings there who are devoted to Brahmā see the Tathāgata Śākyamuni as Brahmā.

analyzed: mahābrahma pati vyāhāreṇa dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: They listen to the Dharma with the speech of the great lord Brahmā.

analyzed: yāvat ye mārabhaktikā
translated: Up to those who are devoted to Māra.

analyzed: ye sūryabhaktikā
translated: Those who are devoted to the sun,

analyzed: ye candra bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to the moon,

analyzed: ye vaiśravaṇabhaktikā  ye virūḍhaka bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to Vaisravana,🔽those who are devoted to Virudhaka,
those who are devoted to Virupaksha,

analyzed: ye dhṛtarāṣṭra bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to Dhritarashtra,

original: ye maheśvarabhaktikāste sattvā maheśvararūpavarṇasaṃsthānavacanavyāhāreṇa śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ paśyanti dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye maheśvara bhaktikāḥ te sattvāḥ maheśvara rūpa varṇa saṃsthāna vacana vyāhāreṇa śākyamunim tathāgatam paśyanti dharmam ca śṛṇvanti
translated: those beings who see the Tathagata Shakyamuni and hear the Dharma in the form, color, appearance, speech and expression of Mahesvara,

original: yāvaccaturaśītistatra sattvānāṃ varṇasaṃsthānabhaktirūpavyāhārasahasrāṇi te tathā caiva śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ paśyanti dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvanti
analyzed: yāvat caturaśītiḥ tatra sattvānām varṇa saṃsthāna bhakti rūpa vyāhāra sahasrāṇi te tathā ca eva śākyamunim tathāgatam paśyanti dharmam ca śṛṇvanti
translated: up to the eighty-four thousand different forms, colors, appearances, and expressions of beings there, they see the Tathagata Shakyamuni in the same way and hear the Dharma.

original: tasyāṃ ca parṣadi rahagarjito nāma bodhisattvo dvitīyaśca jyotiraśmirnāma bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām ca parṣadi rahagarjitaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ dvitīyaḥ ca jyotiraśmiḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: And in that assembly there were two bodhisattvas named Rahu-garjita and Jyoti-rasmi.

analyzed: atha vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ tathāgataḥ tān bodhisattvān āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja addressed those bodhisattvas, saying:

original: gacchatha yūyaṃ kulaputrāḥ sahe lokadhātau śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ madvacanādārogyakauśalyaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ paripṛcchatha /
analyzed: gacchatha yūyam kula putrāḥ sahe lokadhātau śākyamunim tathāgatam mad vacanāt ārogya kauśalyam sukha sparśa vihāra tām paripṛcchatha
translated: Go, noble sons, to the Sahā world system and inquire about the well-being, health, ease, and comfort of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni on my behalf.

analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ āhuḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas said:

original: sarvāvantaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sakṣitigaganaṃ KpSū
analyzed: sarvāvantam bhadanta bhagavan saham buddhakṣetram sa kṣiti gaganam
translated: Reverend Blessed One, we see the entire Sahā buddha field, with its earth and space,

analyzed: bodhisattvaiḥ sphuṭam samanupaśyāmaḥ
translated: filled with bodhisattvas.

original: na cātraikasattvasyāpyavakāśo 'sti kṣitau gagane vā yatra vayaṃ pratitiṣṭhemaḥ /
analyzed: na ca atra eka sattvasya api avakāśaḥ sti kṣitau gagane vā yatra vayam pratitiṣṭhemaḥ
translated: And there is not even space for a single being on the earth or in the sky where we could stand.

original: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgata āha mā kulaputrā evaṃ vadatha /
analyzed: sa ca vimala guṇa teja rājaḥ tathāgataḥ āha mā kula putrāḥ evam vadatha
translated: And that Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejorāja said, Do not speak thus, sons of good family.

analyzed: na asti sahe buddhakṣetre vakāśaḥ
translated: There is space in the Sahā buddha field.

analyzed: vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ cintyaiḥ buddha guṇaiḥ
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni has vast space, with inconceivable buddha qualities.

analyzed: pūrva praṇidhānena vistīrṇā tathāgatasya kṛpā śāsana avatāra praveśā
translated: The Tathāgata's compassion, teaching, and entry into the vastness is due to his previous vows.

analyzed: triśaraṇa gamanam
translated: [He teaches] the three refuges.

original: triyānadharmadeśanāmārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽trividhaṃ ca śikṣāsaṃvaraṃ deśayati /
analyzed: triyāna dharma deśanām ārabhya dharmam deśayati  trividham ca śikṣā saṃvaram deśayati
translated: [He teaches] the Dharma beginning with the three vehicles and the teaching of the Dharma.🔽[He teaches] the three kinds of vows of training.

analyzed: trīṇi ca vimokṣa dvārāṇi upadarśayati
translated: [He shows] the three doors to liberation.

analyzed: tribhyaḥ pāyebhyaḥ sattvān uddharati
translated: [He] delivers beings from the three lower realms.

analyzed: tisṛṣu ca śiveṣu patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: [He] establishes [them] in the three auspicious paths.

original: ekasmiṃ samaye kulaputra śākyamunistathāgato 'cirābhisaṃbuddho vaineyasattvāvekṣayā madhye śailaparvate indrākṣasya yakṣasya bhavane sālaguhāyāṃ
analyzed: ekasmin samaye kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ cira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vaineya sattva avekṣayā madhye śaila parvate indrākṣasya yakṣasya bhavane sālaguhāyām
translated: At one time, noble sir, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, not long after his full enlightenment, out of consideration for beings to be trained, was dwelling in the middle of the Śailapर्वa range, in the abode of the yakṣa Indra-akṣa, in the Sāla cave,

analyzed: sapta aham eka paryaṅkena atināmayati
translated: At one time, noble sir, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, not long after his full enlightenment, looking at beings to be trained, spent seven days in a cross-legged posture in the middle of the Śailapर्वata, in the abode of the yakṣa Indrākṣa, in the Sāla cave,

analyzed: vimukti prīti sukham pratisaṃvedayati
translated: experiencing the bliss of liberation and joy.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā tathāgatakāyena sphuṭā /🔽nāsti tatrāvakāśo 'ntaśaścaturaṅgulapramāṇaṃ KpSū
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā tathāgata kāyena sphuṭā  na asti tatra avakāśaḥ ntaśaḥ catur aṅgula pramāṇam kpsū
translated: The entire Sāla cave was filled with the Tathāgata's body.🔽There was not even space for the tip of a needle,

analyzed: yat tathāgata kāyena na sphuṭam
translated: let alone a larger space, that was not filled with the Tathāgata's body.

original: tasya ca saptāhasyātyayena daśabhir diśābhirdvādaśanayutā bodhisattvānāṃ tatra sahe
analyzed: tasya ca saptāhasya atyayena daśabhiḥ diśābhiḥ dvādaśa nayutāḥ bodhisattvānām tatra sahe
translated: After the seven days had passed, from the ten directions, twelve nayutas of bodhisattvas from the Sahā

original: lokadhātau yastasya parvatasyābhimukhaṃ sthitvā śākyamunestathāgatasya vandanāya
analyzed: lokadhātau yaḥ tasya parvatasya abhimukham sthitvā śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya vandanāya
translated: world system gathered in front of the mountain to pay homage to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

analyzed: paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: to attend on him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: sa ca kulaputra śākyamunistathāgatastatra parśadi ridhyabhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskṛtavān /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tatra parśadi ridhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
translated: And that Tathāgata Śākyamuni, noble sir, performed a miracle in that assembly.

original: sā ca sālaguhā evaṃ vistīrṇā caivaṃ vipulā ca prādurbhūtā /
analyzed: sā ca sālaguhā evam vistīrṇā ca evam vipulā ca prādurbhūtā
translated: The Sāla cave appeared to be so vast and so large,

original: yadā te dvādaśanayutā bodhisattvānāṃ tatra sālaguhāyāṃ praviṣṭā vistīrṇāvakāśaṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: yadā te dvādaśa nayutāḥ bodhisattvānām tatra sāla guhāyām praviṣṭāḥ vistīrṇa avakāśam paśyanti sma
translated: When those twelve nayutas of bodhisattvas entered the Sāla Cave, they saw that it had become spacious.

original: ekaikaśca bodhisattvastatra tathāgatasya vividhabodhisattvavikurvaṇena pūjāṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ tatra tathāgatasya vividha bodhisattva vikurvaṇena pūjām kṛtvā
translated: And each bodhisattva there made an offering to the Tathāgata with various bodhisattva transformations.

original: ekaiko bodhisattvastatra saptaratnamayāsanaṃ nirmitavān yatropaviṣṭā dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti sma /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tatra sapta ratna maya āsanam nirmitavān yatra upaviṣṭāḥ dharmam śṛṇvanti sma
translated: Each bodhisattva created a seat made of the seven precious substances, where they sat and listened to the Dharma.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ kula putra sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni is like that, vast.

original: te ca bodhisattvāstasya śākyamunestathāgatasya sakāśāddharmaṃ śrutvā śākyamunestathāgatasya
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ tasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya sakāśāt dharmam śrutvā śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya
translated: And those bodhisattvas, having heard the Dharma from the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: pādau śirasā vanditvā triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: pādau śirasā vanditvā triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: bowed their heads at the feet of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, circumambulated him three times, and departed for their own buddha-fields.

original: aciraprakāntānāṃ ca teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sālaguhā yathā paurvāṇāṃ saṃsthitā /🔽KpSū
analyzed: acira prakāntānām ca teṣām bodhisattvānām sālaguhā yathā paurvāṇām saṃsthitā  kpsū
translated: And soon after those bodhisattvas had left, the Sāla Cave became as it was before.

analyzed: tatra caturdvīpikāyām kauśikaḥ nāma śakraḥ āyuḥ parīkṣīṇaḥ tiryagyoni upapatti bhaya bhītaḥ
translated: There, in the four continents, there was a Śakra named Kauśika, whose lifespan was exhausted and who was afraid of being reborn in the animal realm.

original: sa caturaśītibhistrayastriṃśaddevasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ yena sālaguhā yena ca bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: sa caturaśītibhiḥ trayastriṃśat deva sahasraiḥ sārdham yena sālaguhā yena ca bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati
translated: He, together with 84,000 gods from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, approached the Sāla Cave where the Blessed One was.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya sāmantake indrākṣasya sālaguhā bhavane sthitaḥ
translated: Having approached, he stood in the vicinity of the Sāla Cave abode of Indra's Eye.

analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ nubhāvena etat abhavat
translated: By the power of the Blessed One, this thought occurred to him:

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam pañcaśikham gandharva putram adhyeṣemaḥ
translated: Let us now request Pañcaśikha, the gandharva son,

original: sa ca pañcaśikho madhureṇa svareṇa bhagavantamabhimukhaṃ staviṣyati /
analyzed: sa ca pañcaśikhaḥ madhureṇa svareṇa bhagavantam abhimukham staviṣyati
translated: and he, Pañcaśikha, with a sweet voice, will praise the Blessed One face to face.

analyzed: tadā bhagavān dhyāna samādhibhyaḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: Then the Blessed One will emerge from his meditative absorption.

analyzed: tatas śakraḥ pañcaśikham gandharva putram adhīṣṭhavān
translated: Then Śakra requested Pañcaśikha, the gandharva son,

original: atha pañcaśikho vīṇāṃ manojñena gītavāditena bhagavato 'nubhāvena pañcabhiḥ stavaśatairbhagavato varṇamabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha pañcaśikhaḥ vīṇām manojñena gīta vāditena bhagavataḥ nubhāvena pañcabhiḥ stava śataiḥ bhagavataḥ varṇam abhāṣata
translated: Then Pañcaśikha, with his lute, with a delightful song and music, by the power of the Blessed One, spoke the praise of the Blessed One with five hundred praises.

original: yadā ca kulaputra pañcaśikha ārabdho bhagavato 'bhistavanāya tataḥ sa śākyamunirbhagavān
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra pañcaśikhaḥ ārabdhaḥ bhagavataḥ bhiḥ stavanāya tatas sa śākyamuniḥ bhagavān
translated: When, noble son, Pañcaśikha was engaged in praising the Blessed One, then that Blessed One Śākyamuni

original: sughoṣavairocanaketuṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannastena samādhinā ye sahe lokadhātau maharddhikayakṣarākṣasā
analyzed: sughoṣa vairocana ketum nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ tena samādhinā ye sahe lokadhātau maharddhika yakṣa rākṣasā
translated: He entered the samadhi called Sughoṣavairocanaketu. By that samadhi, all the powerful yakshas, rakshasas,

original: vāsurā vā garuḍā vā kinnarā vā mahoragā vā gandharvā vā sarve kāmāvacarā devā sarve
analyzed: vā asurāḥ vā garuḍāḥ vā kinnarāḥ vā mahoragāḥ vā gandharvāḥ vā sarve kāmāvacarāḥ sarve
translated: vasus, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, gandharvas, all the gods of the desire realm, all the

original: rūpāvacarā devaputrāstatra sannipātā babhūvurye ca svarabhaktikāste svaraṃ śrutvā prasīdanti /
analyzed: rūpāvacarāḥ deva putrāḥ tatra sannipātāḥ babhūvuḥ ye ca svarabhaktikāḥ te svaram śrutvā prasīdanti
translated: sons of gods of the form realm, who were assembled there, and those who were devoted to sound, upon hearing the sound, were pleased.

analyzed: ye varṇa yaśaḥ bhaktikāḥ te bhagavataḥ varṇam
translated: Those who were devoted to praise and fame, upon hearing the praise of the Blessed One,

analyzed: śrutvā tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśe tīvra prema prasāda guru gaurava citrīkāra jātāḥ prasīdanti
translated: having heard it, generated intense love, faith, reverence, and respect towards that Blessed One, and were pleased.

original: ye veṇuvādyabhaktikāste veṇuvādyaṃ śrutvā prasīdanti /🔽tataḥ śākyamunirbhagavāṃstataḥ samādhervyutthāya sālaguhāyā dvāraṃ darśāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: ye veṇu vādya bhaktikāḥ te veṇu vādyam śrutvā prasīdanti  tatas śākyamuniḥ bhagavān tatas samādheḥ vyutthāya sālaguhāyāḥ dvāram darśāpayāmāsa
translated: Those who were devoted to the sound of the flute, upon hearing the sound of the flute, were pleased.🔽Then the Blessed Shakyamuni, having arisen from that samadhi, showed the door of the Sāla cave.

analyzed: śakraḥ ca upasaṃkrāntaḥ bhagavantam pṛṣṭavān
translated: And Shakra approached and asked the Blessed One:

analyzed: bhagavam kutra upaviśāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, where shall we sit?

original: sa śākyamunistathāgata uvāca niṣīdadhvaṃ yakṣā yāvattasthuḥ samāgatāḥ /
analyzed: sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ uvāca niṣīdadhvam yakṣāḥ yāvat tasthuḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: That Tathagata Shakyamuni said, Sit down, yakshas, as many as have assembled, they remained.

original: tataḥ sālaguhā evaṃ vistīrṇā saṃsthitā yathā dvādaśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamā yakṣāstatra guhāyāṃ praviṣṭā /
analyzed: tatas sāla guhā evam vistīrṇā saṃsthitā yathā dvādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ yakṣāḥ tatra guhāyām praviṣṭā
translated: Then the cave in the Sāla Grove was expanded so that it could accommodate as many Yakṣas as there are sands in twelve Ganges Rivers.

original: niṣaṇṇāyāśca tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ sa śākyamunistathāgatastathārūpāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavāṃ /
analyzed: niṣaṇṇāyāḥ ca tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tathārūpām dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: And when that assembly was seated, that Tathāgata Śākyamuni gave a Dharma teaching such that

original: yathā ye tasmin parṣadi śrāvakayānikā niṣaṇṇāste śrāvakayānakathāṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: yathā ye tasmin parṣadi śrāvaka yānikāḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ te śrāvaka yāna kathām śṛṇvanti
translated: those in that assembly who were followers of the Śrāvakayāna heard a discourse on the Śrāvakayāna.

analyzed: nava navati koṭyaḥ tatra śrotāpatti phalam prāptāḥ
translated: There, nine hundred and ninety million attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ye ca tatra parṣadi anuttarasamyaksaṃbuddhayānikāste śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra parṣadi anuttara samyaksaṃbuddha yānikāḥ te śuddhām mahāyāna kathām śṛṇvanti
translated: And those in that assembly who were followers of the unsurpassed vehicle of the Buddhas heard a discourse on the pure Mahāyāna.

original: tatra ca pañcaśikhagandharvapūrvaṃgamā aṣṭādaśanayutā avaivartikāḥ saṃsthitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatra ca pañcaśikha gandharva pūrvaṃgamāḥ aṣṭādaśa nayutāḥ a vaivartikāḥ saṃsthitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau

analyzed: kaścid śrāvaka yāne cittam utpāditam

original: sa ca tatra kauśikaḥ śakro bhayātparimukto /
analyzed: sa ca tatra kauśikaḥ śakraḥ bhayāt parimuktaḥ

analyzed: varṣa sahasram ca āyuḥ vivṛddham

original: avaivartikaścānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau babhūva /🔽tadevaṃ vistīrṇāvakāśaḥ kulaputra sa śākyamunistathāgataḥ /
analyzed: a vaivartikaḥ ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau babhūva  tat evam vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ kula putra sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: And he became irreversible from highest genuine full Awakening.🔽Thus, noble sir, that Tathāgata Śākyamuni has a vast scope.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇam ca asya tathāgatasya svara maṇḍalam
translated: And the sphere of that Tathāgata’s voice is vast.

original: na śakyaṃ kenacittasya tathāgatasya svaramaṇḍalasya paryantamudgṛhītuṃ vā gaṇāyituṃ vā /
analyzed: na śakyam kenacid tasya tathāgatasya svara maṇḍalasya paryantam udgṛhītum vā gaṇāyitum vā

analyzed: vistīrṇam tasya tathāgatasya upāya kauśalyam sattva paripākaḥ ca
translated: The skillful means and development of beings of that Tathāgata are vast.

analyzed: na śakyam tasya tathāgatasya upāya kauśalyam paryantam udgṛhītum
translated: No one is able to grasp the extent of that Tathāgata’s skillful means.

analyzed: vistīrṇa kāyaḥ ca kula putra tathāgataḥ
translated: Noble sir, the Tathāgata has a vast body.

analyzed: na śākyam kenacid tasya mūrdhānam avalokayitum
translated: No one is able to see the top of his head.

analyzed: kāyasya vā paryantam adhigantum
translated: Or to reach the limit of his body.

original: yāvantaśca sattvā etarhi tatra sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitā yadi te sattvāḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca sattvāḥ etarhi tatra sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitāḥ yadi te sattvāḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya
translated: And all the beings who have now gathered in that Sahā buddha-field, if those beings were to

original: kukṣau praviśeyuste sarve tatra vicareyuste ca sattvāstasya tathāgatasyaikaromamukhe🔽praviśeyuḥ niṣkrameyuśca /🔽te ekaromamukhāttasya tathāgatasya na śaktāḥ paryantamudgṛhītuṃ ūnatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vāntaśo KpSū
analyzed: kukṣau praviśeyuḥ te sarve tatra vicareyuḥ te ca sattvāḥ tasya tathāgatasya eka roma mukhe  praviśeyuḥ niṣkrameyuḥ ca  te eka roma mukhāt tasya tathāgatasya na śaktāḥ paryantam udgṛhītum ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam
translated: All of them would enter his belly and move about there, and those beings would enter and emerge from a single pore of that Tathāgata.

analyzed: divyena api cakṣuṣā
translated: They would not be able to grasp the limit or the fullness or the lack of fullness of that Tathāgata's body, even with the divine eye.

analyzed: tat evam vistīrṇa kāyaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has such an extensive body.

analyzed: punar aparam kula putra vistīrṇa buddhakṣetraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has an extensive Buddha-field.

original: yāvantaśca daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikasamā buddhakṣetrā evaṃ paripūrṇā bhaveyuḥ🔽sattvaistadyathāpi nāmaitarhi sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarve te sattvā etarhi sahe buddhakṣetre
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālika samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ evam paripūrṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ  sattvaiḥ tat yathā api nāma etarhi saham buddhakṣetram sarve te sattvāḥ etarhi sahe buddhakṣetre
translated: As many Buddha-fields as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges river, in the ten directions, they would be completely filled

analyzed: viśeyuḥ sarve te tatra vicareyuḥ
translated: with beings, just as this Sahā Buddha-field is now. All those beings would enter this Sahā Buddha-field now, and they would all move about there.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathaiva tasya tathāgatasya pūrvaṃ prathamacittotpādenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: tathā eva tasya tathāgatasya pūrvam prathama citta utpādena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam babhūva
translated: Because from the very beginning, when he first generated the mind of enlightenment for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, that Tathāgata made this aspiration:

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu kula putra ekam gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ
translated: Let alone one world system with as many buddha-fields as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

analyzed: tat yathā etarhi saha buddhakṣetram paripūrṇam sattvaiḥ te sarve etarhi sahe lokadhātau
translated: just as this Sahā buddha-field is now filled with beings, and if all those beings were now to enter this Sahā world-system,

original: praviśeyuste sarve tatra vicareyurevaṃrūpaṃ tasya tathāgatasya pūrvaṃ prathamacittotpāditānuttarajñānapratilābhāya
analyzed: praviśeyuḥ te sarve tatra vicareyuḥ evaṃrūpam tasya tathāgatasya pūrvam prathama citta utpādita anuttara jñāna pratilābhāya
translated: and if all of them were to move about there, such was the Tathāgata's original aspiration for the attainment of unsurpassed knowledge, beginning with the first generation of the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: praṇidhānam babhūva
translated: Such was his aspiration for the attainment of unsurpassed knowledge.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇa buddhakṣetraḥ sa kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has a buddha-field that is so vast.

analyzed: ebhiḥ catur dharmaiḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ yathāvat gṛhṇīta
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni is superior to you in these four dharmas. Accept it as it is.

analyzed: yūyam kula putrāḥ imām candra roca vimalām puṣpām

analyzed: yaḥ ca punar paścimāyām pañcāśatyām antaśas likhitvā dhārayiṣyati
translated: and whoever, in the last five hundred years, writes it out and bears it in mind,

analyzed: sa bahutaram puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: He will produce a much greater heap of merit.

original: na tvevaṃ ṣoḍaśamahākalpān ṣaṭpāramitācaramāṇasya bodhisattvasya puṇyaskandhaḥ /
analyzed: na tu evam ṣoḍaśa mahā kalpān ṣaṣ pāramitā caramāṇasya bodhisattvasya puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: But it is not like that for a bodhisattva who practices the six perfections for sixteen great eons, in terms of the heap of merit.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sadevakasya lokasya samārakasya sabrahmakasya saśravaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ sayakṣanāgagandharvakumbhāṇḍapretapiśācakinnarāsurāṇāṃ duṣṭacittānāṃ
analyzed: sa devakasya lokasya sa mārakasya sa brahmakasya sa śravaṇa brāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ sa yakṣa nāga gandharva kumbhāṇḍa preta piśāca kinnara asurāṇām duṣṭa cittānām
translated: For the world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā, this is the dispeller of all the wicked thoughts of the beings with śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas, Yakṣas, Nāgas, Gandharvas, Kumbhāṇḍas, Pretas, Piśācas, and Kinnaras and Asuras.

analyzed: sarva rogāṇām praśamanaḥ
translated: It is the pacifier of all diseases.🔽It is the pacifier of all quarrels, disputes, fights, and arguments.
It is the pacifier of all untimely winds, deaths, and diseases.

analyzed: kṣemakaraṇīyaḥ  subhikṣa karaḥ
translated: It is the maker of the pacification of all famines.🔽It is the maker of security.🔽It is the maker of good harvests.
It is the maker of the collection of health.

analyzed: bhītānām abhaya sukha karaḥ
translated: It is the maker of the happiness of fearlessness for the fearful.
It is the maker of the pacification of afflictions.
It is the maker of the increase of roots of merit.

analyzed: apāya duḥkha pramocana karaḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ mārga sandarśana karaḥ
translated: It is the maker of the liberation of the suffering of the lower realms through the three vehicles. It is the maker of the manifestation of the path.
It is the maker of the attainment of samādhi, dhāraṇī, and patience.

analyzed: sarva sattvānām upajīva karo
translated: It is the supporter of all beings.
It is the maker of sitting at the vajra seat.

analyzed: catur māra dharṣaṇa karo
translated: He conquers the four Maras.

analyzed: bodhi pakṣa abhisaṃbudhyana karaḥ
translated: He realizes the factors of enlightenment.
He turns the wheel of Dharma.

analyzed: ārya sapta dhana virahitānām sattvānām bodhi pakṣa samṛddhi karaḥ
translated: He brings about the abundance of the factors of enlightenment for beings who are devoid of the seven noble riches.

analyzed: bahu parivāraḥ
translated: He has a large retinue.

original: abhayapuranagarapraveśakaraṇārthaṃ mayā dharmaparyāyo bhāṣitaḥ /🔽kasya haste imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ parindāmi / /
analyzed: abhayapura nagara praveśa karaṇa artham mayā dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣitaḥ  kasya haste imam dharmaparyāyam parindāmi
translated: I have taught this Dharma discourse in order to make enter the city of the fearless citadel.🔽Into whose hands shall I entrust this Dharma discourse?

original: ko mamemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ paścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ rakṣiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ mama imam dharmaparyāyam paścimāyām pañcāśatyām rakṣiṣyati
translated: Who will protect this Dharma discourse of mine in the last five hundred years?

original: adharmabhūmiṣṭhānāṃ sattvānāṃ bhinnaśīlānāṃ ca bhikṣūṇāṃ KpSū
analyzed: adharma bhūmiṣṭhānām sattvānām bhinna śīlānām ca bhikṣūṇām
translated: For beings who abide in unrighteousness, and for monks with broken morality,

analyzed: karṇa puṭe prakāśayiṣyati
translated: he will proclaim it in their ear.

analyzed: adharma rāga raktānām viṣama lobha abhibhūtānām mithyādharma paricitānām a paripakva cittām saṃvejayiṣyati
translated: He will inspire with remorse those whose minds are not ripe, who are attached to unrighteous desire, who are overcome by wrongful greed, and who are familiar with false Dharma.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā bhagavataścetasā cittamājñāya /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā bhagavataḥ cetasā cittam ājñāya
translated: And the entire assembly, understanding the Blessed One's thought,

analyzed: tatra parṣadi merupuṇyaḥ nāma yakṣa riṣiḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: In that assembly, there was a yaksha sage named Merupunya who was seated.

original: atha maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ merupuṇyaṃ yakṣariṣiṃ gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ sakāśamupanītavān /
analyzed: atha maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam meru puṇyam yakṣa riṣim gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ sakāśam upanītavān
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya took hold of that Merupunya Yakṣarṣi and brought him into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha udgṛhṇa tvaṃ maharṣa imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha udgṛhṇa tvam mahā ṛṣe imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: The Blessed One said, Great Seer, you should uphold this Dharma discourse.

original: yāvatpaścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ deśāntaragatānāmavaivartikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ karṇapuṭeṣu prakāśasva /
analyzed: yāvat paścimāyām pañcāśatyām deśa antara gatānām a vaivartikānām bodhisattvānām karṇa puṭeṣu prakāśasva
translated: Until the last fifty years, let it shine in the ears of the irreversible bodhisattvas who have gone to other lands.

original: adya cāvaivartikacittaṃ saṃjanayasvā haivaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścaturaśītimahākalpā
analyzed: adya ca a vaivartika cittam saṃjanayasva ha evam bhadanta bhagavan caturaśīti mahā kalpā
translated: And today, generate the irreversible mind. So be it, Blessed One. For eighty-four great kalpas,

original: atikrāmantā yanmayā bhadanta bhagavan pūrvaṃ praṇidhānena yakṣariṣitvālabdhyānuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: atikrāmantā yat mayā bhadanta bhagavan pūrvam praṇidhānena
translated: I have been reborn as a yakṣarṣi through the aspiration I made in the past, Blessed One, practicing the conduct for enlightenment in unsurpassed perfect complete awakening,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇo gaṇanātikrāntāḥ sattvā mayā caturṣu brāhmavihāreṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau bodhi cārikām caramāṇaḥ gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ mayā caturṣu brāhma vihāreṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: I have established more beings than can be counted in the four great brahma abodes.

analyzed: a vaivartika bhūmau ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And I have established them in the irreversible stage.

original: KpSū ahaṃ ca sattvānāṃ svayameva paripācayāmi yāvatpaścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ udgṛhīṣyati /
analyzed: aham ca sattvānām svayam eva paripācayāmi yāvat paścimāyām pañcāśatyām yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam udgṛhīṣyati
translated: And I myself will ripen beings until the last fifty years, for whoever will uphold this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: yāvat yaḥ itas catuṣpadikām api gāthām dhārayiṣyati
translated: As long as they will hold even a four-line verse from this.

original: idamavocadbhagavān āttamanāḥ sarvāvatī parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti //
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ sarvāvatī parṣad sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: The Blessed One said this, and the entire assembly, together with the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: iti śrī karuṇāpuṇḍarīkam nāma mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Mahāyāna Sūtra called The White Lotus of Compassion.

analyzed: śubham astu
translated: May there be auspiciousness!

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetu teṣāṃ tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhavāḥ teṣām tathāgataḥ
translated: Those dharmas that arise from causes, the Tathāgata has declared the cause of those,

original: hevadatteṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādi mahāśramaṇaṃ //🔽śubhamastu sarvadāt //
analyzed: hevadatta iṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādi mahā śramaṇam  śubham astu sarva dāt
translated: And also that which is the cessation of them, thus spoke the Great Ascetic.🔽May there be auspiciousness everywhere!

analyzed: śubham śubham śubham
translated: Auspicious! Auspicious! Auspicious!
